Headline: New Northern Ireland talks called, spurred by journalist's death
Description: The British and Irish governments announced on Friday a resumption of talks to restore Northern Ireland's devolved government, spurred into ending a hiatus in dialogue of more than a year by the killing of a journalist last week.

Headline: Britain must get to bottom of Huawei leak - Hammond
Description: Britain must get to the bottom of the leak of confidential discussions during a top-level security meeting about the role of China's Huawei Technologies in 5G network supply chains, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Friday.

Headline: Corbyn says won't attend Trump state dinner
Description: The leader of the Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, said on Friday he had turned down an invitation to a state dinner which will be one of the highlights of U.S. President Donald Trump's visit to Britain in June.

Headline: London's Kings Cross and Euston underground stations evacuated after fire alert
Description: London's King's Cross St Pancras and Euston underground stations were evacuated on Friday after a faulty train triggered a fire alert, transport police said.

Headline: Northern Ireland police suspect teenage gunman killed journalist Lyra McKee
Description: Detectives investigating the murder of journalist Lyra McKee in Northern Ireland last week suspect the gunman who shot her dead is in his late teens as they made a further appeal to the local community who they believe know his identity.

Headline: Hammond optimistic of finding Brexit compromise with Corbyn's Labour
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Friday that he was hopeful of clinching a Brexit compromise with the Labour Party to allow the ratification of Prime Minister Theresa May's thrice-defeated divorce deal.

Headline: Goldman Sachs says dragged-out Brexit is doing deeper damage to UK economy
Description: Britain's protracted divorce from the European Union is hurting the world's fifth largest economy as dwindling company investment, signs of a looming labour market shock and poor productivity hinder growth, Goldman Sachs said.

Headline: Britain wants Brexit deal approved before July - May's deputy
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government wants to get her thrice-defeated Brexit deal approved by parliament before the new European parliament opens in July, her de-facto deputy, David Lidington, said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain warns against travelling to Sri Lanka, sees further attacks
Description: Britain said terrorists were likely to try to carry out further attacks in Sri Lanka and warned its nationals to avoid the country unless it was absolutely necessary following the Easter Sunday bombings that killed 359 people.

Headline: Wright - Huawei leaks 'unacceptable', criminal investigation possible
Description: Culture Secretary Jeremy Wright said on Thursday he could not rule out a criminal investigation over the "unacceptable" disclosure of confidential discussions on the role of China's Huawei Technologies in 5G network supply chains.

Headline: Goldman Sachs, Bank of England and Treasury targeted by climate activists in London
Description: More than 300 environmental activists sowed chaos through London's financial district on Thursday, gluing themselves to the stock exchange and blocking roads outside the Bank of England and major banks such as Goldman Sachs.

Headline: Hunt says he would choose no deal over no Brexit
Description: Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Thursday he would opt to leave the European Union without a deal if he was faced with a choice between a no-deal Brexit or not leaving the bloc at all.

Headline: British Treasury targeted by climate-change activists
Description: Protesters from the environmental group Extinction Rebellion glued themselves to the British Treasury on Thursday on the final day of protests that have caused mass disruption in the British capital.

Headline: Hunt says next Conservative leader must believe in Brexit
Description: Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Thursday the next leader of the governing Conservative Party should be someone who believes in Brexit.

Headline: Brexit discontent drives new grassroots push for Scottish independence
Description: As Brexit gnaws at Britain's political structure, supporters of an independent Scotland are launching a new grassroots campaign aimed at convincing a large majority of Scots to back a split from the United Kingdom.

Headline: UK government launches leak inquiry over Huawei discussions - report
Description: Britain's government has launched a leak inquiry over the disclosure of confidential discussions about the role of China's Huawei Technologies in 5G network supply chains, according to the PoliticsHome website.

Headline: Homicides in England and Wales hit highest in a decade
Description: The number of homicides in England and Wales hit their highest level in a decade, official statistics showed on Thursday, as authorities struggle to halt a surge in fatal stabbings.

Headline: 'Why in God's name?' - Irish, British leaders mourn murdered Northern Irish journalist
Description: The leaders of Britain and Ireland joined hundreds of mourners on Wednesday at the funeral of journalist Lyra McKee whose killing by an Irish nationalist militant during a riot has sparked outrage in the province.

Headline: Tackling climate change can help economy - Fox
Description: Trade Secretary Liam Fox said tackling climate change can bring economic benefits as activists blocked key parts of London's financial district on the final day of protests that have caused mass disruption in London.

Headline: Goldman Sachs's European headquarters targeted by climate-change activists
Description: Environmental activists held a protest outside Goldman Sachs's European headquarters in London on Thursday in attempt to underline what they say is the role the finance industry in fuelling climate change.

Headline: Climate-change protesters block road near Bank of England
Description: Climate-change activists blocked a road near the Bank of England as part of the 11th day of direct action aimed at pushing politicians to take more radical measures to protect the environment.

Headline: Goldman and Bank of England to be targeted by climate-change activists
Description: Environmental activists plan protests outside banks including Goldman Sachs, the Bank of England, Rothschild and Nomura on  the final day of protests aimed at forcing Britain to take action to avert what they cast as a global climate cataclysm.

Headline: Factbox: The Brexit law - What is the UK government considering putting to parliament?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May wants to get her Brexit deal with the European Union approved by lawmakers in time to avoid taking part in next month's European Parliament elections.

Headline: Climate change protesters climb on train at London's Canary Wharf
Description: Climate change activists climbed onto the roof of a train at Canary Wharf's Docklands Light Railway station in London as part of the 11th day of direct action aimed at pushing politicians to take more radical measures to protect the environment.

Headline: Extinction Rebellion to end London blockades on Thursday
Description: Environmental campaigners Extinction Rebellion will close their two remaining central London protest sites on Thursday, the group said after 10 days of disruption in the British capital to highlight the risks of climate change.

Headline: Conservatives to demand clear departure schedule from May
Description: The Conservative Party will demand a clear timetable for Prime Minister Theresa May's departure but will not change the rules governing leadership challenges, the chair of the party's influential 1922 Committee said on Wednesday.

Headline: British man guilty of possessing bomb-making materials in Kenya
Description: A British man accused of helping to plan terrorist attacks in Kenya was found guilty on Wednesday of possession of bomb-making materials but acquitted of conspiracy to commit a felony.

Headline: Scotland will prepare for a second independence vote regardless of UK - Sturgeon
Description: Scotland will start preparing for an independence referendum before May 2021 without permission from London, First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Wednesday.

Headline: Result of 2014 Scottish independence vote should be respected - May's spokesman
Description: Scotland had an independence referendum in 2014, when the majority of voters rejected leaving the rest of the United Kingdom, and that result should be respected, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: After Trump tweet, GCHQ says claim it spied on Trump is utterly ridiculous
Description: Britain's main eavesdropping agency on Wednesday said allegations that it had been asked by the Obama administration to spy on Donald Trump after the 2016 presidential election were utterly ridiculous and should be ignored.

Headline: UK government Brexit talks with Labour cannot be open ended - May's spokesman
Description: British government talks with the Labour Party on finding a Brexit compromise cannot be open ended, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Factbox - Brexit delayed: What happens next?
Description: Britain's exit from the European Union was postponed by an agreement in Brussels this month that gave Prime Minister Theresa May until Oct. 31 to persuade parliament to approve the departure terms.

Headline: Swedish teen accuses UK of 'irresponsible behaviour' over climate
Description: Britain's opposition leaders met Swedish climate change activist Greta Thunberg on Tuesday to discuss what the teenager calls an "existential crisis" for humanity.

Headline: New IRA apologises for journalist's killing, police release woman
Description: The New IRA militant Irish nationalist group has apologised for the killing of journalist Lyra McKee - its first acknowledgement that one of its members was involved, the Irish News newspaper reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Talks with Labour on Brexit are serious but difficult, May tells ministers
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told her top team of ministers on Tuesday that talks with the Labour Party aimed at finding a way forward on Brexit were serious but difficult in some areas, her spokesman said.

Headline: Trump will travel to France, meet with Macron in June - White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and his wife will travel to France on June 6, where Trump will meet with French President Emmanuel Macron, the White House said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headline: EU still sees no reworking of Brexit deal
Description: The European Commission again ruled out on Tuesday any reopening of the withdrawal treaty negotiated with Britain last year after a media report in London that Prime Minister Theresa May had asked aides to review alternative arrangements for the Irish border.

Headline: UK government focused on passing Brexit law, talks with Labour Party continue - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government is focused on passing the law it needs to ratify Britain's exit from the European Union, May's spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: U.S. President Trump to visit UK in June - Sky News
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will make a state visit to the United Kingdom in June and will visit Buckingham Palace, Sky News said in a tweet on Monday.

Headline: Arrests at London climate-change protests top 1,000
Description: The number of environmental campaigners arrested during eight days of direct action in London topped 1,000 on Monday, police said, adding that Waterloo Bridge, one of the sites blockaded by the protests, had re-opened to traffic.

Headline: Swedish teen climate activist joins London protest as arrests top 830
Description: Swedish teenage environmental activist Greta Thunberg on Sunday urged hundreds of climate-change protesters in London to never give up their campaign to save the planet as police arrests over disruptions to the city's landmarks rose above 830.

Headline: Northern Ireland police release teenagers arrested after journalist killing
Description: Police in Northern Ireland on Sunday released without charge two teenagers arrested in relation to the killing of a journalist during a riot in Londonderry.

Headline: British woman killed, three other people kidnapped in northern Nigeria
Description: Kidnappers in Nigeria killed a British woman and a Nigerian man, and abducted three others in the northern city of Kaduna, local police and the British High Commission said on Sunday.

Headline: Northern Ireland leaders urge calm as police arrest two over journalist's killing
Description: Two men have been arrested in Northern Ireland over the killing of a journalist during a riot, police said, with politicians calling for calm after the shooting added to concerns about the stability of the region's 21-year-old peace deal.

Headline: May to be told to quit by top Conservative - Sunday Times
Description: A top member of Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party will tell her in the coming week that she must step down by the end of June or her lawmakers will try again to depose her, the Sunday Times reported, without citing sources.

Headline: UK police say total of climate activists arrested passes 750
Description: More than 750 climate change activists blocking roads at some of London's most famous landmarks have been arrested over the last six days, police said on Saturday, up from a Friday total of 682.

Headline: Slain Northern Irish journalist, 29, was 'inspiring thinker'
Description: A year after moving to Londonderry, celebrated young Northern Ireland journalist Lyra McKee wrote about how she looked forward to "better times ahead and saying goodbye to bombs and bullets once and for all".

Headline: Northern Ireland journalist killed by gunman during riot
Description: A 29-year-old Northern Irish journalist was shot dead during rioting in Londonderry overnight, an attack that shocked the region and police said was likely the work of Irish nationalist militants opposed to the 1998 Good Friday peace deal.

Headline: UK consumers keep calm and carry on shopping before Brexit deadline
Description: British shoppers ignored worries about an impending Brexit deadline and spent heavily in March, official data showed on Thursday, supporting the country's sluggish economy while companies were cutting back on investment.

Headline: Climate-change protesters disrupt London docklands train service
Description: Two environmental activists climbed onto the roof of a train in London's Canary Wharf financial district on Wednesday as part of a third day of action to force Britain to take more radical measures to avert climate change.

Headline: UK should 'cool down', drop Brexit - Socialist candidate to head EU Commission
Description: (This April 17 story was refiled to add name of debate host)

Headline: No Brexit more likely than a disorderly one, say economists
Description: The chances that Brexit will be cancelled are now greater than the chances Britain will leave the European Union without a deal, according to economists in a Reuters poll, who again pushed back their expectations for when the Bank of England will raise interest rates.

Headline: Farage's Brexit Party to top EU elections in Britain - poll
Description: Nigel Farage's Brexit Party will top next month's election in Britain for the European parliament with 27 percent of the vote, far ahead of Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives, according to a survey published on Wednesday.

Headline: Climate change protesters climb on train at London's Canary Wharf
Description: Two climate change activists climbed onto the roof of a train at Canary Wharf's Docklands Light Railway station in London as part of a third day of action to pressure politicians to take more radical measures to protect the environment.

Headline: London climate-change street protest arrests reach 290 on second day
Description: Police have arrested 290 people in two days of protests after climate-change activists blocked some of London's most important junctions including Oxford Circus and Marble Arch, causing traffic chaos.

Headline: Labour Party denies newspaper report UK Brexit talks stalled
Description: The Labour Party denied a Guardian newspaper report on Tuesday that Brexit talks with Prime Minister Theresa May's government had stalled.

Headline: Thousands of activists block London roads to demand action on climate change
Description: Thousands of environmental activists paralysed parts of central London on Monday by blocking Marble Arch, Oxford Circus and Waterloo Bridge in a bid to force the government to do more to tackle climate change.

Headline: Greece - Free our marbles from British Museum's 'murky prison'
Description: Greece's president called on Monday for Britain to free the Parthenon marbles from the "murky prison" of its national museum, upping the rhetoric in a near 200-year-old campaign for the sculptures' return.

Headline: May says no-deal Brexit planning continues - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has said the government will continue to plan for the possibility of a no-deal Brexit, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Factbox - Brexit delayed: What happens next?
Description: Britain's exit from the European Union was postponed by a late night agreement in Brussels last week that gave Prime Minister Theresa May until Oct 31 to persuade parliament to approve the terms of the country's departure.

Headline: Michelle Obama charms British crowd with praise for Queen
Description: (This April 14 story corrects spelling of name in paragraph 8)

Headline: Salisbury, scene of Novichok poison drama, named Britain's best place to live
Description: The English cathedral city of Salisbury, the location of a deadly nerve agent poisoning blamed on Russia, was named as Britain's best place to live by the Sunday Times newspaper.

Headline: Brexit cannot define us, says PM May's deputy as ratings dip
Description: Britain's ruling Conservative Party cannot let itself be defined solely by Brexit, Prime Minister Theresa May's de facto deputy said on Sunday, as polling showed failure to leave the European Union on schedule has badly damaged its support.

Headline: UK parliament very likely to consider new Brexit referendum - Hammond
Description: The idea of a second Brexit referendum is very likely to be put before Britain's parliament again although the government remains opposed to any new plebiscite, the British finance minister said on Friday.

Headline: U.S. charges Assange after London arrest ends seven years in Ecuador embassy
Description: British police dragged WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange out of Ecuador's embassy on Thursday after his seven-year asylum was revoked, paving the way for his extradition to the United States for one of the biggest ever leaks of classified information.

Headline: Amid UK election talk, Thames Water adds nationalisation clause to bonds
Description: UK utility Thames Water has added a clause to its outstanding bonds ensuring lenders are paid back immediately should the company be nationalised, a move bankers say reflects growing unease about its status in the event of a Labour government.

Headline: Highlights: Hammond talks about Brexit, the BoE and PM May's successor
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Friday it was very likely that the idea of a second Brexit referendum would be put to parliament at some point, but time was tight before October when Britain is due to leave the European Union.

Headline: Brexit black hole: Divorce implosion, deal, or election?
Description: The United Kingdom now has until Oct. 31 to leave the European Union but the British political elite is still squabbling over how, when or if to Brexit.

Headline: Brexit talks positive and constructive, Labour's McDonnell says
Description: Talks between Prime Minister Theresa May's government and the opposition Labour Party on Brexit are constructive and positive, Labour finance spokesman John McDonnell said on Friday.

Headline: Watch out parliament, Farage warns at launch of new Brexit Party
Description: Nigel Farage, one of the leaders of a campaign to leave the European Union, launched a new Brexit Party on Friday, promising to put "the fear of God" into lawmakers he accused of betraying Britain's decision to quit the bloc.

Headline: U.N. rights office says Assange must get fair trial
Description: The United Nations human rights office on Friday urged judicial authorities to ensure that Wikileaks founder Julian Assange, currently in British custody and the subject of an extradition request from United States, gets a fair trial.

Headline: EU stands together to avoid no-deal Brexit, German minister says
Description: The latest European Union decision to grant Britain a further Brexit extension shows that European leaders are able to find a common solution, Germany's Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Friday.

Headline: After years of giving refuge, Ecuador suspends Assange's citizenship
Description: Ecuador has suspended Julian Assange's citizenship and accused him and people connected to his WikiLeaks group of collaborating in attempts to destabilise the Andean nation's government, after years of offering him shelter.

Headline: From skateboards to spying, Assange arrest followed drawn-out dispute with Ecuador
Description: Ecuador's decision to abruptly end Julian Assange's seven-year asylum in its London embassy on Thursday followed a long deterioration in relations, driven in part by suspicions he was secretly fuelling corruption allegations against President Lenin Moreno.

Headline: Assange hacking charge limits free speech defence - legal experts
Description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has portrayed himself as a champion of a free press, but the U.S. Department of Justice's decision to charge him with conspiring to hack government computers limits his ability to mount a vigorous free speech defence, some legal experts said.

Headline: Out of the embassy, straight into custody: Assange's court hearing
Description: Julian Assange, wanted by the United States for one of the world's biggest ever security leaks, looked unfazed as he sat in a London court on Thursday, leafing through a book as he waited for proceedings to begin.

Headline: U.S. charges WikiLeaks' Assange with hacking conspiracy with Manning
Description: U.S. prosecutors announced charges on Thursday against WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, accusing him of conspiring with former Army intelligence analyst Chelsea Manning to gain access to a government computer as part of one of the largest compromises of classified information in U.S. history.

Headline: Trump says he does not have opinion on Assange's arrest
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he did not have an opinion about the arrest of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, who faces the prospect of extradition to the United States over the publishing of secret official information.

Headline: Britain standing down no-deal operational planning - Sky
Description: British government departments are standing down their planning for a no-deal Brexit with immediate effect, Sky News said on Thursday.

Headline: Assange may risk torture in United States, his lawyer says
Description: Wikileaks founder Julian Assange may risk torture if he is extradited to the United States, one of his lawyers said in Madrid on Thursday, following Assange's arrest in London.

Headline: Ecuador was not aware of requests for Assange extradition - foreign minister
Description: Ecuador was not aware of any active extradition requests for WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange before it terminated his asylum in the country's London embassy on Thursday, the foreign minister told the national assembly.

Headline: May defends Brexit delay, critic asks her to resign
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May defended her decision to delay Brexit and seek a compromise exit plan with the opposition Labour Party as one angry lawmaker from her own party stood up in parliament on Thursday and asked her to resign.

Headline: May and Labour leader held talks on breaking Brexit deadlock
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn held talks in parliament on Thursday aimed at finding a way out the Brexit impasse.

Headline: Explainer: Assange arrested in London after seven-year refuge in embassy
Description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange was arrested by British police on Thursday after Ecuador withdrew its asylum which had allowed him to take refuge in the Ecuadorean embassy in London for the last seven years.

Headline: What happens after Oct. 31? Some in EU already imagine another Brexit delay
Description: The ink was not yet dry on EU leaders' deal to give Britain a hard-fought, second delay to Brexit until November when some diplomats and officials in the bloc grudgingly conceded: This may well not be the last extension.

Headline: Assange's life in danger if extradited to the U.S., his Quito lawyer says
Description: The life of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange will be in danger if he is extradited to the United States, his lawyer in Quito said on Thursday following Assange's arrest in London.

Headline: Swedish prosecutor receives request to reopen Assange investigation
Description: Swedish prosecutors said on Thursday they have received a formal request to reopen the rape investigation closed in 2017 involving WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, from the legal counsel representing the alleged victim.

Headline: U.S. expects to bring additional charges against Assange - CNN
Description: The U.S. Justice Department expects to bring additional charges against WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, but it was not clear what those charges would be or when they would be filed, CNN reported on Thursday, citing unidentified sources.

Headline: May evoked Blitz spirit to show EU Brexit progress
Description: Theresa May told fellow European Union leaders that she was taking emergency political measures not seen in Britain since World War Two as she urged them to give her more time to clinch a deal for an orderly Brexit.

Headline: U.S. must produce case for Assange extradition by June 12 - UK judge
Description: The United States must produce its case for requesting the extradition of Julian Assange from Britain by June 12, a British judge hearing the WikiLeaks founder's case said on Thursday.

Headline: WikiLeaks' Assange convicted of breaking bail terms at UK court
Description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange was convicted on Thursday by a London court of skipping bail in 2012 after an extradition order to Sweden over an allegation of rape.

Headline: UK govt did not lobby Ecuador to revoke Assange's asylum - May's spokeswoman
Description: The decision to revoke the asylum of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange was taken by Ecuador, and Britain did not lobby for it, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox: Reaction to arrest of Julian Assange in London
Description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange was arrested by British police and carried out of the Ecuadorean embassy on Thursday after his South American hosts abruptly revoked his seven-year asylum in a move his supporters said was illegal.

Headline: May says Assange arrest shows no one above the law
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May welcomed the arrest of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange on Thursday and said it showed that no one was above the law.

Headline: U.N. rights expert seeks access to Assange, evidence
Description: A United Nations human rights expert will ask Britain to let him  meet Wikileaks founder Julian Assange to assess his claims that his privacy has been violated.

Headline: Thumbs up in handcuffs: Julian Assange leaves police station for court
Description: Wikileaks founder Julian Assange was pictured in the back of a van leaving a London police station in handcuffs with his thumb up, after being arrested on Thursday, a Reuters photograph showed.

Headline: EU gives May till October for Brexit, seeking clarity
Description: European Union leaders gave Britain six more months to leave the bloc, more than Prime Minister Theresa May says she needs but less than many in the bloc wanted, thanks to fierce resistance from France.

Headline: Prince Harry and Meghan to keep baby plans private
Description: Prince Harry and Meghan have decided to keep the plans around the arrival of their first child private, Buckingham Palace said on Thursday.

Headline: With Halloween the new Brexit deadline, MPs head off on holiday
Description: After the European Union agreed to delay Brexit by six months to end-October, European Council President Donald Tusk pleaded with Britain: "don't waste this time". Hours later, British lawmakers are heading off for a more than week-long Easter break.

Headline: United States seeks extradition of WikiLeaks founder Assange
Description: The United States has requested the extradition of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, British police said, after they arrested him at the Ecuadorean embassy in London on Thursday.

Headline: Swedish prosecutor says following developments as Assange arrested
Description: The Swedish Prosecution Authority said on Thursday it was following developments after WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange's arrest in London but that it had yet to take stock of the information.

Headline: May willing to talk about an EU customs union - minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government is willing to discuss a possible customs union with the European Union in talks with the opposition Labour Party to end the Brexit impasse, a government minister was quoted as saying.

Headline: UK won't send Assange to U.S. if he faces death penalty - minister
Description: Britain will not extradite WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to the United States if he faces the possibility of the death penalty there, junior foreign minister Alan Duncan said on Thursday after Assange was arrested in London.

Headline: Assange arrest a 'dark moment' for press freedom - Snowden
Description: Former U.S. spy agency contractor Edward Snowden on Thursday called the arrest in Britain of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange a "dark moment for press freedom" and said it contravened a call by the United Nations to allow him to walk free.

Headline: Explainer: Can anyone force May to resign?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May faces increased pressure to quit after failing to lead the country out of the European Union on schedule, with members of her own Conservative Party calling for a more pro-Brexit replacement.

Headline: DUP leader Foster says Irish "backstop" still critical issue
Description: Finding a solution for the Irish border after Britain leaves the European Union remains a critical issue for Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party, its leader said on Thursday after meeting the EU's Brexit negotiator in Brussels.

Headline: Lawyer says to push for Sweden to reopen Assange investigation
Description: A Swedish lawyer representing the alleged victim in a rape investigation involving WikiLeaks' founder Julian Assange said on Thursday she would push to have prosecutors reopen the probe, that was dropped in 2017.

Headline: Wikileaks' Assange is no hero, says UK foreign minister
Description: Julian Assange is no hero and his future will be decided by the British courts, Britain's foreign minister said on Thursday after the Wikileaks founder was arrested by police and carried out of the Ecuadorean embassy where he had been holed up for nearly seven years.

Headline: Kremlin hopes Assange rights will not be violated after his arrest
Description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov, answering a question about the arrest of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange in London, said Moscow hopes that his rights will not be violated.

Headline: Brexit will happen by end-October - Irish finance minister
Description: Ireland's finance minister said he believes Britain will leave the European Union when the latest extension to Brexit talks expires at the end of October and that the country must continue to prepare for all scenarios.

Headline: UK pledges it won't send Assange to country with death penalty - Ecuador
Description: Britain has guaranteed to Ecuador that WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange will not be extradited to a country that has the death penalty, Ecuadorean President Lenin Moreno said on Thursday after Assange was arrested in London.

Headline: Britain should decide on Brexit options by October - EU's Verhofstadt
Description: Britain should scrap its decision to leave the European Union, agree a deal with the Labour Party or launch a second referendum on the issue, the European Parliament's Brexit coordinator said on Thursday, hours after the bloc set an October deadline for its withdrawal.

Headline: German Economy Minister - Brexit extension is good news for all of us
Description: German Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said on Thursday that European Union leaders' decision to give Britain an extra six months to leave the bloc was a good move and would enable the bloc to focus on other pressing issues.

Headline: German conservative - A longer Brexit extension would have been better
Description: A longer Brexit extension would have been better, a senior German conservative said on Thursday, after European Union leaders gave Britain six more months to leave the bloc.

Headline: Special Report: Wish You Weren't Here - Postcards from the Edge of London in the Age of Brexit
Description: Every Friday morning, a pensioner and his grandson gaze across a vast demolition site in east London, one of them remembering a life working at the Ford factory there and the other wishing he could help tear its old buildings down.

Headline: Additional Brexit extension possible, says EU's Oettinger
Description: A second referendum on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union, snap elections, and an additional Brexit extension are among the possible options for Britain, EU Commissioner Guenther Oettinger said on Thursday.

Headline: EU's Tusk tells UK - "Don't waste Brexit overtime"
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk told Britain on Thursday not to waste the extra time to sort out Brexit after the EU agreed a second delay to London's departure until Oct.31.

Headline: No-deal Brexit remains possible, says French government spokeswoman
Description: A "no-deal" Brexit remains a possibility, French government spokeswoman Sibeth Ndiaye told French TV station CNews on Thursday.

Headline: France's Macron stands by tough stance on shorter Brexit delay
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Thursday he took responsibility for blocking a long Brexit delay and convincing other European Union leaders to agree to a shorter one in order to preserve the functioning of the EU.

Headline: Brexit - German minister says all options for Britain on the table
Description: Germany's EU Affairs Minister Michael Roth said on Thursday all options are on the table for Britain after European Union leaders gave London six more months to leave the bloc.

Headline: Acknowledging frustration, May calls on parliament to deliver Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May acknowledged on Thursday there was "huge frustration" that she had to request a second delay to Brexit from the European Union, urging parliament to finally support her Brexit deal.

Headline: New Brexit delay is likely to be the last - Dutch PM Rutte
Description: A further delay of Britain's departure from the EU after the newly agreed deadline of Oct. 31 looks very unlikely, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said on Thursday.

Headline: EU's Juncker sure UK would honour good cooperation rules during Brexit lag
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said he was certain Britain would honour the "sincere cooperation" obligation and would in any case have little power to block key EU decisions on its own during a second Brexit lag until Oct. 31.

Headline: Irish PM says UK would crash out June 1 without EU elections
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Thursday the United Kingdom would crash out of the EU on June 1 if it failed to hold European Parliament elections during a Brexit extension granted until the end of October, 2019.

Headline: EU27/UK agree to Brexit extension until Oct 31 - EU's Tusk
Description: Leaders of the 27 countries remaining in the European Union and British Prime Minister Theresa May have agreed to extend Britain's date of departure from the bloc until October 31, the chair of EU summits said in a tweet on Thursday.

Headline: EU27 leaders agree Brexit extension - summit chair Tusk
Description: The leaders of the 27 EU countries remaining in the European Union have agreed to an extension of Brexit, the chairman of EU summits said in a tweet on Thursday.

Headline: PM May not close to breaking Brexit deadlock with opposition - Labour's McDonnell
Description: Talks between British Prime Minister Theresa May's government and the opposition Labour Party are not close to breaking the Brexit deadlock, Labour's finance spokesman John McDonnell said on Wednesday.

Headline: Customs union with EU wouldn't work for Britain, foreign minister Hunt says
Description: A customs union with the European Union would not work for Britain's economy if it restricted its ability to influence trade policy and strike deals independently, foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK man who fled to Georgia after speedboat death returns to Britain
Description: A British man who went on the run last year after killing a woman in a speedboat crash on the River Thames has returned to Britain after being extradited from the former Soviet state of Georgia, UK prosecutors said on Wednesday.

Headline: Snap! Jolly Merkel breaks Brexit summit ice with May
Description: Angela Merkel says she is determined that Brexit must not poison relations between Britain and the European Union and went out of her way at a crisis summit on Wednesday to show her lighter side to Theresa May.

Headline: Macron speaks against long Brexit delay at EU summit - diplomats
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron told his European Union peers on Wednesday any Brexit delay beyond June 30 would undermine the bloc, diplomatic sources said.

Headline: Brexit delay could extend term of Juncker Commission - EU official
Description: European Union officials are considering an extension of the EU commission's mandate should Britain be granted a long delay to its planned exit date, a senior official said on Wednesday.

Headline: No-deal Brexit not the worst option, French official says
Description: A departure of Britain from the EU without a deal might be preferable than obstruction of EU operations by the British if they were to remain a member against their will, a spokesman for French President Emmanuel Macron said on Wednesday.

Headline: EU steps up defences against British meddling during Brexit extension - draft
Description: European Union will have more meetings without Britain and will demand the country refrains from undermining the bloc "in particular when participating in the decision-making processes" during an extension, according to updated draft conclusions.

Headline: PM May open to longer Brexit delay if it can be cut short - EU officials
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May signalled to other EU leaders on Wednesday she was open to accepting a longer Brexit delay if she could cut it short, EU officials said, describing her performance at a summit as "more solid than usual".

Headline: A pop-up studio captures Londoners in Brexit's troubled age
Description: "What do you want to take a picture of me for?"

Headline: Highlights: EU leaders meet to give Britain second Brexit delay under conditions
Description: European Union leaders meet in Brussels on Wednesday to grant Britain a second Brexit delay, with France pushing the hardest demands on London among the 27 states staying on together in the bloc.

Headline: Newest royal expected to join long tradition of social causes
Description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's first baby, due later this spring, will almost surely extend a long tradition of supporting royal causes, but those same customs will constrain the new prince or princess when it comes to politics.

Headline: Macron says long Brexit delay shouldn't be taken for granted
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Wednesday he was impatient to hear more from Prime Minister Theresa May on why European Union leaders should grant Britain an extension to the Brexit negotiation period.

Headline: Brexit-hungry media to be turfed off grassy patch outside UK parliament
Description: After months of gruelling political perma-crisis, Brexit is taking its toll on the British political establishment - not least the small patch of grass opposite parliament that has become a makeshift home to the world's media.

Headline: May says she aims to secure delay for orderly Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she was asking EU leaders to delay the Brexit deadline to June 30 so she could get approval from parliament for her deal and ensure Britain leaves the European Union in an orderly way.

Headline: Germany, France back shorter Brexit delay ahead of EU summit - document
Description: Germany, France, Luxembourg and the EU's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier favoured a shorter delay to Britain's departure from the bloc in talks on the eve of a summit of EU leaders in Brussels, a document seen by Reuters showed.

Headline: Belgian PM Michel says Brexit delay remains uncertain
Description: Belgian Prime Minister Charles Michel said it remained unclear whether Britain would receive an extension on the deadline for its withdrawal from the bloc ahead of a meeting of EU leaders on Wednesday to discuss Brexit.

Headline: Merkel favours giving UK "reasonable amount of time" to resolve Brexit
Description: Britain should be given a reasonable amount of time to work out its exit from the European Union, though the delay to Brexit could be longer than British Prime Minister Theresa May has requested, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK monitoring situation of 17 F-35s after Japan crash
Description: The British Ministry of Defence is in close touch with U.S. officials and monitoring the situation after Japan grounded its F-35A fighter jets following the crash of a Japanese F-35 in the Pacific Ocean on Tuesday, a ministry spokesperson said.

Headline: May says view on second Brexit referendum has not changed
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday her opposition to holding a second Brexit referendum had not changed, but she expected some lawmakers may try to push for one during the process of ratifying her EU exit deal.

Headline: Dutch PM Rutte says he spoke to Theresa May ahead of EU summit
Description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said in a tweet he had spoken to British counterpart Theresa May ahead of an emergency European Council summit on Wednesday at which the bloc's leaders will discuss a second delay to Brexit.

Headline: Austria says any further Brexit extension must be for clear reason
Description: Any further extension of the period leading up to Britain's departure from the European Union should be for a clear reason, Austria's minister for European affairs Gernot Bluemel said on Wednesday.

Headline: Denmark's PM to push for longer extension to Brexit delay
Description: Denmark's prime minister said he would recommend a long extension to Brexit, a delay to which is expected to be granted to the UK by EU leaders at an emergency summit on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain's Brexit minister says - I don't want a long delay
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit minister said on Wednesday he did not want Britain's departure from the European Union to be delayed for up to a year but indicated he would accept one if it was flexible enough to allow an earlier exit.

Headline: Germany's Scholz says still confident UK parliament will OK Brexit deal - CNBC
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz told CNBC he was "still confident" that the UK parliament will agree on a Brexit deal, adding that talks between the UK government and the opposition Labour Party were good for both Europe and Britain.

Headline: EU to agree Brexit delay but France pushes for conditions
Description: European Union leaders will grant Prime Minister Theresa May a second delay to Brexit but they could demand she accepts a much longer extension as France pushed for conditions to limit Britain's ability to undermine the bloc.

Headline: Labour's Corbyn met DUP's Dodds to try to break Brexit deadlock - Daily Mirror
Description: Britain's Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn met Northern Irish Democratic Unionist Party (DUP)'s deputy leader Nigel Dodds, the DUP's lawmaker Sammy Wilson on Tuesday as part of the opposition party's talks with MPs to break Brexit deadlock, the Daily Mirror reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Finance minister says lawmakers might revoke Brexit to prevent no deal -Telegraph
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond raised the prospect of lawmakers revoking Article 50 this week rather than allowing Britain to leave the European Union without a deal if talks collapse, the Telegraph reported on Tuesday.

Headline: May considering plan to let lawmakers work out Brexit deal if talks fail - report
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is considering a new plan to introduce legislation that would allow lawmakers to thrash out a compromise Brexit deal among themselves, if talks with the opposition Labour party fail, The Guardian reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Second Brexit delay could last until end-March 2020 - EU official
Description: The European Union's second Brexit delay could go on until March 30, 2020, an official with the bloc said, as 27 national envoys were preparing for a leaders' summit on Wednesday that is due to decide on the matter.

Headline: U.S. Treasury Secretary says U.S. preparing for 'hard Brexit'
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Tuesday told lawmakers the Trump administration is preparing for the possibility of a "hard Brexit".

Headline: EU to agree further Brexit delay but could kick UK out on June 1 - draft
Description: The European Union will grant Britain another delay to Brexit on certain conditions, including that it holds European Parliament elections, according to a draft statement by the bloc's national leaders, who are due to decide on the matter on Wednesday.

Headline: PM May outlines to France's Macron talks with opposition Labour Party
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May updated French President Emmanuel Macron on discussions with the opposition Labour Party aimed at finding a way out the Brexit impasse, her office said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU's Tusk proposes Brexit delay up to one year, with early exit option
Description: The chairman of European Union leaders Donald Tusk proposed on Tuesday to offer Britain an extension of the Brexit deadline by up to one year, with the option of leaving earlier, if only Britain ratifies the existing withdrawal agreement.

Headline: Labour sees no clear shift in May's Brexit position
Description: The Labour Party said it had not yet seen a clear shift in Prime Minister Theresa May's position after talks with the government on Tuesday aimed at finding a way out the Brexit impasse.

Headline: MPs approve May's plan to seek Brexit delay to June 30
Description: MPs on Tuesday approved Prime Minister Theresa May's plan to seek to delay Britain's exit from the European Union to June 30 while she tries to reach a compromise with the opposition Labour Party to get her deal through parliament.

Headline: Parliament endorses May's Brexit delay request
Description: MPs endorsed Prime Minister Theresa May's request to the European Union to delay Brexit until June 30 at a vote in parliament on Tuesday, adding weight to the pitch she will make to EU leaders in Brussels.

Headline: Government says Tuesday talks with Labour were productive
Description: Talks between Prime Minister Theresa May's government and the Labour party on Tuesday to find a way out of Britain's Brexit impasse were wide-ranging and productive and will continue on Thursday, a spokesman for May said.

Headline: Weary EU set to give yet more time for Brexit
Description: Brexit will not be on Friday, EU leaders will confirm when they meet Prime Minister Theresa May at another crisis summit on Wednesday, but diplomats said they are still wrestling on how long it might be delayed and under what conditions.

Headline: Talks with Labour will go on as long as deal on Brexit is in sight - PM's spokesman
Description: Talks between Britain's government and the opposition Labour Party on finding a way forward on Brexit will continue as long as both sides engage and there is a prospect of a deal, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit delay to May 22 might not be sufficient for May to pass deal - solicitor general
Description: Britain cannot be certain that delaying Brexit to May 22 would provide enough time to ratify Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal, the government's Solicitor General Robert Buckland said on Tuesday.

Headline: France certainly open to Brexit extension, Irish PM says
Description: Ireland's prime minister expressed confidence that his French counterpart was open to offering Britain an extension to Brexit talks after the pair met last week, but that President Emmanuel Macron favoured setting strict conditions.

Headline: One-year Brexit delay too long for France - Macron aide
Description: A delay to Brexit of one year would be too long, a French presidency official said on Tuesday, adding that London should not be able to negotiate Britain's future relationship with the European Union while inside the bloc.

Headline: France seeks safeguards against UK obstructing EU decision-making - official
Description: Britain should not be allowed to take part in European Union budget talks or choosing the next head of the European Commission if it takes part in next month's elections because of a delay to Brexit, a French presidency official said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit puts end in sight for Theresa May
Description: The beginning of the end of Theresa May's Brexit strategy was an emotional address to the nation in which she blamed parliament for the delay in Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: Government and Labour to discuss customs union in latest Brexit talks - McDonnell
Description: The Labour Party will discuss the prospect of customs union with the EU in talks with the government on finding a Brexit compromise on Tuesday, said John McDonnell, its finance policy chief.

Headline: May outlines steps to secure 'successful' Brexit with Germany's Merkel
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May outlined to German Chancellor Angela Merkel the steps she was taking to bring "the Brexit process to a successful conclusion" and on discussions with the opposition Labour Party, a spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Barnier - EU ready for Brexit delay, length depends on British argument
Description: The European Union hopes cross-party talks in London will yield a majority in the House of Commons for the stalled Brexit deal and is willing to grant more time to achieve that, the EU's chief negotiator Michel Barnier said.

Headline: May will point to Labour talks to unlock Brexit delay - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will tell EU leaders she is asking for an extension to press on with talks with the Labour Party to secure approval in parliament for her Brexit deal, her spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Germany dismisses reports Merkel would time-limit Brexit backstop
Description: A German government spokesman dismissed as "without any foundation" reports that Chancellor Angela Merkel was prepared to limit to five years the so-called backstop that would prevent a hard border in Ireland after Brexit.

Headline: Britain's Leadsom hopes Merkel reopens Brexit withdrawal agreement
Description: A senior Brexiteer in Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Tuesday that she hoped German leader Angela Merkel would agree to reopen the Withdrawal Agreement to get a Brexit divorce deal passed by the British parliament.

Headline: EU needs to know why Britain wants Brexit extension, what role it will play - France
Description: The European Union must understand what Britain wants to achieve during its requested extension of the Brexit deadline and what role it wants to play in the EU during that time before the EU can grant the delay, French EU minister Amélie de Montchalin said.

Headline: EU open to Brexit extension but PM May needs clear plan
Description: European Union ministers said on Tuesday the bloc was ready to grant Britain a second Brexit delay but that British Prime Minister Theresa May must come up with a clear plan of how to ratify the stalled divorce deal in the overtime.

Headline: France needs credible way out of Brexit crisis to grant delay - Le Maire
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May must present a clear and credible way out of the turmoil surrounding Britain's exit from the European Union for France to accept a delay, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK Labour Party says hopes for Brexit deal which protects economy
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party hopes talks with the government will lead to a Brexit deal which protects jobs and the economy, its finance spokesman John McDonnell said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain must move to avoid no deal Brexit - Germany's Roth
Description: EU leaders will discuss extending Britain's Friday deadline for Brexit when they meet on Wednesday but must make clear its Brexit plan to avoid a disorderly departure from the bloc, Germany's EU affairs minister said on Tuesday.

Headline: Dutch minister says EU should give UK more time to sort out Brexit
Description: The European Union should give Britain more time to sort out Brexit but London must be clear on how it plans to do it, Dutch Foreign Minister Stef Blok said a day before EU leaders will decide on whether to delay the UK's departure again.

Headline: Britain must say how it wants to use Brexit extension - EU presidency
Description: It is critical that Britain explains to European Union leaders on Wednesday how it intends to use the extension of the Brexit deadline it wants to apply for, the Romanian minister for European Affairs George Ciamba said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit hangs in the balance as May's government talks with Labour
Description: Brexit hung in the balance on Monday as Prime Minister Theresa May tried to coax the Labour Party into agreeing a divorce deal with a better chance of passage by parliament, ahead of a crisis EU summit where she will try to delay the April 12 departure.

Headline: PM May considering offering lawmakers a vote on second Brexit referendum - Telegraph
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is considering giving lawmakers a vote on whether to hold a second Brexit referendum in a bid to break the deadlock in talks with the opposition Labour Party, the Telegraph reported.

Headline: UK government has not given Labour Party the undertakings it needs on Brexit - Corbyn
Description: The British government has so far not given the opposition Labour Party the undertakings it needs in order to be able to back Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal, Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Monday.

Headline: UK takes legal steps needed for European Parliament elections
Description: The British government said on Monday it had taken the necessary steps required by law to participate in European Parliament elections in May, but that this did not mean it was inevitable Britain would take part.

Headline: Parliament approves Brexit law forcing May to consult on delay
Description: Britain's parliament approved legislation on Monday that gives lawmakers the power to scrutinise and even change Prime Minister Theresa May's request that the European Union agree to delay Brexit until June 30.

Headline: Parliament approves law forcing May to consult on Brexit delay
Description: Britain's parliament approved legislation on Monday that will give lawmakers the power to scrutinise and even change Prime Minister Theresa May's request that the European Union agree to delay Brexit until June 30.

Headline: UK lords approve Brexit law forcing May to consult parliament on delay
Description: Britain's House of Lords on Monday approved legislation that will give parliament the power to scrutinise and even change Prime Minister Theresa May's request that the European Union agree to delay Brexit until June 30.

Headline: In call with PM May, Ireland's Varadkar says open to Brexit delay
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar spoke to Britain's Theresa May on Monday about her plan to seek a further extension to the Article 50 Brexit negotiating period, the Irish government said in a statement.

Headline: Government sets out plan to comply with Brexit delay law, if it passes
Description: The government's leader in parliament set out plans to hold a 90-minute debate on Tuesday on Prime Minister Theresa May's request for a delay to Brexit in order to comply with legislation expected to pass into law later on Monday.

Headline: Summitry Night Fever - Decoding the Brexit showdown
Description: European summits, jaded Englishmen have said, are like soccer: they go into extra-time, and the Germans always win.

Headline: Technical Brexit talks will resume between UK government and Labour - PM's spokesman
Description: Technical talks between officials from the government and Labour Party on finding a compromise on a Brexit deal will resume later on Monday, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said.

Headline: EU's Barnier hopes UK talks can produce positive Brexit outcome
Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator said he hoped cross-party crisis talks in London would yield a positive outcome to allow his team to move swiftly in agreeing more ambitions terms on a future British-EU relationship.

Headline: UK government hopeful for further Brexit talks with Labour on Monday - PM's spokeswoman
Description: Britain's government has been in contact with the Labour Party and hopes there will be more talks with the opposition party later on Monday to find a compromise over a Brexit deal, a spokeswoman for Prime Minister Theresa May said.

Headline: Dutch PM Rutte - spoke with May on Brexit delay request
Description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte on Monday said he had spoken to British counterpart Theresa May about her government's new request for a further delay to Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Brexit-supporting MP calls for no confidence vote in May - Sky
Description: The deputy leader of a pro-Brexit faction in Britain's ruling Conservative Party has called for a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister Theresa May by Wednesday, Sky News reported.

Headline: Jaguar Land Rover begins Brexit-linked UK plant shutdowns
Description: Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) shut its UK plants on Monday for five days over Brexit, adding to other shutdowns to leave at least half the country's car production off-line in what could be a pivotal week for Britain's divorce from the EU.

Headline: Discussions ongoing between May and Labour on customs union, public vote - Telegraph
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May and Labour are yet to agree whether a customs union or confirmatory public vote would be part of a compromise deal to win the opposition party's support for a Brexit deal, the Telegraph's deputy political editor reported.

Headline: Has the media turned on Prince Harry and wife Meghan?
Description: Last May, millions across the world tuned in to watch Queen Elizabeth's grandson Prince Harry tie the knot with his American actress girlfriend Meghan Markle, with the media feting the couple as the epitome of glamour and royal modernity.

Headline: Boris Johnson criticised for failing to declare stake in property
Description: Boris Johnson has been reprimanded for a second time in five months by the British parliament's standards watchdog for failing to declare private income within the correct time limits.

Headline: Britain plans social media watchdog to battle harmful content
Description: Britain proposed new online safety laws on Monday that would slap penalties on social media companies and technology firms if they fail to protect users from harmful content.

Headline: Government hopeful Labour Brexit talks will resume - May's spokeswoman
Description: A spokeswoman for Prime Minister Theresa May said she was hopeful that the government would resume formal talks with the Labour Party on Monday to try to find a solution to the Brexit impasse.

Headline: British voters say - Give us a strong leader and reform the Brexit-fatigued system
Description: British voters want a strong leader who is willing to break the rules and force through wide scale reform after three years of Brexit crisis pushed confidence in the political system to a 15-year low.

Headline: No Brexit breakthrough with May's government, Britain's Labour says
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party and Prime Minister Theresa May's government have not yet found a way forward on reaching an agreement on a Brexit divorce deal, Labour's Brexit point man Keir Starmer said on Monday.

Headline: EU's Moscovici optimistic Britain won't crash out of EU on April 12
Description: European Tax Commissioner Pierre Moscovici on Monday said he was convinced Britain would not crash out of the EU on April 12 without a divorce deal, though Prime Minister Theresa May must first persuade leaders a delay would be useful.

Headline: UK culture minister says Brexit Labour talks to continue on Monday
Description: Britain's culture minister Jeremy Wright said the government would continue to talk to the opposition Labour Party on Monday to try to find a solution to the Brexit impasse.

Headline: UK Novichok victim told all would have died if Russia was behind Salisbury attack
Description: A British man whose partner died after being exposed to nerve agent Novichok was told by Russia's ambassador that Moscow could not have been behind the attacks because they would have "killed everyone", he told the Sunday Mirror newspaper.

Headline: Compromise? Time ticking down for Britain to come to Brexit agreement
Description: Britain's government held out the possibility of compromise with the opposition Labour Party on Sunday to try to win support in parliament for leaving the European Union with a deal, just days before the latest Brexit date.

Headline: Germany's Scholz urges UK government, Labour to agree to avoid no-deal Brexit
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz called on the British government and opposition Labour Party on Sunday to find a pragmatic agreement for Britain to leave the European Union.

Headline: May says greater risk of no Brexit the longer it takes to find compromise
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Saturday that the longer it takes to find a compromise with the opposition Labour Party to secure a parliamentary majority for a Brexit deal, the less likely it is that Britain will leave the European Union.

Headline: May has not moved 'an inch' on Brexit, says Labour's legal chief
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has not moved "an inch" on her Brexit "red lines", Labour's top legal policy chief Shami Chakrabarti said on Sunday, suggesting there was little hope of a quick breakthrough before an EU summit.

Headline: Eurosceptic lawmaker says Britain should make life difficult if left in EU
Description: Leading eurosceptic Conservative lawmaker Jacob Rees-Mogg said if Britain were to stay in the European Union beyond April 12, the country should become the bloc's most difficult member and veto a seven-year financial framework.

Headline: May has plan to offer Labour Brexit customs arrangement - Sunday Times
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government has a plan to enshrine in law a customs arrangement with the European Union in a bid to win over the opposition Labour Party to back a Brexit deal, The Sunday Times newspaper reported.

Headline: Second Brexit vote would be 'ultimate betrayal' - Andrea Leadsom
Description: A second public vote on Britain's membership of the European Union would be the "ultimate betrayal", Andrea Leadsom, the leader of the House of Commons or lower house of parliament, wrote in the Sunday Telegraph newspaper.

Headline: May says choice between leaving EU with deal or no Brexit - The Observer
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said there was now a clear choice between Britain exiting the European Union with a deal or not leaving at all as she tries to find a compromise with the opposition Labour Party, The Observer newspaper reported.

Headline: UK Labour leader waiting for government Brexit red lines to move - BBC
Description: Britain's Labour Party is waiting for the government's Brexit "red lines" to move after talks with the governing Conservatives aimed at ending the deadlock, opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Saturday, according to the BBC.

Headline: May's Brexit talks with Labour stall, delay request fails to convince EU
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party said on Friday that talks with the government on a last-ditch Brexit deal had made no progress, as EU leaders said Prime Minister Theresa May had not convinced them that they should let Britain delay its departure next week.

Headline: UK government ready to hold more Brexit talks with opposition Labour this weekend
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government is ready to hold more discussions with the opposition Labour party this weekend over Brexit, a spokesman for May's office said on Friday.

Headline: Labour party urges PM May to change her EU deal
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party, which is holding talks with Prime Minister Theresa May in an effort to find a way out of the Brexit impasse, urged her on Friday to offer a real change to her EU withdrawal deal.

Headline: EU weighs options for granting Brexit delay next week
Description: European Union envoys on Friday discussed options for granting Britain another Brexit delay next week.

Headline: Germany: UK PM needs to come up with a Brexit plan, stop playing for time
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May must come up with a plan on how to proceed with Brexit, German Justice Minister Katarina Barley said on Friday, adding that London needed to stop playing for time.

Headline: DUP leader Foster blames London and Brussels for Brexit chaos
Description: The leader of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party on Friday said leaving the European Union was "chaotic" because of intransigence in Brussels and ineffectiveness in London.

Headline: Dutch PM Rutte: May's letter alone not enough to grant new Brexit delay
Description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said on Friday that Britain's request to delay Brexit until June 30 needs to be "clarified" before or at a summit of European Union leaders next week before EU can grant a postponement.

Headline: Longer Brexit extension might make more sense - Irish PM
Description: A longer Brexit extension might be favourable to avoid continued uncertainty, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Friday, after his British counterpart Theresa May asked for a delay until up to June 30.

Headline: Factbox: Lost in the Brexit maze - What happens next in Britain?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has formally asked for another delay to the country's exit from the European Union, buying time to thrash out an alternative Brexit plan with her political opponents.

Headline: Hunt says no-deal Brexit might mean recession in Britain and in EU
Description: British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt on Friday said neither Britain nor other European Union member states wanted a no-deal Brexit and that economies in the bloc were not growing fast enough to stave off a recession in such an event.

Headline: EU Commission declines to comment on possible Brexit extension
Description: The European Commission, which has led EU negotiations with Britain over Brexit, declined on Friday to comment on a possible further delay to Britain's departure from the bloc.

Headline: Britain's Hunt says no one wants a long Brexit delay
Description: British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said that neither Britain nor European Union member states wanted a long delay to Brexit and that his government was leaving "no stone unturned" in its bid to find a solution to the deadlock.

Headline: May has set no time limit on talks with Labour - spokesman
Description: The British government's talks with the opposition Labour Party, which are focused on creating a Brexit deal that can be put to the European Union, have no time limit, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Friday.

Headline: Senior German lawmaker: May's Brexit delay request doesn't make sense
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's request for an extension of Britain's departure from the European Union until up to June 30 is motivated by "domestic tactical maneuvering" but does not make sense, a senior German lawmaker said on Friday.

Headline: Germany: Key that PM recognised Britain must prepare for EU vote
Description: It is important that Prime Minister Theresa May recognised in a letter to the European Union asking for a Brexit delay until up to June 30 that Britain must prepare for European elections, a German government spokesman said.

Headline: Text: Theresa May asks Donald Tusk to delay Brexit to June 30
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May wrote to European Council President Donald Tusk on Friday asking to delay Brexit until June 30.

Headline: Britain's Co-op stops kitchen knife sales as stabbings rise
Description: Britain's sixth largest supermarket operator Co-operative Group was the latest chain on Friday to say it had stopped selling single kitchen knives in response to a wave of fatal stabbings.

Headline: France slams as 'clumsy', 'premature' talks of Brexit delay - source
Description: France considers as premature talks of granting Britain another extension to the Brexit negotiation period, a source close to French President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday.

Headline: Brexit 'flextension' idea of EU's Tusk would allow UK to leave on July 1 - senior official
Description: A proposal by European Council President Donald Tusk for a year-long Brexit delay would allow the United Kingdom to leave on July 1 as well if its parliament has ratified the EU divorce deal by then, a senior official within the bloc said on Friday.

Headline: Senior German conservative - We should agree to Brexit extension
Description: The European Union should agree to a Brexit extension if it enables Britain to avoid a chaotic exit, a senior German conservative said after British Prime Minister Theresa May asked the EU for a delay of Brexit until up to June 30.

Headline: Labour can do Brexit deal with PM May but needs new referendum - deputy leader
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party can do a deal with Prime Minister Theresa May on customs arrangements but the party might not support any Brexit proposal unless it includes a new referendum, deputy leader Tom Watson said.

Headline: EU's Tusk considering 'flexible' Brexit extension up to one year - EU official
Description: The chairman of European Union leaders Donald Tusk is likely to offer Britain a flexible extension of the date of the country's exit from the EU of up to one year, with the possibility of leaving sooner, a senior EU official said.

Headline: Labour Party holds Welsh parliamentary seat
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party defeated the governing Conservatives in a by-election, retaining a parliamentary seat as Prime Minister Theresa May struggles to ratify her Brexit divorce deal.

Headline: Parts of UK government risk further cuts after austerity ends - Hammond
Description: An end to austerity in Britain does not mean all government departments will see their budgets keep pace with inflation, Conservative finance minister Philip Hammond said on Friday.

Headline: No-deal Brexit may have steep costs for some sectors - WTO chief
Description: If the United Kingdom leaves the European Union without a deal it could have "very significant" costs for some parts of the British economy, Roberto Azevedo, Director-General of the World Trade Organisation (WTO), said on Thursday.

Headline: Goldman Sachs lowers chances of no-deal Brexit as cross-party talks continue
Description: Goldman Sachs cut its estimate of the likelihood Britain leaves the European Union without a deal on Friday after Prime Minister Theresa May embarked on further cross-party talks to break a deadlock over how, when, and even whether Brexit would happen.

Headline: EU's Tusk proposes to offer UK 12-month 'flexible' extension to Brexit date - BBC
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk is proposing to make an offer of a 12-month "flexible" extension to the UK's Brexit date, the BBC reported on Friday, citing a senior European Union source.

Headline: Rain stops play: UK parliament forced to close after water leak
Description: Britain's parliament was forced to close early on Thursday after a leak in the 19th century Gothic palace caused water to rain down into the debating chamber.

Headline: Brexiteer Lords try to thwart law forcing May to request EU exit delay
Description: Pro-Brexit lawmakers in Britain's upper house of parliament tried on Thursday to thwart the approval of a new law that would force Prime Minister Theresa May to seek a delay to prevent a disorderly EU exit on April 12 without a deal.

Headline: Irish PM pleads patience, says nobody wants no-deal Brexit
Description: Nobody wants Britain to leave the European Union next week without a divorce agreement and EU leaders must be patient while talks continue in London, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit delay law will not complete House of Lords stages on Thursday -Labour
Description: Britain's upper house of parliament will not finish debating and voting on a new law which would force Prime Minister Theresa May to seek a delay to Brexit until Monday, the opposition Labour Party said.

Headline: Brexit - UK loses £6.6 billion a quarter since referendum, S&P says
Description: The United Kingdom has lost £6.6 billion in economic activity every quarter since it voted to leave the European Union, according to S&P Global Ratings, the latest company to estimate the damage from Brexit.

Headline: PM May's party may put second referendum option to lawmakers - Guardian
Description: Theresa May's government is drafting a letter to the opposition Labour Party that could suggest allowing lawmakers to decide whether there should be a confirmatory referendum on any Brexit deal, the Guardian reported on Thursday.

Headline: Conservative Party Deputy Chairman Cleverly named junior Brexit minister
Description: James Cleverly, the deputy chairman of the ruling Conservative Party, has been appointed as a junior minister in the Brexit department, replacing a lawmaker who quit in protest at the government's strategy.

Headline: Merkel hopeful May can present new Brexit proposals by Wednesday
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said recent days had seen significant shifts in the discussion surrounding Brexit in London, and she hoped this would let Britain's Prime Minister present workable proposals to her fellow leaders next week.

Headline: Brexit? It's all Greek to me, says PM Tsipras in Athens
Description: Greece's prime minister said on Thursday he was struggling to understand Britain's Brexit machinations and was surprised its political system could not find a way out of the crisis.

Headline: Text: Go "extra step" to get Brexit deal, Labour lawmakers urge Corbyn
Description: Twenty-five lawmakers in Britain's opposition Labour Party have urged their leader, Jeremy Corbyn, to go the "extra step" if there is a chance of agreeing a Brexit deal in talks with Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: Exclusive: Go "extra step" to get Brexit deal, Labour MPs urge Corbyn
Description: Twenty-five lawmakers in Britain's opposition Labour Party have urged their leader, Jeremy Corbyn, to go the "extra step" if there is a chance of agreeing a Brexit deal in talks with Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: No indicative Brexit votes planned for Monday - May's spokesman
Description: The British government has not taken the required steps to hold votes on different Brexit options in parliament on Monday, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: May seems to prefer talking to Labour than asking lawmakers for Brexit preferences - BBC political editor
Description: Theresa May's government looks set to keep talking to the opposition Labour Party to find a breakthrough in the Brexit process rather than asking lawmakers across the House of Commons for their preferences, the BBC's political editor said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain heading towards a hard Brexit - EU commissioner
Description: Britain appears to be rushing towards a hard "no deal" Brexit because the British parliament cannot agree on clear alternatives, European Commission Vice President Jyrki Katainen said on Thursday.

Headline: UK lawmakers risk tying PM May's hands with Brexit bill: May's spokesman
Description: Lawmakers risk tying the hands of Prime Minister Theresa May in negotiations if they pass a bill that will force her to seek a further Brexit delay to stop Britain leaving the European Union on April 12 without a deal, her spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit: UBS WM sees long extension to Article 50
Description: UBS Global Wealth Management said on Thursday it foresees a long extension to Article 50 as it expects UK PM Theresa May's attempt to build a cross-party consensus on the country's exit from the European Union is unlikely to win enough support in parliament.

Headline: UK might have to hold European Parliament elections - Brexit minister
Description: Britain's Brexit minister said he could not rule out the possibility of the country taking part in next month's elections for the European Parliament, despite the damage that could inflict on the British political system.

Headline: UK lawmakers might need to sit on Brexit day
Description: The lower house of Britain's parliament might need to sit on Friday, April 12, the day the country is currently due to leave the European Union, the government's leader in the House of Commons said on Thursday.

Headline: In Brexit-on-Sea, the left-behind still want Out
Description: On a Sunday evening in March, Evelyn Ovington and her granddaughter Dana Marie went to play bingo as usual in their local town hall near Skegness, a resort on the east coast of England. Like many of the country's seaside towns, it is battling decline and voted heavily to quit the European Union in the 2016 Brexit referendum.

Headline: May's deal preferable than a customs union - minister
