Description: Britain's health minister said it was in the national interest to deliver the prime minister's Brexit deal rather than a customs union, as proposed by opposition Labour after the two sides started talks to try to break a deadlock over Brexit.

Headline: May can only deliver Brexit deal with Labour's support - minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will only be able to pass her Brexit divorce deal with the help of opposition Labour lawmakers because eurosceptics in her party are opposed to the agreement, the health minister Matt Hancock said.

Headline: UK hints at long Brexit delay with option to leave as soon as deal approved
Description: Britain could ask the European Union for a long Brexit delay that gives the option to leave as soon as a divorce deal is approved by parliament, finance minister Philip Hammond indicated on Wednesday.

Headline: UK upper house to start approval process for Brexit delay law from 1030 GMT
Description: The upper house of Britain's parliament will start debating on Thursday legislation to force Prime Minister Theresa May to seek a Brexit delay to prevent a potentially disorderly departure on April 12 without a deal.

Headline: British troops criticised for Corbyn 'target practise' video
Description: Britain's defence ministry said on Wednesday it had launched an investigation into a video circulating on social media apparently showing soldiers using a picture of opposition Labour party leader Jeremy Corbyn for target practise.

Headline: Germany's Merkel to meet border residents on Brexit visit to Ireland
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel will meet residents who live along the border between Ireland and Northern Ireland during a visit to Dublin on Thursday to discuss Brexit to learn what impact any return of frontier checks would have on their lives.

Headline: Brexit delay law approved by House of Commons
Description: The lower house of the British parliament on Wednesday approved legislation which would force Prime Minister Theresa May to seek a Brexit delay to prevent a potentially disorderly departure on April 12 without a deal.

Headline: PM May's government could lose five cabinet ministers over Brexit gambit - The Sun
Description: As many as 15 ministers in Prime Minister Theresa May's government are on the edge of resigning over her Brexit talks with the opposition Labour Party, The Sun newspaper reported.

Headline: EU cannot keep granting two-week Brexit delays - Timmermans
Description: The European Union cannot keep delaying Britain's departure from the bloc by another two weeks, the deputy head of the European Commission said in remarks published on Thursday.

Headline: May's talks with Labour on breaking Brexit deadlock likely to fail, Times quotes source
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's talks with the opposition Labour Party on breaking the deadlock over Brexit are likely to fail, The Times newspaper quoted an unidentified Whitehall source as saying.

Headline: Britain faces a long delay to Brexit, Hammond says - ITV
Description: Britain will have to agree a long delay to Brexit and prepare for participation in European parliamentary elections in late May, finance minister Philip Hammond was quoted as saying by ITV's political editor.

Headline: DUP lawmaker hints at supporting a customs union post-Brexit - BBC correspondent
Description: A lawmaker from the Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government appeared to hold out the prospect of the party supporting Britain's membership of a post-Brexit customs union, a BBC correspondent said.

Headline: Lawmakers approve first stage of Brexit delay law
Description: British lawmakers voted on Wednesday to approve the first stage of legislation which would force Prime Minister Theresa May to seek a delay to Brexit in order to prevent the risk of leaving without a deal on April 12.

Headline: Labour's Corbyn: no agreement with May on referendum
Description: UK opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn said there had been no agreement with Prime Minister Theresa May on the option of a second referendum when they met to discuss possible ways out of the Brexit impasse.

Headline: Lawmakers vote to go ahead with debate on Brexit delay law
Description: British lawmakers on Wednesday voted to begin debating legislation which would force Prime Minister Theresa May to seek a delay to Brexit in order to prevent the risk of leaving without a deal on April 12.

Headline: Labour Party had "constructive" Brexit talks with PM May
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party said on Wednesday it had had constructive discussions with Prime Minister Theresa May on breaking the Brexit deadlock.

Headline: British parliament rejects plan to hold more Brexit indicative votes on Monday
Description: Britain's House of Commons on rejected a plan to hold more indicative votes on Brexit on Monday.

Headline: Britain could one day leave post-Brexit customs union with EU, attorney general says
Description: Britain could one day review its membership of a possible post-Brexit customs union with the European Union, Attorney General Geoffrey Cox told the BBC.

Headline: May focused on ratifying Brexit deal to leave on May 22 - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is focused on ratifying a Brexit deal before May 22 so that Britain can leave on that day, her spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Junior Brexit minister Heaton-Harris quits May's government
Description: Chris Heaton-Harris, a junior minister in Prime Minister Theresa May's government, quit his job on Wednesday because he did not support any further extension to Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: EU would begin customs controls right after no-deal Brexit
Description: The European Union will immediately introduce customs checks and import duties in the event of a "no deal" Brexit, erecting barriers to British exports ranging from cars to farm produce and preventing consumers bringing in British cheese or meats.

Headline: White House adviser says clean Brexit would spur U.S. trade deal
Description: A so-called clean break between Britain and the European Union could help spur U.S. trade talks with the United Kingdom, White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Wednesday.

Headline: Merkel: Will use Ireland trip to mull how to avoid a hard Brexit
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Wednesday she would fight until the very end for an orderly Brexit and use her visit to Ireland on Thursday to consider the border situation and solutions that could prevent a hard Brexit.

Headline: EU's Juncker: no more short Brexit delays unless leave deal approved by Apr.12
Description: The European Union will not grant Britain another short delay to Brexit if UK lawmakers fail to ratify the stalled divorce agreement by April 12, the head of the bloc's executive European Commission, Jean-Claude Juncker, said on Wednesday.

Headline: Irish PM says thinks EU leaders open to further Brexit extension
Description: Ireland believes European Union leaders are open to granting a British request to further delay its exit from the bloc, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK lawmaker Letwin says Brexit delay law will give May backing in request to EU
Description: British Conservative lawmaker Oliver Letwin said on Wednesday that legislation he hopes to pass to force Prime Minister Theresa May to seek a delay to Brexit will give her backing in her request to the European Union.

Headline: Timeline: Seven days of Brexit - Will a week break Britain's political impasse?

Headline: Labour ready for serious Brexit talks if PM May willing to shift position

Headline: May, Labour's Corbyn to meet at 1330 GMT seeking Brexit compromise - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will meet opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn at 1330 GMT on Wednesday, her spokesman said, adding that further talks could probably be arranged if necessary.

Headline: May says she wants to leave EU on May 22
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she wanted Britain to be able to leave the European Union with an exit deal on May 22.

Headline: May sees areas of agreement with Labour opposition on Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May, speaking ahead of talks with Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn to find a compromise on leaving the European Union, said on Wednesday there were several areas of agreement between them.

Headline: May and Corbyn won't produce best Brexit outcome - Sturgeon
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's talks with opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn to break the Brexit deadlock will not produce the best option for the country, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Wednesday.

Headline: Corbyn says any Brexit deal with May must be made law

Headline: Austria sees "absolutely no reason" for Brexit extension
Description: There is currently "absolutely no reason" for another extension to Brexit because the situation in Britain's parliament has not fundamentally changed, Austria's Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK parliament likely to back Brexit deal agreed by May and Corbyn - Barclay
Description: Britain's parliament is likely to back a Brexit deal if it is agreed between Prime Minister Theresa May and the leader of the opposition Labour Party Jeremy Corbyn, Britain's Brexit minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: Berenberg sees higher chance UK stays in customs union as PM May seeks compromise
Description: Berenberg economists on Wednesday increased their estimate of the likelihood Britain stays in the European Union's customs union after Prime Minister Theresa May said she would work with opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn to break the deadlock on Brexit.

Headline: Brexit - Ireland says will support UK request for short extension
Description: Ireland plans to support a British request for a short further delay to its European Union exit at a Brussels summit next week, and it is very unlikely Britain will crash out with no deal on April 12, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Wednesday.

Headline: New Brexit referendum would take 12 months to prepare - UK minister
Description: The legislation necessary for a potential second referendum on Brexit would take around 12 months to prepare, Britain's Brexit minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK parliament likely to back Brexit deal agreed by May and Corbyn - Barclay
Description: Britain's parliament is likely to back a Brexit deal if it is agreed between Prime Minister Theresa May and the leader of the opposition Labour Party Jeremy Corbyn, Britain's Brexit minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: Austria's Kurz calls on British MPs to avoid no-deal Brexit
Description: Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said on Wednesday he hopes that British lawmakers will back a solution that avoids a hard Brexit as leaving the European Union without a withdrawal agreement would do "massive" harm to Britain's economy.

Headline: UK government would accept parliament decision for soft Brexit - Barclay
Description: Britain's Conservative government would accept parliament's choosing a so-called 'soft' Brexit after failing to secure backing for Prime Minister Theresa May's deal, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said on Wednesday.

Headline: PM May's talks with Labour's Corbyn 'a trap' - Labour lawmaker
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's offer of talks with the opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn to break the Brexit deadlock is a trap, Labour lawmaker Ben Bradshaw said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit - DUP still seeking time limit on Northern Ireland backstop: MP

Headline: UK PM May will not set preconditions in talks with Corbyn - Brexit minister
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will not set preconditions when she begins talks aimed at breaking the Brexit deadlock with opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn on Wednesday, her Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said.

Headline: UK's Labour not setting red lines on talks with PM May - lawmaker
Description: Britain's Labour Party will not make particular topics off-limit when its leader, Jeremy Corbyn, starts talks with Prime Minister Theresa May on reaching a Brexit compromise, a senior Labour lawmaker said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK PM May set to meet opposition leader Corbyn on Wednesday - minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is set to meet the opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn on Wednesday to begin talks on how to break the Brexit deadlock, junior Brexit minister Robin Walker said .

Headline: Labour's Corbyn is someone we can do business with on Brexit - Conservative lawmaker Letwin
Description: Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn can be trusted to work with Prime Minister Theresa May on Brexit, Conservative Party lawmaker Oliver Letwin said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK PM May must resign now - Conservative pro-Brexit lawmaker
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May should resign immediately, Andrew Bridgen, a lawmaker from her Conservative Party who is favour of a hard Brexit said on Wednesday.

Headline: Northern Ireland DUP wary of PM's new Brexit strategy

Headline: We need clarity, France and Germany tell UK after May seeks further Brexit delay
Description: The foreign ministers of Germany and France called for more clarity from London on Tuesday after British Prime Minister Theresa May said she would seek a further delay to Britain's withdrawal from the European Union.

Headline: Gove still hopes Northern Irish DUP will back May's Brexit approach

Description: U.S. investment bank JPMorgan predicted failure for British Prime Minister's appeal for help from opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn to break the Brexit logjam.

Headline: Scotland's Sturgeon says May's Brexit offer is a potential trap

Headline: Softer Brexit would be welcome but PM May needs to deliver - Labour's Benn

Headline: Fourteen ministers against long Brexit extension - The Times

Headline: Let's be open to credible Brexit proposals from Britain: Varadkar

Headline: May could soften Brexit plans: Daily Telegraph reporter

Description: Plans to build a glass viewing tower perched 1,000 feet above London on a slender tower shaped like a tulip have been approved by the local authority.

Headline: UK police investigate devices on rail line linked to Brexit
Description: British police on Tuesday were investigating two attempts to disrupt the rail network that they said were linked to Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Factbox: No-deal Brexit - what it might mean for UK economy

Headline: France's Macron says "no-deal" Brexit would be Britain's own making

Headline: UK lawmakers will try to force May to seek further Brexit delay
Description: A group of British lawmakers said on Tuesday they would try to pass a law which would force Prime Minister Theresa May to seek a delay to Britain's departure from the European Union and thus prevent a potentially chaotic no-deal exit on April 12.

Headline: Rumours that UK government told it cannot hold new Brexit vote - BBC political editor
Description: There are suggestions that Britain's government has been told it will not be allowed to bring Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal back for a fourth vote, the BBC's political editor said on Tuesday.

Headline: May would go for no-deal Brexit over revoking Article 50 - FT reporter

Headline: May will set out future steps before next week's EU summit - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will set out how Britain wants to proceed with its departure from the European Union before a summit of the bloc's leaders on April 10 begins, her spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Brexit - Goldman says risk of general election rises amid parliament impasse

Headline: Brexit deadlocked again - Parliament fails to find an alternative
Description: Britain was no nearer to resolving the chaos surrounding its departure from the European Union after parliament failed on Monday to find a majority of its own for any alternative to Prime Minister Theresa May's divorce deal.

Headline: May's Brexit deal is where I hope we end up, British minister says

Headline: Growing consensus in UK cabinet to accept customs union - The Sun

Headline: UK can avoid long Brexit delay by passing deal this week - minister

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP voted against each alternative Brexit plan - spokesman

Headline: Up to 200 Conservative MPs call for 'managed' no-deal Brexit - ITV's Peston
Description: A junior minister in Prime Minister Theresa May's government is said to have collected 200 signatures from Conservative lawmakers for a letter calling for a 'managed' no-deal Brexit, ITV's Political Editor Robert Peston said.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP won't support any alternative Brexit plans in Monday's votes

Headline: Labour says it will back three alternative Brexit options on Monday

Description: British lawmakers debated halting Brexit on Monday after a record six million people signed a petition to revoke the process that set Britain on course to leave the European Union.

Headline: Factbox: Brexit multiple choice again: How will UK parliament's indicative votes work?
Description: British lawmakers wrested control of the Brexit process for a second day on Monday in order to try to find a majority for an alternative way forward that could break the parliamentary deadlock over Prime Minister Theresa May's proposed deal.

Headline: Britain to take over Birmingham prison permanently from G4S

Headline: Brexit in meltdown - May under pressure to forge softer divorce deal

Headline: Conservative lawmaker: May must promise April 12 Brexit or resign
Description: Conservative lawmaker Richard Drax said on Monday that British Prime Minister Theresa May must commit to deliver Brexit on April 12 or resign immediately.

Headline: May to meet Conservative lawmakers later on Monday - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will meet members of her Conservative Party later on Monday, her spokesman told reporters.

Headline: May holds knife-crime summit with teachers ordered to identify violent youths

Headline: British government to hold five hours of cabinet meetings on Tuesday

Headline: Explainer - Breaking the deadlock over Brexit: Is Britain heading for an election?
Description: With Britain's parliament deadlocked over the way forward on Brexit, speculation is growing that Prime Minister Theresa May could call a snap election to try and break the impasse.

Headline: PM wants to bring UK together, May's spokesman says after whip's comments

Headline: Rees-Mogg fears UK's May will add customs union to Brexit deal
Description: A eurosceptic lawmaker in British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party said on Monday he was worried that May could add a customs union to her Brexit deal with the European Union as a way to break the current parliamentary impasse.

Headline: PM May's Brexit deal still the best option - minister

Headline: UK should have said soft Brexit was inevitable in 2017 - chief whip

Headline: Goldman sees softer, later Brexit after withdrawal agreement defeat

Headline: EU has been patient over Brexit but patience runs out - Juncker

Headline: Fearing Brexit, protesters gather along Irish border

Headline: UK opposition Labour - time may come for another no confidence vote in May's government

Headline: May under pressure to rule out long Brexit delay

Headline: Britain has limited options available on Brexit - Conservative deputy chairman

Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May risks the "total collapse" of her government if she fails to get her battered Brexit deal through parliament, the Sunday Times newspaper said, amid growing speculation that she might call an early election.

Headline: UK PM May under huge pressure from some ministers to pursue 'no deal' Brexit - former minister
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is under huge pressure from some members of her top team of ministers who want to Britain to leave the European Union without a deal, a former minister said on Sunday.

Headline: Advisors to May divided over snap election - Mail on Sunday
Description: Advisors to British Prime Minister Theresa May are divided over whether she should call a national election if she fails to win support for her Brexit deal from parliament in the coming week, the Mail on Sunday newspaper said.

Headline: UK minister sees Conservative support for Brexit customs union plan - ITV reporter
Description: A British government minister plans to back a plan for a customs union with the European Union when parliament votes on Monday on alternatives to Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan, ITV political correspondent Paul Brand said.

Headline: Conservatives may try to stop any early election plan by May - Observer
Description: Lawmakers from British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party are threatening to vote down any attempt she makes to call a snap national election in the face of the country's Brexit impasse, the Observer newspaper said.

Headline: Angry over Brexit delay, 'Leave' supporters march through London

Headline: No-deal Brexit fears rise as parliament sinks May's deal

Headline: May should quit as prime minister soon - Telegraph

Headline: Northern Irish DUP says United Kingdom trumps Brexit

Headline: UK PM May to press on with talks to secure support for Brexit deal - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will press on with talks to secure support for her Brexit deal, her spokesman said on Friday, just minutes after parliament rejected it for a third time.

Headline: Risk of no deal Brexit 'very real' - Dutch PM Rutte

Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday that lawmakers' "grave" decision to reject her Brexit deal for a third time meant that parliament was running out of options for how Britain should leave the European Union.

Headline: May must make way for new leader to take on Brexit - eurosceptic lawmaker
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May must make way for a new leader and acknowledge that her deal to leave the European Union is "finished", pro-Brexit Conservative lawmaker Steve Baker said on Friday.

Headline: EU leaders to meet on Brexit on April 10 - summit chair Tusk
Description: European Union leaders will meet on April 10 to discuss Britain's departure from the bloc, summit chair Donald Tusk said after British lawmakers rejected a deal for a third time on Friday.

Headline: May urges parliament to back divorce deal, guarantee Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May urged parliament on Friday to back her divorce deal with the European Union, saying it was the only way for parliament to guarantee Brexit would happen.

Headline: Passing EU withdrawal deal most important step in Brexit process - Dutch PM
Description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said on Friday the British parliament's approval of the European Union withdrawal agreement would significantly increase the chances of an orderly Brexit by May 22.

Headline: Factbox: Conservative MPs who have switched to back May's Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will put a stripped-down version of her twice-defeated Brexit divorce deal to a vote in parliament on Friday in an attempt to break the impasse over the United Kingdom's exit from the European Union.

Headline: May's offer to quit fails to break Britain's Brexit stalemate
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May failed to sway hardline opponents of her European Union divorce deal on Wednesday with an offer to quit, but parliament's bid to agree an alternative fell short, leaving the Brexit process as deadlocked as ever.

Headline: If Brexit deal fails Friday, UK has till April 12 to decide - Barnier
Description: Britain will need to tell the European Union what it wants to do on Brexit by April 12 if parliament fails on Friday to back the EU withdrawal treaty, the bloc's negotiator Michel Barnier said.

Headline: Former UK Brexit minister Raab says he will back PM May's deal on Friday
Description: Former Brexit minister Dominic Raab said he would vote for the government's Withdrawal Agreement on Friday to avoid the risk of  Britain having to seek a longer delay to its exit from the European Union.

Headline: DUP's Wilson says party will not support Brexit deal today or in the future
Description: Democratic Unionist Party lawmaker Sammy Wilson said on Friday he, and the rest of his party, would oppose the government's attempt to get approval for its European Union Withdrawal Agreement at a vote later and on future occasions.

Headline: Poland advocates for a long Brexit delay if deal not passed - PM
Description: Warsaw is ready for another Brexit delay if London fails to ratify the stalled withdrawal agreement on Friday, Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki said after talks with the bloc's chief negotiator Michel Barnier.

Headline: UK accord to exit treaty enough for smooth Brexit - EU executive
Description: For the European Union, Britain's ratification of the Withdrawal Agreement being voted on in parliament on Friday would be sufficient to ensure the country's orderly departure from the bloc, the European Commission said.

Headline: DUP opposition to Brexit deal 'still stands' - spokesman
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party's (DUP) stance that it cannot back a Brexit divorce deal that does not protect the whole of the United Kingdom "still stands and is our position," a spokesman for the party said on Friday.

Headline: UK independent MPs seek to become political party for European elections
Description: A group of pro-European Union British lawmakers who quit the governing Conservatives and opposition Labour over Brexit said on Friday they had applied to become a political party in order to stand in May's European elections.

Headline: EU's Barnier says negotiating new deal more important than Brexit divorce
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator, Michel Barnier, said on Friday that the stalled divorce agreement was "the best compromise" for both sides and that crucial for London was focusing on agreeing a new relationship with the bloc.

Headline: UK parliament to debate Brexit on Friday, exact format unclear
Description: Britain's parliament will discuss a motion relating to Brexit on Friday, the government's leader in parliament Andrea Leadsom said on Thursday, but it was not yet clear whether this would result in a formal third vote on the government's Brexit deal.

Headline: When is a Brexit vote not a Brexit vote? March 29
Description: Britain's parliament holds a special sitting on Friday to discuss and vote on Brexit, potentially unlocking an extension to May 22 to the country's exit from the European Union but falling short of the criteria needed to formally ratify the deal.

Headline: Forget Brexit, there's a new British royal baby on the way
Description: For Britons wearied by the endless contortions of their country's exit from the European Union, the impending birth of Prince Harry and his American wife Meghan's first baby is set to provide some welcome light relief.

Headline: Irish PM to meet Germany's Merkel, France's Macron on Brexit
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar will visit French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday to take stock of the latest Brexit developments, two days before he welcomes German Chancellor Angela Merkel to Dublin.

Headline: Germany's Merkel to make Brexit visit to Ireland on Thursday
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel will visit Ireland on Thursday for talks with her Irish counterpart Leo Varadkar on Brexit, a German government spokeswoman said on Friday.

Headline: EU's Barnier: approval of Brexit deal today to secure 22 May exit
Description: Britain would secure a new Brexit date of May 22 if its parliament approves the EU divorce deal on Friday, the bloc's chief negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday.

Headline: Friday's Brexit vote is last chance to secure exit delay - Attorney General
Description: Britain's Attorney General Geoffrey Cox urged lawmakers to approve the government's EU withdrawal agreement on Friday, saying it was lawmakers' last chance to ensure that Brexit will be delayed until May 22.

Headline: No amendments selected for UK's Brexit debate on Friday - speaker
Description: Britain's parliament will not discuss and vote upon any amendments during Friday's debate on Brexit, Speaker John Bercow said.

Headline: On what was once Brexit day, parliament again votes on PM May's deal
Description: British lawmakers will on Friday debate and vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's Withdrawal Agreement to leave the European Union on May 22, a delay she won with the bloc's leaders last week.

Headline: 'Real fear' in parliament that Brexit will never happen - UK trade minister
Description: There is fear in parliament that Britain may never leave the European Union, trade minister Liam Fox said on Friday, as Prime Minister Theresa May struggles to get her Brexit deal approved by lawmakers.

Headline: Last chance to vote for Brexit as we understand it - UK trade minister
Description: Friday's parliamentary vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's withdrawal agreement is the last chance to vote for Brexit as we understand it, Britain's international trade minister said.

Headline: Voting for UK PM May's Brexit Withdrawal Agreement is 'surrender' - lawmaker Francois
Description: Voting for Prime Minister Theresa May's Withdrawal Agreement on Friday would be a surrender, pro-Brexit Conservative lawmaker Mark Francois said on Friday.

Headline: Next UK PM must believe in Brexit - former Conservative leader Duncan Smith
Description: Britain's next prime minister must be someone who believes in Brexit, the former leader of the ruling Conservative Party Iain Duncan Smith said on Friday.

Description: Goldman Sachs on Friday said a parliamentary vote on Britain's Withdrawal Agreement with the European Union, without the Political Declaration alongside it, could convince more lawmakers to support Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal but will be a close result.

Headline: May plans watered-down Brexit vote to secure departure delay
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May scrambled on Thursday for a way to secure a new delay to Brexit in the face of parliamentary deadlock by setting out plans for a watered-down vote on her EU divorce deal to be held on Friday.

Headline: Softer Brexit now possible, not DUP's priority - deputy leader
Description: The deputy leader of the Northern Irish party propping up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said a Brexit outcome that keeps the United Kingdom more closely aligned to the European Union is now a possibility.

Headline: DUP says it will not back PM May's watered-down Brexit deal on Friday
Description: The Northern Irish Democratic Unionist Party will not back Prime Minister Theresa May's withdrawal agreement from the European Union when she brings it for a vote on Friday, the party's deputy leader said.

Headline: National Grid shares fall on report of Labour party's renationalisation plan
Description: National Grid shares fell more than 3 percent on Thursday after the BBC reported that Britain's main opposition Labour party is preparing to announce plans to renationalise the utility.

Headline: TEXT - Brexit motion to be debated in UK parliament on Friday
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government will ask lawmakers on Friday to vote for a motion approving the Withdrawal Agreement (WA) reached with the EU last November.

Headline: UK lawmakers can secure May 22 Brexit delay by approving divorce deal on Friday - govt
Description: Britain's parliament will be able to secure a delay to Brexit to May 22 by approving the government's Withdrawal Agreement with the European Union in a vote on Friday, the leader of the House of Commons Andrea Leadsom said.

Headline: EU sees no-deal Brexit more likely than ever - diplomats
Description: Britain is more likely than ever to crash out of the European Union, diplomats and officials with the bloc said on Thursday after the UK parliament failed to produce a majority for any Brexit option and Theresa May was struggling to get her divorce deal approved.

Headline: Factbox: Who might be Britain's next prime minister if May quits?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May offered on Wednesday to quit if her twice-defeated EU divorce deal passes, in a last-ditch attempt to persuade Eurosceptics to back it.

Headline: UK parliament speaker approves Friday vote on Brexit Withdrawal Agreement
Description: British parliament Speaker John Bercow said on Thursday he had accepted the government's bid to hold a vote on its Brexit deal on Friday as it will cover only the Withdrawal Agreement element of the country's European Union exit package.

Headline: Terms of Friday Brexit debate still subject to speaker approval - PM's spokesman
Description: The terms of Friday's parliamentary debate on Brexit remain subject to agreement by the Speaker, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: No: May's Brexit deal hits unionist wall

Headline: Brexit: DUP leader says abstaining on May's deal 'never an option'

Headline: Capturing Theresa May's loneliest moment

Headline: Labour will not support a vote on Brexit divorce deal without future relationship
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will not support Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal if she asks parliament to vote on just the divorce element without the agreement on the future relationship, its Brexit spokesman will say on Thursday.

Headline: DUP not in Brexit talks with UK government, none planned - spokesman
Description: The Northern Irish party propping up British Prime Minister Theresa May has not been in negotiations with her government on Thursday and no further Brexit talks are planned, a spokesman for the party said.

Headline: Brexit debate on Friday will not be 'meaningful vote' on exit deal - PA

Headline: DUP not in talks right now with May's government about Brexit deal - BBC political editor
Description: The Northern Irish Democratic Unionist Party is not engaged in any further talks with British Prime Minister Theresa May's government on her Brexit deal at the moment, the BBC's political editor said, citing unidentified DUP sources.

Headline: May presses on with bid to get Brexit deal through parliament - spokesman

Headline: Boris Johnson says May's Brexit deal is "dead" - Evening Standard newspaper
Description: Boris Johnson, who led the campaign to leave the European Union, said Prime Minister Theresa May's twice-defeated Brexit divorce deal is dead, the Evening Standard newspaper said on Thursday.

Headline: Prince William to visit New Zealand to honour shooting victims

Headline: Disappointed, says lawmaker who led move for parliament to seize Brexit

Description: British lawmakers wrested control of the Brexit process from the government on Wednesday to try to find a majority for an alternative way forward that could break the parliamentary deadlock over Prime Minister Theresa May's proposed deal.

Headline: Angst and apathy outside parliament as lawmakers debate Brexit options
Description: Robert Unbranded stands out from other protesters outside the British parliament, and not just because of his red jumpsuit, wild hair and unusual surname.

Headline: Prince Charles mixes mojitos, grinds sugar cane on last day of Cuba trip
Description: His wife may have had some initial reservations about Cuban cuisine, but Prince Charles was so enchanted that he asked for some black bean croquettes to take away with him at a tasting session during the British royals' historic trip to Communist-run Cuba.

Headline: DUP says will not support May's Brexit deal
Description: The Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Wednesday it would not support her Brexit divorce deal.

Description: A leadership contest to replace British Prime Minister Theresa May will begin after May 22 if her deal to leave the European Union is passed by parliament, her office told Conservative MPs on Wednesday.

Headline: Boris Johnson will now back UK PM May's Brexit deal - Times reporter
Description: Boris Johnson, former British foreign minister and prominent eurosceptic, will now back Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal after she promised to quit if it passes, the deputy political editor of The Times said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit: Highly unlikely DUP will back May's deal - UTV
Description: Northern Irish broadcaster UTV on Wednesday reported that the Democratic Unionist Party was very unlikely to give their support to British Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal.

Headline: Rees-Mogg says will back May's Brexit deal if DUP abstain
Description: Jacob Rees-Mogg, a leading Brexiteer in Theresa May's Conservative Party, said he would back the prime minister's EU divorce deal if the Northern Irish DUP party that props up the government abstains on the issue.

Headline: UK government moves to make parliament sit on Friday, mulls Brexit vote - minister

Headline: Factbox - Brexit multiple choice: How will UK parliament's indicative votes work?
Description: British lawmakers wrested control of the Brexit process from the government on Wednesday in order to try to find a majority for an alternative way forward that could break the parliamentary deadlock over Prime Minister Theresa May's proposed deal.

Headline: Labour will back Brexit options which prevent bad deal and 'no deal' - spokesman

Headline: DUP says its Brexit position has not changed
Description: The Democratic Unionist Party's (DUP) position on Brexit remains unchanged, a spokesman for the Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Wednesday.

Headline: Good Friday agreement will apply in all Brexit scenarios - EU's Barnier

Headline: Brexiteer Rees-Mogg says to back PM May's Brexit deal if DUP do

Headline: UK Conservative MP Letwin says will back PM May's deal

Headline: Hardline Brexiteer Boris Johnson edging towards May's deal - Telegraph

Headline: UK lawmakers propose Brexit choice between no-deal and "revoke" if all else fails

Description: British Conservative lawmaker Nick Boles is proposing a common market 2.0 motion as a Brexit option to be voted on as part of a series of indicative votes to be held in parliament on Wednesday, according to a reporter at The Telegraph newspaper.

Headline: UK lawmaker proposes new UK-EU customs union as Brexit option
Description: A British lawmaker has proposed a motion with other parliamentarians to compel the government to negotiate a new UK-EU customs union after Brexit as part of a series of indicative votes due to be held on Wednesday.

Headline: Eurosceptic UK lawmakers challenge PM May over Brexit delay - letter
Description: Pro-Brexit Conservative lawmakers have written to Prime Minister Theresa May to raise "serious legal doubts" over her decision to delay Britain's departure from the European Union, calling on her to explain the government's actions.

Headline: DUP says Brexit position unchanged after report it favours delay

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP prefer long delay to May's Brexit deal - Sky News
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party (DUP), which currently props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government, would prefer a long delay and change of leader to May's Brexit deal, Sky News reported on Tuesday.

Headline: PM May will engage constructively with parliament on Brexit options votes - spokesman
Description: British ministers had a long discussion on Tuesday about a vote by lawmakers late on Monday to seize control of the Brexit process and Prime Minister Theresa May will engage constructively with the process, her spokesman said.

Headline: May expected to set resignation date on Wednesday - Sun newspaper
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is expected to set a date for her resignation when she addresses Conservative lawmakers on Wednesday afternoon, the Sun's political editor said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britons backing away from Brexit, but no safe bets - pollster
Description: British voters appear to be changing their minds about leaving the European Union, Britain's leading polling expert said on Tuesday, but not to a degree that would make a different result in another referendum a safe bet.

Headline: Amid Brexit chaos, May to address Conservatives on Wednesday - lawmaker
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will address a meeting of Conservative lawmakers in parliament on Wednesday, one of her lawmakers said on Tuesday, in a week when she lost control of the process of Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: UK House of Commons leader Leadsom to make statement to parliament on Tuesday - office
Description: Andrea Leadsom, who is in charge of the British government's business in parliament, will make a statement to lawmakers on Tuesday, her office said on Twitter.

Headline: Head of UK Conservative eurosceptics: it's May's deal or no Brexit
Description: The leader of a faction in British Prime Minister Theresa May’s Conservative Party demanding a clean break from the European Union said there was a clear choice now facing lawmakers: back the government's divorce deal or risk no Brexit at all.

Headline: MPs vote to seize control of Brexit for a day
Description: British lawmakers wrested control of the parliamentary agenda from the government for a day in a highly unusual bid to find a way through the Brexit impasse after Prime Minister Theresa May's EU divorce deal was rejected again.

Headline: May would take lawmakers' Brexit proposals to Brussels - former minister
Description: A former British minister who stepped down on Monday to vote against Prime Minister Theresa May's approach to Brexit said he was confident she would present future proposals from parliament to Brussels.

Headline: UK lawmakers who want no-deal Brexit must now back May: minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal is the only way forward for lawmakers who have argued for a no-deal Brexit, health minister Matt Hancock said on Tuesday.

Headline: Goldman Sachs keeps Brexit bets unchanged after UK parliament takes control
Description: Goldman Sachs stuck to its estimates of Brexit outcomes on Tuesday after British lawmakers voted late Monday to seize control of the parliamentary agenda for a day to break the impasse in Britain's tortuous exit from the European Union.

Headline: Shakespeare's birthplace mirrors a scepter'd isle riven by Brexit discontent
Description: In William Shakespeare's ancient birthplace, discontent over Brexit runs even deeper than three years ago when this "scepter'd isle" shocked the world by voting to leave the European Union.

Headline: Brexit in numbers: How did parliament vote on Monday?
Description: British lawmakers on Monday used a vote on the government's next steps on Brexit to wrest control of the process so that they can then try to find a majority for an alternative that would break the parliamentary deadlock.

Headline: Britain calls for 'realism' on Brexit after parliament grabs control
Description: The British government on Monday called for realism after parliament grabbed control of Brexit.

Headline: May indicated she could resign as price for passing Brexit deal - The Sun
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May indicated to some Brexit-supporting lawmakers on Sunday that she would consider resigning in exchange for parliament backing her Brexit deal, The Sun newspaper reported.

Headline: Junior foreign minister Burt resigns over Brexit
Description: British junior foreign minister Alistair Burt has resigned to vote against the government for a proposal to give parliament control over the Brexit process, Press Association reported.

Headline: UK lawmakers vote to take control of Brexit process
Description: British lawmakers on Monday voted to wrest control of the Brexit process to try to find a majority for an alternative way forward that would break the parliamentary deadlock.

Headline: Parliament faces choice on who controls business - Brexit minister
Description: British lawmakers face the question of who controls business in parliament, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said on Monday, trying to persuade them to reject a bid by parliament to wrest control of Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: Pro-Brexit ERG lawmakers to vote against all amendments on Monday - lawmaker
Description: The pro-Brexit European Research Group of Conservative lawmakers plans to vote against all proposed changes to Prime Minister Theresa May's next steps on Brexit on Monday, a Conservative lawmaker said.

Headline: Parliament's bid to control Brexit process is not constitutional revolution - lawmaker
Description: A British lawmaker said his plan to allow parliament to wrestle control of the Brexit process from the government by trying to find a majority for an alternative way forward to end the impasse is not an attempt at a constitutional revolution.

Description: The British government will provide time for parliament to debate the way forward on Brexit later this week if an attempt by lawmakers to wrest control of the process does not pass on Monday, Cabinet Office minister David Lidington said.

Headline: Brexit: What will happen in the British parliament on Monday?
Description: British lawmakers will on Monday seek to use a vote on the government's next steps on Brexit to wrest control of the process so that they can then try to find a majority for an alternative that would break the parliamentary deadlock.

Headline: Brexit up in the air as May pushes divorce deal for third time
Description: (Corrects this March 23 story to show the petition is to revoke Article 50, not for another vote.)

Headline: Brexit: What will happen in the British parliament on Monday?
Description: British lawmakers will on Monday seek to use a vote on the government's next steps on Brexit to wrest control of the process so that they can then try to find a majority for an alternative that would break the parliamentary deadlock.

Headline: Parliament to vote on three proposed changes to PM May's next steps on Brexit
Description: British lawmakers will on Monday have the opportunity to vote on up to three proposed changes to Prime Minister Theresa May's next steps on Brexit, the Speaker of the House of Commons, John Bercow, said.

Description: EU officials said on Monday they had completed their plans for what they saw as an increasingly likely no-deal Brexit, piling pressure on British Prime Minister Theresa May as she battled to persuade her own lawmakers to back a divorce agreement.

Headline: Asked if she will lead next Brexit talks, May says she is doing the job

Headline: UK leaving the EU without a Brexit deal would be difficult - PM May's spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May would find it difficult to take Britain out of the European Union without a Brexit divorce deal after parliament expressed a clear view that it is opposed to this outcome, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: May says parliament will debate formal delay to Brexit date on Wednesday
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday that parliament would debate secondary legislation on Wednesday to formally change the date of Brexit in British law.

Headline: May says she still hopes to bring her Brexit deal back to Parliament
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she still hoped to submit her twice-defeated Brexit deal to another vote by lawmakers.

Headline: May's Brexit approach is "national embarrassment"- Labour leader
Description: The leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, said on Monday that Prime Minister Theresa May's approach to Brexit had become "a national embarrassment" that risked Britain leaving the European Union without an agreement.
