Description: Britain's opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn told Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday there was no basis for bringing her twice-defeated Brexit deal back to parliament for a third vote, a party spokesman said.

Headline: Prince Charles becomes first British royal to visit Cuba
Description: Prince Charles and his wife Camilla landed in Havana on Sunday for the first official trip by the British royal family to Communist-run Cuba even as Britain's top ally the United States seeks to isolate the island nation.

Headline: DUP leader told May nothing has changed on Brexit stance - spokesman
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party propping up Theresa May's government told the British prime minister on Monday that their opposition to her Brexit divorce deal had not changed, a spokesman for the party said.

Headline: UK lawmakers look set to win vote to take control of Brexit process: source
Description: British lawmakers are likely to win a vote on Monday to wrestle control of the Brexit process from the government by trying to find a majority for an alternative way forward to break the parliamentary deadlock, a government source said.

Headline: May will only hold new Brexit vote if there's a chance of success - spokesman
Description: Britain's government will only hold another so-called meaningful vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal if it has a chance of getting the support of parliament on a third attempt, her spokesman said.

Headline: No shift in DUP stance against May's Brexit plan - BBC
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish Democratic Unionist Party, Arlene Foster, showed no change in her opposition to Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal in a telephone call with May on Monday, the BBC's political editor Laura Kuenssberg said.

Headline: UK PM May could put her Brexit deal to a vote in parliament on Tuesday - ITV reporter
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May could put her twice-defeated Brexit divorce deal to a vote in parliament on Tuesday, ITV's political correspondent said, though he later said no final decision had yet been taken on the timing.

Headline: After London march, EU still assumes UK will leave - Commission
Description: The European Commission is working on the assumption that Britain will leave the EU unless the UK government tells it otherwise, the European Commision said on Monday after hundreds of thousands of people marched in London on Saturday to demand a new referendum.

Headline: May should not resign over Brexit - pensions minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May should not resign in the face of intensified criticism from her own Conservative Party over her handling of Brexit, work and pensions minister Amber Rudd said on Monday.

Headline: UK might not leave EU at all if May's deal fails - Fox
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox said on Monday that Britain might not leave the European Union if Prime Minister Theresa May's deal is not approved by parliament, triggering a democratic and constitutional crisis.

Headline: UK ministers meet to discuss parliament's bid for Brexit control - source
Description: British ministers will discuss how to address parliament's attempts to take control of Britain's departure from the European Union at 0900 GMT on Monday before a meeting of Prime Minister Theresa May's cabinet team, a government source said.

Headline: PM May told Brexiteers she'll quit if they vote for her deal - ITV
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told Brexit-supporting lawmakers on Sunday that she would quit if they voted for her twice-defeated European Union divorce deal, ITV news said.

Headline: May has lost confidence of cabinet and party - lawmaker
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has lost the confidence of her senior ministers, lawmakers and party members, and should step down, said Andrew Bridgen, a Conservative lawmaker who supports a hard Brexit.

Headline: Britain can still avoid no-deal Brexit, says EU Commissioner Moscovici
Description: EU Economic Affairs and Tax Commissioner Pierre Moscovici said on Monday he believed Britain would not leave the European Union without a withdrawal agreement.

Headline: May must go once her Brexit deal clears parliament: lawmaker
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May should be given time to get her Brexit deal through parliament before making way for someone else to lead the next phase of negotiations with the European Union, a eurosceptic lawmaker from her Conservative Party said.

Headline: 'Time's up, Theresa' Sun newspaper says of British PM May
Description: Rupert Murdoch's The Sun newspaper said in a front page editorial that Prime Minister Theresa May must on Monday announce she will stand down as soon as her Brexit deal is approved and the United Kingdom has left the European Union.

Headline: PM May to offer indicative votes on Brexit options - Telegraph reporter
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is considering offering lawmakers so called indicative votes to find a way to break the Brexit deadlock, The Daily Telegraph's deputy political editor said.

Headline: PM May was told - set out her exit date to get Brexit deal approved
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May was told at a meeting on Sunday with Brexit-supporting rebel lawmakers that she must set out a timetable to leave office if she wants to get her Brexit deal ratified, a Buzzfeed reporter said.

Headline: PM May met rebel lawmakers to discuss her Brexit deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May met senior colleagues and Brexit-supporting rebel lawmakers on Sunday at her country residence to discuss her strategy and whether there is sufficient support to put her deal to another vote this week.

Headline: Uri Geller urges mass-telepathy against Brexit
Description: Spoon-bending psychic Uri Geller wants to bend British Prime Minister Theresa May's will against Brexit using mass-telepathy.

Headline: UK could face risk of election if parliament takes control of Brexit - Barclay
Description: A British election could be the consequence of parliament seizing control of the Brexit process this week if lawmakers back proposals contrary to the pledges the government was elected on, Brexit Secretary Steve Barclay said on Sunday.

Headline: Britain must resolve Brexit but changing PM May wouldn't help, Hammond says
Description: Britain must find a way to leave the European Union in an orderly fashion rather than trying to oust Prime Minister Theresa May, finance minister Philip Hammond said on Sunday.

Headline: UK minister Gove backs PM May, saying it is not the time to change captain
Description: Britain's Environment Secretary Michael Gove said on Sunday Prime Minister Theresa May "absolutely" had his support, adding that it was a time for "cool heads" to focus on getting her  twice-rejected Brexit agreement approved by lawmakers.

Headline: Theresa May's de facto deputy says - I don't think I want to be PM
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's de-facto deputy said on Sunday he did not think he had any wish to take her job.

Headline: PM May facing plot from minister to oust her - Sunday Times reporter
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is facing a full-blown cabinet plot to remove her and 11 cabinet ministers have said they want her to resign, The Sunday Times's political editor said.

Headline: Hundreds of thousands march in London to demand new Brexit referendum
Description: Hundreds of thousands of people opposed to Britain's withdrawal from the European Union marched through central London on Saturday to demand a new referendum as the deepening Brexit crisis risked sinking Prime Minister Theresa May's premiership.

Headline: Wheat fields and underpants: Brexit satire lampoons British leaders on huge march
Description: Thousands of anti-Brexit protesters on Saturday displayed a sometimes bizarre array of placards to lampoon British leaders and Brexit with references to everything from fields of wheat to ornithology.

Headline: Returning to London, May faces mammoth task to change minds on Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May on Friday began the mammoth struggle of persuading a deeply divided parliament to back her Brexit deal after an EU summit granted her more time but little to help change minds at home.

Headline: Factbox: What happens next on Brexit?
Description: European Union leaders have given Prime Minister Theresa May a two week reprieve before Britain could leave the bloc without an exit deal if she fails to win parliament's backing for her agreement with Brussels.

Headline: May hints she might not bring Brexit deal back for third parliament vote next week
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May hinted on Friday that she might not bring her European Union withdrawal deal back to parliament for a third time next week if there was not enough support for it to be passed.

Headline: UK's Clark says government will allow lawmakers indicative Brexit votes
Description: Britain's business minister Greg Clark said on Friday that the government would allow parliament to hold votes to indicate what Brexit plans might be able to command the support of a majority of lawmakers.

Headline: EU summit an "inexcusable" failure for UK PM, DUP says
Description: Nothing has changed as far as the Brexit divorce deal British Prime Minister Theresa May is seeking to convince lawmakers to back, the deputy leader of the Northern Irish party propping up her government said on Friday.

Headline: UK lawmakers might vote on Brexit alternatives on Weds - Corbyn
Description: The leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party said votes on alternative Brexit plans to Prime Minister Theresa May's deal could be held in parliament on Wednesday, and there was support for other proposals.

Headline: French President Macron says Europe must not remain hostage to Brexit
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said Europe must not remain a hostage to the ongoing Brexit process, as British Prime Minister Theresa May struggles to persuade a deeply divided parliament to back her Brexit deal after an EU summit granted her more time.

Headline: France talks tough on no-deal Brexit deadline, at odds with others
Description: France said on Friday that Britain would crash out of the European Union on April 12 if it fails to ratify the Brexit withdrawal agreement and present a new plan, putting it at odds with other member states which adopted a softer stance.

Headline: Brexit fatigue, Ireland's Varadkar says hopes Brexit deal will pass UK parliament
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Friday he hoped British Prime Minister Theresa May will get her deal to leave the European Union through parliament, adding that both sides have Brexit fatigue.

Headline: Can't get the staff: Scenic Highlands at eye of Scotland's Brexit storm
Description: Glen Mhor Hotel, a picturesque base for tourists hunting Scotland's Loch Ness monster, is struggling to find staff for the summer season as workers from the European Union snub Brexit Britain.

Headline: Keep Farage out: Weber wants no EU vote in UK
Description: Europeans don't want Britons to vote in May's EU parliamentary election, the lead candidate for the centre-right said on Friday, in part because Nigel Farage and other British eurosceptics would disrupt the Union.

Headline: May determined to deliver Brexit deal, no date yet for new vote - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is determined to deliver on her Brexit deal and end uncertainty, her spokesman said on Friday, although he could not confirm when lawmakers would be given a vote to approve that agreement.

Headline: If Britain rejects deal again, hard Brexit looms closer - Austria's Kurz
Description: Austria's Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said on Friday he hoped the withdrawal agreement negotiated between Britain and the remaining European Union states would now pass the British parliament after EU leaders granted Britain extra time.

Headline: The Brexit ending: deal, no deal, or no divorce?
Description: Just days before the United Kingdom was due to leave the European Union, the March 29 cliff edge was moved by two weeks to April 12 but it is still uncertain how, when or if Brexit will happen.

Headline: Franklin Templeton's Zahn says 30 percent probability of no-deal Brexit, may rise further
Description: There is a 30 percent chance of Britain crashing out of the European Union without a divorce deal in place, Franklin Templeton's head of European fixed income, David Zahn, said on Friday.

Headline: Best Brexit outcome would be remain vote in a new referendum - Luxembourg PM
Description: Luxembourg Prime Minister Xavier Bettel put the chances of Britain's parliament passing the withdrawal deal at 50-50 and said the best possible Brexit outcome would be a new referendum and a vote to stay in the European Union.

Headline: Brexit agreement is the right one - Belgium's Michel
Description: Belgian Prime Minister Charles Michel said the deal reached by European leaders in the early hours of Friday morning to grant Britain a conditional Brexit delay was the right one and gave clarity.

Headline: May gets two-week Brexit reprieve from impatient EU
Description: European Union leaders have given Prime Minister Theresa May two weeks' reprieve, until April 12, before Britain could lurch out of the EU if she fails to persuade MPs to back the withdrawal treaty she concluded with Brussels.

Headline: Brexit deal 'very, very unlikely' to pass - Conservative eurosceptic
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is "very, very unlikely" to win support in parliament for the Brexit divorce deal she agreed with the European Union, a eurosceptic member of her minority government said on Friday.

Headline: Brexit delay gives economy a moment to breathe, nothing more - Germany's DIHK
Description: The reprieve the European Union had given Britain for the deadline of its departure from the EU gives the economy a moment to breathe, but nothing more, the head of Germany's chambers of commerce DIHK said on Friday.

Headline: Goldman Sachs raises chances of no-deal Brexit after PM's late reprieve
Description: Goldman Sachs on Friday lowered its expectations of UK Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal getting ratified, and hiked its estimate of the chances of a "no-deal" exit from the European Union.

Headline: Five percent? EU leaders doubt May's Brexit vote chances
Description: After British Prime Minister Theresa May reassured them she could win a crunch vote in parliament next week to ensure an orderly Brexit, EU leaders were left even more doubtful of her chances.

Headline: End the Brexit ambiguity, Macron tells Britain
Description: The European Union has made clear its options for delaying Brexit and now it is time for Britain to lift all ambiguities surrounding its position, French President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday.

Headline: May welcomes Brexit delay, says parliament now has clear choice
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May on Friday welcomed the European Union's decision to delay Brexit, saying that MPs in the British parliament now had clear choices about what to do next.

Headline: EU's Tusk says all Brexit options still open until April 12
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Thursday all Brexit options were still open for Britain until April 12 after a summit of EU leaders agreed on Prime Minister Theresa May's request to delay the leave date from March 29.

Headline: Text of EU summit agreement on Brexit
Description: 1. The European Council takes note of the letter of Prime Minister Theresa May of 20 March 2019.

Headline: EU summit talks on Brexit finished, official says
Description: Thursday's European Union summit talks on Brexit have ended, an official said.

Headline: EU to offer Brexit delay, length depends on UK parliament - draft
Description: The European Union will grant Britain an extension to its Brexit negotiating period, but the length of the delay will depend on whether Prime Minister Theresa May is able to win a vote in parliament on an exit agreement next week, draft summit conclusions said.

Headline: EU looks at two-stage approach to Brexit delay - diplomats
Description: European Union leaders were considering an offer of a two-stage Brexit delay on Thursday, depending on whether Prime Minister Theresa May gets her divorce deal approved by the British parliament next week, diplomatic sources said.

Headline: EU considers options for Brexit delay - May 7, year-end or open-ended, diplomats say
Description: European Union leaders were considering different options on delaying Brexit on Thursday, possibly until May 7, the end of the year or even leaving the date open for now, diplomatic sources said.

Headline: Stop Brexit - A million people sign UK petition to stay in EU
Description: More than one million people have rushed to sign a petition on the British parliament's website calling for the government to revoke its divorce notice to the European Union and remain in the bloc.

Headline: EU offers Brexit delay until May 22 - draft statement
Description: The European Union will agree to hand Britain a Brexit delay until May 22 if its parliament approves the divorce agreement next week, according to draft conclusions considered by the other 27 national leaders on Thursday.

Headline: May to give news conference in Brussels later - PM's office
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will hold a news conference in Brussels later on Thursday, her office said, without giving a specific time.

Headline: Deutsche Bank hikes no-deal Brexit probability
Description: Deutsche Bank on Thursday hiked its expectation of a no-deal Brexit to 20 percent - the highest level ever - from 10 percent as the third attempt to get UK parliamentary approval for the nation's exit from the European Union looms.

Headline: May's "reckless" Brexit message angers the lawmakers she needs to win over
Description: If British Prime Minister Theresa May hoped a televised address late on Wednesday would help persuade wavering lawmakers to support her Brexit deal, it appears to have backfired, instead alienating the very people she needs to win over.

Headline: Britain headed towards no-deal if parliament votes down Brexit deal: Macron
Description: Britain is headed towards a no-deal Brexit scenario if its parliament votes against Prime Minister Theresa May's withdrawal agreement for a third time next week, French President Emmanuel Macron said on Thursday.

Headline: We'll fight for a Brexit deal, but prepare for failure - Merkel
Description: The European Union must do everything possible to ensure that Britain leaves the bloc in an orderly fashion, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said ahead of a European Council summit that is set to be dominated by Brexit.

Headline: May's Brexit deal now less likely, election more likely - JP Morgan
Description: JP Morgan said it no longer thought the single most likely outcome for Brexit would be Prime Minister Theresa May getting approval in parliament for her deal in the first half of 2019, and a new national election was now more likely.

Headline: May could back no-deal if she loses third Brexit vote - Sky citing cabinet source
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May could back leaving the European Union without a deal over a longer delay if she loses a third parliamentary vote on her Brexit plan next week, a cabinet source has told Sky News.

Headline: Top bankers back London as financial hub whatever Brexit outcome
Description: London will be central to global financial markets whatever shape Britain's exit deal from the European Union (EU) takes, senior players in British banking said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain extends Northern Ireland talks, but no resolution seen
Description: Britain sought to extend by five months the period for allowing a new devolved government to be formed in Northern Ireland, but parties in the province saw little hope a two-year deadlock would be broken.

Headline: Corbyn says he will try to renegotiate Brexit deal
Description: British Labour opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said after meeting the EU's Brexit negotiator that he will push ahead with Brexit and seek to renegotiate the terms of the divorce deal.

Headline: May says short Brexit delay will give Britain time to make final choice
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday a short delay to Britain's departure from the European Union would give parliament time to make a final choice on Brexit, hours before she will make her case with EU leaders for an extension.

Headline: Merkel lends support to Tusk's offer of short Brexit delay
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel expressed readiness on Thursday to back a short extension to Britain's planned exit from the European Union, suggesting that the June 30 date requested by Prime Minister Theresa May was problematic.

Headline: Cut Britain some slack, but no rolling extension says Ireland's Varadkar
Description: European Union leaders must show flexibility on Britain's Brexit plans given the "chaos" currently reigning in London, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said, adding that Britain would have to give a valid reason for the time extension it was seeking.

Headline: May has a 'good shot' of getting Brexit deal approved next week, UK junior minister
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has a good chance of getting her twice-defeated Brexit deal approved by parliament next week, a junior Brexit minister in her government said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain says EU could hold emergency summit to offer conditional Brexit extension
Description: The European Union could next week hold an emergency summit to offer a Brexit extension with potentially onerous conditions such as holding another referendum, British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Thursday.

Headline: Let the British parliament find a softer Brexit option, MP tells May
Description: The British parliament should be given the opportunity to find an alternative way to leave the European Union and MPs would support a Norway-style post-Brexit relationship, Conservative lawmaker Oliver Letwin said on Thursday.

Headline: Labour's Corbyn to discuss 'alternative' Brexit plan with EU leaders
Description: British Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn will travel to Brussels on Thursday to discuss an "alternative" Brexit plan with European Union (EU) leaders, including the bloc's chief negotiator Michel Barnier, his party said in a statement.

Headline: EPP's Weber: I can't imagine Brexit extension until June
Description: Extending Britain's departure from the European Union until June is not a good idea as it would have to participate in the European Parliament election, Manfred Weber, the centre-right's lead candidate in the vote, said on Thursday.

Headline: German foreign minister open to one last push for orderly Brexit
Description: Delaying Britain's departure from the European Union is justifiable if there is a real chance of securing an orderly Brexit, German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas told Germany's Funke media group.

Headline: May urges parliament to back her on Brexit, tells Britons 'I'm on your side'
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May made an impassioned appeal to MPs to support her on Wednesday after the European Union said it could only grant her request to delay Brexit for three months if parliament next week backed her plans for leaving.

Headline: May urges MPs to back her Brexit deal now
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she deeply regretted her decision to seek a Brexit extension from the European Union and she urged MPs, who have twice previously rejected her plan, to back her now.

Headline: Tusk invites EU leaders to agree short, conditional Brexit delay
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Wednesday he believed the EU should endorse a short delay of Brexit beyond March 29 if Britain's parliament ratifies the stalled divorce agreement next week.

Headline: EU leaders should cut UK some slack on Brexit extension - Irish PM
Description: European Union leaders should cut Prime Minister Theresa May some slack over her request to delay Brexit, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Wednesday.

Headline: Next Brexit defeat could mean election, May could say - Channel 4
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May could indicate in a statement later that another defeat for her Brexit deal could mean a general election, Channel 4's political editor Gary Gibbon said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit minister: Parliament will debate EU exit plans on Monday
Description: Parliament will have the chance to discuss a motion on Brexit on Monday, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said, confirming government plans to set out a process for parliament to find a way forward on Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: Brexit delay request will be rejected if no guarantees of deal success - France
Description: Britain's request for a delay to Brexit will be rejected by the EU if Prime Minister Theresa May cannot provide sufficient guarantees that her parliament will approve the divorce deal she negotiated, France's foreign minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK parliament to hold emergency debate on Brexit on Wednesday
Description: Britain's parliament will hold an emergency debate on Wednesday on Prime Minister Theresa May's decision to request a three-month delay to Brexit, the speaker John Bercow said.

Headline: Rumours of UK PM May speech on Wednesday - newspaper political editor
Description: There are unconfirmed rumours Prime Minister Theresa May will give a speech outside her Downing Street residence on Wednesday evening, the political editor of the Independent newspaper said on Twitter.

Headline: Brexit delay until European elections no legal problem, says Germany
Description: Delaying Britain's departure from the European Union until European elections in late May would not be legally problematic, a senior German official said on Wednesday, a day before EU leaders meet to discuss a possible extension.

Headline: Labour will press its Brexit plan, open to compromise - spokesman
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will continue seeking talks on its alternative Brexit plan and believes a proposed three-month delay to the country's EU exit would be long enough to agree a new deal, a party spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Asked if long Brexit delay would make May resign, spokesman says way forward is clear
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has sent a clear signal about what she believes is the correct way ahead on Brexit, her political spokesman said when asked if she could resign if the country's EU exit is delayed for longer than she wishes.

Headline: Berlin welcomes PM's clear request for Brexit extension
Description: The German government welcomes British Prime Minister Theresa May's clear request for a three-month extension of the Brexit deadline beyond March 29, a spokesman said in Berlin on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit delay doesn't rule out no-deal EU exit - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday that delaying Brexit by extending negotiations did not rule out the possibility that Britain could leave the European Union without a deal.

Headline: May seeks delay to Brexit to June 30  - letter
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday asked the European Union to delay Brexit until June 30.

Headline: EU's Juncker warned PM May against Brexit extension beyond European elections
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker warned British Prime Minister Theresa May against requesting a Brexit delay beyond European Parliament elections due on May 24-26, unless the United Kingdom takes part, an EU spokeswoman said.

Headline: May: I am opposed to long Brexit extension, it is time to move on
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she was opposed to a long extension to the country's negotiations on leaving the European Union, saying it was time to move the national debate on to other subjects.

Headline: EU Commission resists May's June 30 Brexit date - document
Description: The European Commission opposes extending British membership of the European Union to June 30 as British Prime Minister Theresa May proposed on Wednesday, according to an EU document seen by Reuters.

Headline: UK Labour leader Corbyn heads to Brussels on Thursday for Brexit meetings
Description: British Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Wednesday he would travel to Brussels to meet EU leaders and officials on Thursday, the day when Prime Minister Theresa May is seeking approval for her request for a delay to Brexit.

Headline: EU's Tusk received Brexit delay letter from PM May - official
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk received a formal letter from British Prime Minister Theresa May requesting a delay to Brexit, an EU official told Reuters.

Headline: Labour to request emergency debate in parliament on Brexit delay
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party Brexit spokesman Keir Starmer will request an emergency debate in parliament on the length and purpose of any extension to the Article 50 Brexit negotiation period, the party said on Twitter.

Headline: Decision on UK participation in EU elections due by mid-April - EU official
Description: A decision on whether Britain should participate in the European Parliament election needs to be taken by mid-April, an EU official said on Wednesday, as British Prime Minister Theresa May is expected to ask the EU for a short delay to Brexit.

Headline: UK Labour lawmaker requests emergency debate on Brexit
Description: An opposition Labour lawmaker requested on Wednesday an emergency debate in parliament on Brexit, seeking to challenge Prime Minister Theresa May's pursuit of a short delay to Britain's departure from the European Union, her office said.

Headline: Labour: We will support fresh Brexit debate if May does not make statement
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party said they would support all steps to force a debate in parliament on Brexit if Prime Minister Theresa May does not make a statement on the subject, a party spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Austria expects short Brexit extension, would support it
Description: Austria expects there to be a short postponement of the date on which Britain will leave the European Union and would support it if London asked for one, Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said on Wednesday.

Headline: May must tell EU about any Brexit delay plan Thursday at the latest - official
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May must inform the other 27 EU national leaders of any plans to delay Brexit on Thursday at the latest, a senior EU official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Long Brexit delay would need parliamentary approval, UK's Leadsom says
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May would have to put a long delay to Brexit to parliament if that is what the European Union offer in talks this week, the leader of House of Commons Andrea Leadsom said on Wednesday.

Headline: Leadsom says Brexit 'absolutely essential' before EU parliament election
Description: Britain will seek a short delay to its departure from the European Union, due on March 29, and wants to be out before European Parliament elections are due to be held in late May, parliamentary leader Andrea Leadsom said on Wednesday.

Headline: Former Conservative leader warns PM May that Brexit delay would cause problems
Description: A delay to Brexit creates problems and can only be justified if British Prime Minister Theresa May can change her withdrawal deal, former Conservative party leader Iain Duncan Smith said on Wednesday.

Headline: Czech PM: we are ready to support delay of Brexit
Description: The Czech Republic may support a delay to the date of Brexit at the upcoming European Council meeting, Prime Minister Andrej Babis said on Wednesday.

Headline: EU can not budge any more on Brexit, says Juncker before summit
Description: The European Union has done a lot to accommodate Britain over Brexit and can go no further, European Commission head Jean-Claude Juncker said on Wednesday, as he played down hopes of a breakthrough at this week's EU summit.

Headline: Long Brexit delay won't solve uncertainty, UK education minister says
Description: A long delay to Britain's departure date from the European Union would not provide certainty, Education Secretary Damian Hinds said on Wednesday.

Headline: May will not request long delay to Brexit - Downing Street source
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will not request a long delay to Brexit and there is a case for giving parliament a little more time to agree a way forward, a Downing Street source said on Wednesday.

Headline: 'Interventionist' speaker centre-stage in parliament's Brexit drama
Description: With a wordy speech invoking a 17th-century precedent, and a cold stare aimed at stunned ministers, the grandiose Speaker of Britain's parliament cast Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit strategy into chaos.

Headline: May's letter to EU on Brexit extension to be sent Wednesday - BBC
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday will send a letter to European Council President Donald Tusk seeking an extension of her country's departure from the European Union beyond a March 29 deadline, BBC News' political editor reported in a tweet late on Tuesday.

Headline: Trump adviser Bolton says British establishment failing on Brexit
Description: U.S. National Security Adviser John Bolton accused Britain's political establishment on Tuesday of failing to implement the result of the 2016 referendum to leave the European Union.

Headline: EU's Barnier warns costs of long Brexit delay must be worth it
Description: Any long Brexit delay would pile on economic and political costs for the European Union, the bloc's chief negotiator Michel Barnier said on Tuesday, stressing that these would need to be weighed up carefully against potential benefits.

Headline: May seeks Brexit delay after third vote on her deal is derailed
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will ask the European Union to delay Brexit by at least three months after her plan to hold a third vote on her fraught divorce deal was thrown into disarray by a surprise intervention from the speaker of parliament.

Headline: France ready to veto any meaningless Brexit delay: Elysee official
Description: France is ready to veto any British request for a Brexit delay that either kicks the can down the road without offering a way out of its deadlock or imperils European Union institutions, an official in President Emmanuel Macron's office said on Tuesday.

Headline: Labour's Corbyn holds talks with MPs who support softer Brexit
Description: Jeremy Corbyn, leader of the Labour Party, held cross-party talks with four MPs who support a close economic relationship with the European Union and they pledged to work together to break the Brexit impasse, a Labour spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain must have plan to push through deal to get Brexit extension - Coveney
Description: Britain must present a detailed plan how to push the agreement on its withdrawal from the European Union through parliament to get the EU's approval for an extension of the March 29th membership deadline, Irish foreign minister Simon Coveney said.

Headline: DUP's Dodds says Brexit talks good but deal not close - BBC reporter
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party has had good discussions with the British government, a BBC journalist quoted the party's deputy leader as saying on Tuesday, as Prime Minister Theresa May seeks its support for her Brexit divorce agreement.

Headline: Factbox: What does the speaker of Britain's parliament do, and who is John Bercow?
Description: The speaker of Britain's House of Commons threw Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans into further turmoil this week by ruling that she could not put her divorce deal to a new vote unless it was resubmitted in fundamentally different form.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP may not back UK PM's Brexit deal - HuffPost
Description: The Northern Irish party that is crucial to Prime Minister Theresa May's hopes of getting her twice-defeated Brexit deal through parliament is unlikely to support it in a third vote unless it is convinced her deal can pass, HuffPost reported.

Headline: UK lawmakers will debate ways to break Brexit impasse from Monday - PM's spokesman
Description: British lawmakers will from Monday be able to debate ways to break an impasse over Brexit in parliament, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday, repeating a promise made last week.

Headline: Labour's Corbyn calls on UK opposition parties to work on Brexit plan
Description: Jeremy Corbyn, leader of Britain's main opposition Labour Party, called on other opposition leaders on Tuesday to work towards finding a majority in parliament for "a close economic relationship" with the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: EU impatient with Brexit, but resigned to delay
Description: European Union governments are exasperated by British dithering over quitting the bloc but have little appetite for pushing it out on schedule next week without a divorce deal, senior figures said on Tuesday.

Headline: Protesters in yellow vests invade UK Attorney General's office
Description: Protesters wearing yellow vests invaded the office of Britain's Attorney General in central London on Tuesday.

Headline: In Brexit chaos, UK eurosceptics see dream ticket - new leader, new deal
Description: In a week when Brexit was plunged into deeper uncertainty, eurosceptics in Theresa May's Conservative Party are eyeing their dream scenario - a new prime minister and a new deal to leave the European Union.

Headline: Tusk assures Ireland of EU unity on Brexit
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said he told Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar in Dublin on Tuesday that the European Union was united on Brexit and preparing if need be for Britain leaving the EU without a deal.

Headline: May seeking Brexit delay to June 30 with option of two-year extension - BBC
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will write to the European Union on Tuesday to ask for a Brexit extension until the end of June and with a possible two-year delay, the BBC's political editor said.

Headline: Britain could ask for longer Brexit delay, still hope to leave EU earlier - source
Description: Britain could theoretically ask for a longer extension to its Brexit negotiations and try to leave the European Union before the new end date is reached, a UK government source said on Monday.

Headline: May to write to EU's Tusk on Brexit extension Tuesday or Wednesday - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will write to European Council President Donald Tusk to request a delay to Brexit either on Tuesday or Wednesday, her spokesman said.

Headline: EU expects swift info from Britain on next steps in Brexit
Description: The European Union expects swift information from Britain on how it wishes to proceed in its exit form the EU, a spokesman for the EU executive said on Tuesday, noting EU leaders meet on Thursday to discuss Britain's withdrawal.

Headline: Germany's Merkel ready to fight to last minute for orderly Brexit
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday she would fight for an orderly Brexit right up until Britain's planned departure from the European Union on March 29.

Headline: How does the Brexit maelstrom end: Deal, no deal or no Brexit?

Headline: British minister Gove hints at indicative Brexit votes in parliament

Headline: UK Conservative lawmaker no longer backing her own no-deal amendment

Headline: UK lawmakers to vote on two proposed changes to government's 'no deal' Brexit motion

Headline: German Economy Minister - Disorderly Brexit must be avoided

Headline: Factbox - What will be decided in parliament's latest Brexit votes?

Headline: UK government has no plans for Irish border controls in case of no-deal Brexit - BBC
