Description: The British government will set out in the coming days which European Union trade deals it does not believe will be rolled over before its March 29 exit from the bloc, trade minister Liam Fox said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK bid to replicate EU trade deals will 'go down to wire' - trade minister Fox
Description: Trade minister Liam Fox said on Wednesday he expected efforts to replicate European Union trade agreements with third countries in time for Britain's exit from the bloc would "go down to the wire".

Headline: Irish PM: I believe we will strike a Brexit deal
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said he believes the European Union will strike a deal with Britain to smooth its exit from the bloc, even as Dublin continue its preparations for all outcomes, including a no deal.

Headline: EU executive says any Brexit delay cannot be open-ended
Description: The European Commission said on Wednesday Britain has not requested a Brexit delay and that any such extension of negotiating time before the divorce could not be open-ended but leading to a concrete result.

Headline: Brexit: What will happen in the British parliament on February 14?
Description: The British parliament will hold a debate on Brexit on Feb. 14. This is not a re-run of a vote last month on whether to approve the exit deal Prime Minister Theresa May's negotiated with the European Union.

Headline: Swiss allow 3,500 work permits for Britons in case of no-deal Brexit
Description: Switzerland will introduce a quota system allowing Britons to come and work in the country in the event Britain crashes out of the European Union without an exit deal.

Headline: May seeks more time to find Brexit deal, tells lawmakers: Hold your nerve
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told MPs on Tuesday to hold their nerve over Brexit and give her more time to negotiate a deal acceptable to both the European Union and the British parliament.

Headline: UK's chief Brexit negotiator says: It's May's deal or extension - ITV
Description: Britain's lead Brexit negotiator Olly Robbins has saidlawmakers face a choice between Prime Minister Theresa May's exit deal or a long extension of the March 29 deadline for leaving the EU, ITV news said, citing a private conversation.

Headline: Brexit: extending Article 50 would serve no purpose - FT quotes PM May
Description: British Prime Minster Theresa May told business leaders on Tuesday that extending the Article 50 process under which the UK is meant to leave the European Union on March 29 would serve no purpose, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Labour MP has new plan for parliament vote on no-deal Brexit
Description: British MP Yvette Cooper, one of the leading campaigners against Britain leaving the EU without an agreement with the bloc, unveiled a new plan on Tuesday to ensure parliament has a chance to vote on ruling out a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: "Real hunger" for Brexit deal - Jeremy Hunt
Description: Foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said on Tuesday it was still possible to get a Brexit deal by March 29 when Britain leaves, describing a "real hunger" to finalise the exit in the European Union.

Headline: France tells UK to make clear its Brexit intentions
Description: London still needs to make clear its next steps towards reaching a deal over the terms of its divorce with the European Union, France's foreign ministry said on Tuesday after talks were held with Britain's foreign secretary.

Headline: EU announces plans to keep Channel Tunnel rail link open after no-deal Brexit
Description: The European Commission announced plans on Tuesday to keep the rail link with Britain through the Channel Tunnel open on current terms for three months after a no-deal Brexit in an effort to minimise disruption expected from any abrupt split.

Headline: British tattooist admits to court he took off customer's ear
Description: A British tattooist pleaded guilty on Tuesday to performing illegal body modifications on clients, including taking off an ear and a nipple and splitting a customer's tongue.

Headline: We can reach a Brexit deal parliament can support - PM May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday she believed she could reach a Brexit deal that parliament could support, allowing Britain to leave the European Union on March 29.

Headline: May says will speed up ratification of Brexit deal if time is tight
Description: The government will seek to speed up the ratification of its Brexit deal with the European Union if time gets too tight to pass legislation before Britain's March 29 exit day, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday.

Headline: May has no plans to resign this summer - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has no plans to resign this summer, her political spokesman said on Tuesday, denying reports that the British leader was ready to step aside after Brexit.

Headline: UK's 'broken' cash system needs overhaul
Description: Britain's system for cash is "broken" and needs a fundamental rethink to avoid vulnerable people being cut off, lawmakers and regulators said on Tuesday.

Headline: PM May: Important we see a strong vote from across parliament for Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday she wanted lawmakers from all parties to back the Brexit deal she is aiming to strike, citing the need to pass further legislation to prepare for Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: UK parliament will not vote on revised Brexit deal this week - May's office
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told her top team of ministers on Tuesday that parliament would not be asked to vote on a revised Brexit deal this week as she needed more time to negotiate with the European Union, her office said.

Headline: May to promise new Brexit debate in push for more negotiating time
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will pledge this week to give parliament another chance to voice their opinions on Brexit by Feb. 27 as she tries to buy more time to negotiate a new deal with the European Union.

Headline: Factbox: Brexit - What will happen in the British parliament on February 14?
Description: The British parliament is set to hold a debate on Brexit on Feb. 14 but this is not a re-run of a vote last month on whether to approve the exit deal Prime Minister Theresa May's negotiated with the European Union.

Headline: May rejects pivot towards Brexit customs union compromise
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has rejected the idea of targeting a customs union with the European Union, pouring cold water on hopes from some that she could shift her Brexit policy to win over the opposition Labour Party.

Headline: Fox says Brexit is not the only reason for GDP slowdown
Description: Britain's economic slowdown should not be blamed entirely on Brexit, British Trade Minister Liam Fox said on Monday after data showed the economy last year grew at its slowest since 2012.

Headline: 'Something has to give,' EU's Barnier tells Brexit Britain
Description: European Union Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Monday British Prime Minister Theresa May should endorse a permanent customs union with the bloc - as proposed by the opposition Labour party - to break the impasse over their looming divorce.

Headline: "Something has to give," EU's Barnier tells Brexit UK
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier suggested on Monday British Prime Minister Theresa moves towards proposals by the opposition Labour Party on a permanent customs union with the bloc to break the impasse over the details of the looming divorce.

Headline: British cabinet ministers believe PM May preparing to resign - The Sun
Description: Cabinet ministers now believe Theresa May is preparing to resign as British Prime Minister this summer so she can influence who succeeds her, The Sun newspaper reported on Monday.

Headline: EU, UK Brexit negotiators hold 'constructive' talks - UK spokesperson
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier and Britain's Brexit Secretary Stephen Barclay held a "constructive" meeting in Brussels on Monday evening, a British government spokesperson said.

Headline: UK public services face post-Brexit squeeze, forecasters warn
Description: Many British public services risk ongoing real-terms cuts for years to come, despite a softer fiscal stance from finance minister Philip Hammond, a major think tank predicted ahead of a half-yearly budget update next month.

Headline: Post-Brexit UK ready to use "hard power" - defence minister
Description: Britain will use military force to support its interests after Brexit, defence minister Gavin Williamson said on Monday, in a speech setting out a global role for the armed forces but with little detail on how to fund such ambitions in the long term.

Headline: UK pitches 'global Britain' by flexing military muscle - defence minister
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's "Global Britain" slogan is more than a pithy phrase because the United Kingdom will be ready to flex its military muscles after it leaves the European Union, defence minister Gavin Williamson said on Monday.

Headline: PM May to make Brexit statement on Tuesday - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will make a statement on Tuesday to update lawmakers on her talks to win changes to the Brexit deal, her spokesman said on Monday, before parliament votes on her next steps.

Headline: Hammond says now not time for Brexit delay - Channel 4
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond does not believe the time is right for Britain to ask the European Union to delay its scheduled March 29 departure from the bloc, broadcaster Channel 4 reported on Monday.

Headline: EU's Moscovici - We must be prepared for all Brexit scenarios
Description: European Economic Commissioner Pierre Moscovici said on Monday that it was necessary for the European Union and all of its member states to be ready for all possible scenarios regarding Britain's expected departure from the European Union.

Headline: Prince Philip gives up driving licence after crash
Description: The Queen 97-year-old husband Prince Philip has voluntarily given up his driving licence after a crash last month, Buckingham Palace said on Saturday.

Headline: EU urges May to seize Labour opening as way out of Brexit impasse
Description: It's a proposal that is not even on the table, and reverses Theresa May's determined position - but EU officials are still urging her to grasp an offer from the Labour opposition to break an impasse over the terms of Britain's EU exit.

Headline: Farage ready to be new 'Brexit Party' candidate if EU exit delayed
Description: Prominent Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage announced on Friday he would stand as a candidate for a new "Brexit Party" to contest European Parliament elections if Britain's departure from the European Union, due in 49 days, is delayed.

Headline: In Brussels, EU gives May glimpse of Brexit hope
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May came away from a day in an increasingly impatient Brussels on Thursday with a pledge of renewed talks that held out some hope for a new Brexit deal, if no sign of compromise yet.

Headline: May will press for changes to Brexit deal with Irish PM - spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will use a dinner with Ireland's Leo Varadkar on Friday to build on talks she held with EU leaders and press her argument for legally binding changes to the Brexit divorce deal, her spokeswoman said.

Headline: May approaches number of Labour MPs for amendment to withdrawal motion - The Sun
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has approached a number of members of parliament from the opposition Labour Party to put forward an amendment to her withdrawal motion, The Sun newspaper reported late on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox: Brexit - What will happen in the British parliament on February 14?
Description: The British parliament is set to hold a debate on Brexit on Feb. 14 but this is not a re-run of a vote last month on whether to approve the exit deal Prime Minister Theresa May's negotiated with the European Union.

Headline: Explainer - The Brexit backstop conundrum
Description: A row between London and the European Union over the "Irish backstop" is blocking a Brexit deal and could mean Britain leaving on March 29 without one, disrupting trade.

Headline: May says EU leaders want to ensure UK leaves with a deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday that she saw and heard a desire from European Union leaders to ensure Britain leaves the bloc with a deal.

Headline: More work to do for Brexit deal after Brussels talks - senior UK official
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May knows her government has "got work to do" to try to secure changes to her divorce deal with the European Union, a senior official in her office said, describing talks in Brussels as part of a process.

Headline: Authorities working to guard against hard Brexit fallout - German finance minister
Description: German finance minister Olaf Scholz on Thursday warned Germans to prepare for a hard Brexit, and said that European authorities would aim to minimize the risks of Britain withdrawing from the European Union without a deal.

Headline: With Troubles in mind, Irish concern grows over British stance on border
Description: As Britain's exit from the European Union grows closer with no agreement reached on the Irish border, many in Ireland fear that pro-Brexit British politicians have forgotten the bombs and bullets of three decades of conflict in Northern Ireland and fail to grasp how high the stakes are for the entire island.

Headline: U.S. congressman tells London Irish border could weigh on UK-U.S. trade deal
Description: An influential U.S. Congressman warned Britain on Thursday that the prospects for any bilateral trade deal could be influenced by what agreement is reached over the Irish border in a Brexit accord.

Headline: Brexit deal needs insurance policy for Irish border - PM May's spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is talking to the European Union about what form an insurance policy to ensure there is no return of a hard border on the island of Ireland should take, her spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: France would oppose Brexit delay without a plan - government official
Description: France would oppose any British request to delay Brexit if London was simply delaying making a decision, but could agree if London presented a credible political solution, a French government official said on Thursday.

Headline: EU's Tusk sees no Brexit breakthroguh, says talks will continue
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said that British Prime Minister Theresa May's visit to Brussels on Thursday brought no breakthrough but that talks on Brexit between the EU and the UK would go on.

Headline: EU's Verhofstadt - closer ties after Brexit could overcome backstop impasse
Description: The European Union is ready to have a closer relationship with the United Kingdom after Brexit so that the contentious Irish border backstop would never have to be used, the Brexit pointman for the bloc's parliament said.

Headline: Eleventh-hour Brexit deal? Legislation backlog may still prompt delay
Description: If Britain's parliament has not approved a Brexit deal by the end of February, Prime Minister Theresa May is likely to have to seek a delay to Britain's March 29 exit from the EU as there will not be time to pass all the required legislation.

Headline: Factbox - What Brexit legislation does Britain still need to pass before EU exit?
Description: Britain is due to leave the European Union on March 29, yet in reality the deadline for reaching an exit deal with the European Union is likely to be well before that date if parliament is to pass necessary legislation in time.

Headline: Corbyn puts forward terms for backing May on Brexit
Description: British opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn met Prime Minister Theresa May last week and has written her a letter putting forward five demands by his Labour Party on the Brexit deal, his party said late on Wednesday.

Headline: German SPD leader supports Labour leader's Brexit demands - paper
Description: The leader of Germany's Social Democrats (SPD), junior partner in Chancellor Angela Merkel's ruling coalition, has written to Britain's Labour Party leader to support his demands on a Brexit deal, the Rheinische Post newspaper reported.

Headline: Merkel says Brexit solution is possible without reopening divorce deal
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Thursday she believes a solution to the Irish border issue can be reached in Brexit negotiations without reopening the Withdrawal Agreement on Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: EU's Juncker, UK's May 'working together' to find Brexit solution
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker told British Prime Minister Theresa May during their "robust but constructive" talks on Thursday that the European Union would not renegotiate the Brexit deal.

Headline: UK parliament to debate Brexit motion on February 14  - Leadsom
Description: Lawmakers will debate a parliamentary motion on Britain's exit from the European Union on February 14, House of Commons leader Andrea Leadsom said on Twitter.

Headline: PM May will respond to Labour Brexit proposals - spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will respond to a letter from opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn on his proposals for a Brexit deal but she has not changed her position that a customs union with the European Union should be ruled out, her spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: "Special place in hell" for Brexiteers, says EU's Tusk
Description: British leaders who sold Brexit with no plan for how to deliver it deserve a "special place in hell", the EU's Donald Tusk said, revealing frustration in Brussels and sparking fury among anti-EU campaigners.

Headline: UK house builders show caution as Brexit approaches - NHBC
Description: British construction firms are making a cautious start to 2019 after slowing their house-building plans late last year in the face of Brexit uncertainty, an industry body said on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox - UK opposition Labour Party sets terms for backing May on Brexit
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn has written to Prime Minister Theresa May, offering to support her Brexit deal if she makes five legally binding commitments – including joining a customs union.

Headline: EU rebuffs May, says no-plan Brexiteers deserve 'place in hell'
Description: The European Union will make no new offer on Brexit and those who promoted Britain's exit without any understanding of how to deliver it deserve a "special place in hell", European Council President Donald Tusk said on Wednesday.

Headline: May set to delay second parliament vote on Brexit deal - report
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is preparing to delay the second parliament vote on her Brexit deal until the end of February, the Telegraph newspaper reported late on Wednesday.

Headline: DUP told May that Brexit border backstop must be replaced
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) stressed to British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday that the Irish border backstop was the issue with her Brexit deal and needs to be replaced, leader Arlene Foster said.

Headline: Brexit deal must change to avoid no deal departure - UK PM's spokesman
Description: There will have to be changes to the Brexit agreement if the European Union wants Britain to leave with a deal, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: Juncker says EU won't reopen Brexit deal, Britain's May knows that
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said on Wednesday he would tell British Prime Minister Theresa May when she travels to Brussels on Thursday that the EU's stalled withdrawal agreement with Britain cannot be renegotiated.

Headline: We'll take on social media giants, Labour Party says
Description: Digital tech firms are too big and Britain's opposition Labour Party would create a dedicated technology regulator to prevent market abuse and look at breaking up monopolies like Facebook , the party's deputy leader will say on Wednesday.

Headline: Ireland increasingly prepared for no-deal Brexit, says PM
Description: Ireland is increasingly prepared for a no-deal Brexit, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Wednesday, while highlighting Dublin did not want things to end in such an abrupt split.

Headline: Indonesia court jails British woman for slapping Bali immigration officer
Description: An Indonesian court on Wednesday jailed a British woman for six months for slapping an immigration officer in an argument over a fine for overstaying her visa.

Headline: Question for Tusk on whether Brexit language is helpful - May's spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Wednesday it was a question for European Council President Donald Tusk on whether his choice of language about Brexit supporters was helpful, responding to Tusk's remarks in Brussels earlier.

Headline: EU now sees Brexit unstoppable, aims to avert 'fiasco'
Description: EU summit chairman Donald Tusk said he had abandoned hope that Brexit might be stopped and said on Wednesday his priority was now to avert a "fiasco" in 50 days if Britain crashes out without a deal.

Headline: UK's Fox says does not support zero tariffs if no Brexit deal
Description: Trade minister Liam Fox said on Wednesday he did not support the idea of slashing tariffs on all imports to zero if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal.

Headline: Extending Brexit talks would just defer difficult decisions - UK's Lidington
Description: Extending the negotiating period for Britain to leave the European Union would only defer a decision by parliament on a Brexit deal, cabinet office minister, David Lidington, said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK MP to May: Get Brussels to talk and we will give you more time
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will be given more time by her Conservative Party to negotiate Brexit with the European Union if she can convince Brussels to talk, a member of parliament involved in discussions with the government said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK Wylfa nuclear project could still be deployed in 2030s - energy secretary
Description: Britain's energy secretary said on Wednesday it is still possible to deploy the Wylfa nuclear power project in the 2030s if a financing model can be agreed.

Headline: After meeting May, Northern Irish UUP says she is exploring time limit for backstop
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May discussed putting a time limit on the so-called Irish border backstop in talks with Northern Ireland's Ulster Unionist Party, the party's leader said on Wednesday.

Headline: Delaying Brexit would extend uncertainty - Greg Clark
Description: Delaying Brexit would extend rather than resolve the uncertainty that is hurting the economy, Britain's business secretary Greg Clark told a parliament committee on Wednesday.

Headline: Sterling to slump on no-deal Brexit, rise a bit on orderly exit - Reuters poll
Description: Sterling will gain between 2 and 5 percent if Britain parts ways with the European Union with a divorce deal but will slide between 5 and 10 percent in the event of a disorderly Brexit, a Reuters poll found on Wednesday.

Headline: Hammond set to miss key budget target - NIESR
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond will probably say next month that he will miss a key budget target because he will not be able to squeeze spending as much as he planned, a leading think-tank said on Wednesday.

Headline: PM May denies 'shafting' Northern Ireland over Brexit backstop
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May denied "shafting" Northern Ireland in a visit to the province after she said she would seek changes to the backstop border arrangements to secure support for her withdrawal agreement with the European Union.

Headline: UK ministers hold secret talks of delaying Brexit by eight weeks - The Telegraph
Description: UK cabinet ministers have secretly held talks on plans to delay Brexit by eight weeks, the Telegraph newspaper reported late on Tuesday.

Headline: UK ministers examining secret plan of keeping Irish border open -The Sun
Description: Britain's department for exiting the European Union has been examining a secret new high-tech plan of keeping the Irish border open with the plan to be ready for a road test in March, the Sun newspaper reported late on Tuesday.

Headline: EU, Ireland in talks on emergency fund to offset no-deal Brexit - Guardian
Description: The European Union and Ireland are in discussions over a substantial Brexit emergency fund in order to offset the impact of a no-deal Brexit on Ireland's food exports to Britain, the Guardian newspaper reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Exclusive: Britain's financial heartland unbowed as Brexit risks deepen
Description: Britain's financial services industry has emerged largely unscathed so far from the build-up to Brexit, with about 2,000 roles expected to have moved or been created overseas even as the risk of a disorderly exit grows, a new Reuters survey showed.

Headline: May to visit Brussels in search of a Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will travel to Brussels on Thursday to tell European Union leaders they must accept legally binding changes to the Irish border arrangements of Britain's divorce deal or face the prospect of a disorderly no-deal Brexit.

Headline: In Brexit bid, May to meet EU's Tusk in Brussels
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will meet European Council President Donald Tusk on Thursday in an attempt to get changes to her Brexit deal, her spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Too little too late? No-deal Brexit planning shakes service suppliers
Description: From Britain's hospitals and schools to its prisons and armed forces, firms supplying essential public services have been asked by the government to outline plans for a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: Karl Marx's London grave memorial damaged in hammer attack
Description: A memorial to Karl Marx at the cemetery in north London where the 19th century political philosopher is buried has been defaced, with marble hacked away apparently by a vandal armed with a hammer.

Headline: Man arrested over threats made against Labour MP
Description: Police investigating threats made against a British member of parliament have arrested a man in the latest case of alleged abuse targeted at politicians as Britain prepares to leave the European Union.

Headline: Risk of no-deal Brexit still seen low, delay likelier, banks say
Description: The risk Britain will crash out of the EU without an agreement is low but rising, according to banks and asset managers who also see a growing likelihood of Brexit being  delayed.

Headline: In search of a Brexit deal, May to visit Brussels
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will travel to Brussels on Thursday to tell European Union leaders they must accept legally binding changes to the Irish border arrangements of the divorce deal or face the prospect of a disorderly no-deal Brexit.

Headline: May told ministers she wants legally binding changes to Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told her top ministers on Tuesday  her objective was to secure legally binding changes to Britain's EU exit deal to ensure that the country could not be trapped indefinitely in the Northern Irish backstop, her spokesman said.

Headline: EU is waiting to hear PM May's Brexit plan - Commission
Description: The European Union wants to hear what Theresa May plans to do on Brexit, a spokesman for the bloc said before the British prime minister holds talks in Brussels on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit and the City - A barometer for London's financial outlook
Description: A few miles down the River Thames from the British parliament at Westminster, months of political tremors over Brexit have still barely registered on a monitor of London's financial services.

Headline: DUP's Foster says Irish backstop is toxic, would back May without it
Description: The leader of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party which props up British Prime Minister Theresa May's minority government said the Irish backstop in her Brexit deal was toxic but she could back the agreement if it was replaced.

Headline: Northern Ireland's Trimble plans challenge to Brexit Irish backstop
Description: Northern Ireland's David Trimble, a pro-British leader who won the Nobel peace prize in 1998, plans to take the British government to court over the Irish border backstop in the Brexit deal agreed by Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: British Transport Secretary says Brexit will not be delayed
Description: The process of Britain leaving the European Union will not be delayed via an extension of the Article 50 exit negotiation period, British Transport Secretary Chris Grayling told the Telegraph newspaper in an interview published late Monday.

Headline: May urges business leaders to ask EU to avoid no-deal Brexit - FT
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has urged business leaders to ask European Union policymakers to avoid a no-deal or a hard Brexit, the Financial Times reported on Monday.

Headline: Britain should not view March 28 as deadline to reach Brexit deal - business minister
Description: Britain does not have until the day before its March 29 exit from the European Union to reach a Brexit deal as businesses have to make decisions now, business minister Greg Clark said on Monday.

Headline: PM May to meet DUP leader Foster on Wednesday
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will meet with the leader of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party Arlene Foster on Wednesday during a visit to Belfast, the DUP said.

Headline: Germany's Merkel drops hint of a 'creative' Brexit compromise
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Monday offered a way to break the deadlock over the United Kingdom's exit from the European Union, calling for a "creative" compromise to allay concerns over the future of Irish border arrangements.

Headline: UK focused on new Brexit proposal to take to Brussels - PM May's spokeswoman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government is focused on coming up with Brexit proposals to take to European Union negotiators in Brussels to push forward with Britain's departure, May's spokeswoman said on Monday.

Headline: EU denies ready to make binding Brexit tweaks
Description: A senior EU official denied on Monday that the bloc was considering offering legally binding assurances to Britain that might secure backing in parliament for the Brexit deal.

Headline: May will speak to EU business, visit Northern Ireland to bolster Brexit plan
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will talk to European businesses on Monday to underline the importance of Britain leaving the EU with a deal, a day before she travels to Northern Ireland to make a speech on Brexit, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: With creativity, we can find Northern Ireland solution, Merkel says
Description: With creativity and goodwill, Britain and the European Union can still perhaps resolve the issue of Irish border arrangements after Brexit, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Monday.

Headline: May will seek "pragmatic" solution to Brexit deal in Brussels
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Sunday she would seek a "pragmatic solution" to a parliamentary impasse over the terms on which Britain leaves the European Union when she tries to reopen talks with Brussels.

Headline: UK Brexit minister to work with compromise Brexit plan Conservatives
Description: Britain's Brexit minister Stephen Barclay will hold a meeting of a new working group of Conservative lawmakers on Monday seeking to find an alternative plan to avoid a post-Brexit border in Ireland, Prime Minister Theresa May's office said.

Headline: The Queen to be evacuated in case of Brexit unrest - media
Description: British officials have revived Cold War emergency plans to relocate the royal family should there be riots in London if Britain suffers a disruptive departure from the European Union next month, two Sunday newspapers reported.

Headline: May says to seek 'pragmatic' Brexit solution in Brussels
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said she would seek a "pragmatic solution" to a parliamentary impasse over the terms on which Britain leaves the European Union when she tries to reopen talks with Brussels.

Headline: UK trade secretary says EU 'irresponsible' to refuse to reopen Brexit deal
Description: It would be irresponsible for the European Union to refuse to reopen negotiations over Britain's exit deal, British trade secretary Liam Fox said in an interview aired on Sunday.

Headline: PM's office denies report of June 6 election plan
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's office denied a report in the Mail on Sunday newspaper that the prime minister's advisors were considering scheduling a national election for June 6.

Headline: Exit from Brexit? I'd like it, but it's unlikely - German foreign minister
Description: While German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas would like to see an "exit from Brexit" - Britain abandoning its plan to leave the European Union - he said in a newspaper interview on Sunday that he saw such an outcome as extremely unlikely.

Headline: EU irks Britain by calling Gibraltar a 'colony'
Description: Britain complained about the European Union calling Gibraltar a "colony" in a piece of draft legislation on Friday, highlighting how the EU is lining up behind Spain in its territorial dispute as Britain quits the bloc.

Headline: UK would regret no-deal Brexit 'for ever' - Greg Clark
Description: Britain would permanently regret leaving the European Union without a deal, and parliament needs to reach a decision to stop this in the next two weeks, business secretary Greg Clark said in a newspaper interview on Saturday.

Headline: Two men shot in incidents in Northern Ireland's Londonderry - police
Description: Northern Ireland police said on Friday two men were shot in 'paramilitary style attacks' at about 8 p.m. in two locations in the Ballymagroarty area of Londonderry.

Headline: UK government begins 'serious work' on UK staying in EU customs union - The Independent
Description: British officials have begun "serious work" on the UK staying in a permanent EU customs union as a way to rescue the Brexit deal, the Independent newspaper reported on Friday.

Headline: Small extension to Brexit timetable could be acceptable - Rees-Mogg
Description: Prominent British eurosceptic lawmaker Jacob Rees-Mogg said he could accept a short delay to the departure from the European Union on March 29 if Prime Minister Theresa May pursued his plan for Brexit.

Headline: Weak EU economies add urgency to getting Brexit deal - Fox
Description: British Secretary of State for International Trade Liam Fox said on Friday he hoped that the European Union, facing a slowdown in the economies of some of its biggest members, will seek to settle Britain's request for new Brexit terms as quickly as possible.

Headline: UK expects to discuss backstop options with EU soon - May's spokesman
Description: Britain is looking at what options there are to replace the Irish backstop in the Brexit withdrawal deal and expects to discuss them with the European Union shortly, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Friday.

Headline: Brexit campaign Leave.EU fined for unlawful marketing
Description: Britain's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) said on Friday it had fined the EU referendum campaign Leave.EU and Brexit supporter Arron Banks's Eldon Insurance 120,000 pounds for serious breaches of electronic marketing laws.

Headline: Braving dangerous waters, Iranians seek a better life in Britain
Description: (This Jan. 23 story has been refilled to clarify researcher's relationship with Home Office)

Headline: EU negotiator, Council chief tell May - No renegotiation
Description: The EU's chief Brexit negotiator told Britain on Wednesday that time was too short to find an alternative to the Irish border arrangement agreed in their divorce deal, as London wants, and that this deal was not open for renegotiation.

Headline: Factbox - Risk of no-deal Brexit still seen low, delay likelier, banks say
Description: (This Jan. 30 story has been refilled to corrects ING projection, update chart)

Headline: British MP sees cross-party demand for accounting change
Description: A senior British lawmaker leading a review of the world's top accounting firms said on Thursday there is cross-party consensus for change, calling the approach of the "Big Four" complacent.

Headline: UK car output falls at fastest rate since recession
Description: British car production fell by 9 percent last year, the biggest drop since the 2008-9 recession, and investment slumped by nearly half due to fears about Brexit, an industry body said on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox - With Brexit looming, UK Plc triggers emergency measures
Description: With Britain at risk of leaving the European Union without a divorce deal, many of its biggest companies have lost patience and started to restructure their operations to prepare for the chaotic fallout that could ensue.

Headline: UK to formulate Irish border proposals 'in a few days' - Hunt
Description: Britain will take a few days to formulate proposals to put to the European Union in an attempt to resolve the issue of Irish border arrangements after Brexit, foreign minister Jeremy Hunt told BBC radio on Thursday.

Headline: Russia says BBC guilty of 'violations' - news agencies
Description: Russia's state communications regulator said on Thursday that the BBC World News channel had committed "certain violations" while operating in Russia, Russian news agencies reported.

Headline: EU could offer more backstop assurances if UK moves on customs union - EU lawmaker
Description: The European Union can offer Britain more assurances over the Irish border 'backstop' in a political declaration on post-Brexit ties if London moves towards accepting a permanent customs union, a leading EU lawmaker dealing with Brexit said.

Headline: May to meet MPs behind Brexit compromise plan - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will meet the group of MPs behind an alternative Brexit proposal later on Thursday, her spokesman said.

Headline: UK set to cancel parliament's planned February break as Brexit looms
Description: Britain's parliament is likely to abandon plans for a 10-day break in February, House of Commons leader Andrea Leadsom warned MPs on Thursday, as the country's March 29 exit from the European Union draws nearer.

Headline: Irish PM Varadkar rejects May plans to change backstop
Description: Ireland's Prime Minister Leo Varadkar told British Prime Minister Theresa May he would not accept her plans to renegotiate a post-Brexit arrangement for the Irish border and said the so-called Irish "backstop" needed to be legally robust.

Headline: EU's Barnier says time too short for alternatives to Irish backstop
Description: Time is too short to find an alternative arrangement to the Irish backstop and Britain's divorce deal with the European Union will not be re-opened for negotiation, the EU chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK finance industry to shrug off Brexit and grow - Hammond
Description: Finance minister Philip Hammond said on Wednesday that Britain was well positioned to expand financial services exports to some of the world's fastest growing economies as it prepares to leave the European Union.

Headline: Brexit withdrawal deal not open for renegotiation - EU's Tusk
Description: The European Union is sticking to the Brexit withdrawal agreement, European Council President Donald Tusk tweeted on Wednesday, in what he said was a message to British Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: May woos Labour MPs with local investment to back Brexit - The Times
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is preparing to entice Labour MPs to support her Brexit deal with a cash injection into deprived areas that supported Leave, The Times on Thursday.

Headline: May and Corbyn had useful Brexit meeting - Labour spokesperson
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn had a "useful exchange of views" at a meeting on how the country should proceed with leaving the European Union, a Labour spokesperson said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit backstop renegotiation will not be easy - May's spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has been clear that her efforts to renegotiate the Brexit agreement with Brussels would not be easy, her spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Factbox - Brexit: What happens next?

Headline: Ireland says Brexit backstop alternatives tested, none work

Headline: Irish PM says no plans for emergency EU Brexit summit

Headline: May looking at three ideas from Irish backstop renegotiation - spokesman

Headline: May will speak to Irish PM Varadkar later on Wednesday
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she would be speaking with her Irish counterpart Leo Varadkar later on Wednesday, a day after parliament gave her a mandate to try and renegotiate her Brexit deal.

Headline: Access to UK fishing waters post-Brexit is not up for renegotiation - May
Description: Access to Britain's fishing waters is not up for renegotiation in any talks with the European Union over possible changes MPs have demanded to the country's exit deal, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: May will meet Corbyn at 1500 GMT - source
Description: Britain's Theresa May will meet Jeremy Corbyn, leader of the opposition Labour Party, at 1500 GMT inside parliament, a government source said on Wednesday, a day after lawmakers voted for the prime minister to renegotiate her Brexit deal.

Headline: EU needs Britain to clarify next Brexit steps - Commission
Description: The European Union needs Britain to clarify its next steps on Brexit, a deputy head of the bloc's executive European Commission said on Wednesday.

Headline: EU's Tusk, May to hold Brexit call at 1745 GMT on Wednesday
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk and British Prime Minister Theresa May will have a phone call about Brexit at 1745 GMT on Wednesday, Tusk's press office said.

Headline: German customs will manage orderly or disorderly Brexit - Finance Minister

Headline: Corbyn will call on PM May to remove no deal threat - source

Description: Britain is exploring alternative options to the backstop within the Withdrawal Agreement from the European Union, after parliament voted to order Prime Minister Theresa May to renegotiate the terms, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said.

Headline: UK parliament rejects Cooper amendment seeking way to delay Brexit

Headline: UK parliament rejects amendment J on delaying Brexit

Headline: Ireland, EU resolve on Brexit withdrawal deal unchanged - Irish finance minister

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP to support proposal to replace backstop - Dodds
Description: The Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government will support a proposal for the so-called Irish backstop to be replaced with other arrangements to avoid a hard border in Ireland, deputy leader Nigel Dodds said on Tuesday.

Headline: Germany - We can't accept hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland

Headline: May spoke to EU's Juncker on Tuesday - May's spokesman

Headline: May - EU is willing to agree a Brexit deal

Headline: May tells parliament - show EU what Brexit deal you want

Headline: May's party offers new compromise to break Brexit impasse

Headline: May to EU - Reopen Brexit withdrawal agreement to win parliament's support

Headline: Labour Party to back plan which could delay Brexit

Headline: Slowing EU economy will help to reopen Brexit talks - Fox

Headline: UK Home Office will seek to end free movement in case of no-deal Brexit

Headline: Hammond to deliver Spring fiscal statement on March 11 - Sky
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond will deliver his Spring fiscal statement on March 11, Sky News reported on Monday.

Headline: EU has Brexit message for May - Decide what you want

Headline: UK PM May did not set new date for vote on Brexit deal - source

Headline: May told Conservative lawmakers - send Brussels a message about what you want on Brexit

Headline: UK could reopen Brexit deal if parliament ready to accept agreement with backstop changes - BuzzFeed
Description: The British government's enforcer Julian Smith has told lawmakers that the Brexit agreement could be reopened if parliament shows it would back an agreement with legally-binding changes to the Irish backstop, BuzzFeed reported on Friday.

Headline: New Russian board game makes light of UK nerve agent attack

Headline: No-deal Brexit would betray UK referendum - Hammond

Headline: Union leader McCluskey says May should delay Brexit by three months

Headline: Blair urges second Brexit vote to bring 'closure'

Headline: Twenty ministers discussing plans to stop no-deal Brexit - Telegraph

Headline: Barnier to UK MPs: Agree alternative to stop no deal

Headline: Eurosceptic Rees-Mogg hopeful of changes to May's Brexit deal

Headline: May's spokesman says unaware of any discussions about suspending parliament

Headline: EU customs union after Brexit incompatible with trade aims - May's spokesman

Headline: EU will do all it can to avoid hard Irish border after Brexit - Commission

Headline: Merkel, Barnier to discuss Brexit deadlock

Headline: May - attempts to delay Brexit do not solve the issue

Description: The EU cannot renegotiate the backstop agreement in the Brexit deal with the U.K. government, Commission First Vice President Frans Timmermans said at an event in Krakow, Poland.

Headline: Labour is backing bid to avoid no deal Brexit - The Sun
Description: Britain's opposition Labour party is backing an attempt to block a no-deal Brexit by lawmakers, the Sun reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Germany fears 'security disaster' without Brexit transition rules - report

Headline: EU's Moscovici says ball in UK court on Brexit

Headline: No deal Brexit would represent 'profound' failure - Moody's

Headline: Celebrities to keep social media posts 'clean', UK watchdog says

Headline: A time-limited Brexit backstop would be useless - EU's Barnier

Headline: Opposition leader pushes for parliament vote on new Brexit referendum

Headline: Payday lending complaints surge in Britain - watchdog

Headline: Experts say it’s safe to raise limit for tremors at Britain's fracking sites
