Description: Ireland said on Tuesday it would not block a possible request to delay Brexit after a newspaper reported that British and European officials had discussed the possibility of extending the formal divorce process from the bloc.

Headline: Serco, Mears win £2.9 billion refugee housing contracts in Britain
Description: Serco and Mears have won contracts totalling 2.9 billion pounds from the British government to provide accommodation and support for asylum seekers, lifting shares in both outsourcing firms.

Headline: Brexit vote planned for January 15, no plans to delay EU exit
Description: Britain plans to hold a vote in parliament on the government's deal to leave the European Union on Jan. 15, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday after a meeting of senior ministers.

Headline: Brexit with a smile - UK launches EU exit preparedness campaign
Description: A smiling construction worker, a grinning farmer and a jolly pensioner: these are the cartoon faces the government is using to try to reassure Britons that the country can cope with a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: London taxi-maker delays arrival of first van
Description: The London Electric Vehicle Company, which makes the city's famous black taxis, is delaying the arrival of its first van as it now plans to work more closely with Chinese parent company Geely , its boss said.

Headline: Risk of no-deal Brexit remains - German foreign minister
Description: Britain could crash out of the European Union without a deal, German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas said on Tuesday, urging British lawmakers to back an agreement that Prime Minister Theresa May sealed with the bloc last year.

Headline: Heathrow consults public as it eyes thousands more flights
Description: London's Heathrow, Europe's biggest airport, launched a public consultation on Tuesday ahead of the construction of a third runway, and gave details on how it plans to mitigate noise disruption for locals from thousands of extra flights.

Headline: Britain to expand drone exclusion zone after Gatwick chaos
Description: Britain will extend a drone exclusion zone five-fold and give police new powers against lawbreaking operators, the government said on Monday, after sightings last month paralysed the nation's second busiest airport.

Headline: May to pitch more Brexit ideas as she seeks EU help
Description: Britain will set out additional proposals for Northern Ireland and giving parliament a bigger role as the government seeks more assurances from the European Union on her Brexit deal, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: Labour chides government over Brexit ferry contract
Description: The Labour Party criticised the government on Monday for awarding a 14 million pound contract to a ferry company with no ships to provide backup freight cover in case the country exits the European Union without a deal.

Headline: No-deal Brexit truck 'war game' prompts scorn
Description: A convoy of nearly 90 trucks rolled through the southeast English countryside to Britain's main port to continental Europe on Monday in a government test-run for a potentially chaotic Brexit that was mocked as a farce by opponents of the split.

Headline: Labour to back bid for extra parliamentary barrier to no-deal Brexit - source
Description: Britain's main opposition Labour Party are expected to back a proposal on Tuesday that could mean the government needs parliamentary approval for a no-deal Brexit, putting up a new hurdle for Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: Record low of 18 percent of voters think May has the right Brexit deal - poll
Description: A record low of just 18 percent of British voters think Prime Minister Theresa May has got the right Brexit deal, an ORB poll published on Monday showed.

Headline: May still working on assurances from EU on Brexit deal - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is still working on obtaining assurances from the European Union which MPs have said they need before they could vote for her Brexit deal, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: May to hold parliamentary Brexit vote on January 15 - BBC
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will hold a delayed parliamentary vote on her Brexit deal on Tuesday, January 15, the BBC reported on Monday, citing government sources.

Headline: UK junior minister - I hope May's Brexit deal is approved
Description: The British government very much hopes that Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal is approved next week, a junior Brexit minister said on Monday.

Headline: May says if Brexit deal is rejected, UK will be in uncharted territory
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Sunday that Britain would be in uncharted territory if her Brexit deal is rejected by parliament later this month, despite little sign that she has won over sceptical lawmakers.

Headline: Factbox: Britain's big Brexit vote - What happens in parliament?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May must win a vote in parliament to get her Brexit deal approved or risk seeing Britain's exit from the European Union descend into chaos.

Headline: Britons would now vote to stay in EU, want second referendum - poll
Description: More Britons want to remain a member of the European Union than leave, according to a survey published on Sunday which also showed voters want to make the final decision themselves.

Headline: DUP calls on British government to dump 'poison' Brexit backstop
Description: The Northern Irish party that props up Britain's minority government on Sunday called on Prime Minister Theresa May to stand firm in demanding that the EU changes its "poison" backstop provision on Ireland's post-Brexit border.

Headline: UK health minister - Hopefully chances of winning Brexit vote have improved
Description: British health minister Matthew Hancock said on Sunday that he hoped the probability of getting the government's Brexit deal approved by parliament have improved over the Christmas break.

Headline: Factbox: Britain's big Brexit vote - What happens in parliament?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May must win a vote in parliament to get her Brexit deal approved or risk seeing Britain's exit from the European Union descend into chaos.

Headline: Juncker had 'friendly' Brexit call with May, to talk again next week
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker had a "friendly" telephone conversation with British Prime Minister Theresa May on her Brexit plans, a spokeswoman for the EU executive said on Friday.

Headline: UK plans rehearsals for no-deal Brexit amid fears of road, port chaos
Description: Britain will begin rehearsals for the possible chaos of a no-deal Brexit on Monday by testing how the road network copes with a tailback of around 150 lorries caused by disruption at its most important trading gateway to continental Europe.

Headline: France's Macron tells May Brexit deal is best possible - Elysee official
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron told Britain's Theresa May in a telephone call on Friday that the deal she negotiated over Britain's departure from the European Union was the "best one possible", an official in the French presidency said.

Headline: UK to test emergency plan for dealing with truck jam in no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain will hold a trial run on Monday of its plans for dealing with long queues of lorries at the southeastern port of Dover caused by disruption to cross-Channel traffic in the event of a no-deal Brexit.

Headline: Ahead of Brexit, top British universities enrol fewer EU students
Description: The number of European Union students enrolling in Britain's leading universities fell by 3 percent in the 2018/2019 academic year, with the biggest drop hitting postgraduate research courses.

Headline: May to speak to Juncker on Friday - BBC
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will speak to European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker later on Friday as she steps up her push to secure concessions from Brussels to help get her Brexit deal through parliament.

Headline: Northern Irish kingmakers - We will not support May's Brexit deal
Description: The Northern Irish party that props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Friday that it would not support her Brexit deal but that businesses should be relaxed about leaving the EU without an agreement.

Headline: Gatwick, Heathrow airports order military-grade anti-drone equipment
Description: London's Gatwick and Heathrow airports have ordered military-grade anti-drone defences worth "several million pounds" after drones caused three days of disruption at Gatwick last month, the airports confirmed late on Thursday.

Headline: Most of May's Conservative Party members oppose her Brexit deal - survey
Description: A majority of Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party members oppose her Brexit deal with the European Union, according to a survey published on Friday.

Headline: British police to start training in case of Northern Ireland Brexit unrest - Guardian
Description: About 1,000 police officers from Scotland and England will start training for deployment in Northern Ireland in the event of disorder arising from a no-deal Brexit, the Guardian newspaper reported late on Thursday.

Headline: With May's agreement in balance, ministers warn against no-deal Brexit
Description: Britain is more likely to leave the EU without a deal if lawmakers reject the agreement Prime Minister Theresa May has negotiated, one of her ministers said on Thursday, as a second said a no-deal exit would hit the farming sector hard.

Headline: DUP's Dodds says party's objections to PM May's Brexit deal remain, talks continue
Description: The Democractic Unionist Party's objections to Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal remain, its deputy leader Nigel Dodds said on Thursday after talks with the British leader.

Headline: Dredging starts at UK port that may be used in no-deal Brexit
Description: Work began on Thursday to extend a small British port that could serve as a back-up if the UK leaves the European Union with no trade deal, providing the government some respite after days of criticism.

Headline: No-deal Brexit would hit Britain's farmers, food firms hard - Gove
Description: Britain's farmers face rising costs if the country leaves the EU without a deal as export tariffs kick in and border inspections slow traffic through ports, Farming and Environment Minister Michael Gove said on Thursday.

Headline: May to speak to EU leaders this week over Brexit - FT
Description: UK Prime Minister Theresa May is expected to speak to European Union leaders this week including Dutch PM Mark Rutte, German Chancellor Angela Merkel and European Council President Donald Tusk, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Former Brexit minister says May should delay Brexit deal vote - the Telegraph
Description: Former Brexit minister David Davis said in an opinion essay published on Wednesday that UK Prime Minister Theresa May should delay the vote on her Brexit deal for leaving the European Union.

Headline: May will find a way to get Brexit deal through parliament - Hunt
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will find a way to get her Brexit deal approved by the British parliament, Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Wednesday during a visit to Singapore.

Headline: Grayling defends giving Brexit ferry contract to company with no ships
Description: The transport secretary has defended awarding a 14 million-pound contract for shipping goods after Brexit to a new ferry company that owns no ships.

Headline: Manchester stabbings suspect may have mental problems as terrorism probe ongoing
Description: A 25-year-old man suspected of stabbing three people with a kitchen knife at Manchester Victoria train station on New Year's Eve was being held and assessed for mental health issues on Tuesday, police said.

Headline: Police detain young man in Manchester stabbing, investigation continues
Description: A 25-year-old man suspected of stabbing three people in Manchester's Victoria train station has been detained under Britain's mental health act although a counter terrorism probe is still ongoing, Greater Manchester Police said on Tuesday.

Headline: Police treating Manchester stabbing attack as terrorist investigation
Description: Police confirmed on Tuesday they were treating a stabbing attack which injured three people at Manchester's Victoria train station as a terrorist investigation, and were searching an address in the Cheetham Hill area of the city.

Headline: Counter terrorism police investigate stabbing in Manchester
Description: British counter-terrorism police are investigating stabbings at Manchester Victoria train station that left three people injured including a police officer, police said.

Headline: May would be 'good time' for Trump visit to UK after Brexit - envoy
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump might visit Britain in May 2019 after the country's departure in March from the European Union, the U.S. ambassador to Britain, Woody Johnson, said on Monday.

Headline: May - Back my Brexit deal and let Britain 'turn a corner'
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May urged MPs on Monday to back her Brexit deal, promising that it would allow the country to "turn a corner" and let the government focus on solving domestic problems such as housing and a skill shortage.

Headline: Britain deploys extra patrol boats as migrant crossings rise
Description: Britain is recalling two patrol boats from overseas deployments to help deal with an increase in the number of migrants trying to reach the country from France, interior minister Sajid Javid said on Monday.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP will hold May to promise of Brexit deal changes
Description: The Northern Irish party that props up Britain's minority government will hold Prime Minister Theresa May to her commitment to secure changes to the divorce deal struck with the European Union, its leader said on Monday.

Headline: More work to do on Brexit assurances, says May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain still has work to do to get the assurances from the European Union it needs over its Brexit agreement, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Monday, adding that May had spoken to other EU leaders over the Christmas holiday.

Headline: UK to spend over £100 million on ferries to cope with no-deal Brexit
Description: The British government will spend more than 100 million pounds chartering extra sea ferries to ease cross-Channel congestion if the United Kingdom fails to secure a trade deal before leaving the European Union next year.

Headline: Brexit sends Britons seeking Irish passports up 22 percent in 2018
Description: The number of British citizens applying for Irish passports rose by 22 percent in 2018, Ireland's foreign office said on Monday, more than doubling the total of annual applications since Britain voted to leave the European Union.

Headline: Hammond accused of failing to release funding for no-deal Brexit - The Telegraph
Description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond has been accused by his colleagues in the cabinet of failing to release the necessary funding required to prepare Britain for a no-deal Brexit, the Telegraph newspaper reported late on Sunday.

Headline: Liam Fox says '50-50' chance Brexit may be stopped - paper
Description: Trade minister Liam Fox said there is a "50-50" chance that Brexit may be stopped if parliament rejects the government's divorce deal with the European Union next month.

Headline: UK says rising migrant Channel crossings are a 'major incident'
Description: British interior minister Sajid Javid has said the fast-growing number of would-be immigrants crossing the English Channel from France in dinghies is a "major incident."

Headline: May's Brexit deal can get through parliament - Hunt
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal can be passed by the British parliament if the European Union provides clarification that the Northern Irish "backstop" will be temporary, foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said on Friday.

Headline: Corbyn - Labour bid to force general election matter of 'when, not if'
Description: British opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn told the Independent newspaper the Labour party's attempt to force a general election by tabling a no-confidence motion was a matter of "when, not if."

Headline: EU's Oettinger sees chance British parliament votes for Brexit deal in January
Description: European Commissioner Guenther Oettinger said on Thursday there is still a chance that Britain's parliament will vote in favour of the Brexit agreement in January and that there was no public support for a disorderly Brexit or another referendum.

Headline: Prince Philip misses Christmas Day church service
Description: Britain's Prince Philip, Queen Elizabeth's husband, missed a traditional Christmas Day church service on Tuesday, though a royal source said that the 97-year old was in good health and just wanted to spend the day in private.

Headline: Queen extols goodwill and respect in Christmas message
Description: Queen Elizabeth will say in her Christmas message that the festival's message of peace and goodwill needs to be heeded as much as ever, and people should respect each other even when  they harbour the most deeply held differences.

Headline: Banksy gifts Welsh steel town a white Christmas attraction
Description: Banksy fans are flocking to the Welsh town of Port Talbot to see a new mural by the elusive British street artist depicting a child covered in snow that is in fact ash from a burning bin.

Headline: U.N. tells UK - Allow Assange to leave Ecuador embassy freely
Description: U.N. rights experts called on British authorities on Friday to allow WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to leave the Ecuador embassy in London without fear of arrest or extradition.

Headline: A renegotiated Brexit would go ahead under Labour government - Corbyn
Description: Britain's opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn would push ahead with Brexit and seek to renegotiate the terms if he won a snap election next year, he said on Saturday, in a blow to party supporters who want a second referendum.

Headline: Prayers, tributes in Lockerbie mark 30 years since Pan Am bombing
Description: A simple wreath-laying and prayer service in Lockerbie on Friday marked 30 years since a jumbo jet was blown up over the small Scottish town, killing 270 people.

Headline: Russia launches investigation into BBC as dispute with Britain escalates
Description: Russia's media regulator said on Friday it had launched an investigation into the activities of British public broadcaster the BBC, a move it described as a response to pressure being put on a Russian TV channel in Britain.

Headline: BBC could be restricted in Russia if violations found - source to Interfax
Description: The work of Britain's BBC could be restricted in Russia if Roskomnadzor, the media regulator, finds any violations of Russian law, Interfax cited a source familiar with the investigation as saying on Friday.

Headline: BBC says it complies with Russian regulations after new checks
Description: The BBC said on Friday it worked in full compliance with Russia's laws and regulations to deliver independent news after the country's media regulator said it would carry out checks on the British broadcaster in an escalation of tensions.

Headline: Kremlin questions impartiality of some BBC news reports
Description: The Kremlin said on Friday that an investigation into the BBC's work in Russia was a response to Britain's treatment of Russia's RT TV channel and called some BBC reports tendentious and politically-motivated.

Headline: Russia says it is responding in kind to Britain's actions against its media
Description: Britain's actions against Russian broadcaster RT leave Russia with no option but to respond in kind, Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova wrote on Facebook on Friday.

Headline: Britain removes word 'unlikely' from no-deal Brexit guidance
Description: The British government has removed the word "unlikely" from its official Brexit guidance telling companies and citizens how to prepare for a disorderly exit where the UK leaves the European Union without a deal.

Headline: UK's Transport Secretary lifts night-flying restriction at other airports - Sky News
Description: UK Transport Secretary Chris Grayling said he would temporarily lift night-flying restrictions at other airports in Britain, Sky News reported on Thursday.

Headline: easyJet cancels all Gatwick flights on Thursday after drones ground planes
Description: The British airline easyJet cancelled all its Gatwick flights on Thursday after drones flying near the airport grounded flights and said the disruption is expected to continue into Friday.

Headline: UK government officials working on "serious incident" at Gatwick
Description: British officials from across government are meeting to discuss how to bring an end to the "serious incident" at Gatwick Airport where the presence of several drones has grounded flights for at least 17 hours.

Headline: UK ministers focused on getting Brexit deal through parliament, May says
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday that her cabinet's focus was on building support for her Brexit deal after different ministers floated contrasting back-up plans should her Brexit deal fail to pass in parliament next month.

Headline: UK media watchdog says Russian broadcaster RT broke impartiality rules
Description: Britain's media regulator Ofcom said on Thursday Russian broadcaster RT had broken impartiality rules in news and current affairs programmes aired in March and April, including coverage of the poisoning of former spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia.

Headline: British ministers split over next Brexit steps if PM's deal fails
Description: British ministers are divided over the government's next steps if Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal with the European Union is not approved by parliament next month.

Headline: Irish PM - hard border only a problem if Britain changes rules post-no deal Brexit
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Thursday that "difficulties" around a hard border with Northern Ireland would arise only if Britain left the European Union without a withdrawal agreement and subsequently changed its laws.

Headline: UK parliament to resume Brexit deal debate on January 9
Description: Britain's parliament will resume a debate on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal with Brussels on Jan. 9, the leader of the House of Commons Andrea Leadsom said on Thursday.

Headline: UK had been talking with U.S. for days on Trump Syria withdrawal - May's spokesman
Description: Britain had been in discussion with U.S. President Donald Trump's administration for several days regarding his decision to withdraw troops from Syria, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Gatwick airport drone disruption 'irresponsible' - May's spokesman
Description: The flying of drones near London Gatwick which has forced the airport to shut its runway is irresponsible and completely unacceptable, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: EU has been clear a managed no-deal Brexit is not available - May's spokesman
Description: The European Union has been clear that a managed no-deal Brexit is not available, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday after one of her ministers said it was an option if the government's deal with Brussels is rejected by parliament.

Headline: UK could seek minimalist agreement for "managed no-deal" Brexit, minister says
Description: Britain could seek to agree a further "minimalist" withdrawal deal with the European Union if British lawmakers reject Prime Minister Theresa May's divorce agreement, House of Commons leader Andrea Leadsom said on Thursday.

Headline: EU temporarily suspends UK carbon permit processes ahead of Brexit
Description: The European Commission said on Thursday it has temporarily suspended emissions trading system processes related to Britain as from Jan. 1 next year until there is clarity on the terms of the country's departure from the EU.

Headline: The waiting game - Labour navigates its own Brexit minefields
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party ought to be rubbing their hands with glee as the governing Conservatives tear themselves apart in a Brexit-induced civil war.

Headline: Ireland unveils 'stark' contingency plans for no-deal Brexit
Description: Ireland on Wednesday disclosed its first major set of contingency plans in case Britain crashes out of the European Union without a withdrawal deal, including possible emergency measures to avoid any shortages of medicines and food.

Headline: Ireland may ask for derogations from some EU rules in no-deal Brexit
Description: Ireland does not rule out asking the European Union to relax or waive some rules of the single market in the event of a no-deal Brexit in order to avoid a hard border on the island of Ireland, Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK to prioritise high-skilled migrants post-Brexit, business groups sceptical
Description: Britain set out the biggest overhaul of its immigration policy in decades on Wednesday, ending special treatment for European Union nationals in plans criticised by one business group as a "sucker punch" for many firms.

Headline: UK post-Brexit immigration system will not put a cap on numbers
Description: Britain's post-Brexit immigration system will not put a cap on numbers but will prioritise high-skilled labour and end special treatment for European Union nationals, according to a policy paper published by the government on Wednesday.

Headline: Factbox - Britain's post-Brexit immigration plans
Description: The British government set out its biggest overhaul of immigration in decades on Wednesday, publishing a long-awaited policy paper on how it intends to approach the issue after it exits the European Union.

Headline: Factbox - Reaction to the UK government's post-Brexit immigration plans
Description: The British government set out its biggest overhaul of immigration in decades on Wednesday, publishing a long-awaited policy paper on how it intends to approach the issue after it leaves the European Union.

Headline: Russian whistleblower probably died of natural causes, UK inquest finds
Description: A Russian mafia whistleblower who was found dead after going out for a run near his home in southern England six years ago probably died of natural causes rather than from an elaborate poison plot, a British coroner found on Wednesday.

Headline: Anger in UK parliament as Corbyn accused of calling PM 'stupid woman'
Description: The House of Commons erupted in anger on Wednesday when Labour opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn appeared to mouth the words "stupid woman" after a lively exchange with Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: 100 days to Brexit, EU tells London - financiers on their own without a deal
Description: With just 100 days until Brexit, the EU's executive cautioned that most banking, insurance and other financial firms in Britain would be cut off from the European Union if there is no divorce deal.

Headline: I did not call PM May a stupid woman, says Corbyn
Description: British opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn on Wednesday said he had not referred to Prime Minister Theresa May as a "stupid woman".

Headline: Guaranteed date for post-Brexit trade deal would undermine backstop - Irish PM
Description: The European Union refused a British request for a legal guarantee that a post-Brexit trade deal would go into effect in 2021 as it would have potentially rendered the Northern Ireland backstop inoperable, Ireland's prime minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: Corbyn did not call May a 'stupid woman' - spokesman
Description: British Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn did not call Prime Minister Theresa May "a stupid woman" under his breath in parliament on Wednesday but rather muttered "stupid people" in response to the pantomime atmosphere in the House of Commons, his spokesman said.

Headline: Another EU referendum could rip UK society apart, warns biggest union
Description: Another referendum on European Union membership risks tearing British society apart and would undermine support for a possible future Labour government, the leader of Unite, Britain's biggest trade union, Len McCluskey said on Wednesday.

Headline: May's spokesman says discussions with EU on Brexit deal ongoing
Description: Britain began discussions with the European Union last week on what assurances it can give to help Prime Minister Theresa May win the support of parliament for her Brexit deal and talks are ongoing, May's spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain will set out results of EU talks in New Year - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she would set out in the New Year what assurances she had won from the European Union over her Brexit deal.

Headline: May says sticking to pledge to reduce annual net migration to tens of thousands
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she was sticking to a pledge to reduce annual net migration to Britain to less than 100,000.

Headline: EU warns of border checks, end of licences in no-deal Brexit
Description: The European Commission outlined areas of trade that would be impacted on Wednesday if Britain leaves the bloc without a withdrawal agreement at the end of March next year.

Headline: Scotch whisky makers tell UK politicians - Avoid no-deal Brexit
Description: Makers of Scotch whisky, Britain biggest food and drink export, said on Wednesday it was imperative that lawmakers work quickly to avoid crashing out of the European Union without a deal.

Headline: PM May urges devolved nations to back her Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will urge the devolved nations of Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland to "listen to business" at a meeting on Wednesday and back her Brexit deal, which envisages continuing close ties with the EU.

Headline: UK to unveil details of post-Brexit immigration system
Description: Britain's interior minister Sajid Javid will on Wednesday publish plans for a post-Brexit immigration system that would bring net migration to the UK down to "sustainable levels", his department said.

Headline: Minor UK opposition parties table vote of no confidence in government
Description: The Scottish National Party (SNP) and other minor British opposition parties have tabled a vote of no confidence in Theresa May's Conservative government, the SNP said on Tuesday.

Headline: British government to activate full 'no-deal' Brexit preparations
Description: The British government said on Tuesday it would implement plans for a no-deal Brexit in full and begin telling businesses and citizens to prepare for the risk of leaving the European Union without an agreement.

Headline: No plans for indicative vote in parliament on Brexit options - May's spokesman
Description: The British government is not planning to hold an indicative vote in parliament to test support for various Brexit options, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK cannot revoke Article 50 as a temporary measure - Brexit minister
Description: Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said on Tuesday Britain's Article 50 notice to leave the European Union could be not be revoked as a temporary measure.

Headline: Explainer - Brexit basics: What is Brexit and why does it matter?
Description: The United Kingdom is due to leave the European Union on March 29, 2019. The date is set in law - the 2018 Withdrawal Act - but the divorce has been plunged into chaos.

Headline: UK to implement plans for no-deal Brexit in full - May's spokesman
Description: Britain will begin to put into place plans for an exit from the European Union without any deal in place, with the public and businesses told to prepare now for the eventuality, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK government makes no-deal Brexit an operational priority - minister
Description: British government ministers have agreed that preparing for a no-deal Brexit will be their operational priority and companies need to take the possibility of a sudden exit from the European Union much more seriously, Britain's Brexit minister said.

Headline: Companies in England to pay packaging waste costs under new proposals
Description: Companies and factories in England will have a legal obligation to foot the bill for the disposal or recycling of waste packaging they produce under new plans by Britain's environment minister.

Headline: Timeline - The United Kingdom's tortuous journey in and out of the EU
Description: Britain will leave the European Union at 2300 GMT on March 29, 2019. Wednesday marks 100 days to departure day.

Headline: Brexit - Chaotic exit, referendum or last-minute deal?
Description: The United Kingdom's exit from the European Union has been plunged into disarray by Prime Minister Theresa May's failure to find a divorce deal the British parliament will approve.

Headline: Facing opposition, May will bring Brexit deal back to parliament
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she would bring her Brexit deal back to parliament for a mid-January vote, pledging to get assurances from the European Union before then to break a deadlock over Britain's fraught efforts to quit the bloc.

Headline: Factbox - What do British politicians say about another referendum on Brexit?
Description: The crisis in Prime Minister Theresa May's government over her plans to leave the European Union has stirred interest in the possibility that Britain may hold a second vote on whether to end decades of membership of the world's largest trading bloc.

Headline: May has cabinet support for her Brexit deal - spokesman
Description: Theresa May's cabinet of top ministers is backing the prime minister in working to get her Brexit deal through parliament, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Labour claims credit for forcing new date for Brexit vote
Description: The Labour Party said on Monday Prime Minister Theresa May had only offered a date for a new vote on her Brexit deal because it had threatened to call for a motion of no confidence in her.

Headline: Right to maintain no-deal Brexit planning - Brokenshire
Description: British Communities Secretary James Brokenshire said on Tuesday that preparing for a no-deal Brexit was the right course of action for the government to take despite the fact that it was not what it wanted to happen.

Headline: Labour calls May no confidence vote over Brexit vote timing
Description: The leader of Britain's main opposition Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, said he was calling for a no confidence vote in Prime Minister Theresa May -- a largely symbolic gesture -- for not putting her Brexit plan to a vote by lawmakers immediately.

Headline: Labour leader slams May for pushing Brexit vote into January
Description: The leader of the Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, criticised Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday for rescheduling a delayed vote in parliament on her Brexit deal until mid-January.

Headline: May says rescheduling Brexit vote in parliament for mid-Jan
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday that she intended to re-schedule a delayed vote in parliament on her Brexit plan in the week starting on Jan. 14.

Headline: Labour's Corbyn to call for no confidence vote in May - source
Description: The leader of Britain's main opposition Labour Party will on Monday call for a no confidence vote in Theresa May if the prime minister fails to name a date for a vote in parliament on her Brexit deal, a Labour source said.

Headline: Corbyn could call for no confidence vote in May shortly
Description: The leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, will call for a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister Theresa May if she does not announce a date for a vote on her Brexit deal shortly, said BBC political Editor Laura Kuenssberg.

Headline: Meghan Markle's father asks Queen Elizabeth to get his daughter back in touch
Description: Meghan Markle's father appealed to Britain's Queen Elizabeth on Monday to intercede to end his estrangement from his daughter, the wife of Prince Harry.

Headline: Lockerbie marks 30 years since deadly attack
Description: Memorial services in the Scottish town of Lockerbie will this week mark the 30th anniversary of the bombing of a Pan Am jumbo jet that killed 270 people.

Headline: Rejecting second or indicative vote, May presses on with Brexit deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is seeking the "extra assurances" needed to get parliament's backing for her deal to leave the European Union, her spokesman said on Monday, ruling out a second referendum or an indicative vote on Brexit options.

Headline: Another Brexit referendum would increase uncertainty - UK Business minister
Description: British business minister Greg Clark said that a second Brexit referendum would increase uncertainty for the country and his preference would be for parliament to back Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal.

Headline: UK signs air service deal with Switzerland for post-Brexit flights
Description: Transport minister Chris Grayling will sign an agreement with Switzerland on Monday to ensure air services continue to operate between the two countries after Brexit.

Headline: Confidence motion against UK government could pass - Scotland's Sturgeon
Description: Scotland's first minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Sunday she thought that a confidence motion against the government could succeed in parliament, piling pressure on the main opposition Labour Party to trigger such a vote.

Headline: British government is not planning for second Brexit vote - minister
Description: British education minister Damian Hinds said on Sunday the government was not planning for a second referendum, denying reports that ministers were looking at such a vote to break the deadlock over Brexit.

Headline: Brexit pressure rises, but UK government says no to second vote
Description: Britain's government is not preparing for a second referendum on Brexit, ministers said on Sunday, sticking to the script that Prime Minister Theresa May's deal could still pass through parliament with a few changes.

Headline: Rudd warns Brexit is stuck as no-deal or referendum loom
Description: Britain's exit from the European Union was heading for an impasse, one senior minister said on Saturday, after a week in which Prime Minister Theresa May failed to win EU assurances on her deal and pulled a vote because UK lawmakers would defeat it.

Headline: UK would have to delay Brexit for an 'entirely new' proposal - Irish foreign minister
Description: Britain would likely have to delay its departure from the European Union or rescind its exit notification "for the moment" if it wanted to put an "entirely new" Brexit proposal forward, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Sunday.

Headline: Labour will try to force parliament Brexit vote next week
Description: Britain's main opposition Labour Party will do all it can to force the government to bring a vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal to parliament next week, its election coordinator Andrew Gwynne said on Sunday.

Headline: Any decision on Brexit deal will happen in New Year - Liam Fox
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox said on Sunday talks with the European Union to secure "assurances" for parliament on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal will take time, with a decision expected in the New Year.

Headline: UK ministers think May's Brexit plan is dead, seek alternatives - The Times
Description: Most of British Prime Minister Theresa May's senior ministers think her Brexit plan is dead and are discussing different options including a second referendum, The Times newspaper reported.

Headline: 'Who are you calling 'nebulous'?' May presses testy EU for Brexit help
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday further assurances on her Brexit deal were possible after European Union leaders told her they would not be renegotiating the treaty and scorned her stilted defence of Britain's departure.

Headline: Brexit bother - animated May remonstrates with EU's Juncker
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May remonstrated with Jean-Claude Juncker at a Brussels summit on Friday, and the EU chief executive had to placate her after publicly calling Britain's Brexit demands "nebulous".

Headline: EU's Tusk says no more Brexit negotiations
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Friday he had no mandate to reopen Brexit negotiations with Britain, while the head of the bloc's executive, Jean-Claude Juncker, said he "admired" Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: EU's Juncker says did not mean to offend May
Description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said he had highest respect for Prime Minister Theresa May and his use of the word "nebulous" had referred to the broader state of the Brexit debate in Britain rather than its leader.

Headline: Ireland's Varadkar wants to help May as far as possible
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Friday he wanted to help Prime Minister Theresa May as much as possible but that EU leaders could not offer her any guarantees that ran counter to what was already agreed in Brexit talks.

Headline: Cuadrilla pauses gas fracking again following more tremors
Description: British shale gas company Cuadrilla has paused fracking at its Preston New Road site in Lancashire, northwest England, for the fourth time since October following a minor seismic event, it said on Friday.

Headline: Germany's Altmaier sees no disorderly Brexit, hopeful on U.S. trade ties
Description: Germany's economy minister does not expect a disorderly Brexit and believes the danger of a major trade conflict between the European Union and the United States is not yet over but has also not grown, he told Reuters on Friday.

Headline: Risk of "managed" no-deal Brexit rising, British minister says
Description: The risk of a "managed" no-deal Brexit is rising as Prime Minister Theresa May is unlikely to win enough from the European Union to satisfy Eurosceptic rebels in her own party, a senior British minister told Reuters.

Headline: France's Macron - The Brexit accord is not renegotiable
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday said he continued to believe an economic stabilisation function was necessary in the budget of the euro zone and reiterated there was only one  achievable deal with London regarding Brexit.

Headline: EU wants to use Northern Irish backstop only as last resort - Merkel
Description: The European Union wants to use the so-called Northern Irish backstop only if necessary, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Friday.

Headline: Highlights - EU leaders arrive for second day of summit dominated by Brexit
Description: European Union leaders arrive in Brussels for a second day of day of talks on Brexit, the euro zone, migration and Russia, among others.

Headline: Swiss cabinet approves text of trade deal with Britain after Brexit
Description: The Swiss government approved on Friday the text of a trade deal with Britain that aims to maintain economic and commercial relations with its sixth-biggest export market after Brexit.

Headline: Brexit talks get tougher close to the end - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said the Brexit talks were going to get tough towards the very end of the negotiations as she battled to win assurances from the European Union to persuade lawmakers to back her deal.

Headline: Still possible to get Brexit reassurances from EU, says May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday it was still possible to get further clarification from the European Union on the Brexit deal to help her win parliamentary approval for it.

Headline: May - Juncker's "nebulous" comment not aimed at me
Description: British Prime Minister said European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker had clarified during an animated conversation on Friday that he had not called her "nebulous".

Headline: Tony Blair sees another Brexit referendum as most likely outcome
Description: Former Prime Minister Tony Blair said a second Brexit referendum is now the most likely outcome because plans to leave the European Union face deadlock in parliament.

Headline: Dutch fudge or Walloon macaroon? EU weighs gift for May
Description: Dutch fudge is off the summit table as EU lawyers look closer to home in Belgium for a model of what leaders can offer Prime Minister Theresa May in the way of reassurances to help her sell a Brexit deal at home in Britain.

Headline: May's spokeswoman - We are confident we can get the Brexit solutions we need
Description: Britain is confident it can get the assurances it needs from the European Union over Brexit to get Prime Minister Theresa May's deal though parliament, May's spokeswoman said on Friday, stressing however there was more work to be done.

Headline: Britons will have to pay 7 euros for visa-free travel to EU after Brexit
Description: British travellers will have to pay 7 euros (6.29 pounds) for a three year pre-travel authorisation to visit the European Union after Brexit, provided London seals a divorce agreement with the bloc.

Headline: Britain's EU referendum cost almost 130 million pounds to organise
Description: The cost of staging the 2016 referendum that triggered Britain’s impending exit from the European Union was almost 130 million pounds, the UK’s electoral regulator said on Friday, amid calls from some politicians for a second vote.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP tells May - stand up to EU on Brexit
Description: The Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's minority government gave her a blunt warning on Friday: stand up to the European Union on Brexit.

Headline: May meets French president Macron in Brussels
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May was meeting French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday at an EU summit where her request for assurances to calm a parliamentary rebellion at home were met with a demand for concrete proposals.

Headline: May's Brussels trip was "complete failure" - ex-UKIP leader Farage
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's inability to extract any concessions from European Union leaders on Thursday showed a complete failure of British diplomacy, former UK Independence Party (UKIP) leader Nigel Farage said.

Headline: EU summit a welcome first step - May's deputy
Description: The EU council meeting was a welcome first step as British Prime Minister Theresa May tries to win reassurances she hopes will persuade MPs to back her Brexit plan, her deputy told the BBC.

Headline: Labour Party says May has failed to get meaningful changes to Brexit deal
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party said Prime Minister Theresa May had failed to win meaningful changes to her Brexit divorce deal at a summit with European leaders.

Headline: EU gives May assurances on Brexit, but cold comfort

Headline: EU offers Britain some assurances over Brexit backstop

Headline: EU leaders agreed Irish backstop should only be temporary - Austria's Kurz
Description: EU leaders agreed on Thursday to spell out that the "backstop" guarantee to avoid a hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland should only be a temporary solution, Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz said.

Headline: 'Trust me', May tells EU leaders she can get Brexit deal passed
Description: "Trust me," Prime Minister Theresa May told other European Union leaders on Thursday, saying that with their help, she could win the British parliament's backing for her Brexit deal and prevent a chaotic departure.

Headline: Britain willing to host U.N. climate talks in 2020 - minister
Description: Britain is willing to host United Nations climate talks in 2020, the country's energy minister said on Thursday, as it seeks to establish a lead role in the fight against global warming after it leaves the European Union.

Headline: Brexit vote will happen next month, before Jan. 21 - May's spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will put her Brexit deal to a vote in parliament as soon as possible in January, and definitely before Jan. 21, her spokeswoman told reporters on Thursday.

Headline: Make your Brexit mind up - EU leader's Xmas wish for May
Description: If Britons would just make their minds up about what they want for Brexit, the European Union will help make it happen, one EU leader said in a light-hearted tweet as a pre-Christmas summit got under way.

Headline: Highlights - EU leaders arrive for two-day summit dominated by Brexit
Description: European Union leaders arrive in Brussels for two days of talks on Brexit, the euro zone, migration and Russia, among others.

Headline: No credible fallback option to replace backstop: Irish minister
Description: Ireland's foreign minister insisted there was no credible fallback option to take the place of the "backstop" to prevent the return of border checks on the island of Ireland after Brexit.

Headline: Macron says up to May to find political solution for Brexit deal

Headline: Emissions in, bubbles out - UK plans world's first carbon-neutral industry hub
Description: Britain plans by 2040 to develop the world's first net-zero carbon industrial centre by teaming up emitters with industries that can reuse their polluting gases or by moving to lower carbon fuels such as hydrogen, it said on Thursday.

Headline: EU can offer UK assurances, but no changes to Brexit deal - Merkel
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Thursday that Britain might be able to secure assurances on its deal to exit the European Union, but the tentative agreement itself could not change.

Headline: Next steps on Brexit law up to Scottish government after court ruling - PM May's spokeswoman

Headline: UK court rules Scotland partly overstepped powers over Brexit bill

Headline: We are prepared to accommodate May on Brexit - Austria's Kurz

Headline: May says she does not expect immediate Brexit breakthrough

Headline: UK's post-Brexit immigration policy paper will be published next week

Headline: Former Brexit minister Raab: Hard to see how PM May can lead on
Description: The scale of opposition to Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal means it is difficult to see how she can lead the Conservative Party forward, her former Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said on Thursday.

Headline: UK has not looked in detail at legal route to revoking Article 50 -Attorney General
Description: Britain has not looked in detail at how to revoke its Article 50 notice to leave the European Union as the government does not plan to do so, Attorney General Geoffrey Cox said on Thursday.

Headline: No vote on May's Brexit deal included in pre-Christmas parliament schedule

Headline: EU's Tusk to meet May for "last-minute" pre-summit talks
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said he would meet British Prime Minister Theresa May on Thursday before he chairs an EU summit starting at 3 p.m. (1400 GMT) in Brussels that will be dominated by Brexit.

Headline: Irish and British prime ministers to meet ahead of EU summit

Headline: May seeking assurances over Irish backstop - Brexit minister

Description: Britain's parliament needs to regain control of the Brexit process, opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Wednesday after Prime Minister Theresa May survived a vote of no confidence from her own party.

Headline: Influential Brexiteer Jacob Rees-Mogg rules out a leadership bid

Headline: May tells her MPs she will not lead them into next election
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has told lawmakers in the ruling Conservative party that she will not lead them into the next general election, one Member of Parliament said.

Headline: Irish nationalist Sinn Fein steps up calls for post-Brexit united Ireland

Headline: Explainer - How will the leadership challenge to May work?
Description: Lawmakers in British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party on Wednesday triggered a confidence vote in her leadership over Britain's planned divorce from the European.

Headline: Brexiteer Michael Gove says - May will win confidence vote
Description: The most senior Brexiteer in Prime Minister Theresa May's government said on Wednesday he was sure that she would win a vote of confidence triggered by rebel lawmakers.

Headline: Majority of Conservative MPs indicate support for May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has secured indications of support from at least 158 of her Conservative Party lawmakers, which would be enough to ensure she wins a confidence vote later on Wednesday, based on statements they have made to the media and on social media.

Headline: At least 150 MPs publicly back May ahead of confidence vote

Headline: Merkel - There's still time for an orderly Brexit

Headline: Change in UK government would mean risk to Brexit - May

Headline: EU leaders to issue Brexit statement on Thursday - Tusk

Headline: At least 100 MPs back May ahead of confidence vote
Description: At least 100 Conservative Party lawmakers have expressed support for Prime Minister Theresa May ahead of a confidence vote in her leadership later on Wednesday, based on public statements in the media and social media.

Headline: At least 75 Conservative MPs so far back May
Description: At least 75 Conservative Party lawmakers have expressed support for Prime Minister Theresa May ahead of a confidence vote in her leadership on Wednesday, based on public statements in the media and social media.

Headline: Germany: We are prepared for both Brexit options
Description: Germany is prepared for both an orderly and a disorderly departure of Britain from the European Union and hopes that the British government will make wise decision on the matter, German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Wednesday.

Headline: May vows to fight leadership challenge

Headline: Cabinet meeting cancelled - May's office
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has cancelled a meeting of her cabinet of senior ministers which had been scheduled for later on Wednesday, her office said in a statement.

Headline: UK will delay Brexit if May loses vote - justice minister
Description: Britain would need to delay its exit from the European Union if Prime Minister Theresa May loses a vote of confidence in her leadership on Wednesday, her justice minister David Gauke said.

Headline: Britain's credit default swaps hit highest since 2016 Brexit vote
Description: News of a vote of no confidence against Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday pushed the cost of insuring UK government debt against default to its highest since the country's 2016 vote to leave the European Union.

Headline: May could not have been surprised over no confidence vote - Brady
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May could not have been surprised about the triggering of a no confidence vote against her and wants to move on with it quickly, the chairman of a Conservative committee which will organise the vote said on Wednesday.

Headline: May's weakness immobilising government at critical time - Labour
Description: The weakness of British Prime Minister Theresa May "has completely immobilised the government at this critical time for the country", the chairman of the main opposition Labour Party said on Wednesday.

Headline: May says a new leader would have to extend or rescind Brexit notice
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May, who faces a vote of no confidence in her leadership of the Conservative Party on Wednesday, said any new leader would have to extend the March 29 deadline for Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: May - I will fight confidence vote with "everything I have got"
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she would fight a vote of no confidence in her leadership of the Conservative Party later on Wednesday with "everything I have got".

Headline: Fox, Lidington back May in confidence vote
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox and cabinet office minister David Lidington said they will support Prime Minister Theresa May in a vote of confidence taking place later on Wednesday.

Headline: Former minister Paterson submits letter of no confidence in May
Description: Former British minister Owen Paterson said he had submitted a letter of no confidence in Prime Minister Theresa May in the hope of triggering a leadership challenge.

Headline: Conservative MPs trigger no confidence vote in May's leadership
Description: MPs in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party triggered a vote of no confidence in her leadership on Wednesday as Britain's planned divorce from the European Union was plunged into chaos.

Headline: Statement on vote of confidence in British Prime Minister May
Description: Graham Brady, chairman of the Conservative Party's 1922 committee, released the following statement on Wednesday:

Headline: After Brexit vote delay, leadership challenge looms for May
Description: An attempt to oust British Prime Minister Theresa May gathered pace on Tuesday, a day after her decision to delay a vote in parliament on her Brexit deal for fear of a rout angered many in her Conservative Party.

Headline: Brady not planning to meet May after Wednesday question session - City AM
Description: Graham Brady, the chairman of the Conservative lawmakers' "1922 Committee," is not planning to meet British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday after her weekly question session in parliament, a reporter with the British newspaper City AM said https://twitter.com/owenjbennett/status/1072627298392834048 on Twitter, citing a source.

Headline: Explainer - How does a leadership challenge to a Conservative prime minister work?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's position as leader of the Conservative Party - and consequently her premiership - is under threat from lawmakers who are unhappy at the Brexit deal she has agreed with the European Union.

Headline: PM May returns to Downing Street office - TV
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has returned to her Downing Street office, television footage showed late on Tuesday, as media reported the threshold of lawmakers' letters to trigger a vote of no confidence in her leadership had been reached.

Headline: Factbox: Who has submitted letters of no confidence in May?
Description: Some lawmakers in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party have said they have submitted letters of no confidence in the British leader.

Headline: PM May could face confidence motion on Wednesday night - lawmaker
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's lawmakers could vote on a no confidence motion in her leadership as soon as Wednesday night, said a Conservative lawmaker who has long been critical of May.

Headline: Don't know if threshold reached to trigger no confidence vote in PM May - Rees-Mogg
Description: Eurosceptic British lawmaker Jacob Rees-Mogg said in an interview with CNBC he does not know if the 48-letter threshold has been reached to trigger no-confidence vote in Prime Minister Theresa May's leadership.

Headline: Threshold reached to trigger no confidence vote in PM May - BBC
Description: Enough letters have been submitted by Conservative lawmakers to trigger a vote of no confidence in British Prime Minister Theresa May's leadership, the BBC reported on Tuesday, citing multiple sources who believe the tally of 48 has been reached.

Headline: Armed British police use stun gun on man inside grounds of parliament
Description: Armed British police used a Taser stun gun to restrain a man after he ran into the grounds of parliament on Tuesday, close to where an officer was stabbed to death last year, and ignored warnings to stop.

Headline: Tusk tells May - EU wants to help on Brexit, but how?
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said after meeting British Prime Minister Theresa May on Brexit on Tuesday that the bloc was willing to help her win the UK parliament's approval of their draft divorce deal.

Headline: EU president Austria says Brexit deal cannot be renegotiated
Description: The Brexit deal between Britain and the European Union cannot be renegotiated but the EU should consider giving assurances on the so-called Irish backstop without reopening the deal, Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz's office said on Tuesday.

Headline: PM May says just starting talks with EU leaders over Brexit backstop
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said she was just at the start of discussions with European leaders as she seeks reassurances that the Northern Irish backstop is only temporary, in a bid to persuade lawmakers to back her Brexit deal.

Headline: "Stop Brexit!" - one man's daily protest against UK-EU divorce
Description: Steve Bray is already hard at work when dawn breaks over London, waving anti-Brexit banners behind television crews reporting live outside Westminster.

Headline: UK can revoke or postpone Brexit, says Dublin as it prepares for 'no deal'
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said Britain could avoid prospective disruption to trade across the EU by revoking or extending its notice to quit the bloc, as Dublin on Tuesday began enacting its contingency plan for a 'no-deal' Brexit.

Headline: May, boxed in on Brexit, gets locked in her limo
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May, who is boxed in on her options for Brexit, had her room for manoeuvre further diminished when she was briefly locked in her car in front of German leader Angela Merkel on Tuesday.

Headline: May to meet Ireland's Varadkar in Dublin on Wednesday - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will meet Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar on Wednesday, her spokesman said on Tuesday, part of her bid to secure "reassurances" from EU leaders to help get her Brexit deal through parliament.

Headline: Not enough letters yet to trigger confidence vote in May - The Sun
Description: The senior Conservative lawmaker who would oversee any confidence vote in Prime Minister Theresa May does not yet have enough letters from lawmakers to trigger the process, the Sun political editor said.

Headline: May, Merkel agree to stay in touch to clear Brexit parliament hurdle
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May and German Chancellor Angela Merkel agreed on Tuesday to stay in close touch to try to get Britain's deal to leave the European Union through parliament, the British leader's spokesman said.

Headline: May's spokesman has no comment on report threshold for leadership challenge met
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman had no comment on Tuesday on a report by Sky News that the threshold had been met to trigger a challenge to her leadership.

Headline: No confidence vote about to be triggered in PM May, Sky News reporter
Description: Some lawmakers in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party are confident that enough letters of no-confidence have been submitted to trigger a leadership challenge, the deputy political editor of Sky News said on Tuesday.

Headline: Opposition UK lawmakers call for second Brexit referendum preparations
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government and the European Union should begin planning for a second Brexit referendum because parliament cannot agree on a divorce deal and voters will be asked to break the deadlock, opposition lawmakers said.

Headline: EU's Brexit message to May - clarify, reassure, but not renegotiate
Description: "Clarify?" - yes. "Reassure?" - sure. "Renegotiate?" - no.

Headline: Britain must revoke notice to quit EU now, former PM John Major says
Description: Britain must revoke its notice to quit the European Union with immediate effect to allow for "serious and profound reflection" by both parliament and the people, former Prime Minister John Major said on Tuesday.

Headline: Merkel said there will be no more negotiations on Brexit - sources
Description: After meeting British Prime Minister Theresa May in Berlin, Chancellor Angela Merkel told her conservative parliamentary group on Tuesday that there would be no further negotiations on Brexit, two German conservative sources said.

Headline: Cuadrilla pauses gas fracking at English site after more tremors
Description: British shale gas company Cuadrilla has again paused fracking at its Preston New Road site in Lancashire, northwest England, after tremors were detected, the company said.

Headline: Six migrants rescued from dinghy in busy UK shipping lane
Description: Six suspected migrants were rescued from a dinghy in the English Channel just off the port of Dover early on Tuesday morning, the interior ministry said.

Headline: UK can end 'no deal' threat by revoking, extending Brexit - Irish PM
Description: Britain can remove the threat of a no deal Brexit by revoking or extending its notice to quit the bloc, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Tuesday.

Headline: Explainer - Chaos, or keep calm and carry on: What happens now in the UK?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has delayed a vote in parliament to approve her Brexit deal in search of extra assurances from the European Union that will win over deeply sceptical lawmakers. Britain cannot ratify any withdrawal agreement without parliament's consent.

Headline: Deal or no deal, UK parliament will debate Brexit next steps - minister
Description: Parliament will debate and vote upon the government's next steps whether or not Prime Minister Theresa May has a Brexit deal for them to approve, junior Brexit minister Robin Walker said on Tuesday.

Headline: London police say man arrested in grounds of parliament for "trespassing"
Description: London police said a man detained by officers using a stun gun in the grounds of the British parliament on Tuesday was arrested on suspicion of trespassing at a protected site.

Headline: New Brexit vote will be before January 21 - May's spokesman
Description: Britain's parliament will vote on whether to approve Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal before Jan. 21, her spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Dutch PM calls meeting with May "useful"
Description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte described a meeting with Theresa May on Tuesday as "useful", a day after the British premier threw Brexit plans into doubt by postponing a parliamentary vote on a deal with the EU.

Headline: EU offers new Brexit deal clarity, won't renegotiate - Juncker
Description: The European Union is willing to give Britain further clarifications on its Brexit deal but will not renegotiate the treaty or its protocol on the Irish border, EU chief executive Jean-Claude Juncker said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU's Juncker, May to meet in Brussels at 1815 GMT on Tuesday
Description: European Commission head Jean-Claude Juncker will meet Prime Minister Theresa May at 1815 GMT in Brussels on Tuesday, his spokesman said.

Headline: Italy's PM Conte says EU needs to prepare for worst over Brexit
Description: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said on Tuesday he hoped Britain would leave the European Union next year within the framework of an agreed deal, but said EU partners needed to prepare for the worst.

Headline: Germany sees no scope to change Brexit deal - Roth
Description: There is no scope to re-negotiate the agreement on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union as the existing deal was difficult enough to reach, Germany's EU affairs minister Michael Roth said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU's Tusk to meet May at 1600 GMT on Tuesday
Description: The chairman of European Union summits Donald Tusk is scheduled to meet British Prime Minister Theresa May at 1600 GMT on Tuesday, his spokesman said.

Headline: German conservative - No scope for further Brexit negotiations
Description: There is no scope whatsoever for holding further negotiations on the Brexit agreement between the European Union and Britain, the deputy EU spokesman for Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservative parliamentary bloc said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU can help as UK seeks changes to Brexit divorce deal - minister
Description: Andrea Leadsom, leader of Britain's lower house of parliament, said on Tuesday the European Union had a history of doing last minute deals as Prime Minister Theresa May sought support from European leaders for changes to her Brexit deal.

Headline: May must go now, says Conservative MP Baker
Description: Theresa May needs to be replaced as British prime minister now, a leading Eurosceptic lawmaker in her Conservative party said on Tuesday as he urged colleagues to trigger a vote of no confidence in her leadership.

Headline: Crispin Blunt sends letter of no confidence to '1922 Committee' - The Times
Description: British lawmaker Crispin Blunt has sent a letter of no confidence in Prime Minister Theresa May to the chairman of the committee in charge of Conservative Party leadership contests, the 26th MP in the party to do so, The Times reported on Monday.

Headline: Brexit in turmoil as May pulls vote to seek changes to EU divorce
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday postponed a parliamentary vote on her Brexit deal to seek more concessions but the European Union refused to renegotiate and lawmakers doubted her chances of winning big changes.

Headline: May to meet Germany's Merkel after delaying Brexit vote
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will meet German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Tuesday to discuss the concerns expressed by British lawmakers over her Brexit deal, her office said on Monday.

Headline: UK parliament to hold emergency debate after Brexit vote delay
Description: Parliament will on Tuesday hold a three-hour emergency debate on Prime Minister Theresa May's decision to defer a planned vote on her Brexit deal, Speaker John Bercow announced following a request by the opposition Labour Party.

Headline: UK government takes formal step in parliament to delay vote on Brexit deal
Description: The British government on Monday formally delayed a planned vote in parliament on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal.

Headline: Amber Rudd says May's premiership and deal are not dead
Description: British minister Amber Rudd said on Monday she did not believe Theresa May's premiership was dead after the prime minister pulled a parliamentary vote on Brexit for fear of losing it.

Headline: EU court says UK can U-turn on Brexit if it wants
Description: The European Union's top court ruled on Monday that the British government may reverse its decision to leave the bloc without consulting other member states, a decision welcomed by those campaigning to stop Brexit.

Headline: Irish PM says preparations for 'no-deal' Brexit should intensify
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Monday preparations for a no-deal Brexit should intensify after Britain's Theresa May pulled a parliamentary vote on her EU divorce deal to avoid a major defeat among lawmakers.

Headline: EU rules out reworking Brexit deal, prepares for no-deal -Tusk
Description: EU leaders will not renegotiate Britain's Brexit deal, including the Irish border "backstop", their chairman Donald Tusk said on Monday after Prime Minister Theresa May put off a parliamentary vote on a package that was facing heavy defeat.

Headline: Brexit backstop assurances will be irrelevant if not in divorce deal - Rees-Mogg
Description: Any assurances Britain secures from the European Union on the Irish backstop in the Brexit divorce deal will be "completely irrelevant" if they are not in the Withdrawal Agreement, eurosceptic lawmaker Jacob Rees-Mogg said on Monday.

Headline: ECJ ruling does not change our policy on Article 50, says UK Brexit minister
Description: Britain's policy of not revoking its Article 50 Brexit notice has not been changed by a European court ruling saying that the government could do so without needing the consent of European Union counterparts, Brexit minister Stephen Barclay said.

Headline: May to meet Dutch PM in bid to win Brexit vote approval
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will meet Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte in the Hague on Tuesday, her office said on Monday, part of her attempts to secure assurances to win over a hostile parliament in London over her Brexit deal.

Headline: UK government to publish immigration policy paper by end of year - parliamentary leader
Description: The British government plans to publish a policy paper on its post-Brexit immigration system before the end of the year, the leader of the House of Commons, Andrea Leadsom, said on Monday.

Headline: UK government will decide when Brexit vote takes place - parliamentary leader
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government will decide when parliament will vote on her Brexit agreement with the European Union, the governing Conservative Party's leader in the lower house said on Monday.

Headline: Labour Party will bring no confidence motion when likely to be successful
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party said on Monday it would only launch a motion of no confidence in Prime Minister Theresa May's government when it felt it would most likely be successful.

Headline: Date for new Brexit vote depends on when we get assurances from EU - May's spokesman
Description: The date for a new vote on whether to approve Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal will depend on when her government gets the assurances it needs to satisfy parliament, May's spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: EU ministers plan no Brexit meeting on Tuesday - EU official
Description: European affairs ministers who will meet in Brussels on Tuesday to prepare a leaders' summit later in the week will not convene a special session on Brexit, a senior EU official said on Monday.

Headline: No-deal Brexit more likely amid 'confused' situation in London, France says
Description: A costly British exit from the European Union without a negotiated deal is increasingly likely, France's European affairs minister said on Monday, after British Prime Minister Theresa May postponed a vote on a deal in the face of defeat.

Headline: Germany sees no possible change to Brexit deal
Description: German foreign minister Heiko Maas said on Monday there were no possibilities of changing the agreement on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union next year.

Headline: Liberal Democrat leader says would support vote of no confidence in May
Description: The leader of Britain's pro-European Union Liberal Democrats said on Monday his party would support a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister Theresa May if one were called by the opposition Labour Party.

Headline: UK Parliament should decide whether Brexit vote is delayed - speaker
Description: The speaker of Britain's lower house of parliament said it would be "right" that members of parliament were given a chance have their say on whether or not to delay a planned vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan.

Headline: Labour leader Corbyn tells May: Make way for Labour
Description: Britain's Labour Party called on Prime Minister Theresa May to make way for the opposition party if she could not take on board the fundamental changes required to get her deal through parliament.

Headline: Senior eurosceptic MP: May must govern or quit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May must either govern or quit, a senior eurosceptic lawmaker in her Conservative Party said on Monday, after she delayed a vote in parliament on her Brexit deal.

Headline: May will seek further assurances from EU on Brexit backstop
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she would do all she could to secure further assurances from the European Union on the so-called backstop arrangement in the Brexit deal that has angered so many across parliament.

Headline: May says Brexit is her duty, will seek new reassurances from EU
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday that it was her duty to deliver Brexit, and that she would seek reassurances needed by parliament to complete the process.

Headline: May says will delay parliament vote on Brexit deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she was delaying a planned vote in parliament on her Brexit deal as it was set to be rejected "by a significant margin".

Headline: UK court orders Indian tycoon Mallya to be extradited on fraud charges

Headline: London's Crossrail gets more money but faces further delay
Description: London's Crossrail project will receive as much as 1.7 billion pounds in additional public funding to complete the delayed line that will link the Canary Wharf financial district to Heathrow airport.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP tells May: abandon the Brexit 'backstop'
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party propping up Britain's Conservative government said on Monday she had told Prime Minister Theresa May to scrap the "backstop" in the Brexit deal.

Headline: UK government can delay Brexit vote without parliament's approval - source
Description: Britain's government can delay a vote on Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal without needing the approval of parliament, a source in Whitehall said on Monday.

Headline: May to head back to Brussels to discuss Brexit - junior minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will head back to Brussels to seek to renegotiate the so-called Irish backstop element of her exit deal with the European Union, a junior minister said on Monday.

Headline: Scottish nationalists will back Labour no confidence motion in May government
Description: Scottish National Party members of parliament will back any Labour Party motion of "no confidence" in Prime Minister Theresa May's government in the national parliament, party leader Nicola Sturgeon said on Monday.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP demands May end 'shambles' over Brexit

Headline: Brexit vote delay is 'pathetic cowardice' - Scotland's Sturgeon
Description: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon accused the British government on Monday of "pathetic cowardice" by postponing a key vote on Brexit in the UK parliament.

Headline: Brexit secretary Barclay to make statement on Article 50 Brexit notice
Description: Brexit secretary Stephen Barclay will make a statement to parliament on "EU Exit- Article 50" in parliament on Monday, the government's leader in parliament, Andrea Leadsom, said via an official Twitter feed.

Headline: Irish PM says UK cannot renegotiate parts of Brexit deal

Headline: May to make statement in British parliament at 1530 GMT

Headline: Britain no longer has 'a functioning government' - Labour Party
