Description: The leader of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party (DUP), on whose support British Prime Minister Theresa May relies on to govern, said she could no accept different regulation in the province to the rest of the UK after Brexit.

Headline: Conservatives gripped by 'Mogg-mania' as diehard eurosceptic draws the crowds
Description: Sighing at the sight of a queue of hundreds of people that snaked its way around the conference centre and out of the door, one Conservative Party member complained: "They should have put him on the main stage".

Headline: UK will legislate to ensure tech giants take online responsibilities seriously - Javid
Description: Britain will legislate to ensure that technology firms take their responsibilities for online security seriously, interior minister Sajid Javid said on Tuesday.

Headline: Alternative Brexit conference shows threat to May from party rebels
Description: A day after Prime Minister Theresa May urged her party to use their annual conference to unite behind her Brexit plans, rebel members of parliament were running out of patience with her decision to proceed with proposals many feel do not make a clean enough break from the EU.

Headline: Backing out of the USSR? Theresa May says the EU is not the Soviet Union
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday the European Union was not the same as the Soviet Union after her foreign secretary provoked anger by likening the 28-member bloc to the USSR.

Headline: UK will bring in salary threshold for skilled workers' visas - minister
Description: Britain will bring in a salary threshold for highly skilled workers' visas as part of its post-Brexit immigration system, interior minister Sajid Javid said on Tuesday.

Headline: Hunt says EU is not like the Soviet Union
Description: British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said that the European Union was not like the Soviet union, in an interview with CNBC on Tuesday.

Headline: Eurosceptics plan for Ireland will avoid hard border - former Brexit minister
Description: A plan by eurosceptic rebels in Britain's ruling party to rely on technology to check goods on the north-south land border on the island of Ireland would resolve a stalemate currently holding up a Brexit deal, a former junior Brexit minister said.

Headline: DUP leader says Northern Ireland must leave EU on same terms as rest of Britain
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May's government said she would look at any new offer to the European Union on the Irish border, but Northern Ireland must leave on the same terms as rest of Britain.

Headline: UK's May says has shown nothing but respect to EU - LBC
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday that she had shown "nothing but respect" during Brexit talks with the European Union, and that Britain deserved the same.

Headline: Britain is preparing new proposal on Irish border - UK PM May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday she is preparing to make a new offer to the European Union aimed at breaking the deadlock in the Brexit negotiations.

Headline: Britain's PM May says she's in the job "for the long term"
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she planned to remain in the job "for the long term" as she called on her party to come together and back her plan for Brexit.

Headline: Britain's PM May says she's in the job "for the long term"
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she planned to remain in the job "for the long term" as she called on her party to come together and back her plan for Brexit.

Headline: May's Brexit is 'wilful economic vandalism' - Sturgeon
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's plans to leave the European Union are damaging and inviable, Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon will say on Tuesday.

Headline: UK could go it alone on digital services tax - Hammond
Description: Britain will unilaterally implement a digital service tax if there is no international agreement soon on how to tax big internet companies, Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond said on Monday, blaming U.S. tax reforms for slow multilateral progress.

Headline: Conservatives should back May, says lawmaker Rees-Mogg
Description: Changing Conservative leader could cause more problems than it solves and the party should back Prime Minister Theresa May, senior Eurosceptic lawmaker Jacob Rees-Mogg said on Monday.

Headline: Three of May's ministers privately 'see argument for' second Brexit vote - MP
Description: Three British government ministers privately support the idea of holding a second referendum on the final Brexit deal, a former junior minister said on Monday.

Headline: British seem to think the EU is quitting the UK - Juncker
Description: The discussion in Britain over its departure from the European Union is still far removed from reality, the European Commission's President Jean-Claude Juncker said at a public forum in the German city of Freiburg.

Headline: Brexit proposals are not undeliverable, it is about political will - Raab
Description: Britain's Brexit proposals are not undeliverable but rather it is political will holding up negotiations, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Monday.

Headline: Conservatives would block another Scottish independence vote - Davidson
Description: Britain's Conservative party will commit in its next manifesto to blocking another referendum on Scottish independence from the United Kingdom, Scottish Conservative leader Ruth Davidson has said.

Headline: International agreement on digital taxes unlikely soon - Hammond
Description: Chancellor of the exchequer Philip Hammond said on Monday that an international agreement to tax digital service providers was unlikely to come any time soon, blaming U.S. tax reforms brought in by U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headline: Britain must not pull the rug out under trade with EU - Hammond
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Monday  rebalancing trade with the EU was a delicate process which should be done gradually, and that product standards should stay the same after Brexit.

Headline: Britain looking at regulatory checks for Brexit Irish border fix
Description: Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Monday Britain was looking at how regulatory checks on some goods could be used as part of a solution to move Brexit talks, notably a "backstop deal" for the Irish border, forward.

Headline: Blockchain may resolve Irish border Brexit problem - Hammond
Description: A solution to providing frictionless trade across the Irish border after Britain leaves the European Union might be found using technology such as Blockchain, finance minister Phillip Hammond said on Monday

Headline: Raab confident Britain has time to get good Brexit deal
Description: British Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Monday that he was confident there is time for Britain to get a good deal in negotiations to leave the European Union

Headline: No-deal Brexit would cost European firms up to $18 billion - Fox
Description: European companies face potential tariffs of as much as 14 billion pounds ($18.28 billion) a year if the Britain and the European Union fail to reach a trade agreement, Britain's trade minister Liam Fox said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit Secretary Raab says - We will not accept two UK customs regimes
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government will not accept two different customs regimes in the United Kingdom after Brexit so the European Union needs to show less dry legalism in talks on Northern Ireland, Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said.

Headline: Santander says Brexit uncertainty may have 'significant' impact on results
Description: Britain's exit from the European Union will likely trigger a period of high uncertainty that may significantly impact Banco Santander's business, the Spanish lender said in a filing to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

Headline: PM May will struggle to get deal through parliament - former minister
Description: Justine Greening, a former minister in Theresa May's government, said on Monday Britain's parliament was unlikely to pass a Brexit deal based on the prime minister's plans or one based on a Canada-style free trade deal.

Headline: We must prove EU wrong about the UK's Brexit plans - Hammond
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Monday the government would prove the European Union was wrong to dismiss Britain's plans for Brexit as unworkable.

Headline: UK will see truly driverless cars on roads in three to four years - minister
Description: Britain will see truly driverless cars on its roads in three to four years but there will still be a role for diesel cars for many years, Transport Secretary Chris Grayling said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit minister Raab tells EU - Do not try to bully us
Description: Britain's Brexit minister warned the European Union on Monday against trying to bully the United Kingdom into signing a divorce deal that would undermine the unity of the country.

Headline: UK parliament would back Norway-style Brexit with customs union - senior lawmaker
Description: The British parliament would back a Norway-style Brexit deal with a customs union, pro-EU Conservative lawmaker Nicky Morgan, a former government minister who heads parliament's Treasury Select Committee, said on Monday.

Headline: Hammond says UK can cope with no-deal Brexit
Description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond said on Monday the United Kingdom had the fiscal capacity to cope with leaving the European Union without any agreement but believed the mood in Brussels was to reach a divorce deal.

Headline: Hammond says EU is in the mood for a Brexit deal
Description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond said the European Union was in the mood to do divorce deal, though he said uncertainty over Brexit had already hit the United Kingdom's economy.

Headline: UK could change business rates to help high street - business minister
Description: Business minister Greg Clark said on Sunday he could seek an adjustment to the tax system to help Britain's struggling high street retailers, which he said played an important role in communities.

Headline: As Brexit divisions widen, PM May challenges Brexit critics
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May called on her party on Sunday to unite behind her plan to leave the European Union, making a direct appeal to critics by saying their desire for a free trade deal was at the heart of her Brexit proposals.

Headline: Britain will leave EU "not just in name", Brexit minister says
Description: Britain will leave the European Union "in fact, not just in name", Brexit minister Dominic Raab will say on Monday, warning that London's "willingness to compromise is not without limits" and leaving without a deal is very much an option.

Headline: Prince William visits British troops in Kenya, trains with them
Description: Prince William visited British troops in Kenya on Sunday, participating in a training exercise north of the capital Nairobi.

Headline: Russia will pay high price if it doesn't play by international rules - Hunt
Description: British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt warned Russia on Sunday it would pay a high price for its actions if it sought to intimidate Britain and flout international rules.

Headline: Parliament and EU will reject May's Brexit plan - UK lawmaker Rees-Mogg
Description: Leading Eurosceptic lawmaker Jacob Rees-Mogg on Sunday predicted that neither the British parliament or the European Union would accept Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan, and that leaving the bloc without an exit deal should hold no fear.

Headline: Boris Johnson says Britain should use aid to pursue national priorities
Description: Boris Johnson, Britain's former foreign secretary, on Sunday called on the government to use its international aid budget to focus on national priorities amid speculation about whether he will challenge Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: UK's Hunt to Brussels - Punishing Britain will damage EU
Description: Foreign minister Jeremy Hunt told the European Union on Sunday that punishing Britain in Brexit talks would fuel the desire of other states to break away, in a speech aimed at uniting Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party against Brussels.

Headline: Eurosceptic UK lawmaker Patel says cannot accept PM's Brexit plan
Description: Eurosceptic lawmaker Priti Patel said on Sunday Britain should not accept Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan and, if necessary, be ready to leave the European Union without a deal.

Headline: Gove backs PM's plan, snubs Johnson's proposals
Description: Britain's environment minister, Michael Gove, one of the ruling Conservative Party's highest-profile Brexit campaigners, threw his weight on Sunday behind Prime Minister Theresa May's strategy to leave the European Union, dismissing a rival proposal by his former ally Boris Johnson.

Headline: EU disrespect to May 'beyond the pale', says UK trade minister
Description: The European Union's "taunting" of Prime Minister Theresa May at a summit in Salzburg this month was "beyond the pale", British trade minister Liam Fox said on Sunday.

Headline: Extending Article 50 would not make Brexit issues easier to solve - Clark
Description: Business minister Greg Clark said on Sunday he did not think Britain should extend Article 50 to delay the country's exit from the European Union as it would not make the outstanding Brexit issues easier to solve.

Headline: Britain announces ban on high-rise combustible cladding
Description: Britain announced on Sunday that it is banning the use of combustible materials on the outside of high-rise buildings in response to the Grenfell Tower fire that killed 71 people.

Headline: Canada-style Brexit deal would make things more difficult for business - Clark
Description: A Canada-style Brexit deal with the European Union would make things harder for businesses by creating friction at the border, business minister Greg Clark said on Sunday.

Headline: UK business minister Clark says 'overwhelmingly likely' Brexit deal is reached
Description: It is overwhelmingly likely that Britain reaches a Brexit deal with the European Union, business minister Greg Clark said on Sunday.

Headline: Brexit has cost Britain 500 million pounds a week, study says
Description: Britain's decision to leave the European Union has cost the government 500 million pounds a week, wiping out for the moment any future savings from stopping payments to the bloc, according to a study published on Sunday.

Headline: PM May says her Brexit plan addresses manufacturers' concerns
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Sunday that her plan for leaving the European Union addresses the concerns that manufacturers have raised about the future of the operations after Brexit.

Headline: PM May calls on her party to unite over Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Sunday called for her Conservative Party to unite behind her to ensure the government gets a good exit deal from the European Union, insisting that her so-called Chequers plan was the right way forward.

Headline: Former Brexit minister Davis says exit deal 80-90 percent likely
Description: Britain's former Brexit minister David Davis said he thought it was 80-90 percent likely that the government will strike an exit deal with the European Union, but warned that he expected talks to go down to the wire.

Headline: Scottish Conservative leader plays down Salzburg Brexit row
Description: The leader of the Scottish arm of Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party played down the impact of a row with the European Union over Brexit, saying it may have actually helped restart stalled exit negotiations.

Headline: Latest glitch for May - botched party app lets public log in as cabinet ministers
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party apologised on Saturday after releasing a phone app for the annual party conference that let members of the public log in as senior government ministers and view their personal details.

Headline: Conservative Party investigating data breach - chairman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party is investigating a data breach which let members of the public log into a smartphone app as senior government ministers and view their personal details.

Headline: PM May tells divided party - Don't play politics with my Brexit plan
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party began gathering for its annual conference on Saturday with bitter divisions over her Brexit plans rising to the fore, raising doubts about her own future.

Headline: Conservative Chairman Lewis says working for election in 2022
Description: Britain's governing Conservatives are working towards a national election in 2022, the party's chairman Brandon Lewis said on Sunday, saying he hoped Prime Minister Theresa May would lead the party into that vote.

Headline: PM May to unveil new levy on foreign home buyers
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will unveil plans on Sunday to levy an extra fee on foreign buyers of homes in Britain, saying she wanted to stop it being as easy for those who do not live in the country to buy homes "as hard working British residents".

Headline: British PM May accuses critics of "playing politics" over Brexit - Sunday Times
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May accused critics of her plans to leave the European Union of "playing politics" with Britain's future and undermining the national interest in an interview with the Sunday Times newspaper.

Headline: Exclusive: With six months to go before Brexit, 630 finance jobs have left - Reuters survey
Description: As few as 630 UK-based finance jobs have been shifted or created overseas with just six months to go before Brexit, a far lower total than banks said could move after Britain's surprise vote to leave the European Union, according to a new Reuters survey.

Headline: Boris Johnson demands May scrap her Brexit proposals
Description: Brexit hardliner Boris Johnson called on Prime Minister Theresa May to rip up her plan for Britain's departure from the European Union, ratcheting up pressure on May as she prepares to face her divided party at its annual conference next week.

Headline: Boris Johnson swerves question on whether he will challenge May
Description: Brexit hard-liner Boris Johnson, a fierce critic of Prime Minister Theresa May's "Chequers" plan for leaving the EU, declined to answer directly on Friday when asked if he would rule out a leadership challenge of the Conservative party.

Headline: Brexit challenger Gina Miller: UK's battle over EU membership must end
Description: Gina Miller, who took the British government to court over triggering Brexit, said if Britain leaves the European Union next year all sides must accept the result and the campaign to remain in the bloc should be abandoned.

Headline: Boris and Brexit gym punchbags help Londoners vent their rage
Description: Londoners fed up with Brexit can vent their rage with a special gym routine that includes high-intensity exercises like pummelling punchbags bearing photographs of some of the main players like Boris Johnson and Jean-Claude Juncker.

Headline: EU 'intransigence' is reason why no deal Brexit is real prospect - Northern Ireland's DUP
Description: The European Union's "intransigence" in Brexit negotiations is the reason for the real prospect of Britain leaving the EU without a deal, the deputy leader of the Northern Irish party backing Britain's minority government said on Friday.

Headline: Russia says photos don't prove its spy was linked to Skripal case
Description: The Kremlin said on Friday a likeness between a Russian intelligence colonel and a suspect in the Skripal poisoning case does not prove they are the same person, comparing the resemblance to that of impersonators posing as Lenin.

Headline: Britain has identified third Russian agent in attack on former spy - Telegraph
Description: British police have identified a third Russian military intelligence officer they believe carried out a reconnaissance mission before the attempted murder of double agent Sergei Skripal, the Telegraph newspaper reported.

Headline: Britain to probe £4.1 billion 'rip-off' of telecoms, financial customers
Description: Telecoms and financial services companies face an investigation by Britain's competition regulator after consumer body Citizens Advice complained that customers who do not switch providers were being "ripped off" .

Headline: UK consumers worry about onset of Brexit - GfK
Description: British consumers lost some of their confidence in early September -- before Prime Minister Theresa May's latest setback on Brexit -- but companies were more upbeat, two surveys showed on Friday.

Headline: Britons would narrowly back remaining in the EU - poll of polls
Description: Britons would vote 52 to 48 percent in favour of remaining in the European Union were there to be another Brexit referendum, showing only a small change in public opinion since the 2016 vote, according to a poll of polls.

Headline: An Englishwoman in New York -  May poses with police to help stranded aides
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May struck an unusual deal with New York police to help stricken British officials make their flight home on Wednesday: a high-speed escort through airport traffic in exchange for a picture with the British leader.

Headline: Britain tells Iran it will not let matter of detained aid worker rest
Description: British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt said on Thursday he had had a frank discussion with his Iranian counterpart about detained British-Iranian aid worker Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe and that he would not let the matter rest.

Headline: Kremlin on Skripal suspect identification - 'Many people look alike'
Description: The Kremlin on Thursday cast doubt on photographs that appeared to show a suspect in the Skripal poisoning case was a Russian intelligence officer, saying that "many people look alike."

Headline: Labour's Corbyn tells EU's Barnier hard Irish border must be avoided
Description: The leader of Britain's main opposition Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, said he had told the EU's Brexit chief Michel Barnier in talks on Thursday that Britain's withdrawal must not disrupt trade across the Ireland-Northern Ireland border.

Headline: Murdered British MP remembered in Brussels street sign
Description: The city of Brussels named a square on Thursday after Jo Cox, the British lawmaker murdered during the Brexit referendum campaign, in a ceremony where her family lamented the continued ferocity of political debate.

Headline: Hunt says May's Chequers plan still basis for Brexit deal
Description: British foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said he believes that Prime Minister Theresa May's Chequers Brexit plan should remain the basis for Britain's exit from the European Union, and that negotiations should take place around it.

Headline: EU's Barnier says, after Corbyn meeting, wants orderly Brexit
Description: The European Union's Brexit chief Michel Barnier said on Thursday he had listened to the views of Britain's opposition Labour party, Jeremy Corbyn, and wanted to ensure Britain's orderly withdrawal from the bloc.

Headline: Corbyn says told Barnier must avoid Irish hard border
Description: Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn said after meeting EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier in Brussels on Thursday that a deal on Britain's withdrawal must ensure that trade across the Ireland-Northern Ireland border is not disrupted.

Headline: Salisbury poisoning suspect named as a Russian colonel by UK media
Description: The real identity of one of the men wanted by Britain for the Salisbury nerve agent attack on former Russian spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter is Anatoliy Vladimirovich Chepiga, according to media reports on Wednesday which said he was a decorated Russian colonel.

Headline: Hunt says Russia may wonder if Skripal poisoning was smart
Description: British foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said on Thursday that the world would not be a comfortable place for Russia if it used chemical weapons, adding that the Kremlin may be regretting ordering an attack on a former Russian spy in Salisbury.

Headline: EU accepts no-deal Brexit would still include some deals - diplomats
Description: The European Union will wait until November before kicking off full-blown preparations for a possible collapse of Brexit talks, diplomats said, reluctantly accepting that such a scenario would still require some managing.

Headline: UK judge adjourns contempt case against far-right activist Tommy Robinson
Description: A judge adjourned a rehearing on Thursday in a contempt-of-court action against British far-right activist Tommy Robinson, whose case has attracted the sympathy of right-wing supporters of U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headline: EU's Barnier says working for Brexit deal, close economic ties later
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Thursday he was working for a Brexit deal and a close economic relationship afterwards.

Headline: Labour will vote against PM May's Chequers Brexit plan, says Corbyn
Description: British opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Wednesday Labour would vote against a Brexit deal based on Theresa May's proposals, the strongest warning yet to a prime minister whose plan to leave the European Union is hanging by a thread.

Headline: May losing support for no-deal Brexit if EU rejects Chequers plan - report
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is losing cabinet support for her plan to revert to a 'no-deal' Brexit if Europe rejects the  Chequers proposals, The Times newspaper reported, citing sources.

Headline: 'No-deal' Brexit could cost food retail industry 9.3 billion pounds  - Barclays study
Description: Food retailers and suppliers could lose 9.3 billion pounds as a result of new tariffs if Britain leaves the European Union without a deal, a study commissioned by Barclays said on Thursday.

Headline: Trump, May discuss desire for 'ambitious' post-Brexit trade deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and U.S. President Donald Trump discussed their will to strike a "big and ambitious" trade deal after Britain's withdrawal from the European Union, May's office said on Wednesday.

Headline: 'True identity' of Salisbury suspect revealed, UK defence minister says
Description: British defence minister Gavin Williamson said the "true identity" of one of the suspects in a nerve agent attack on a former Russian spy in Salisbury had been revealed, apparently confirming media reports that the suspect was a Russian colonel.

Headline: British turmoil spooks Brussels on Brexit deal chances
Description: As British Prime Minister Theresa May prepares to face critics of her Brexit plan at her party conference at the weekend and her Labour opponents vow to vote against it in parliament, EU officials are increasingly uneasy about prospects for a deal.

Headline: UK faces permanent debate over financial rules after Brexit - MP
Description: Britain faces a permanent debate over whether to copy or diverge from European Union financial rules after Brexit, a top UK lawmaker said on Wednesday in comments likely to prolong uncertainty for banks.

Headline: Labour Party's Corbyn to say will vote against PM May's Brexit deal as it stands
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will vote against a Brexit deal based on Prime Minister Theresa May's so-called Chequers proposals as it stands and opposes leaving the bloc without a deal, leader Jeremy Corbyn will say on Wednesday.

Headline: EU negotiator seeks orderly Brexit, new partnership respecting UK sovereignty
Description: The European Union's negotiator Michel Barnier said on Wednesday that he was working for a Brexit deal and a future cooperation model with Britain that would respect the UK's sovereignty.

Headline: On charm offensive, Labour tells business - 'Work with us'
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party is wooing business bosses even as it unveils a raft of radical economic policies, determined to thaw a sometimes frosty response to its plans to give more power to the workers.

Headline: Timeline - Brexit at breaking point? Diary dates for Britain's EU departure
Description: With just six months to go until the United Kingdom is due to leave the European Union, negotiations are at what Prime Minister Theresa May has called an impasse.

Headline: Snap election not in UK's interest during Brexit talks - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday it would not be in Britain's national interest to hold another general election just as she is negotiating the terms of Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Factbox - Reuters surveys UK financial services jobs post-Brexit
Description: As few as 630 UK-based finance jobs have been shifted or created overseas so far ahead of Brexit, while the number of jobs that UK-based financial institutions said they expected to move in the event of a "hard" Brexit is 5,766, a Reuters survey shows.

Headline: Labour open to second EU vote with option of remaining - Starmer
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will keep open the option of a second Brexit referendum with a question wide enough to include the option of remaining in the European Union, the party's Brexit spokesman Keir Starmer said on Tuesday.

Headline: Labour set to vote against Brexit deal, open to second referendum
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party is set to vote against any deal Prime Minister Theresa May clinches with the European Union and is open to a second referendum with the option of staying in the bloc, Brexit spokesman Keir Starmer said on Tuesday.

Headline: May - No-deal Brexit better than current EU offer
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May signalled on Tuesday that she would prefer a 'no-deal' Brexit to the offer currently put forward by the European Union, stressing that Britain needs to see counter-proposals from the EU to move Brexit negotiations forward.

Headline: Post-Brexit Britain will be staunchly 'pro-business' says May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will pledge on Wednesday that her government will be "unequivocally pro-business" as it seeks to forge a future role outside the European Union.

Headline: Labour approves Brexit motion
Description: Britain's Labour overwhelmingly approved its Brexit motion with a show of hands on Tuesday, paving for the way for the party to reject any deal with the EU that fails to meets its tests and to keep open the option of a second referendum.

Headline: Brexit deal ratification not a given - Irish PM
Description: Brexit negotiators should not assume that any agreement they strike on the terms of Britain's withdrawal from the European Union will be ratified by parliaments on both sides, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK to take over Liverpool hospital build after Carillion collapse - Sky News
Description: The British government will step in to bail out a 335 million pound ($439 million) new hospital in the city of Liverpool, after the collapse of Carillion, which was overseeing the deal, Sky News reported on Monday.

Headline: Labour increasingly likely to vote against Brexit deal - Starmer
Description: It is increasingly likely Britain's opposition Labour will vote against any Brexit deal reached by Prime Minister Theresa May, the party's Brexit spokesman Keir Starmer said on Tuesday.

Headline: "No deal" not an option - Labour to vote on Brexit stance
Description: Britain's Labour will vote on a motion on Tuesday that says the party should oppose a "no deal" Brexit and keep the idea of a second referendum on the table if talks with the European Union fail or any deal is voted down in parliament.

Headline: UK to favour skilled migration, no EU preference after Brexit - reports
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May and her ministers have agreed to focus Britain's post-Brexit migration system on high-skilled migrants and will not offer preference to European Union workers, newspapers said.

Headline: 'No-deal' Brexit would hit trucks, airlines and pet owners - government papers
Description: Leaving the European Union without a proper divorce deal could ground airlines, stop hauliers from lugging goods to the world's biggest trading bloc and even make headaches for pet owners who want to take their dogs on holiday, according to government documents.

Headline: May to meet Trump in New York to discuss Brexit and trade
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will discuss Brexit and a bilateral trade deal with U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly in New York, amid increasing uncertainty over Britain's EU exit plans.

Headline: May to meet Iran's Rouhani, lobby for detained aid worker's release
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will lobby for the release of detained British-Iranian aid worker Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe during a meeting with Iranian President Hassan Rouhani when both attend the United Nations General Assembly in New York on Tuesday.

Headline: May's ministers still fully behind her Brexit plans - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's senior ministerial team remains fully behind her Brexit proposals, her spokesman said on Monday, after her plans were savaged by European Union leaders at a summit last week.

Headline: No UK cabinet minister challenged May over Brexit - Sun
Description: No members of British Prime Minister Theresa May's cabinet challenged her over her so-called Chequers plan for Brexit at a meeting earlier on Monday, a journalist from the Sun newspaper reported.

Headline: May tells ministers to hold their nerve over Brexit - Downing St
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told her ministers on Monday that they must hold their nerve in an impasse with the European Union over Brexit, her office said after a cabinet meeting.

Headline: We hope to keep Britain close after Brexit - Merkel
Description: Germany wants a Brexit deal to keep Britain as close to the European Union as possible, Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Monday.

Headline: UK to hold nerve after Brexit talks hit impasse - Brexit minister
Description: Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Monday that Britain would not flinch in an impasse with the European Union after European leaders rejected Prime Minister Theresa May's plans for leaving the bloc last week.

Headline: May defends 'credible' Brexit proposal - CBS News interview
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday defended Britain's Brexit plan, saying her government had "put forward a credible proposal" to exit the European Union.

Headline: Factbox - UK details what a no-deal Brexit would mean for planes, trucks and pets
Description: Britain's government published its third batch of advice to companies and individuals on how to prepare for any disruption that might follow a disorderly Brexit where there is no deal with the European Union.

Headline: Beware of 'no-deal' Brexit, UK warns owners of cats, dogs and ferrets
Description: Britain warned owners of cats, dogs and ferrets that if it failed to secure a divorce deal with the European Union then their animals might have to get rabies jabs and discuss travel with vets months before travelling on holiday to the EU.

Headline: UK will seek bilateral agreements to keep haulage moving if no Brexit deal
Description: Britain said on Monday it would seek to strike bilateral agreements with European countries to ensure hauliers would retain access as the government set out its plans should London and Brussels fail to agree a Brexit deal.

Headline: British, EU airlines could see flights grounded in no-deal Brexit
Description: British and European Union airlines will automatically lose the right to fly to each other's territories if Britain leaves the bloc without a divorce deal, the government warned on Monday, meaning that flights could potentially be grounded.

Headline: Despite Brexit planning, EMA fears disruption for 39 medicines
Description: Despite actions taken by companies to prepare for Brexit, there is still a risk of serious supply disruptions for 39 medicines as a result of Britain's departure from the European Union, the bloc's drugs regulator said on Monday.

Headline: Labour keeps second Brexit referendum on table
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will vote this week to keep a second Brexit referendum as an option if Theresa May fails to pass her plan to quit the European Union through parliament, heaping pressure on a struggling prime minister.

Headline: Labour's finance spokesman sees parliament rejecting any May Brexit deal
Description: John McDonnell, finance spokesman for Britain's opposition Labour Party, said on Monday he could not see Prime Minister Theresa May bringing back a Brexit deal from Brussels that parliament could pass.

Headline: Next four weeks 'fundamental' for Brexit deal - EU lawmaker
Description: "Sufficient progress" in Brexit talks by the European Union's summit due on Oct.18 is the condition for having an extra summit in November to finalise any deal between the bloc and Britain, a leading European Parliament lawmaker said on Monday.

Headline: Labour plans to make companies give shares to workers
Description: Large companies would be forced to transfer as much as 10 percent of their shares to their workers under plans set out by Britain's opposition Labour Party on Monday.

Headline: Ditch EU for change, Corbyn supporters stick to Brexit script
Description: On a cold autumn night, trade union activist Paula Barker made a passionate plea to fellow members of Britain's Labour Party to be positive about leaving the European Union and make way for leader Jeremy Corbyn's radical new agenda.

Headline: Labour says it will vote down a Brexit deal that fails to meet its tests
Description: The Brexit spokesman for Britain's opposition Labour Party said on Monday his party would vote against any deal Prime Minister Theresa May strikes with the European Union if the agreement failed to meet its tests.

Headline: Labour's finance spokesman McDonnell tells tax avoiders - the game is over
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will demand companies demonstrate they pay their fair share of tax, its finance spokesman John McDonnell said on Monday.

Headline: Macron does not want Brexit talks to drag - French presidency official
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron is reluctant to let negotiations over Britain's divorce from the European Union drag and is raising pressure on London to break an impasse, an Elysee Palace official said on Monday.

Headline: May will change her mind on Brexit, says Rees-Mogg
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will eventually decide to abandon her strategy for maintaining close trade ties with the European Union because it lacks support, a leading eurosceptic lawmaker in her Conservative Party said on Monday.

Headline: No special rules for Britain in Brexit talks - German minister
Description: Germany and it European Union partners cannot afford to make special rules for Britain on their single market, Germany's European Affairs Minister Michael Roth said in a letter, warning that Berlin had taken measures to prepare for a no-deal scenario.

Headline: Scottish Labour leader says party will oppose fresh independence vote
Description: Britain's main opposition Labour Party will oppose a fresh vote on Scottish independence from the United Kingdom, Scottish Labour's leader Richard Leonard said on Monday, potentially benefiting its political rivals.

Headline: Labour to keep second Brexit vote on table, but only on final deal - McDonnell
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party would keep the option for a second vote on any Brexit deal struck with the European Union on the table but it would prefer a national election to sort out the issue, its finance spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Raab says confident of Brexit deal, needs two to tango
Description: British Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab said on Monday that he was confident that the United Kingdom will make progress and eventually clinch a Brexit deal with the European Union.

Headline: Majority of May's cabinet supports Canada-style Brexit deal - Telegraph
Description: A majority of British Prime Minister Theresa May's senior ministerial team now supports moving towards a Canada-style trade deal with the European Union after Brexit, the Daily Telegraph reported on Monday.

Headline: Labour Party to vote on motion including second Brexit referendum - BBC political editor
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party will vote on a motion this week to keep all options on the table including a second Brexit referendum if the party cannot get a national election, BBC political editor Laura Kuenssberg said on Twitter.

Headline: UK opposition leader will back second Brexit vote if party wants it
Description: British opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Sunday he would back a second Brexit referendum if his Labour Party votes to pursue the move, heaping pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May, whose plans for a divorce deal with the EU have hit an impasse.

Headline: Labour wants election if PM May can't get backing for Brexit deal
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party wants a national election if Prime Minister Theresa May cannot win the support of parliament for her Brexit deal, its business spokeswoman said on Sunday.

Headline: Corbyn says prefers election to second Brexit referendum
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Sunday he would prefer a national election to a second referendum on Brexit.

Headline: Pro-Brexit movement splinters in fight against PM's EU divorce plan
Description: The grassroots campaign to steer Britain into a more radical departure from the EU is at a crossroads: time is short, and the self-styled "People's Army" of activists that was a driving force in bringing about Brexit is splintering.

Headline: UK standing firm on Brexit proposals, no election planned - Brexit minister Raab
Description: Britain is standing resolute on its proposals for a divorce deal with the European Union, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Sunday, ruling out an early election.

Headline: UK opposition Labour plans to give workers a third of seats on company boards
Description: Britain's main opposition Labour Party would require large companies to reserve at least one third of the seats on their boards for workers, party leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Sunday.

Headline: UK government on verge of collapse - opposition Labour deputy leader
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government is on the verge of collapse and there could be another national election soon, the opposition Labour Party's deputy leader Tom Watson said on Sunday.

Headline: May's team draw up contingency plans for November election
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's aides have begun contingency planning for a snap election in November to save both Brexit and her job, the Sunday Times reported.

Headline: May vows to hold nerve after Brexit talks hit impasse
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said Britain would not flinch in an impasse with the European Union about its departure from the bloc, as French and German ministers suggested the next move in the negotiations should come from London.

Headline: PM May, EU leaders need to look at room for movement on Brexit - UK lawmaker
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit proposals seem to have no life left in them and the government and European leaders need to look at what room for movement there is in negotiations, a senior pro-EU lawmaker from her Conservatives said on Sunday.

Headline: Labour will challenge PM May on her Brexit deal, Corbyn says
Description: British opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Saturday his party would challenge Prime Minister Theresa May on any Brexit deal she can strike with Brussels, and called for a national election if the deal fell short.

Headline: AstraZeneca ceo warns of medicine shortages after Brexit - Sunday Times
Description: Britain could see widespread medicine shortages if there is no deal to prevent friction at the border with the European Union after Brexit, the AstraZeneca chief executive told the Sunday Times.

Headline: May says Britain will hold nerve in Brexit talks - Sunday Express
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has vowed that Britain will "hold its nerve" in Brexit talks with the European Union, the Sunday Express reported.

Headline: In government, Labour would nationalise quickly - finance spokesman
Description: Britain's opposition Labour party would move to nationalise key industries as a priority if it took office, its finance spokesman said ahead of its annual conference.

Headline: No-deal Brexit would have limited impact on German labour market - Der Spiegel
Description: Chancellor Angela Merkel's government expects the impact of a no-deal Brexit on the labour market in Europe's biggest economy would be "relatively small", the German newsmagazine Der Spiegel said on Saturday.

Headline: May challenges EU as Brexit talks hit 'impasse', sterling tumbles
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday that Brexit talks with the European Union had hit an impasse, defiantly challenging the bloc to come up with its own plans a day after EU leaders savaged her proposals.

Headline: France sees Brexit deal as possible, but must prepare for 'no deal'
Description: France still believes that a good deal on Brexit is possible but the country must prepare for the possibility of Britain and the European Union failing to reach an agreement on its divorce from the bloc, a minister said on Saturday.

Headline: UK foreign minister Hunt urges EU - get serious in Brexit talks
Description: British foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said on Saturday that the European Union should end its blanket refusals of British proposals in Brexit talks, as any belief that Britain would capitulate was misplaced.

Headline: May facing ministerial resignations over Brexit plan - Telegraph
Description: Some of British Prime Minister Theresa May's ministers will demand a "Plan B" on her Brexit proposal next week and could quit if she does not change course, the Telegraph newspaper reported late on Friday, citing unnamed sources.

Headline: Doctors win battle with drug giants over cheaper eye medicine
Description: Drug giants Novartis , Bayer  and Roche  on Friday lost a bid to stop British doctors from recommending a cheaper drug option for people with an eye disease that causes blindness, the High Court in London ruled.

Headline: EU's Tusk says a compromise with Britain is still possible
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said he was convinced that the European Union and Britain could still find a compromise over the country's exit from the 28-country bloc.

Headline: May has only self to blame for Salzburg sandbagging, Europeans say
Description: If Theresa May felt ambushed, as British media saw it, at the Salzburg EU summit, she has only herself to blame for irritating continental leaders with her stand on Brexit, EU officials and diplomats said on Friday.

Headline: Political price of no-deal Brexit would be high - Sturgeon
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives would pay a high political price for a no-deal Brexit in Scotland, which voted to keep its EU membership, First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said.

Headline: Brexit protection? Farage-themed condoms a hit among UK eurosceptics
Description: Nigel Farage, the former leader of Britain's UK Independence Party, has long had a knack for generating publicity for his eurosceptic cause, but campaigners say he had nothing to do with the latest stunt: branded condoms bearing his image.

Headline: DUP says it would veto any new UK-Northern Ireland barrier
Description: The head of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party on Friday vowed to veto any attempt to introduce a new regulatory barrier between the region and the rest of the United Kingdom, and said the European Union's Brexit position was disgraceful.

Headline: Brexit campaigner says PM May should now ditch her Brexit plans
Description: Brexit campaigner Richard Tice welcomed Prime Minister Theresa May's change of tone on Brexit but warned that unless she abandoned her Brexit plan then Conservative Party lawmakers would try to topple her.

Headline: MPs criticise RBS and Barclays for online banking outages
Description: Royal Bank of Scotland  apologised for outages that hit its online and mobile banking services on Friday, the latest in a string of such failings at British banks which have drawn criticism from customers and members of parliament.

Headline: May's stance on Northern Ireland border issue welcomed by DUP
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's stance in Brexit talks with the European Union on the issue of Northern Ireland's border was welcomed by the deputy leader of the party in the province backing her minority government.

Headline: End the political games over Brexit, Corbyn says
Description: The leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party Jeremy Corbyn said the time for political games involving Brexit must end after Prime Minister Theresa May called on the European Union to break an impasse.

Headline: Macron's office says 'no comment' when asked about May's Brexit speech
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron's office said it had no comment to make about British Prime Minister Theresa May's speech on Friday about the state of Brexit negotiations, following a fraught summit in Austria.

Headline: May tells EU - Come up with new proposals to break Brexit impasse
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told the European Union on Friday that it should come up with an alternative to her Brexit proposals and warned she would never accept a break-up of the United Kingdom.

Headline: PM May's statement on Brexit talks after EU rejects her proposals
Description: Following is British Prime Minister Theresa May's statement on Brexit talks.

Headline: Brexit talks entering 'rocky' couple of weeks - Irish PM
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said that he remained confident that negotiators can strike a deal on Britain's exit from the European Union but that talks were entering a rocky couple of weeks.

Headline: UKIP will not join Steve Bannon's anti-EU movement, says leader

Headline: Brexit proposals will not be 'salami sliced' by EU - Raab

Headline: May to make statement on Brexit talks after EU rejects her plans

Headline: UKIP launches populist manifesto, demands clean Brexit
Description: Britain's anti-European Union UK Independence Party (UKIP)  launched a set of populist policies on Friday hoping to revive their dwindling political influence and capitalise on outrage over the government's handling of Brexit.

Headline: Duchess Meghan joined by her mother for launch of London Grenfell cookbook

Headline: UK says disappointed by Scottish court decision on Article 50 reversal case

Headline: No major statement is planned by UK PM May on Friday - BBC political editor
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will not be delivering a major statement on Friday, the BBC's political editor said amid speculation from lawmakers in her Conservative Party that there would be an announcement.

Headline: 'Pretence' of May's Brexit plan has to stop - Scotland's Sturgeon

Headline: UK minister says May did not miscalculate at Salzburg EU summit

Headline: EU pushes October Brexit agreement, threatens no deal

Headline: UK warns there will be no Brexit deal unless EU softens on Irish border

Headline: "Big four" accounting firms could be broken up by Labour party - FT

Headline: Britain to create 2,000-strong cyber force to tackle Russia threat - Sky News

Headline: May's Brexit plans opposed by 40 rebels in her party: former Brexit minister

Headline: Brexit at breaking point? Diary dates for Britain's EU departure

Headline: Spain hopes to reach deal on Gibraltar status with Britain by October

Headline: October EU summit will be 'moment of truth' for Brexit talks - EU's Tusk
Description: The next meeting of European Union leaders in October will be the "moment of truth" for negotiations over Britain's exit from the bloc, the chair of EU summits said on Thursday.

Headline: EU leaders to hold extra Brexit summit on November 17-18 - sources

Headline: UK foreign minister Hunt says confident parliament will pass any Brexit deal

Headline: Special Brexit summit to be held on Nov. 17-18 - Austrian news agency APA

Headline: November Brexit summit possible but only if needed - French official

Headline: Slovenia PM - chance of autumn Brexit deal if Britain backs it

Headline: Austrian EU presidency proposes special Brexit summit in November

Headline: Nearing divorce, May seeks goodwill from EU to avoid disorderly Brexit

Headline: Nearing divorce, May seeks goodwill from EU to avoid disorderly Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said Britain and the European Union were nearing a divorce deal but called on the bloc to show "goodwill and determination" to avoid a disorderly Brexit and secure a close future partnership.

Headline: Austria's Kurz calls on Britain to compromise in Brexit talks
Description: Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz called on Britain to be more flexible in the Brexit negotiations after the EU's chief negotiator offered compromises.

Headline: Ireland's Brexit backstop, and why it matters
Description: A "backstop" policy on Northern Ireland's land border with the European Union is a key obstacle to Britain securing a deal with Brussels on an orderly exit from the bloc in March. This is what it is and why it matters:

Headline: UK Brexit minister asks opposition Labour to clarify whether it backs second vote
Description: Britain's Brexit minister wrote to the opposition Labour Party on Wednesday asking it urgently to clarify whether it backs a second Brexit vote after some Labour figures have left open the possibility of a new referendum.

Headline: Jacob Rees-Mogg distances himself from Steve Bannon

Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is set to reject an improved offer from the European Union on how to solve the operation of the Irish border after Brexit, the Times newspaper reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Two hospitalised after London Muslim centre incident, not terror-related- police

Headline: New EU terms still mean unacceptable Irish sea border - DUP

Headline: May's spokesman - European Parliament's Weber welcomed UK's Brexit proposal

Headline: No special treatment for EU citizens after Brexit, report recommends

Headline: Factbox: Migration Advisory Committee's proposals for UK's post-Brexit immigration system
Description: Britain should not give preferential treatment to European Union workers in its post-Brexit immigration system but should prioritize the higher-skilled, a report commissioned by the British government said on Tuesday.

Description: Two people taken ill in a restaurant in Salisbury, the English town where a former Russian agent and his daughter were poisoned in March, were not exposed to any kind of nerve agent, British police said on Tuesday.

Headline: Don't hurt economy for Brexit 'erotic spasm', says Vince Cable

Description: Brexiteers who support a clean break with the European Union have launched a nation-wide advertising campaign in an attempt to force Prime Minister Theresa May to ditch her Brexit proposals.

Headline: May vows to defend Jews and Israel, in dig at Corbyn

Headline: May tells rebels - It's my Brexit deal or no deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told rebels in her divided party that if they torpedoed her Brexit deal then the United Kingdom would leave the EU without any agreement, a scenario the IMF said would make the country much poorer.

Headline: UK needs second plan in case 'Chequers' fails - Brexit committee head
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May urgently needs to develop an alternative approach to leaving the European Union in case her current negotiating strategy fails, the chairman of parliament's Brexit committee said on Tuesday.

Headline: Former trader facing deportation from UK gets temporary reprieve
Description: Kweku Adoboli, a former UBS trader jailed for a $2.25 billion (1.7 billion pounds) fraud, has won a temporary reprieve from deportation to Ghana, his spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: No-deal Brexit would bring 'some short-term disruption' - May

Headline: France, Britain reach deal over scallop fishing dispute
Description: French and British fisherman have reached an agreement to end a dispute over scallop fishing in the English Channel, a French Agriculture Ministry official said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit talks going ahead in 'spirit of good cooperation' - EU's Barnier
Description: Talks between the European Union and Britain on Brexit are being conducted in a spirit of "good cooperation", Michel Barnier, the EU's chief negotiator on the issue, said on Monday.

Headline: UK duchess Meghan backs cookbook to help project set up after deadly London fire
Description: Meghan Markle, Britain's Duchess of Sussex, has lent her backing to a new charity cookbook to help funds for a community cooking project set up in the wake of London's Grenfell Tower fire disaster in which killed 71 people.

Headline: How Irish border shuffle could ease Brexit deal

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP unconvinced by Irish Sea technological border - MEP

Headline: EU says more talks needed on Irish border issue to reach Brexit deal

Headline: Ireland flags 'east-west' technology as possible Brexit border aid

Headline: May's spokesman - We are confident of reaching Brexit deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is confident of reaching a Brexit deal with Brussels but the government is fully prepared in case no agreement is possible, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: EU's Barnier says Brexit talks continue in spirit of good cooperation
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier on Monday said talks over a divorce deal with Britain were continuing in a spirit of good cooperation.

Headline: London mayor calls for second Brexit referendum
Description: London mayor Sadiq Khan has called for another referendum on Britain's European Union membership, saying the prime minister's handling of Brexit negotiations had become "mired in confusion and deadlock" and was leading the country down a damaging path.

Headline: May says parliament will vote to back possible Brexit deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said the British parliament will vote to back any Brexit deal she strikes with the European Union and it would not be possible to achieve a better deal.

Headline: Kremlin says Skripal poisoning suspects have nothing to do with Putin - Ifax

Headline: Labour says big London banks must never again be 'masters of the economy'

Headline: Johnson says supports May, opposes her Brexit plan - newspaper
Description: Former Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson has said he supports Prime Minister Theresa May and his opposition was not to her but to her proposals for exiting the European Union, according to a report in the Daily Telegraph on Saturday.

Headline: Britain and EU 'closing in' on a Brexit agreement, Raab says
Description: Britain and the European Union are "closing in" on a withdrawal agreement, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Friday, before a meeting of European leaders in Salzburg next week.

Headline: RBS CEO 'edited' the truth in evidence session - MPs

Headline: Merkel - Want close defence cooperation with Britain after Brexit
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Friday that she wanted the European Union to have a close relationship with Britain when it leaves the bloc and added that the allies should work together closely on security and defence in the future.

Headline: Airbus says worst-case Brexit would hit its sites beyond Britain - Spiegel

Headline: Brexit buoyancy bypasses Brussels - EU still unsure of deal

Headline: EU's Barnier says 'substantive differences' remain on Brexit deal

Headline: Brexit talks 'closing in on workable solutions', Raab says

Description: Britain's property market would crash and mortgage rates spiral up in the event of a chaotic no-deal Brexit, with house prices falling 35 percent over three years, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney told ministers, The Times newspaper reported.

Headline: Britain says Russia interview is 'an insult', 'deeply offensive'- PM May's spokesman
Description: (This September 13 story correct to say suspects accused of attempted murder of former spy, not murder, in first paragraph.)

Headline: Russians in UK spy case say they wanted to see cathedral; Britain calls it 'lies'
Description: Two Russians resembling men Britain accuses of jetting to England to try to murder a former spy said on Thursday that they were innocent tourists who had flown to London for fun and visited the city of Salisbury to see its cathedral.

Headline: Prison officers return to work after protest against violence in jails
Description: Thousands of British prison officers returned to their jobs on Friday, after staging a six-hour walkout to protest against rising levels of violence in jails.

Headline: UK court rules against electoral watchdog in Brexit spending row
Description: Britain's electoral regulator misinterpreted the spending law when it allowed the main Brexit campaign to donate to a smaller, aligned group during the 2016 referendum campaign, London's High Court ruled on Friday.

Headline: 'No-deal' Brexit would complicate driving, data and roaming, UK says
Description: Leaving the European Union without a divorce deal could increase Britons' mobile phone roaming charges, upset data sharing and force motorists to get an international licence to drive in Europe, the government said on Thursday.

Headline: Scotland's SNP to target 50,000 voters in 'day of action' on independence
Description: Nicola Sturgeon's ruling Scottish National Party (SNP), which backs independence from the United Kingdom, is targeting 50,000 people in a "day of action" later this month aimed at building support for secession.

Headline: British foreign minister dismisses Russian suspects' interview as 'fake tv'
Description: British Foreign Minister Jeremy Hunt dismissed as a sham the appearance on Russian state TV of two Russians resembling men London accuses of jetting to England to try to murder a former spy.

Headline: Brexit no-deal may stop Eurostar trains entering France -French minister
Description: Eurostar trains heading from London to Paris may not be allowed into France if there is no Brexit deal and sufficient preparations have not been made, France's European Affairs minister said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit deal cannot be a 'fudge'- Raab
Description: Any Brexit deal has to set out a clear model for the relationship between London and Brussels after Britain leaves the European Union, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Thursday.

Headline: UK will pay 'substantially' less to EU in event of no Brexit deal - Raab
Description: Britain will pay "substantially" less to the European Union than the roughly 39 billion pounds withdrawal bill agreed with the bloc if there is no final agreement, Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain hands over more Northern Ireland trade data to Brussels - EU official
Description: Britain has handed over more data on trade flows with Northern Ireland at the request of chief negotiator Michel Barnier, an EU official said on Thursday, part of efforts to address the border question with EU member Ireland.

Headline: Britain's aim is to get Chequers-based Brexit deal - May's spokesman
Description: Britain's firm aim is to secure a deal with the European Union based on Prime Minister Theresa May's so-called Chequers plan, her spokesman said on Thursday after she met her cabinet team of top ministers.

Headline: EU leaders to discuss November Brexit summit next week - diplomat
Description: European Union leaders will discuss when they meet in Austria next week whether to hold a special summit on Brexit in November, a senior EU diplomat said on Thursday.

Headline: Russians accused by UK in spy case say they were in Salisbury for tourism
Description: Two Russians appeared on state television on Thursday, saying they had been wrongly accused by Britain of trying to murder a former Russian spy and his daughter in England and that they had visited Salisbury in March for tourism.

Headline: Roche boss says Brexit and curbs on drug use pose threat to UK science
Description: Uncertainty over drug regulation and a reluctance by Britain's health service to use certain pricey modern medicines pose a threat to the country's respected life sciences sector, the head Swiss drugmaker Roche  said on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox - Britain sets out no-deal Brexit impact on businesses and consumers
Description: Britain has published the second batch of advice to companies and individuals on how to prepare for any disruption that might follow a disorderly Brexit where there is no deal with the European Union.

Headline: UK says free flow of personal data from EU not guaranteed if no-deal Brexit
Description: British organisations would need to take action to ensure they could continue to receive personal data about their customers in the European Union in the event of the UK leaving the bloc without a deal next year, the UK government said on Thursday.

Headline: UK driving licences may not be valid in EU after no-deal Brexit - UK government
Description: Britons may not be able to rely on using just their British driving licences when driving in the European Union after March 29 if there is no Brexit deal, the British government warned on Thursday.

Headline: UK says clear that Russian Salisbury suspects are GRU officers
Description: Britain is clear that the men who appeared on Russian state television on Thursday are military intelligence officers whom police have identified as the suspects in the poisoning of a former Russian spy, the Foreign Office said on Thursday.

Headline: Statements by Russian Salisbury suspects are not credible - UK lawmaker
Description: Statements by two Russians accused of trying to murder a former Russian spy in Salisbury are not credible, the British lawmaker who represents the city in parliament said on Thursday.

Headline: EU tells Britain it won't renegotiate Brexit divorce bill
Description: The European Union will not reconsider parts of the Brexit agreement with Britain that have already been agreed on, like the divorce bill London will have to pay, a spokesman for the bloc's executive said on Thursday.

Headline: BoE's Carney attended 'no deal' Brexit cabinet meeting - May's spokeswoman
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney attended a meeting of the government's top ministers on Thursday to outline the bank's preparations for the possibility of a no deal Brexit, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said.

Headline: Russians accused in spy poisoning say they are victims of coincidence
Description: Two Russian men accused by Britain of poisoning a former Russian spy and his daughter in England said on Thursday they had been the victims of a "fantastical coincidence" and were simply Russian businessmen on holiday abroad.

Headline: World is sleepwalking towards another financial crisis, former UK PM Brown warns
Description: Former British Prime Minister Gordon Brown warned that the world is on the verge of sleepwalking into another financial crisis because governments have failed to tackle the causes of the last major financial crash a decade ago.

Headline: Fox warns Trump "protectionism has never ended well"
Description: Protectionism has never ended well, British trade minister Liam Fox said on Thursday when asked about U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to withdraw from the World Trade Organization.

Headline: UK businesses using Brexit as an excuse for poor performance - Raab
Description: It is easy for British businesses to use Brexit as an excuse rather than taking responsibility for their poor performance, Brexit minister Dominic Raab told BBC Radio on Thursday.

Headline: France says talks with Britain over scallop fishing end in failure
Description: Talks between French and British fisherman over rights to catch scallops have ended in failure, France's agriculture ministry said on Wednesday, raising the risk of further tensions at sea.

Headline: Raab - Brexit deal attainable, but no deal means no EU payment: Telegraph
Description: A deal on the future relationship between Britain and the European Union is within reach, Brexit Minister Dominic Raab said on Wednesday, although he confirmed London would withhold any financial settlement in a "no deal" scenario.

Headline: Tony Blair - world's strategy for countering Islamist extremism flawed
Description: Former British Prime Minister Tony Blair will warn on Thursday that the threat from Islamist militants is growing and the current approach for tackling the threat will fail unless there is a global strategy to tackle the roots of extremism.

Headline: Thomas Cook says has not seen full report from Egypt prosecutor on resort deaths
Description: British tour operator Thomas Cook said on Wednesday it had not yet seen the full report from Egypt's public prosecutor on the deaths of two British holidaymakers in the Red Sea resort of Hurghada last month.

Headline: EU must grasp world role as U.S. retreats, Juncker says
Description: The European Union must flex its muscles as a world power, EU chief executive Jean-Claude Juncker said on Wednesday, as he spoke critically of U.S. President Donald Trump's retreat from international engagement.

Headline: EU's Juncker says ties with UK will always be close but Brexit demands remain
Description: European Commission head Jean-Claude Juncker on Wednesday renewed a pledge of close trade and security ties with Britain after Brexit, but said the European Union would not compromise on key withdrawal terms.

Headline: Brexit rebels pledge loyalty to May after talk of a plot to topple her
Description: Brexit-supporting lawmakers in British Prime Minister Theresa May's party publicly pledged support for her on Wednesday after media reports of a plot to oust her by rebels unhappy with her proposals for exiting the European Union.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP sees no need for border infrastructure in Brexit deal or no deal
Description: Infrastructure will not be needed on the Northern Irish border whether a Brexit deal is reached or not, the deputy leader of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party said on Wednesday.

Headline: May's Brexit plan only credible one for Britain - spokesman
Description: The Brexit proposals put forward by British Prime Minister Theresa May are the only "credible and negotiable" ones, her spokesman said on Wednesday after rebels in her party presented alternative plans for the border in Northern Ireland.

Headline: May's spokesman says she would fight any attempt to oust her
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May would fight any attempt by her lawmakers to oust her, her spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Rebel MPs tell May: change course on Brexit
Description: Brexit-supporting lawmakers in British Prime Minister Theresa May's party called on her to change course on Brexit but said they supported her remaining as leader.

Headline: May says 'position changes' on divorce payment if no Brexit deal
Description: If Britain does not reach an exit deal with the European Union, the "position changes" on its agreement to pay a financial settlement to the bloc, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: Former minister Davis: UK will reset Brexit plans after Salzburg
Description: Former Brexit Secretary David Davis said he expected Prime Minister Theresa May's government to change course on Brexit after an informal meeting of EU leaders in Salzburg next week.

Headline: Barclays and UK government launch 1 billion pound house-building fund
Description: Britain's government and Barclays  launched a fund on Wednesday to provide up to 1 billion pounds in finance to small house-builders in an attempt to tackle England's housing shortage.

Headline: Hammond says autumn budget may be less than 10 weeks away
Description: British Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Tuesday that he had yet to fix a date for the government's annual budget, due before the end of the year, but that it could be less than 10 weeks away.

Headline: Hammond says happy to hear from statisticians on reform to RPI inflation
Description: Britain's Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Tuesday he would be happy to hear from the country's statistics agency about reforming the discredited, but still widely-used, retail price index gauge of inflation.

Headline: Greece's Tsipras says confident of Brexit solution for citizens
Description: Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras said on Tuesday he was "confident" the European Union and Britain would eventually reach a deal on Brexit.

Headline: Hammond says BoE governor to stay on as Brexit turbulence looms
Description: Mark Carney will stay on as Bank of England governor until the end of January 2020 to help navigate the turbulence of Brexit, Britain's finance minister said on Tuesday, as he warned time was running out to secure a deal with the EU on future ties.

Headline: Britain should keep foreign students in immigration numbers, report says
Description: Britain should not remove international students from targets to reduce migration, a government-commissioned report said on Tuesday, in a vindication of the prime minister's strategy after she resisted pressure to soften her stance on immigration.

Headline: Time running out to agree a Brexit deal with EU, UK's Hammond says
Description: Britain is devoting all its efforts to securing a Brexit deal but time is running out in negotiations with the European Union to agree the terms of its departure, British finance minister Philip Hammond said on Tuesday.

Headline: EU Salzburg summit is a staging post in Brexit talks - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May sees an informal EU summit next week as a "staging post" in Brexit negotiations, that will allow the bloc's leaders to discuss her proposals to leave the European Union for the first time.

Headline: May's Brexit plans opposed by 80 rebels in her party - former minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party faces a "catastrophic split" if she persists with her proposals on Brexit, which 80 or more of her lawmakers are prepared to vote against, a former junior minister said.

Headline: UK focussed on securing Brexit deal in October - May's spokesman
Description: Britain is focussed on securing a Brexit deal in October, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said, after the European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said an agreement with Britain could be agreed in six to eight weeks.

Headline: Pound gains on cautious Barnier Brexit deal comment
Description: A cautious comment by the EU Brexit negotiator that there could be a deal by November if unrealistic demands are taken off the table boosted sterling on Monday amid new optimism among investors.

Headline: 'Lives torn apart in 82 seconds', UK Westminster attack inquest hears
Description: A man who mowed down pedestrians with a car near Britain's parliament before stabbing a policeman ruined many lives in a matter of seconds, an inquest heard on Monday, as it began with tributes to the victims and details of their last moments.

Headline: EU leaders expected to hold special Brexit summit on Nov. 13 - Guardian
Description: European leaders are expected next week to announce that they will hold an extraordinary Brexit summit in November, the Guardian newspaper reported. It said the summit would most likely be held on Nov. 13.

Headline: May hopes parliament will support her Brexit plan - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May hopes parliament will support her plan for Brexit, her spokesman said on Monday, adding it was the only one on the table which delivered on the will of the British people while avoiding a hard border in Northern Ireland.

Headline: Johnson attacks government on taxes, rail
Description: Former Foreign Minister Boris Johnson launched a two-pronged attack on Britain's government on Sunday, criticising suggestions it may increase taxes to fund services and its management of a high-speed rail project.

Headline: Labour will make companies set up 'ownership funds' - Observer
Description: The Labour Party will make private companies employing more than 250 people set up "ownership funds" to give workers financial stakes in their firms if the party comes to power, its finance spokesman told the Observer newspaper.

Headline: May wraps 'suicide vest' around UK over Brexit, says Johnson
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit deal wraps "a suicide vest around the British constitution" and hands the detonator to the European Union, former foreign secretary Boris Johnson said in comments that drew strong criticism.

Headline: Britain must focus on moving ahead with May's Brexit plan - Brokenshire
Description: Britain must focus on moving forward with Prime Minister Theresa May's plans to leave the European Union, housing minister James Brokenshire said on Sunday, after her proposals were criticised by her former foreign minister.

Headline: Chequers plan is only deal on the table with EU - Javid
Description: British interior minister Sajid Javid said on Sunday that the prime minister's so-called Chequers plan was the only one on the table with the European Union, suggesting that Theresa May is not planning to succumb to pressure to change tack over Brexit.

Headline: Trade unions could support second Brexit vote if deal hurts workers - TUC
Description: Britain's Trades Union Congress will support a second referendum on a Brexit deal if Prime Minister Theresa May fails to get a deal with the European Union that can help the country's workforce, General Secretary Frances O'Grady said on Sunday.

Headline: UK wants deal on Brexit by November at latest - Lidington
Description: Britain believes an orderly, agreed exit from the European Union is still the most likely outcome but time is running out and a deal should be done by November at the latest, cabinet office minister David Lidington said on Saturday.

Headline: British anti-terrorism police help investigate Barnsley knife attack
Description: British anti-terrorism officers were helping to investigate a knife attack in a northern English town on Saturday in which one man was injured, although police said they were keeping an open mind.

Headline: Fuelling independence? Scotland's oil hub embraces green energy
Description: Scotland's leader Nicola Sturgeon launched on Friday a major renewable energy project boasting the world's most powerful wind turbines, which she hopes will also propel the independence ambitions of her nationalist party.

Headline: EU's Barnier wants orderly Brexit with Irish fix, strong future ties
