Description: Prime Minister Theresa May on Friday called on the European Union to strike a new deal to prevent a hard border in Northern Ireland and demanded Brussels quickly respond to her plan to avoid a damaging no-deal Brexit.

Headline: May frustrated Northern Ireland lacks devolved government
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday that she was frustrated that Northern Ireland had been without a devolved government for over eighteen months.

Headline: Forget Brexit for a while and count the butterflies, Attenborough tells Brits
Description: Naturalist David Attenborough suggested the British public take a break from squabbling over Brexit and instead take part in the world's biggest count of butterflies.

Headline: Britain set for energy price caps after new law approved - regulator
Description: Around 5 million British households are set for lower energy bills this winter after parliament approved a law on gas and electricity tariff price caps, energy regulator Ofgem said on Thursday.

Headline: Visiting Northern Irish border, May to defend her Brexit plan
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will tell the people of Northern Ireland on Friday that her Brexit plan is the best way to avoid a hard border with Ireland, standing firm against critics in her own party.

Headline: UK to warn public every week over 'no-deal Brexit' - The Times
Description: Britons will from next week start receiving weekly information bulletins from the government about how to make sure they're ready for a disorderly Brexit, The Times reported on Friday.

Headline: UK's new Brexit envoy optimistic, as EU warns of Brexit crash
Description: London's new Brexit minister said he was confident he could reach a deal, on his first trip to Brussels on Thursday as the EU warned business to get ready for Britain crashing out of the bloc without agreed terms to cushion the economic disruption.

Headline: Exclusive - Britain says Huawei 'shortcomings' expose new telecom networks risks
Description: Technical and supply-chain issues with equipment made by Chinese firm Huawei have exposed Britain's telecom networks to new security risks, a government report said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit progress suggests no deal with EU is unlikely - PM's spokeswoman
Description: The progress Britain has made in talks to leave the European Union suggests that the country will not crash out of the bloc without a deal, a spokeswoman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain has identified Russians suspected of Skripal nerve attack - news agency
Description: British police have identified several Russians who they believe were behind the nerve agent attack on former spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter, the British news agency, Press Association, said on Thursday, citing a source close to the investigation.

Headline: Huawei 'shortcomings' expose new security risks in UK telecom networks - government report
Description: Problems with products made by China's Huawei Technologies  have exposed new security risks in Britain's telecommunications network, a UK government report said on Thursday.

Headline: UK watchdog and EU tell banks to prepare for hard Brexit
Description: Britain's banks and insurers must plan for a "hard" Brexit in case a transition period is not in place next March, a senior British regulator said on Thursday in a warning echoed by Brussels.

Headline: Britain dismisses news report on Skripal poisoners as 'wild speculation'
Description: Britain's security minister on Thursday dismissed a report that police have identified several Russians who were behind the poisoning of former Russian double-agent Sergei Skripal as "wild speculation".

Headline: 'It's not too late to save Brexit,' Johnson tells UK parliament
Description: Boris Johnson, who quit as Britain's former foreign minister last week, accused Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday of planning a phoney Brexit that would betray voters by failing to take the country completely out of the European Union.

Headline: British man plotted to kill May
Description: A British man was found guilty on Wednesday of a plot to kill Prime Minister Theresa May by first detonating an explosive device to get into her Downing Street office and then using a knife or a gun to attack her.

Headline: 'Brexit continues to mean Brexit' - May presses on with her plan
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May refused to budge from her position on Brexit on Wednesday, brushing aside criticism from all corners of parliament and saying her strategy was already being negotiated with the European Union.

Headline: Watching Westminster, Brussels wills May on
Description: If Prime Minister Theresa May can survive and steer her Brexit plan through parliament, the European Union is keen to help her reach a deal that can avoid Britain lurching chaotically out of the bloc, EU officials say.

Headline: Conservative MPs back May on EU approach, says UK minister
Description: The Conservative Party has come together to support a vision for the country's future ties with the European Union put forward by Prime Minister Theresa May, a minister in her cabinet team said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK to require big companies to report CO2 emissions from April 2019
Description: Big companies will have to report their energy use, carbon dioxide emissions and energy efficiency measures in their annual reports from next April under a new framework set out by the British government on Wednesday.

Headline: UK to consult public on possible bid to join Pacific trade pact
Description: Trade Secretary Liam Fox said on Wednesday he will consult the public about a possible bid to join a Pacific trade group that includes Canada, Australia and Mexico, once Britain leaves the European Union.

Headline: May says government will publish new environment legislation
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday her government would bring forward a new piece of environment legislation, building on a previously published 25-year plan to improve the environment for future generations.

Headline: We are not closer to a no deal Brexit, says May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she did not believe that Britain was getting close to a so-called "no deal" Brexit, where the country crashes out of the European Union without an exit agreement.

Headline: Chemical weapons agency says has collected samples from Amesbury for identification
Description: The world's chemical weapons watchdog said on Wednesday it has collected samples to identify the substance believed to have caused the July 8 death of a British woman in Amesbury, England, and sickened her partner.

Headline: Britons jailed for membership of banned neo-Nazi group
Description: Two Britons were jailed on Wednesday after being convicted of belonging to a banned white supremacist group following a trial in which another defendant had earlier pleaded guilty to plotting to kill an elected MP.

Headline: There is enough time for Brexit deal, says May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday there was enough time to negotiate a Brexit deal with the European Union.

Headline: UK police interview three people under caution over Grenfell fire
Description: Police investigating the Grenfell Tower fire in London that killed 71 people last year said on Wednesday they had conducted three interviews under caution, and more would probably take place in the coming weeks.

Headline: Britain already talking to EU on future ties based on white paper - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday her government was already negotiating with the European Union on future ties, based on a white paper policy document published last week.

Headline: EU needs to know Britain is also preparing for a no-deal Brexit - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday Britain needed to make clear to the European Union that it was preparing for a no-deal outcome to the Brexit negotiations despite wanting to leave with an agreement.

Headline: Back May or face national election, Brexit rebels told
Description: Pro-European Union rebels were threatened with a general election this summer if they defeated Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans on customs, a lawmaker said on Wednesday, threatening to widen rifts in the PM's party.

Headline: Irish foreign minister says EU to negotiate Brexit on UK's white paper only
Description: The European Union plans to negotiate Britain's withdrawal on the basis of the British government's white paper on Brexit and will not focus on amendments passed by parliament, Ireland's foreign minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: May to visit Northern Ireland to offer Brexit reassurances
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will make a two-day visit to Northern Ireland on Thursday, seeking to reassure businesses that her government will avoid a hard border after Brexit between the province and European Union member Ireland.

Headline: May narrowly avoids defeat in parliament on EU trade laws
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May narrowly avoided a defeat in parliament at the hands of pro-EU lawmakers from her own party on Tuesday, fending off a rebellion that had threatened to deepen a crisis over her Brexit strategy.

Headline: 'Fanatical' pro-Brexit lawmakers pushing UK towards new election - former PM Major
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May could be forced to call another election in months if the "fanatical" pro-Brexit wing of her party do not compromise over how Britain leaves the EU, former prime minister John Major warned on Tuesday.

Headline: May suffers parliament defeat over plans to leave European medicines network
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May suffered an embarrassing defeat on a trade law that means ministers must now seek to secure an agreement that allows Britain to have continued participation in the European medicines regulatory framework.

Headline: May U-turns on plan to give lawmakers extended summer holiday
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May cancelled an attempt on Tuesday to end parliament early and give lawmakers an extended summer holiday, as members of parliament criticised the move as a ploy to ease pressure on her leadership.

Headline: UK government wins approval for Brexit trade law in lower house of parliament
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May won approval from the lower of house of parliament on Tuesday for a law needed to let Britain pursue an independent trade policy once it leaves the European Union.

Headline: May defeats rebels over plans to remain in EU customs union
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May narrowly avoided a defeat in parliament at the hands of pro-EU lawmakers from her own party on Tuesday, fending off a rebellion that threatened to worsen a crisis over her Brexit strategy.

Headline: Trade minister says government cannot accept pro-EU rebel plan on trade law
Description: Britain's government cannot accept a plan put forward by pro-European Union rebels in parliament that could see Britain stay in the bloc's customs union, junior trade minister George Hollingbery told parliament.

Headline: Breitbart lobbying prompted U.S. envoy to raise Tommy Robinson case with British
Description: (The July 16 story was refiled to correct the first name of the U.S. congressman in paragraph 9 to Paul not Louis)

Headline: Carney - no deal Brexit would prompt interest rate review
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Tuesday that a no-deal Brexit would have "big" economic consequences, prompt a review of interest rates and leave many bankers idle.

Headline: UK watchdog paints gloomier long-term picture for public finances
Description: Britain's budget watchdog on Tuesday outlined a gloomier picture for the government's finances in the long term, reflecting recent pledges to increase health spending without tax hikes or spending cuts to pay for it.

Headline: Britain's EU referendum was legitimate, says May's spokesman
Description: Britain's vote on its EU membership was a legitimate democratic exercise, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday after the officially designated Brexit campaign group was referred to the police over breaching spending rules.

Headline: May's spokesman says Trump's meeting with Putin does not undermine transatlantic alliance
Description: A spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said the outcome of President Donald Trump's meeting with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin in Helsinki on Monday does not undermine the strength of the transatlantic alliance.

Headline: May wins parliament vote after bowing to Brexit pressure
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May won a series of votes in parliament on Monday, keeping her over-arching strategy to leave the European Union just about on track after bowing to pressure from Brexit supporters in her party.

Headline: Fast-growing e-cigarette maker Juul to launch in UK
Description: Silicon Valley e-cigarette start-up Juul Labs is bringing its small flash drive-sized vaping device to the United Kingdom this week, aiming to reproduce its break-neck U.S. growth overseas.

Headline: UK ethics body says gene-edited babies may be 'morally permissible'
Description: The use of gene editing technologies to alter the DNA of human embryos could be morally permissible as long as the science and its impact on society is carefully considered, a British ethics panel said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK government wins approval for customs bill in lower house of parliament
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May won approval from the lower of house of parliament on Monday for a law designed to create an independent customs policy after Brexit.

Headline: UK junior defence minister resigns, votes against government - BBC
Description: British junior defence minister Guto Bebb resigned after voting against a government-backed amendment on the customs bill, part of plans for Britain's exit from the European Union, BBC news reported on Monday.

Headline: Pro-Brexit lawmakers' amendment to customs bill narrowly passes with UK government backing
Description: A pro-Brexit lawmakers' amendment that will stop Britain collecting tariffs for the European Union after Brexit unless there is a reciprocal arrangement was narrowly approved by parliament on Monday with the government's support.

Headline: Britain plans to bring forward parliament's mid-year break - official
Description: Britain's government intends to bring forward parliament's mid-year recess to Thursday, a parliamentary official said on Monday.

Headline: Britain unveils fighter jet model to rival Franco-German programme
Description: Britain unveiled a model of a sleek proposed fighter jet named Tempest on Monday, raising questions about the future of European defence cooperation, given that Germany and France launched their own fighter jet program a year ago.

Headline: Airbus says Europe, UK should work together on future fighter
Description: Britain and Europe should work together on a future combat air system, or risk further fragmenting the European defence market, Airbus  defence chief Dirk Hoke said on Monday, after Britain pushed forward with its own new fighter jet programme.

Headline: May says her Chequers plan on Brexit is not dead
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May rejected on Monday the suggestion that the Brexit negotiating strategy she agreed with her cabinet earlier this month was dead, and denied she had caved to pressure from eurosceptics.

Headline: May accepts amendments by pro-Brexit MPs on customs law - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will accept four changes to its customs legislation proposed by eurosceptics within her party on a law designed to create a functioning and independent customs policy, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Government makes concession to eurosceptics on customs law - BBC political editor
Description: The British government will accept four changes to its customs legislation proposed by eurosceptics within Prime Minister Theresa May's party, the BBC reported, neutralising a planned rebellion by MPs who reject her Brexit plan.

Headline: May promises to protect planemakers' supply chains in Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will on Monday seek to reassure aviation bosses that her under-fire Brexit plan won't disrupt their supply chains, and promise that the industry will flourish as Britain leaves the European Union.

Headline: UK looking to Sweden, Japan in search for partners on new fighter jet
Description: Britain is talking to a number of potential partners for its new fighter jet project, Tempest, which it launched on Monday, a senior official in the UK's Royal Air Force told Reuters.

Headline: There will be no second Brexit referendum, says May's spokesman
Description: There will be no second referendum on Brexit, a spokesman for Britain's Theresa May said on Monday, repeating the prime minister's belief that her plan for leaving the European Union was the only way to get a deal that meets the government's aims.

Headline: Britain backs Scottish spaceport plan with £30 million in grants
Description: Britain wants to build its first spaceport for launching satellites in Scotland, with the government kick-starting the project by handing almost 30 million pounds in grants to companies including Lockheed Martin .

Headline: Former UK minister calls for second vote on Brexit to end stalemate
Description: A former senior British minister called on Monday for a second referendum to solve a parliamentary stalemate on Brexit, saying Prime Minister Theresa May's proposals for new ties with the European Union were a fudge that satisfied no one.

Headline: Planemakers plot course through trade, Brexit worries to air show deals
Description: Aerospace firms are setting out wares from luxury jets to lethal drones at back-to-back British air shows this week, hoping trade tensions will not deter airlines from buying jetliners even as geopolitical uncertainty allows them to sell more weapons.

Headline: May warns rebels - Back me or risk 'no Brexit at all'
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May warned her divided party on Sunday that there may be "no Brexit at all" if they wrecked her plan to forge a close relationship with the European Union after leaving the world's biggest trading bloc.

Headline: U.S. President Donald Trump departs Britain
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump left Britain on Sunday after a visit in which his criticism of Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plans overshadowed attempts to present a strengthened bilateral relationship.

Headline: Trump plays golf in Scotland before Putin summit amid Russian meddling charges
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump played golf on Saturday at his course on Scotland's west coast ahead of a summit with Kremlin chief Vladimir Putin that could be overshadowed by accusations of Russian meddling in the 2016 U.S. election.

Headline: May says Donald Trump told her to sue the EU over Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said U.S. President Donald Trump had previously advised her to sue the European Union as part of her Brexit strategy, disclosing a piece of advice Trump said last week she had ignored.

Headline: Ireland to move oil reserves from UK over Brexit - Sunday Independent
Description: The Irish government is planning to move 200,000 tonnes of its oil reserves from Britain as part of its Brexit preparations and will sign off on the move this week, Ireland's Sunday Independent newspaper reported.

Headline: Factbox - What do May's critics say of her and her Brexit plans?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May warned her divided party on Sunday that there may be "no Brexit at all" if they wrecked her plan to forge a close relationship with the European Union after leaving the world's biggest trading bloc.

Headline: Man arrested over paraglider protest at Trump's golf course in Scotland
Description: A 55 year-old man has been arrested following a protest at U.S. President Donald Trump's golf course in Scotland on Friday, Scottish police said, after a an activist used a powered parachute to get within a few hundred yards of the president.

Headline: Trump questions why Obama did not act on claims of Russian election meddling
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday questioned why Barack Obama's administration did not act on allegations of Russian meddling in the U.S. 2016 presidential election.

Headline: Trump's ambassador lobbied Britain on behalf of jailed right-wing activist Tommy Robinson
Description: (This July 13 story fixes dateline and typo in eighth paragraph.)

Headline: Trump vows 'great' trade deal with UK, abruptly changing tack on May's Brexit plan
Description: President Donald Trump said on Friday the United States and Britain could secure a "great" post-Brexit trade deal, lavishing praise on Prime Minister Theresa May and contradicting his own withering assessment of her strategy publicised hours earlier.

Headline: UK police recover 400 items in Novichok murder probe
Description: British counter-terrorism police said on Saturday they had recovered more than 400 items as part of their investigation into the murder of a woman in southwest England who was poisoned by the Novichok nerve agent.

Headline: Trump playing golf at Turnberry course in Scotland
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump is playing golf at the Turnberry course he owns in Scotland, according to a Reuters photographer on Saturday.

Headline: Explosive thrown at house of former Sinn Fein leader Gerry Adams
Description: An explosive device was thrown at the home Gerry Adams in Belfast overnight, the former Sinn Fein leader said on Saturday, saying the attack may have been carried out by Irish nationalist militants opposed to Northern Ireland's peace deal.

Headline: Trump says hopes to play golf in Scotland ahead of Putin meeting
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he hoped to play some golf at the course he owns in Scotland, ahead of a summit with Russian leader Vladimir Putin next week.

Headline: UK police find source of Novichok nerve agent in small bottle
Description: British counter-terrorism police said on Friday they believed they had found the source of the Novichok nerve agent that killed a woman in southwest England and left her partner critically ill in hospital.

Headline: 'Together Against Trump', thousands protest peacefully in London
Description: Chanting "Donald Trump has got to go," tens of thousands of protesters marched through London on Friday waving banners and banging pots to demonstrate against the U.S. president on his first official visit to Britain.

Headline: Trump meets Queen Elizabeth at Windsor Castle
Description: Donald Trump met Queen Elizabeth at Windsor Castle on Friday but the 92-year-old monarch was forced at one point to walk around the U.S. president after he halted abruptly during a ceremonial inspection of the guard.

Headline: Man who encouraged attack on Prince George gets life in jail
Description: A British man who suggested Islamist militants should target four-year-old Prince George - destined to be Britain's future king - was sentenced to life in jail on Friday.

Headline: Snarling orange 'Trump baby' blimp flies outside British parliament
Description: A blimp depicting Donald Trump as an orange, snarling nappy-wearing baby flew outside the British parliament in London on Friday, launched by critics of the U.S. president who are demonstrating throughout his visit to the country.

Headline: HIGHLIGHTS - President Trump news conference with UK PM May
Description: Visiting U.S. President Donald Trump held a news conference on Friday after talks with British Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: Factbox - U.S. President Trump's views on UK's May, Brexit
Description: U.S President Donald Trump delivered a withering verdict on British Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit strategy, criticised the London mayor and tipped a minister who resigned this week as a future leader in an newspaper interview published on Friday.

Headline: U.S. President Trump arrives at PM May's Chequers country residence
Description: U.S President Donald Trump arrived at British Prime Minister Theresa May's Chequers country residence for talks followed by a news conference.

Headline: Trump says he and May 'probably never developed a better relationship'
Description: U.S President Donald Trump said on Friday he and British Prime Minister Theresa May had "probably never developed a better relationship" than during a dinner on Thursday.

Headline: PM May has good relationship with Trump, confident of trade deal - spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has a good relationship with Donald Trump and is confident a trade deal can be agreed with the United States after the president criticised her Brexit plans in an interview, her spokeswoman said.

Headline: 'Where are your manners, Mr President?' asks UK minister after May criticism
Description: A junior minister in Prime Minister Theresa May's government asked Donald Trump: "Where are your manners, Mr President?" after the U.S. leader criticised her Brexit strategy in an interview published during his visit to Britain.

Headline: May and Trump will have positive trade discussion - Hammond
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and U.S. President Donald Trump will have a positive discussion on future trade ties, despite the latter's criticism of May's Brexit plan, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Friday.

Headline: May could change her mind on Brexit - Rees-Mogg
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has an opportunity to reverse her strategy for Brexit, a eurosceptic lawmaker in her Conservative Party said on Friday, criticising her plan for maintaining close trade ties with the European Union.

Headline: London mayor says preposterous for Trump to blame crime on immigration
Description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan said it was preposterous for Donald Trump to blame a rise in violent crime in the city on immigration after the U.S. president criticised his handling of crime and militant attacks.

Headline: May looking forward to explaining Brexit stance to Trump - May spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is looking forward to sitting down with Donald Trump to talk him through her Brexit negotiating stance after the U.S. president criticised her plans in an interview, her spokesman said on Friday.

Headline: Trump blasts May's Brexit plan, says it puts trade deal in doubt
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said a free trade deal with Britain might be impossible if London went ahead with Prime Minister Theresa May's proposals for post-Brexit ties with the European Union, in damaging remarks that could widen domestic criticism of her plans.

Headline: Street violence hits Northern Ireland towns on eve of annual marches
Description: Northern Ireland was hit by a barrage of street violence overnight on the eve of annual parades that often raise tensions between pro-British Protestants and Irish nationalist Catholics in the British region, police said on Thursday.

Headline: Setting out vision for future ties, May presses Brexit plans
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May published her blueprint for Britain's future relations with the European Union on Thursday, proposals which would keep close trade ties after Brexit but make it harder for banks to access the European single market.

Headline: Trump warns May's Brexit plans will hit trade with U.S. - Sun
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump warned that British Prime Minister Theresa May's proposals for leaving the European Union will have a negative effect on trade with the United States, according to an interview published on Thursday.

Headline: Police briefly cordon off area near Salibury poisoning
Description: Police briefly cordoned off part of the English city of Salisbury on Thursday near where former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter were found poisoned, then removed the barriers after discovering no cause for alarm.

Headline: Trump says May's soft Brexit deal could 'kill' U.S.-UK trade deal - Sun
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump says that a soft Brexit of the type set out by Prime Minister Theresa May last week would "probably kill" chances of a trade deal between Britain and the United States, the Sun newspaper reported late on Thursday.

Headline: May would like to host reception for England football team - spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May would like to host an event for the English football team after they reached the World Cup semi-finals for the first time in 28 years, her spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: Ireland welcomes UK white paper as a step to softer Brexit
Description: Ireland's foreign minister on Thursday welcomed the release of the British government's blueprint for future ties with the European Union.

Headline: German finance minister says EU must make its own decisions on financial services
Description: The European Union must make its own decisions and cannot have outside legislators deciding on financial services rules after Brexit, German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Thursday.

Headline: May says Brexit delivers people's wishes after Trump casts doubt
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday her new proposal for Brexit delivers what Britons voted for, responding to U.S. President Donald Trump who said he was unsure whether the different route May was taking fulfilled the wishes of the people.

Headline: Donald Trump arrives in Britain for first visit as U.S. president
Description: U.S President Donald Trump landed in Britain on Thursday to start a four-day trip to a country he has described as a "hot spot" that is in turmoil due to a political crisis over its decision to leave the European Union.

Headline: Factbox - Britain proposes agri-food free trade, common rulebook
Description: Britain published its proposals on Thursday for future trade with the European Union after it leaves the bloc next March.

Headline: Factbox - How Britain plans to maintain flow of data with EU after Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May published her blueprint for relations with the European Union after Brexit on Thursday, covering everything from trade to services, immigration, airlines and cars.

Headline: Factbox - UK wants EU immigration policy that supports business, tourists and students
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May published her blueprint for relations with the European Union after Brexit on Thursday, including how the country will manage immigration, a key issue during 2016's referendum.

Headline: Britain's Brexit plan will damage financial services - City of London boss
Description: Britain's blueprint for relations with the European Union will damage the vast financial services sector, the policy chief of London's financial district said on Thursday after the government announced plans to diverge from the bloc's rules after Brexit,

Headline: Brexit minister tells EU - now it is your turn to respond
Description: British Brexit minister Dominic Raab said on Thursday that it was now up to the European Union to respond after the government published a long-awaited white paper policy document.

Headline: EU to analyse UK Brexit plan - Barnier
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said the European Union would review the British government's latest proposal on Thursday for trading arrangements after the country leaves the bloc.

Headline: Factbox - Britain proposes new fishing arrangements after Brexit
Description: Britain published on Thursday its proposals for future trade with the European Union after it leaves the bloc next March.

Headline: Factbox - Britain wants to stay in EU aviation safety body, to maintain flying rights
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May published her blueprint for relations with the European Union after Brexit on Thursday, including proposals for the UK to participate in the European Aviation Safety Agency and maintain flying rights.

Headline: UK foreign minister says expects fierce debate over Brexit plan
Description: British foreign minister Jeremy Hunt said on Thursday he expects a lively debate in parliament around the government's soon-to-be-published Brexit policy, but that it offers a basis for talks to move forward in Brussels.

Headline: Trump not sure if Britain's Brexit approach is what the people voted for
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he was not sure if Britain's new approach to Brexit was what the people had voted for, adding that Britain was in a "pretty hot spot" after two major resignations from Prime Minister Theresa May's government.

Headline: Britain's opposition Labour Party takes poll lead amid May's Brexit crisis
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party, led by socialist Jeremy Corbyn, has taken a lead over the Conservative Party as Prime Minister Theresa May's government grapples with a crisis over Brexit, according to two opinion polls.

Headline: Brexit campaigners seek to harden May's EU plan next week
Description: Several Brexit supporters in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party will seek to harden the government's plan on leaving the European Union by changing her customs legislation in parliament next week.

Headline: Brexit blueprint should reassure EU over strategy - Dominic Raab
Description: Britain's newly appointed Brexit minister said on Thursday he hoped that the government's soon-to-be-published policy on leaving the European Union will reassure those in the EU who are unclear as to how it will work.

Headline: UK wants leading role in next-generation fighter - UK air chief
Description: Britain wants to maintain a leadership position in fighter jet technology and will not take a subsidiary role to France and Germany as they move ahead on developing a next-generation warplane, the country's air chief said on Wednesday.

Headline: Harry and Meghan visit Dublin in first trip as married couple
Description: Prince Harry paid tribute on Tuesday to Britain's complex and "at times tragic" shared history with Ireland, at the start of a two-day visit to Dublin with his wife Meghan, their first trip abroad since their wedding in May.

Headline: Brexit and protests cast shadow over Trump visit to Britain
Description: Britain on Wednesday geared up for the arrival of Donald Trump just hours after the U.S. president waded into the Brexit crisis gripping Prime Minister Theresa May's government and portrayed the closest U.S. ally in Europe as a country in turmoil.

Headline: Factbox - Trump and Theresa: Six key moments in their 'special relationship'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump meets Prime Minister Theresa May this week, making a long-awaited first visit to Britain which will be closely watched to determine the health of the so-called "special relationship" between the two countries.

Headline: UK police speak to man poisoned with Novichok nerve agent
Description: Police said on Wednesday they had spoken to the man poisoned with a nerve agent as detectives sought to discover how he and his partner, who died on Sunday, were exposed to Novichok.

Headline: Trump should be welcomed to Britain amid planned protests - minister
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump should be welcomed to Britain when he visits on Thursday because of the close security cooperation between the countries, Cabinet Office minister David Lidington said on Wednesday.

Headline: British man poisoned with Novichok is no longer in critical condition - hospital
Description: A 45-year-old British man poisoned with Novichok nerve agent is no longer in a critical condition, the hospital treating him said on Wednesday as he continues to recover.

Headline: Shots fired at Northern Irish police ahead of flashpoint parade
Description: Northern Irish police came under gunfire and petrol bomb attack in the fifth night of violence in Londonderry late on Tuesday on the eve of a major annual parade in the British province that frequently triggers sectarian violence.

Headline: May presses on with Brexit plan after high-profile resignations
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May won the support of senior ministers and an endorsement from Europe's most powerful leader, Angela Merkel, on Tuesday, surviving the explosive resignations of two top cabinet members in protest at her Brexit plans.

Headline: Britain to double Western Balkans funding, security staff
Description: Britain is to almost double the funding it provides to countries in the Western Balkans to 80 million pounds and ramp up its number of security staff in the region to try and tackle organised crime gangs.

Headline: Americans in UK warned to keep 'low profile' during Trump visit
Description: The U.S. Embassy in London issued an alert on Tuesday to Americans in the British capital, warning them to keep a low profile during President Donald Trump's visit later this week in case protests against him turn violent.

Headline: PM May looking forward to positive talks with Trump
Description: Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday she was looking forward to positive talks with U.S. President Donald Trump later this week, after he said that Britain was in turmoil and considered May critic Boris Johnson a friend.

Headline: Germany's Merkel welcomes May's Brexit proposals
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Tuesday welcomed proposals on Britain's exit from the European Union drawn up by Prime Minister Theresa May's government, saying that they brought the Brexit process "a whole step forward".

Headline: Two Conservative Party vice chairs quit over PM May's Brexit proposals
Description: Two vice chairs in British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party are quitting over her Brexit proposals, said a government official who spoke on condition of anonymity.

Headline: UK cabinet discussed Brexit policy document, plans no-deal exit - PM May's spokesman
Description: Britain's cabinet discussed the so-called white paper Brexit policy document and stepping up preparations for a no-deal exit, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday.

Description: Amid one of the deepest crises of Prime Minister Theresa May's premiership, Boris Johnson posed for a photograph of himself, pen poised, ready to resign as foreign minister over Brexit.

Headline: Airbus boss Enders backs UK PM May's latest Brexit position
Description: Airbus  chief executive Tom Enders gave his backing to the latest Brexit position set out by British Prime Minister Theresa May, softening criticism made on Friday when he had stated May's government had "no clue" over the process.

Description: British environment minister Michael Gove said on Tuesday he would not resign after the government was thrown into turmoil when two senior ministers quit in protest at plans for close trade ties with the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: Curb new nuclear plants and back renewables, government advisers say

Headline: May appoints Jeremy Hunt as new foreign minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May appointed Jeremy Hunt as foreign minister on Monday after predecessor Boris Johnson resigned in protest at the government's plans for a close trading relationship with the European Union.

Headline: UK police hunt nerve agent container after woman dies
Description: A woman who died after being poisoned with a nerve agent that also struck a former Russian spy in March must have handled a contaminated item, and tracking it down is key to police investigations, Britain's top counter-terrorism officer said.

Headline: May a 'little surprised' by Johnson resignation - letter

Headline: Conservative lawmakers don't expect confidence vote against PM May after crunch meeting

Headline: Germany still wants end to Brexit talks by October despite Johnson, Davis departures

Headline: Former foreign minister Johnson warns Britain will end up like colony to the EU after Brexit
Description: Former British foreign minister Boris Johnson warned on Monday that the United Kingdom will end up like a colony to the European Union after the government announced plans for a close trading relationship with the bloc after Brexit next year.

Headline: Unclear whether UK lawmakers have numbers to trigger PM May confidence vote - editors say
Description: It was unclear on Monday whether British lawmakers in Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party had the numbers to trigger a confidence vote, political editors said on Monday.

Headline: Lawmakers cheer and bang on tables as PM May arrives at party meeting
Description: Conservative lawmakers cheered, applauded and banged tables as British Prime Minister Theresa May arrived at a meeting of her party in a particularly upbeat welcome.

Headline: Britain will not put Brexit deal to a new referendum - PM May

Headline: How does a leadership challenge to a UK prime minister work?

Headline: PM May says government will publish Brexit policy document on Thursday
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said in parliament the government would publish its so-called white paper Brexit policy document on Thursday.

Headline: Britain must be free to maintain leading position in services after Brexit - May
Description: Britain must be free to protect its leading position in the services sector, including finance, after it leaves the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: PM May aims to name new foreign minister later on Monday - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May plans to name a new foreign minister later on Monday, her spokesman said, after the former Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson resigned in protest at her plans to retain close ties to the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: EU's Tusk raises 'no Brexit' idea in tweet on Johnson
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk raised the idea that Brexit might be called off in a tweet on Monday after Boris Johnson, a campaigner for Britain to leave the EU, resigned as foreign secretary.

Headline: Hammond says he fully supports May's Brexit plan
Description: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond said on Monday that Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan had his full support after Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson and Brexit Secretary David Davis quit within hours of each other.

Headline: Hammond says he fully supports May's Brexit plan
Description: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond said on Monday that Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit plan had his full support after Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson and Brexit Secretary David Davis quit within hours of each other.

Headline: Russian attack led to death of woman from Novichok - UK defence minister
Description: Russia has committed an attack that resulted in the death of a Briton, defence minister Gavin Williamson said on Monday, linking Russia to the incident after a 44 year-old woman who was poisoned by nerve agent Novichok died.

Headline: EU's Tusk raises 'no Brexit' idea in tweet on Johnson
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk raised the idea that Brexit might be called off in a tweet on Monday after Boris Johnson, a campaigner for Britain to leave the EU, resigned as foreign secretary.

Headline: Carillion collapse exposed flaws in UK government policy - MPs
Description: The collapse of Carillion exposed the risks of using private companies to cut the cost of delivering public services and its failure could be repeated if the government does not learn lessons, lawmakers said on Monday.

Headline: Banksy's subversive art draws tourists and locals in Paris
Description: British graffiti artist Banksy, known for his politically charged sketches on walls from London to New York to Gaza City, has descended on Paris, painting a series of murals that are sparking debate among residents and tourists.

Headline: Foreign minister Boris Johnson resigns - PM May's office
Description: British foreign minister Boris Johnson resigned on Monday, following former-Brexit minister David Davis out of the cabinet just days after Prime Minister Theresa May secured a hard-won agreement from senior ministers on an EU exit strategy.

Headline: Russia's UK embassy calls Amesbury poisoning 'anti-Russian provocation'
Description: Russia's embassy to Britain said on Monday it would regard the Amesbury poisoning incident which has left one woman, Dawn Sturgess dead, as an anti-Russian provocation in the absence of access to the investigation.

Headline: UK police say unclear if latest Novichok poisoning linked to attack on Skripals
Description: Britain's top counter-terrorism officer said on Monday that detectives were unable to say if the Novichok that two Britons were exposed to was the same that struck down a former Russian double agent and his daughter.

Headline: Kremlin sorry to hear of death of UK woman exposed to nerve agent
Description: The Kremlin said on Monday it was sorry to hear that a British woman, Dawn Sturgess, had died after being poisoned by a nerve agent, but said any suggestion that Russia was involved would be "quite absurd."

Headline: Factbox - Who is Dominic Raab, Britain's new Brexit minister?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May appointed Dominic Raab as the new Brexit minister on Monday after his predecessor quit in protest at the government's plans for a close trading relationship with the European Union

Headline: EU Commission says to continue talks with Britain after Davis resigns
Description: The European Commission on Monday said it would continue to negotiate with the British government after its Brexit minister David Davis resigned over night.

Headline: May appoints Dominic Raab as new Brexit minister
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May appointed Dominic Raab as the new Brexit Secretary on Monday after his predecessor quit in protest at the government's plans for a close trading relationship with the European Union.

Headline: UK Brexit minister Braverman has not resigned in protest - official
Description: A junior UK Brexit minister Suella Braverman, a leading supporter of leaving the European Union, has not resigned in protest at the government's plans for close trading ties with the bloc, a government official said on Monday.

Headline: May should not face a leadership challenge - ex-Brexit minister Davis
Description: Britain's former Brexit minister David Davis said on Monday he would not encourage his colleagues to try to oust Prime Minister Theresa May, after he quit in protest at her strategy for leaving the European Union.

Headline: Davis says not calling for other resignations
Description: Britain's former Brexit minister David Davis, who resigned on Sunday over Prime Minister Theresa May's plan for leaving the European Union, said he was not calling on other ministers to quit and May could survive his resignation.

Headline: Text - David Davis to May: You are undermining Brexit
Description: The following is David Davis's resignation letter to Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: Brexit department minister Steve Baker resigns - government source
Description: Steve Baker, a minister in the British government's Brexit department has resigned, a government source said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit minister Davis resigns over May's EU exit plan - letter
Description: Brexit minister David Davis said on Monday he had resigned from government because he felt Prime Minister Theresa May's policies were undermining exit negotiations with Brussels and that parliament would not truly regain powers after leaving.

Headline: Brexit department minister Steve Baker resigns - Telegraph
Description: Steve Baker, a minister in Britain's Brexit department, has resigned from the government, the Telegraph newspaper reported on Monday, shortly after the resignation of his boss, Brexit minister David Davis.

Headline: Irish, Austrian PMs welcome UK Brexit plan, questions remain
Description: The prime ministers of Ireland and Austria welcomed Britain's new Brexit plan as a step forward on Sunday but said many questions remained to be answered in the negotiations ahead.

Headline: Ireland says UK Brexit plan a significant move in talks
Description: Britain's new Brexit plan represents a significant move towards a much less disorderly departure from the European Union, though it will not be accepted in full by the 27 other member states, Ireland's foreign minister said on Sunday.

Headline: Leading Brexiter Gove backs May's free trade zone plan as UK cabinet falls into line
Description: One of Britain's most vocal anti-EU cabinet ministers publicly endorsed Prime Minister Theresa May's plan to keep Britain in a free trade zone for goods with the EU, a sign she has so far averted a revolt against a new proposal for a soft Brexit.

Headline: Donald Trump's visit puts Britain's Brexit dependence on show
Description: When Donald Trump visits Britain next week, Prime Minister Theresa May will have to face a harsh reality: Brexit makes Britain more dependent than ever on an alliance with the most unpredictable U.S. president in living memory.

Headline: World Cup success offers cheer and hope to a divided England
Description: Everyone loves a winner, but the English public's embrace of its national team goes beyond the routine pride in sporting success.

Headline: Sajid Javid says risk from latest Novichok poisoning is low
Description: The risk to the public is low from the nerve agent Novichok, exposure to which has left two people critically ill, Britain's Home Secretary Sajid Javid said on Sunday during a visit to the town where they live.

Headline: Police in protective suits investigate latest Novichok poisoning
Description: Police wearing protective suits entered a hostel in the southern English city of Salisbury on Friday as counter-terrorism detectives stepped up their investigation into how two people were exposed to the nerve agent Novichok.

Headline: May wins support from divided government on Brexit plan
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May secured a cabinet agreement on Friday for her plans to leave the European Union, overcoming rifts among her ministers to win support for "a business-friendly" proposal aimed at spurring stalled Brexit talks.

Headline: PM May will sack foreign minister Johnson if he undermines Brexit deal - Times
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has told senior allies she will sack her foreign minister if he seeks to undermine a Brexit negotiating position agreed by her cabinet on Friday, the Times newspaper reported without citing sources.

Headline: EU's Barnier says will assess Brexit proposals to see if 'workable and realistic' - Twitter
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday he would assess the negotiating position agreed by British Prime Minister Theresa May and her cabinet to see if it was workable and realistic.

Headline: PM May reaches deal with cabinet on Brexit strategy
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May agreed Britain's Brexit negotiating position on trade and customs with her cabinet on Friday at a make-or-break meeting with senior ministers at her country residence.

Headline: PM May reaches deal with cabinet on Brexit strategy
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May agreed Britain's Brexit negotiating position on trade and customs with her cabinet on Friday at a make-or-break meeting with senior ministers at her country residence.

Headline: Factbox - Key points from PM May's Brexit negotiating position
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May secured cabinet agreement on Friday for her plans to leave the European Union, overcoming deep rifts among her ministers to win support for "a business-friendly" proposal to try to spur stalled Brexit talks.

Headline: Trump to avoid London protests with tour of English country homes
Description: President Donald Trump would like a quick trade deal with Britain once Brexit is finished, the U.S. ambassador to Britain said on Friday ahead of a presidential visit to London next week that will keep Trump largely away from planned mass protests.

Headline: Factbox - Itinerary of U.S. President Trump's visit to Britain
Description: Donald Trump is steering clear of the mass protests in central London that will mark his first visit to Britain as president next week, instead holding meetings with dignitaries outside the capital at grand country residences and a castle.

Headline: Still too many questions, few answers in Brexit talks - EU's Barnier
Description: There are still too many questions and too few answers in talks between the European Union and Britain over the country's withdrawal from the bloc, EU chief negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday.

Headline: We love Donald Trump - U.S. president's UK fans look forward to visit, denounce protests
Description: Tens of thousands of protesters are expected to turn out against Donald Trump when he visits Britain next week but some believe the protests are an embarrassment and that the U.S. president deserves a warm welcome.

Headline: EDF gets approval to raise heat limit in some UK nuclear reactors
Description: Britain's nuclear regulator said it has approved a request from EDF Energy to increase the maximum operating temperature in the reactors at its Hartlepool and Heysham 1 nuclear plants to avoid reducing reactor power.

Headline: What will ministers discuss at crunch Brexit meeting?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will gather her senior ministers for talks on Friday that she hopes will settle differences in her fractious cabinet about Brexit and unblock stalled talks with the European Union.

Headline: From Churchill to Trump - Key moments in the UK-U.S. special relationship
Description: Since Winston Churchill coined the term "special relationship" after World War Two, the United Kingdom has placed its alliance with the United States at the heart of its foreign and security policy.

Headline: UK demands Russia explain nerve attack after two more people struck down
Description: Britain demanded on Thursday that Russia provide details about the Novichok nerve agent attack on a former double agent and his daughter after two British citizens were struck down with the same poison.

Headline: Labour leader Corbyn urges European leftists to unite against far-right
Description: Europe's social democratic parties must resist cuts to public services or risk seeing their traditional working class supporters switch to backing the anti-immigrant far right, British opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Thursday.

Headline: On eve of key talks with split cabinet, May has new Brexit pitch
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will propose a new plan on Friday to ease trade and give Britain more freedom to set tariffs after Brexit, in a last-ditch attempt to unite her divided government on how to leave the European Union.

Headline: UK business minister confident cabinet will agree Brexit customs plan on Friday
Description: British business minister Greg Clark said he was confident his colleagues would be able to agree a common position on a future customs deal with the European Union when Prime Minister Theresa May calls them together for a crunch meeting on Friday.

Headline: Britain can strike trade deal with U.S. under new Brexit plan - PM May's spokeswoman
Description: A spokeswoman for British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday it was wrong to suggest that a new Brexit customs proposal would prevent Britain from striking a new trade deal with the United States.

Headline: Mayor of London says 'Trump baby' protest blimp can fly
Description: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan will allow protesters to fly a blimp over parliament portraying Donald Trump as an orange, snarling baby during the U.S. president's upcoming visit, Khan's office said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain's May proposes new customs plan to divided government
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will propose on Friday a new plan to ease trade and offer Britain more freedom to set tariffs after Brexit, a last-ditch attempt to unite her divided government on plans to leave the European Union.

Headline: Time is pressing on Brexit negotiations - Merkel
Description: Time is pressing in Britain's negotiations with the European Union on its departure from the bloc, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Thursday before talks with British Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: UK will consider further action against Russia if it is behind poisoning - minister
Description: Britain will consider what further action it should take against Russia if it is proven that the Kremlin was responsible for the nerve agent poisoning of two Britons, interior minister Sajid Javid said on Thursday.

Headline: British PM May says new Novichok poisoning deeply disturbing
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday it was deeply disturbing to see two British citizens poisoned by the Novichok nerve agent.

Headline: Latest UK poisoning is same strand of Novichok used against Russian spy - Javid
Description: The poison that struck down two Britons has been identified as the same strand of Novichok nerve agent that was used in the attempted murder in March of a former Russian agent and his daughter, Britain's interior minister Sajid Javid said on Thursday.

Headline: UK notifies OPCW about latest poisoning incident - PM May's spokesman
Description: Britain has notified the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) of the latest poisoning in England involving the Novichok nerve agent, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: UK poisoning looks like an unfortunate after-effect of Skripal incident - minister
Description: The poisoning of two Britons with the Novichok nerve agent looks like an unfortunate after effect of the attempted murder in March of a former Russian agent and his daughter, Britain's health minister Jeremy Hunt said on Thursday.

Headline: Kremlin says offered Britain Salisbury attack help, was rebuffed
Description: The Kremlin said on Thursday it had offered Britain its assistance in investigating a nerve agent attack on a Russian former spy and his daughter in Salisbury in March long ago, but had been rebuffed.

Headline: From Mugabe to Xi, Trump joins leaders Queen Elizabeth has met amid protests
Description: Protesters are planning demonstrations when U.S. President Donald Trump arrives in Britain next week for talks with Prime Minister Theresa May and a meeting with Queen Elizabeth.

Headline: Trump to meet Queen despite chorus of discontent
Description: When Donald Trump meets Queen Elizabeth next week, he will become the 12th U.S. President that the monarch has met during her 66 years on the throne, the longest in British history.

Headline: Blood and treasure or fantasy: What is the UK-U.S. 'special relationship'?
Description: Britain's so-called 'special relationship' with the United States was one of the most enduring alliances of the 20th Century, though Brexit and the election of U.S. President Donald Trump have raised questions about its future.

Headline: UK to invest 420 million pounds to lift construction productivity
Description: Britain's government announced what it said was the largest investment in at least a decade to speed up home-building on Thursday, which will see 420 million pounds of public and private money spent on new construction technology.

Headline: MPs oppose plan to remove local role in fracking decisions
Description: British government plans to transfer shale oil and gas exploration planning decisions from local authorities to the national level will be a backward step and harm local democracy, a cross-party committee of UK lawmakers warned on Thursday.

Headline: Britain 'dumb' if it thinks Russia would stage nerve attack during World Cup - Russian diplomats
Description: Britain is foolish if it believes Russia staged a new nerve agent attack in England in the middle of the soccer World Cup, Russia's embassy to the Netherlands wrote on social media on Thursday.

Headline: Javid to make statement on Wiltshire incident - House of Commons leader
Description: Interior minister Sajid Javid will on Thursday make a statement to parliament on the nerve agent poisoning of two Britons, the leader of the House of Commons said.

Headline: Factbox - A few facts about the nerve agent Novichok
Description: Two British citizens are critically ill after they were exposed to the Novichok nerve agent which struck down a former Russian agent and his daughter in March, Britain's top counter-terrorism officer said on Wednesday.

Headline: Javid to make statement on Wiltshire incident - House of Commons leader
Description: Interior minister Sajid Javid will on Thursday make a statement to parliament on the nerve agent poisoning of two Britons, the leader of the House of Commons said.

Headline: Two Britons poisoned with Novichok nerve agent near where Russian spy was struck down
Description: Two British citizens are critically ill after they were exposed to Novichok, the same nerve agent that struck down a former Russian agent and his daughter in March, Britain's top counter-terrorism officer said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK should ask for Russian help to investigate new poisoning - Russian lawmaker
Description: Britain should ask Russian experts to help investigate a new poisoning incident involving a nerve agent, Vladimir Shamanov, head of the Russian parliament's defence committee, was cited as saying by the RIA news agency on Thursday.

Headline: UK calls on Russia to give details after new Novichok poisoning
Description: Britain's security minister called on Russia to give details about the Novichok nerve agent attack on a former double agent and his daughter after two British citizens were poisoned with the same substance.

Headline: Britain's emergency committee to meet on Thursday over Wiltshire incident
Description: Britain's interior minister said he would chair a meeting of the government's emergency committee on Thursday to discuss the exposure of two people in southern England to the nerve agent Novichok.

Headline: UK counter-terrorism chief says two people in Wiltshire poisoned with Novichok nerve agent
Description: Britain's counter-terrorism chief said on Wednesday that two people who are critically ill in hospital in Wiltshire were exposed to the Novichok nerve agent, the same toxin that was used in an attack on ex-Russian spy Sergei Skripal.

Headline: Risk to UK public remains low after two people exposed to Novichok - chief medic
Description: England's Chief Medical Officer said on Wednesday the risk to the general public remained low after a man and woman became exposed to the Novichok nerve agent in southern England.

Headline: UK police chief says no intelligence Wiltshire pair were deliberately targeted
Description: Britain's counter-terrorism police chief said on Wednesday that there was no intelligence to indicate that a man and a woman exposed to a nerve agent in southern England had been deliberately targeted.

Headline: Police keeping open mind after possible poisoning near Salisbury
Description: Police said on Wednesday they were keeping an open mind about whether a crime had been committed after a British man and woman in their forties fell critically ill near the southwestern city of Salisbury, where Russian former spy Sergei Skripal was poisoned in March.

Headline: Pro-Brexit campaign group may have broken spending rules, former CEO says
Description: Britain's Electoral Commission is preparing to find the official campaign to leave the European Union guilty of breaking election law during the 2016 referendum, according to the former chief executive of the group.

Headline: UK officials to meet over Wiltshire incident - PM May's spokesman
Description: British officials are expected to meet later on Wednesday to discuss the case of two people whose possible poisoning is being investigated by counter-terrorism police, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said.

Headline: May couldn't watch 'nerve-wracking' England shootout win
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May found it too nerve-wracking to watch the final moments of the England soccer team's nail-biting win over Colombia late on Tuesday night, her spokesman said.

Headline: McVey apologises for misleading parliament but keeps her job
Description: Britain's welfare minister Esther McVey apologised on Wednesday for making misleading remarks to parliament about a controversial reform but did not publicly offer her resignation.

Headline: Wiltshire incident being treated with utmost seriousness - PM May's spokesman
Description: The case of two people whose possible poisoning is being investigated by counter-terrorism police is being treated with the "utmost seriousness", a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK wants to set own fishing access rules after Brexit - document
Description: Britain wants to decide how much access to its fishing grounds it gives after it leaves the European Union, according to a policy document on Wednesday.

Headline: Arch-Brexiteer Gove says - No senior British ministers will resign over Brexit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will not face any ministerial resignations after a meeting of her senior ministers on Friday to resolve differences over leaving the European Union, environment minister Michael Gove said on Wednesday.

Headline: May to pitch 'softest possible Brexit' plan to team - ITV
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will present to her team a new proposal for trade with the European Union that in effect comprises the "softest possible Brexit", ITV's political editor reported on Tuesday, citing sources.

Headline: Days from Brexit crunch meeting, May calls for unity
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has called on her Conservative Party to "stand together" over Brexit, days before a crunch meeting she hopes will overcome bitter rifts over how Britain should leave the European Union.

Headline: Britain moves closer to legalising medicinal use of cannabis
Description: Britain moved a step closer to legalising the medicinal use of cannabis after a report concluded there are benefits for patients as the government reviews the rules to allow drugs derived from the banned plant.

Headline: May looking forward to full discussion with cabinet on Brexit - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told her cabinet on Tuesday that she was looking forward to a full discussion on Brexit policy where decisions will be taken on the future partnership with the European Union, her spokesman said.

Headline: Dutch PM Rutte - Clarity urgently needed about EU-UK relationship
Description: Clarity is quickly required on "every aspect" of the future relationship between the European Union and Britain, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said on Tuesday after meeting his British counterpart Theresa May.

Headline: UK healthcare worker arrested on suspicion of murdering eight babies
Description: A British female healthcare worker has been arrested on suspicion of murdering eight babies and trying to murder six others after an investigation into deaths at a neonatal unit in northern England, police said on Tuesday.

Headline: MPs ask Hammond and Carney for Brexit impact studies
Description: Lawmakers have asked Chancellor Philip Hammond and Bank of England Governor Mark Carney to produce and publish analyses on the impact of Brexit ahead of a vote on the final divorce deal with the European Union.

Headline: Accountancy and law firms tell May - We need a Brexit deal on services
Description: A group of leading accountancy and law firms have called on British Prime Minister Theresa May to strike a Brexit deal on services that gives mutual recognition of regulations and qualifications to prevent damage to the $250 billion (190.42 billion pounds) sector.

Headline: May gets new customs idea as party bickers over Brexit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's advisers have come up with a new proposal for handling customs with the EU after Brexit as lawmakers in her party bicker before a crunch meeting of senior ministers on Friday.

Headline: May wants future customs relationship with EU by end of 2020
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she wanted a future customs relationship with the European Union in place by the end of 2020 so that a backstop arrangement for the border between the north and south of Ireland would not be required.

Headline: May to EU - Parliament will reject exit deal without clarity on future relationship
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she warned European Union leaders last week that the British parliament will not approve Britain's EU exit deal unless there is clarity on what its future relationship with the bloc will look like.

Headline: Brexit clouds UK financial sector mood
Description: Banks' Brexit worries were a key theme in a quarterly survey of Britain's financial services sector, published on Monday, even though business sentiment stabilised in the second quarter, ending a near two-year slide, and recruitment picked up.

Headline: Barclays shifting 50 jobs to Frankfurt as Brexit planning accelerates
Description: Barclays has begun shifting 40 to 50 investment banking jobs from Britain to Frankfurt as part of its plans to continue doing business in the European Union after Britain leaves the bloc in 2019, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headline: Barclays shifting 50 jobs to Frankfurt as Brexit planning accelerates
Description: Barclays has begun shifting 40 to 50 investment banking jobs from Britain to Frankfurt as part of its plans to continue doing business in the European Union after Britain leaves the bloc in 2019, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headline: UK PM May's spokesman refuses to comment on reported new post-Brexit customs plan
Description: A spokesman for British Prime Minister Theresa May said he would not speculate about Brexit policy options ahead of a meeting of ministers later this week, after a report said officials have drafted a new way of handling customs with the European Union.

Headline: NHS has started planning for Brexit no deal
Description: Britain's public health service has started "significant planning" to ensure medicines are still supplied to patients if the government fails to negotiate a Brexit deal with the European Union, its head said on Sunday.

Headline: Conservative lawmakers pile Brexit pressure on May
Description: More than 30 Conservative lawmakers have signed a letter demanding Theresa May "get tough" in negotiations to leave the European Union, increasing the pressure on the British prime minister before a crunch government meeting.

Headline: Put your cards on the table, EU makes last Brexit call to Britain
Description: The European Union issued Prime Minister Theresa May a final Brexit warning on Friday -- put your cards on the table, offer ways to overcome "huge" differences and prevent Britain from crashing out of the bloc without a deal.

Headline: Britain, Ireland agree to convene joint Northern Irish consultative body
Description: The British and Irish governments agreed for the first time in over a decade on Thursday to convene a British-Irish cooperative body as Dublin seeks a greater say in the running of Northern Ireland amid a political deadlock there.

Headline: May wants good Brexit deal for UK, EU
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday she wanted a Brexit deal that worked for Britain and the European Union, including a "strong and deep" security partnership.

Headline: Hazard at No.10 - Belgian PM's World Cup dig at May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is used to being isolated in Europe and looked to be on her own again on Thursday in Brussels as England faced Belgium at the World Cup.

Headline: Protect your people, May urges EU leaders
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May urged the European Union on Thursday to consider Europe's safety before cutting Britain adrift from its security architecture, as she sought to push Brexit talks forward to address future ties.

Headline: British lawmaker eyes tribunal to help small firms challenge banks
Description: Small businesses that are victims of fraud, conspiracy and misconduct by British banks could soon be able to sue their lenders in a tribunal dedicated to helping them bring banks to justice without fear of financial ruin.

Headline: British spies complicit in torture of suspected militants - lawmakers' report
Description: British spies were complicit in the mistreatment of hundreds of suspected militants by the United States and involved in dozens of cases of their illegal transfer, according to the findings of a committee of lawmakers.

Headline: UK watchdog urged to cap pension charges to end 'rip-offs'
Description: Britain's markets watchdog should cap charges on drawdown of pension savings after "glacial" progress in stopping customers being ripped off, a senior lawmaker said on Thursday.

Headline: Kenya says four police face arrest over death of British aristocrat's son
Description: Kenyan prosecutors on Thursday ordered the arrest of four police officers on murder charges over the death of the son of a British aristocrat.

Headline: Chemical arms watchdog wins right to assign blame for attacks
Description: The world's chemical weapons watchdog won new powers on Wednesday to assign blame for attacks with banned toxic munitions, a diplomatic victory for Britain just months after a former Russian spy was poisoned on its territory.

Headline: Sturgeon prepares for early UK election ahead of Brexit
Description: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon has moved one of her key allies into a campaigning role because she thinks the United Kingdom could hold a national election just before it is due to leave the European Union.

Headline: British royals to move out of Buckingham Palace wing for repairs
Description: Britain's royal family are to move out of the famous front wing of London's Buckingham Palace later this year as part of a multi-million pound building repair project, palace aides said on Thursday.

Headline: Prince William pays first official British royal visit to occupied West Bank
Description: Prince William paid the first official British royal visit to the Palestinian Territories on Wednesday, touring a refugee camp and telling Palestinians "you have not been forgotten."

Headline: UK's top court grants heterosexual couple right to civil partnership
Description: Britain's Supreme Court has ruled in favour of allowing a heterosexual couple the right to enter into a civil partnership, previously a union only eligible to those of the same sex.

Headline: Britain's Prince William tells Palestinians "you have not been forgotten"
Description: Prince William, paying the first official British royal visit to the Palestinian Territories on Wednesday, told Palestinians they had not been forgotten and his trip to the West Bank was a "very powerful one".

Headline: Inquest should hear if Russian whistleblower worked for UK before death - lawyer
Description: Britain should disclose whether Alexander Perepilichny, a Russian whistleblower who died in 2012, had been working for UK intelligence as it is relevant to suspicions that he was murdered, an inquest heard on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain should delay Brexit to avoid no-deal scenario, Tony Blair says
Description: Former Prime Minister Tony Blair said on Wednesday the government should be ready to ask the European Union for more time to complete divorce talks to avoid the risk of leaving without a deal.

Headline: Russian minister - future of chemicals body OPCW in question after vote
Description: Russia's Industry Minister on Wednesday said the future of the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) was in doubt after member states voted - over objections by Moscow - to empower it to assign blame for attacks.

Headline: 'Staggering' Bank of England expenses payments shock MP
Description: The Bank of England has paid out "staggering" sums on expenses to two members of its Financial Policy Committee (FPC), a lawmaker from a top parliament committee said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK PM May says will consider civil partnership court ruling with care
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told parliament on Wednesday she would consider with great care a Supreme Court ruling in favour of allowing a heterosexual couple to enter into a civil partnership.

Headline: Prince William enters occupied West Bank to meet Palestinian president
Description: Britain's Prince William travelled to the Israeli-occupied West Bank on Wednesday to meet Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas.

Headline: Britain is underestimating true size of EU divorce bill, say MPs
Description: The British government's estimate of how much it will have to pay the European Union as part of its divorce settlement is at least 10 billion pounds too low, a committee of MPs said on Wednesday.

Headline: Harry and Meghan greet young leaders at Queen's reception
Description: Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle were among those who greeted the winners of a special youth leadership award from Queen Elizabeth on Tuesday.

Headline: Greece wants Parthenon Marbles back, Tsipras tells May
Description: Greece wants the Parthenon Marbles back from the British Museum,  Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras said in London on Tuesday, trying to reinvigorate a longstanding campaign for the 2,500-year-old  treasures.

Headline: Prince William brings message of homage, hope on first Israel visit
Description: Prince William envisaged a strong future for Israel while making the first official British royal visit to the country on Tuesday and pledged to commemorate the Holocaust that contributed to its foundation.

Headline: UK, allies - empower chemical arms watchdog to assign blame for attacks
Description: Britain's Foreign Minister Boris Johnson called on Tuesday for all nations to vote to bolster the powers of the chemical weapons watchdog, saying it should be able to assign blame for attacks with banned poison munitions.

Headline: Prince William says Yad Vashem visit was "profoundly moving"
Description: Britain's Prince William said in a speech during a reception at the British Ambassador's residence on Tuesday to welcome him that his visit to Israel's Yad Vashem Holocaust memorial centre in Jerusalem had been a "profoundly moving experience."

Headline: Meghan's father - If Queen meets Trump, she should meet me too
Description: Thomas Markle, whose daughter Meghan married Britain's Prince Harry last month, said that if Queen Elizabeth meets U.S. President Donald Trump next month, she should also make time to meet him, the TMZ website reported.

Headline: Queen approves Brexit law that will end membership of EU
Description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth granted royal assent to Prime Minister Theresa May's flagship Brexit legislation on Tuesday, ending months of debate over the legislation that will formally end the country's European Union membership.

Headline: Britain's Johnson - chemical weapons watchdog should be given new powers
