Headline: As Zuckerberg heads to Brussels, MPs ask for answers
Description: MPs want their European counterparts to quiz Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg about a scandal over improper use of millions of Facebook users' data, as he will not give evidence in London himself.

Headline: Bereaved father weeps for lost baby at London's Grenfell fire inquiry
Description: Survivors of London's deadly Grenfell Tower fire wept on Monday as they listened to a bereaved father pay tribute to his baby son and heard a recording of another victim making his last phone call from the burning building.

Headline: Bereaved father weeps for lost baby at London's Grenfell fire inquiry
Description: Survivors of London's deadly Grenfell Tower fire wept on Monday as they listened to a bereaved father pay tribute to his baby son and heard a recording of another victim making his last phone call from the burning building.

Headline: London's Chelsea Flower Show display pays tribute to Windrush Generation
Description: Britain's most prestigious flower show, a celebration of the genteel world of gardening, opens this week with a tribute to the "Windrush" generation of Caribbean migrants whose recent treatment has provoked a political scandal.

Headline: Decontamination of shopping centre after nerve agent attack on Russian spy completed
Description: A shopping centre in the English city where a former Russian spy was found collapsed with his daughter after a nerve agent attack more than two months ago has been successfully decontaminated, Britain's environment department said on Monday.

Headline: Ambitious bids were sought for failed British rail line, MPs told
Description: Britain's Department for Transport (DfT) encouraged "ambitious" bidding on revenue projections for the failed East Coast main line contract, a rail expert told MPs on Monday.

Headline: Former London mayor Livingstone quits Labour over antisemitism accusations
Description: Former London mayor Ken Livingstone resigned from the Labour Party on Monday, saying that a row over anti-Semitism allegations against him had become a distraction for the party's leadership.

Headline: May's spokesman says cannot comment on Russian billionaire's Abramovich visa delay
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday the government could not comment on why Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich's visa was yet to be renewed.

Headline: 'I am proud to be a feminist' - Will Meghan shake-up Britain's royals?
Description: A biography of Britain's latest royal, Meghan Markle, appeared on the monarchy's official website within hours of her marrying Queen Elizabeth's grandson Prince Harry on Saturday, with a single quote: "I am proud to be a woman and a feminist".

Headline: Network Rail names aviation regulator head as new CEO
Description: Britain's Network Rail named Andrew Haines as its new chief executive on Monday, bringing in the current head of the country's aviation regulator to lead the state-owned rail infrastructure company.

Headline: May challenges scientists to help transform Britain after Brexit
Description: Britain's prime minister challenged scientists on Monday to help diagnose cancer earlier and create zero-emission cars, trying to reboot an industrial strategy all but eclipsed by Brexit, while acknowledging Britain's reliance on foreign scientists.

Headline: Meghan and Harry release official photos of their royal wedding
Description: Prince Harry and his wife Meghan on Monday thanked all those involved in their lavish wedding at the weekend as they released official photographs from their big day.

Headline: Britain more welcoming to migrants, says Brexit-supporting minister Gove
Description: Britain has become more welcoming to migration since it voted to leave the European Union, environment minister and leading Brexit campaigner Michael Gove said on Monday.

Headline: Kremlin says UK's 'dirty money' report is Russophobic, unfair competition
Description: The Kremlin said on Monday a report drawn up by British lawmakers about "dirty" Russian money was evidence of Russophobic hysteria in Britain and unfair competition against Russian business.

Headline: London underground drivers to hold two days of strike in June - union
Description: London commuters will face major disruption next month after the train divers' union said on Monday it would stage two 24-hour strikes on the underground rail line which serves the Canary Wharf financial district.

Headline: Now is not the time for Scottish independence vote - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May believes that now is not the time for a second referendum on Scottish independence, her spokesman said on Monday, adding there was no appetite for one.

Headline: Cuadrilla files injunction to stop trespassing at shale gas site
Description: British shale gas exploration company Cuadrilla has filed papers to a court seeking an injunction forbidding trespassing at its Preston New Road site in Lancashire, it said on Monday.

Headline: Meghan loved her veil embroidered with tribute to the Commonwealth - designer
Description: When Meghan Markle walked down the aisle to marry Prince Harry on Saturday, she had with her the 53 countries of the Commonwealth - each one represented in the embroidery of her veil.

Headline: In a union of tradition and modernity, U.S actress Meghan marries Prince Harry
Description: Prince Harry and his actress bride Meghan Markle married on Saturday in a dazzling ceremony that blended ancient English ritual with African American culture, infusing the 1,000-year-old British monarchy with a blast of modernity.

Headline: With Brexit clarity, Scotland will look again at independence - Sturgeon
Description: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Sunday she would again consider another vote on independence for Scotland when the British government offers some certainty over Brexit.

Headline: Socialist Britain will not be 'ripped off any more' under Labour - McDonnell
Description: Britain's main opposition Labour Party wants to radically transform the economy, forming a Socialist society where "we're not going to get ripped off any more", its finance policy chief, John McDonnell, said on Sunday.

Headline: Britain to tackle 'Wild West' internet with new laws
Description: Britain will tackle "the Wild West elements" on the internet from cyberbullying to online child exploitation by introducing new laws for social media companies, digital minister Matt Hancock said on Sunday.

Headline: Meghan Markle picks simple, sleek dress by Givenchy designer for wedding
Description: Meghan Markle picked a sleek sculpted dress by the British designer of couture house Givenchy for her marriage to Prince Harry on Saturday, worn with a five-metre long veil and a sparkling diamond tiara lent by Queen Elizabeth.

Headline: Reuters photographers pick their best royal wedding picture
Description: Patience, meticulous preparation and a big dose of luck were among the elements that Reuters photographers were counting on when they took up their positions to cover the UK royal wedding.

Headline: Ryanair's Irish union threatens possible strike
Description: Ryanair’s Irish union has given the company until May 24 to agree to new working practices, or it will ballot pilots for possible industrial action, including strikes.

Headline: African-Americans hail royal wedding's nod to black history, culture
Description: Hometown and racial pride fired up royal wedding watchers across the United States on Saturday, from pre-dawn partiers wearing pajamas and fancy hats in Los Angeles to Twitter posts from Miami to Indianapolis hailing "the blackest royal wedding the U.K. has ever seen."

Headline: U.S. bishop wows royal wedding with impassioned sermon on love
Description: African-American bishop Michael Curry electrified the wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle with a barnstorming sermon on the power of love that won smiles in the ancient British chapel and praise across the internet.

Headline: Worlds away from Windsor, people celebrate Harry and Meghan's big day
Description: From the windswept Falkland Islands, battered by the South Atlantic and home to colonies of penguins, to the heat of Kenya, India and Australia, people around the world celebrated Britain's glittering royal wedding on Saturday.

Headline: A royal reception feast for 600: langoustines, quail eggs and rhubarb tartlets
Description: Guests of Prince Harry and his new wife Meghan were set to tuck into dishes including Scottish langoustines, grilled asparagus and rhubarb crumble tartlets at a lunchtime reception for the newlyweds.

Headline: 'The Power of Love' - address by U.S. bishop at Harry and Meghan's wedding
Description: Following is the text of the address by U.S. Episcopalian bishop, Michael Bruce Curry, at the wedding of Britain's Prince Harry and American actress Meghan Markle, as released by Kensington Palace on Saturday.

Headline: Air traffic controllers give Harry and Meghan the gift of silence
Description: British air traffic controllers gave Prince Harry and Meghan Markle a rare wedding gift - 15 minutes of guaranteed peace and quiet for the ceremony without the roar of airliners passing overhead.

Headline: Diana's favourite flowers adorn her son's wedding chapel
Description: White roses - the favourite flowers of Prince Harry's late mother Diana - arched over the organ loft and West Door of St George's chapel, where he will marry American actress Meghan Markle on Saturday.

Headline: Diana's favourite flowers adorn her son's wedding chapel
Description: White roses - the favourite flowers of Prince Harry's late mother Diana - arched over the organ loft and West Door of St George's chapel, where he will marry American actress Meghan Markle on Saturday.

Headline: Wedding ring of Welsh gold for Meghan Markle, platinum ring for Prince Harry, Palace says
Description: U.S. actress Meghan Markle will wear a wedding ring made from Welsh gold gifted by Queen Elizabeth when she marries her grandson Prince Harry on Saturday, his office said.

Headline: All aboard for the royal wedding: excitement builds on trains to Windsor
Description: Waking up with a black coffee as her train rolled out of London, Pam Boothby explained how she had not missed a royal wedding in four decades - not even when it fell on her child's birthday or when she lived abroad.

Headline: Oprah Winfrey arrives at Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding
Description: American media mogul Oprah Winfrey was among the first celebrity guests to arrive at the wedding of Britain's Prince Harry and Meghan Markle on Saturday.

Headline: Prince Harry named Duke of Sussex, Markle to be a duchess
Description: Prince Harry was given the title Duke of Sussex by his grandmother Queen Elizabeth on Saturday, Buckingham Palace said, meaning his American fiancee Meghan Markle will become a duchess after the couple wed later.

Headline: After cold nights on Windsor streets, royal super-fans thrilled as big day dawns
Description: Donna Werner, an American who has spent four nights on the streets in Windsor to secure a prime position for Saturday's royal wedding, was cold and stiff as dawn broke but looking forward to catching a glimpse of the newly weds.

Headline: Factbox: Timings for Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding
Description: Britain's Prince Harry and fiancée Meghan Markle marry on Saturday in a ceremony that brings together royalty and Hollywood glamour. [L5N1SQ03V]

Headline: Cheering crowds greet Harry on walkabout ahead of UK wedding extravaganza
Description: Crowds of well-wishers cheered Britain's Prince Harry as he made an impromptu walkabout on Friday outside the ancient walls of Windsor Castle on the eve of his wedding to U.S. actress Meghan Markle.

Headline: Meghan Markle to follow in thousand years of UK royal history at wedding
Description: When Meghan Markle walks down the aisle at St George's Chapel in Windsor to marry Prince Harry, she will be following in the footsteps trod by England's royals for nearly a thousand years.

Headline: Britain's Queen Elizabeth meets Meghan Markle's mother
Description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip met Meghan Markle's mother, Doria Ragland, on the eve of Prince Harry's wedding to the U.S. actress at Windsor Castle, Buckingham Palace said.

Headline: Princes Harry and William go on Windsor walkabout to greet fans before wedding
Description: Britain's Prince Harry and elder brother, Prince William, left Windsor Castle on Friday to greet royal fans ahead of Harry's wedding on Saturday to U.S. actress Meghan Markle.

Headline: Factbox - Prince Harry, Queen Elizabeth's grandson
Description: Prince Harry, the grandson of Britain's Queen Elizabeth, marries his fiancée, U.S. actress Meghan Markle, at the monarch's home in Windsor on May 19.

Headline: Factbox - Meghan Markle, the U.S. actress joining the UK royal family
Description: U.S. actress Meghan Markle will join Britain's royal family when she marries Queen Elizabeth's grandson Prince Harry on Saturday.

Headline: Uber files appeal against licence loss in Brighton
Description: Uber submitted an appeal on Friday against the decision by the southern coastal English city of Brighton to strip the taxi app of its licence for not being "fit and proper" over data concerns and the use of drivers from outside the area.

Headline: Russian ex-spy Sergei Skripal discharged from UK hospital
Description: Sergei Skripal, the Russian former spy who was left in critical condition by a nerve agent attack in Britain more than two months ago, has been discharged from hospital, national health authorities said on Friday.

Headline: Putin - Skripal would be dead if poisoned by weapons grade agent
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that former Russian spy Sergei Skripal would be dead if a weapons grade agent had been used to poison him.

Headline: Prince Philip to attend wedding of Harry and Meghan Markle
Description: Queen Elizabeth's 96-year-old husband, Prince Philip, will attend this weekend's wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, Buckingham Palace said on Friday.

Headline: Father of groom, Prince Charles, to walk Meghan Markle down aisle at royal wedding
Description: Meghan Markle has asked Britain's heir to the throne, Prince Charles, to walk her down the aisle on Saturday at her wedding to his son Prince Harry after her own father had to pull out because of ill health.

Headline: Harry and Meghan's cake will break with tradition, says royal wedding baker
Description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding cake has taken six bakers five days to prepare and breaks with tradition, according to its designer Claire Ptak.

Headline: Ecuador orders withdrawal of extra Assange security from embassy in London
Description: The president of Ecuador, Lenin Moreno, ordered the withdrawal on Thursday of additional security assigned to the Ecuadorian embassy in London, where WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has remained for almost six years.

Headline: With carriage rehearsal, Britain gears up for Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding
Description: Britain's armed forces will on Thursday rehearse the carriage procession that Prince Harry and American actress Meghan Markle are to make through the crowded streets of Windsor after their wedding this weekend.

Headline: PM May says Britain will leave customs union, to offer Ireland backstop
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday Britain would leave the EU customs union after Brexit but a source said London was considering a backstop plan that would apply the bloc's external tariffs beyond December 2020.

Headline: UK to put forward Northern Ireland backstop proposal shortly:  PM May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain will soon put forward its proposal for a backstop arrangement to prevent a hard border with EU member Ireland, Prime Minister Theresa May told European Union officials on Thursday, her spokeswoman said.

Headline: American 'super-fan' to sleep on Windsor streets for glimpse of royal couple
Description: For Donna Werner, an American, travelling more than seven hours and 3,000 miles will all have been worth it if she just gets a look and a wave from Britain's newly-married royal couple on Saturday.

Headline: UK announces extra measures to support shale gas development
Description: The British government announced measures on Thursday to speed up planning applications to support development of the country's shale gas industry.

Headline: Britain cuts top stake on gambling machines on addiction fears
Description: Britain will cut the maximum stake on fixed-odds betting terminals to just two pounds after the government opted to try to tackle problem gambling and rejected claims that such a big reduction could cost thousands of jobs.

Headline: Sleeping out on the streets of Windsor - Royal fans join the homeless
Description: Across the road from Queen Elizabeth's Windsor Castle home, Lewis Davis huddles under bus shelter, one of the many town's homeless people who sleep rough in doorways in the genteel town.

Headline: UK could ban combustible materials in tall buildings after Grenfell fire
Description: Britain could ban the use of combustible materials on high-rise buildings in response to the Grenfell Tower fire that killed 71 people last June, the housing minister said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain rehearses carriage procession for Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding
Description: British armed forces carried out a carriage procession rehearsal through the ancient streets of Windsor on Thursday ahead of Prince Harry's wedding on Saturday to Meghan Markle.

Headline: UK still negotiating with EU over Brexit backstop - May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain is still negotiating with the European Union over a workable backstop arrangement if any Brexit deal is delayed, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: UK still negotiating with EU over Brexit backstop - May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain is still negotiating with the European Union over a workable backstop arrangement if any Brexit deal is delayed, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: Bookies William Hill, Paddy Power set out cost of new gambling curbs
Description: Bookmakers William Hill  and Paddy Power Betfair  said plans to cut the maximum stake on fixed odd betting terminals in Britain to two pounds would hit gaming revenue hard.

Headline: May insists Britain leaving EU customs union
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May denied on Thursday she was "climbing down" on plans to leave the EU customs union.

Headline: UK dismisses report that it could stay in customs union after 2021
Description: A source in Theresa May's Downing Street office has dismissed a media report saying that Britain would tell Brussels it was prepared to stay in the European Union's customs union beyond 2021.

Headline: No time frame for UK's cut in gambling machine stakes - minister
Description: The British government has not set an exact timetable for implementing a decision to slash the maximum stake on fixed odds betting terminals to 2 pounds from the current 100 pounds, the minister responsible for the sector said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain seeks 30 billion pounds investment to boost economy after Brexit
Description: Trade secretary Liam Fox will invite overseas investors on Thursday to submit bids for financing 30 billion pounds of projects to help the world's sixth-largest economy cope with the upheaval of leaving the European Union.

Headline: Meghan Markle's Los Angeles school toasts its most famous alumna
Description: With a choreographed dance routine and plenty of British and American flags, students at the Los Angeles school attended by American actress Meghan Markle saluted their most famous alumna on Tuesday, days before she is to wed Britain's Prince Harry.

Headline: UK to tell EU it is ready to stay in customs union beyond 2021 - Telegraph
Description: Britain will tell Brussels it is prepared to stay in the European Union's customs union beyond 2021 as ministers remained deadlocked over a future deal with the bloc, the Telegraph newspaper reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Matt Hancock cuts top stake on FOBT to £2 - The Sun
Description: Media secretary Matt Hancock has said that the highest stake on fixed odds betting terminals (FOBT) will be cut to 2 pounds, The Sun reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Remote control parking to become legal in Britain
Description: British motorists will be able to use an app on their phone or a key fob to park their cars remotely from next month as a new law is introduced, in the latest drive towards self-driving and connected cars.

Headline: Britain to renationalise rail line sparking new row over ownership
Description: The British government is renationalising the rail route between London and Edinburgh, taking back the line from a private company after it over-estimated profits, in a step likely to reignite a debate over public ownership of the UK's railways.

Headline: UK government suffers new Brexit defeat as Lords demand environment safeguards
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government on Wednesday suffered its 15th defeat on legislation that will end Britain's membership of the European Union when parliament's upper chamber voted in favour of adding environmental safeguards to the bill.

Headline: May defeats Labour bid to force her hand on customs
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May defeated a bid by the opposition Labour Party on Wednesday to force her government to disclose details of its two Brexit customs proposals, thwarting efforts to embarrass her divided team.

Headline: May defeats Labour challenge on Brexit customs proposals
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May defeated an attempt by the opposition Labour Party on Wednesday to force her government to reveal details of its two Brexit customs proposals, thwarting efforts to embarrass her divided team.

Headline: West's knowledge of Novichok came from sample secured in 1990s - report
Description: The West's knowledge of the secret Russian nerve agent that Britain says was used to poison an ex-spy and his daughter came from a sample obtained by Germany in the 1990s, German media reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Wrongly locked up after decades in UK, Windrush victims speak out

Headline: New East Coast rail franchise to be public-private partnership - minister
Description: Britain will replace Stagecoach's East Coast rail franchise with a public-private partnership that will connect London with Edinburgh, transport minister Chris Grayling said on Wednesday, after he announced a renationalisation of the route.

Headline: First 'plastic free' label to help shoppers curb pollution

Headline: Too busy to watch? Corbyn to miss royal wedding show

Headline: UK Northern Ireland minister says there will be no new cameras on the border after Brexit

Headline: Meghan Markle's dad says will miss wedding, needs heart procedure - TMZ.com
Description: Meghan Markle's father said on Tuesday he could not attend his daughter's wedding to Prince Harry in London because he needs to undergo a heart procedure, celebrity website TMZ.com reported.

Headline: Britain to publish Brexit position paper before June summit
Description: The British government will publish detailed plans for its future relationship with the European Union next month in an attempt to break the deadlock in Brexit negotiations.

Headline: Cups and condoms: vendors offer up array of royal wedding memorabilia
Description: From masks and mugs to tea-bags and even condoms, royal fans can get their hands on all sorts of memorabilia to commemorate Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's upcoming wedding.

Headline: UK to detail 2040 new petrol and diesel car ban in weeks ahead

Headline: Scottish parliament refuses consent for Britain's EU withdrawal bill

Headline: Scottish parliament refuses consent for Britain's EU withdrawal bill
Description: The Scottish parliament refused consent for Britain's flagship Brexit legislation on Tuesday, pushing Britain into constitutionally uncharted territory as London presses ahead with the bill regardless.

Headline: UK minister says Brexit deal must avoid new supply chain frictions

Headline: Meghan Markle's father says now hopes to attend royal wedding
Description: The father of American actress Meghan Markle said on Tuesday he does wish to attend his daughter's wedding to Britain's Prince Harry on Saturday.

Headline: Upping pressure on PM, Labour Party to call for Brexit customs papers

Headline: London looking into more car-free days to cut pollution
Description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has asked officials to look into introducing more days when cars are not allowed on certain roads or in specific areas as the city considers new ways to cut pollution.

Headline: Factbox - Timings for Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's wedding
Description: Britain's Prince Harry and fiancée Meghan Markle will marry on Saturday in a ceremony that brings together royalty and Hollywood glamour.

Headline: May to raise human rights during Turkish president's visit
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will raise human rights issues at talks with Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan in London later on Tuesday, her spokesman said.

Headline: Spain and Catalonia could learn from Scotland, Sturgeon says

Headline: Scottish independence is never off the table, Sturgeon says
Description: Scottish independence will never be off the table until it happens, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Monday.

Headline: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle to stay at separate hotels on eve of wedding

Headline: Johnson backs May's position over EU customs' plans

Headline: Britain focussed on getting right customs decision - May's spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is focussed on getting the right decision on Britain's future customs arrangements with the European Union rather than meeting any deadlines, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Two British hostages, driver, released in Congo

Headline: Two British hostages, driver, released in Congo
Description: Two Britons and their Congolese driver held hostage in Democratic Republic of Congo have been released, Virunga National Park said on Sunday.

Headline: Britain awards £2.4 billion in submarine work to BAE Systems
Description: Britain on Monday awarded defence firm BAE Systems  2.4 billion pounds to work on two submarine programmes, the company said in a statement.

Headline: UK government disappointed by Lords votes on Brexit laws - May's spokesman

Description: Lawyer Gaile Walters has no time for the British monarchy but still believes the wedding of American actress Meghan Markle to Queen Elizabeth's grandson Prince Harry marks an important moment for Britain's black community.

Headline: Factbox - Don't touch Her Majesty: The protocol around the British royals
Description: Touching Queen Elizabeth has long been considered one of the greatest taboos surrounding the British monarch, one of the unwritten rules about how people are expected to behave around the royal family.

Headline: As debate rages, Britain still weeks away from customs decision
Description: Britain is weeks away from making a decision on its future customs arrangements with the European Union, a minister said on Sunday, adding fuel to a debate that is all but stalling Brexit talks in Brussels and politics at home.

Headline: Anger in France, Britain over Trump's gun law speech

Headline: Waiting to hear from British government on customs plans, says DUP leader

Headline: Coming to right post-Brexit customs plan takes time, minister says

Headline: Topics agreed for post-Brexit relationship talks
Description: Negotiators from Britain and the European Union agreed a broad structure for further talks on their future relationship after Brexit, dividing economic issues from those on security, the EU said on Friday.

Headline: Meghan Markle's father to walk her down aisle at wedding to Prince Harry
Description: Meghan Markle's father will walk her down the aisle when the American actress marries Britain's Prince Harry this month and both her parents will meet Queen Elizabeth and senior royals in the run-up to the ceremony, Kensington Palace said on Friday.

Headline: Man accused of plotting to kill May pleads not guilty
Description: A man accused of plotting to kill British Prime Minister Theresa May pleaded not guilty to terrorism charges in a London court on Friday.

Headline: Factbox - UK local government elections: Key results and ones to watch
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party avoided a wipeout in London local elections and eked out gains in Brexit-supporting regions elsewhere, results on Friday showed, denting the opposition Labour Party's hopes of a big win.

Headline: Factbox - UK local government elections: Key results and ones to watch
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party avoided a wipeout in London local elections and eked out gains in Brexit-supporting regions elsewhere, results on Friday showed, denting the opposition Labour Party's hopes of a big win.

Headline: Pro-Brexit MPs pressure May over customs plan
Description: Pro-Brexit members of parliament heaped pressure on British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday over her future customs plans with the European Union, calling on her to drop what some say is her preferred proposal.

Headline: PM May's Conservatives keep control of key London borough
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives held control of the symbolic London borough of Wandsworth in local government elections, results announced on Friday showed, defying some predictions it could fall to the opposition Labour Party.

Description: Voters in England cast their ballots on Thursday in local government elections expected to show rising support for Prime Minister Theresa May's opponents in London and add to questions about her ability to follow through on her Brexit plan.

Description: Scotland is to review the conviction of the only man found guilty of the Lockerbie aircraft bombing to decide whether to allow his family to launch a fresh appeal.

Headline: UK confident of agreeing solution on post-Brexit customs - PM's spokesman
Description: Britain is confident it can agree a solution on post-Brexit customs arrangements which works for both sides of the negotiations with the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: No surprise future customs plans with EU are taking time - Davis
Description: There should be no surprise that it is taking time to decide on a future customs arrangement with the European Union, Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox - Recent British royal weddings
Description: Queen Elizabeth's grandson Prince Harry marries his U.S. fiancee Meghan Markle this month in a wedding expected to attract huge global interest.

Headline: Government defeated as Lords back powers to prevent hard Irish border
Description: The House of Lords on Wednesday voted to give parliament the power to stop any Brexit deal that might restore a hard border across the island of Ireland, in the latest defeat for Prime Minister Theresa May's government.

Headline: Breast cancer screening failure may have shortened 270 lives in England

Headline: Ideas on post Brexit customs setup are evolving - May's spokesman
Description: Britain's proposals for its future customs arrangements with the European Union are evolving as negotiations with the European Union progress, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Prince Harry and Meghan choose their royal wedding carriage
Description: Britain's Prince Harry and his bride-to-be Meghan Markle said on Wednesday they were looking forward to the procession through Windsor following their wedding this month, after choosing an open-top royal carriage for the journey.

Headline: UK court rejects union bid to overturn Deliveroo worker rights decision
Description: The High Court rejected an application by a British trade union to review a decision not to allow it to represent food courier Deliveroo's riders in a part of London as it pushes for workers' rights in the gig economy.

Headline: British decision on post-Brexit customs position to take a few weeks, minister says

Headline: Senior Brexiteers demand May drops EU customs partnership option - BBC
Description: Senior British lawmakers that back Brexit have demanded that Prime Minister Theresa May drops a proposal for a customs partnership with the European Union once it leaves the bloc, the BBC reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Senior Brexiteers demand May drops EU customs partnership option - BBC
Description: Senior British lawmakers that back Brexit have demanded that Prime Minister Theresa May drops a proposal for a customs partnership with the European Union once it leaves the bloc, the BBC reported on Wednesday.

Headline: UK territories ordered to open up about secretive companies

Description: Britain will be able to impose sanctions on people who commit gross human rights violations under a so-called "Magnitsky amendment" backed by members of parliament on Tuesday.

Headline: With a jingle and a beer, English Morris dancers ring in May Day
Description: Traditional English Morris Dancers with jingling bells on their shins and flower-bedecked hats rang in May Day with early morning jigs on Tuesday.

Headline: Scotland introduces minimum alcohol pricing to cut deaths
Description: Scotland introduced minimum unit pricing on alcohol on Tuesday as it tries to improve public health by raising the cost of cheap, strong drinks favoured by young people and binge-drinkers.

Headline: Uber loses its licence in Brighton
Description: Uber's licence in the southern English coastal city of Brighton will not be renewed, the local council said on Tuesday, adding the taxi app is not "fit and proper" and citing concerns over a data breach and the use of drivers from outside the area.

Headline: Prince William and Kate register new son Louis's birth
Description: Prince William and his wife Kate formally registered the birth of new son Louis on Tuesday, just over a week after the arrival of the latest member of Britain's royal family.

Headline: Britain intervenes in Daily Mirror-Express deal
Description: Britain ordered regulators on Tuesday to investigate the Daily Mirror publisher's deal to buy the Express tabloids because of the potential impact on the titles' editorial policies and the need for a range of views in newspapers.

Headline: How old is 'Big Ben'? The trivia Meghan Markle must know to become British
Description: U.S. actress Meghan Markle will join Britain's royal family when she marries Prince Harry this month but before she can become a British citizen, it will help her to know how big the Lake District is and the age of "Big Ben".

Headline: May names new minister to try to end immigration scandal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May appointed a former banker of South Asian origin as home secretary on Monday, trying to draw a line under an immigration scandal threatening her authority as she negotiates Brexit.

Headline: Factbox - Does Javid appointment tilt Britain's approach to Brexit?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will convene her Brexit sub-committee later this week, aiming to narrow down the government's position on a future customs arrangement with the European Union to one of two options.

Headline: New interior minister has drive, determination - May's spokesman
Description: Sajid Javid, who was appointed Britain's new interior minister on Monday following the resignation of Amber Rudd, has shown drive, ambition and determination to get to grips with difficult subjects, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said.

Headline: Factbox - Who is new home secretary, Sajid Javid?
Description: Sajid Javid was appointed as Britain's home secretary on Monday after Amber Rudd resigned over her handling of immigration policy.

Headline: Barnier says rapid EU-UK progress needed on Irish border
Description: The EU's Brexit negotiator expressed confidence on Monday that a solution for the Irish border can be achieved if rapid progress is made by June, but said a real risk remained of Britain leaving the bloc without an overall deal.

Headline: MP suspended by Labour after sexual harassment allegations
Description: A Labour party opposition MP has been suspended  pending an investigation, Labour said on Monday, after media reports alleging that he had harassed a staff member.

Headline: UK government defeated as Lords back powers to block or change EU exit deal
Description: Britain's upper house on Monday voted to give parliament powers to block or delay a final deal on departure from the European Union, defeating Prime Minister Theresa May's government.

Headline: New home secretary Javid opposes 'hostile environment' approach to immigration
Description: Britain's new home secretary Sajid Javid on Monday attempted  to distance himself from the "hostile environment" approach to a crackdown on illegal immigration which was favoured by Prime Minister Theresa May during her time in the job.

Headline: Beneath a baobab, Prince Harry and Meghan's love blossomed in Botswana
Description: In an exclusive Botswana safari camp where Prince Harry took Meghan Markle on a romantic getaway last year, guests wake to the sound of doves cooing in the trees and hippos splashing in the serene waters of the Okavango Delta.

Headline: Britain's crime agency to expand probe into HBOS fraud allegations
Description: Britain's National Crime Agency is expanding a review into fraud allegations at HBOS, part of Lloyds Banking Group, that have already led to the jailing of six people in a scam that pushed business owners to hire a costly turnaround consultancy.

Headline: Britain's crime agency to expand probe into HBOS fraud allegations
Description: Britain's National Crime Agency is expanding a review into fraud allegations at HBOS, part of Lloyds Banking Group, that have already led to the jailing of six people in a scam that pushed business owners to hire a costly turnaround consultancy.

Headline: UK government defeated as Lords back powers to block or change EU exit deal
Description: Britain's House of Lords voted on Monday to give parliament powers to block or delay the final deal on the country's departure from the European Union, defeating Prime Minister Theresa May's government.

Headline: Rudd resigns after immigration scandal
Description: Britain's interior minister resigned on Sunday after Prime Minister Theresa May's government faced an outpouring of indignation over its treatment of some long-term Caribbean residents who were wrongly labelled illegal immigrants.

Headline: EU's Barnier says must be prepared for risk of no Brexit deal
Description: The European Union must be prepared for the real risk that negotiations over Britain's departure from the bloc will end without a deal, the EU's Brexit negotiator said on Monday.

Headline: EU's Barnier says confident of deal to avoid hard Irish border
Description: The European Union's Brexit negotiator said on Monday that he is confident Brussels and London can agree on the right solution for avoiding the return of a hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland.

Headline: Northern Irish DUP says EU's Barnier needs to understand unionists' views - BBC
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish political party that props up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government said the European Union's chief negotiator needs to do more to understand the views of unionists, the BBC reported on Monday.

Headline: Factbox - Balancing Brexit, who could UK PM May appoint as the next interior minister?
Description: With her Conservative Party split over Brexit, British Prime Minister Theresa May will have to be careful to preserve the uneasy balance in the cabinet after the resignation of Home Secretary Amber Rudd.

Headline: Rudd resigns for misleading parliament over deportation targets
Description: Home Secretary Amber Rudd resigned on Sunday, saying she had mistakenly misled parliament over whether her department had targets for deporting illegal immigrants.

Headline: London elections might leave May down, but not out
Description: Voters in London are expected to punish Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party at local government elections this week which could embolden critics of her Brexit strategy, but are not expected to trigger her downfall.

Headline: Amber Rudd faces fresh calls to resign over deportation targets
Description: Britain's interior minister Amber Rudd was under growing pressure on Sunday after a challenge to her testimony on the deportation of immigrants prompted fresh calls for her resignation.

Headline: Iran confirms holding British-Iranian academic on security charges
Description: Iran confirmed on Sunday that it had arrested a British-Iranian academic on security charges, state media reported, the latest in a string of arrests of dual nationals in the Islamic Republic over the past few years.

Headline: Prince Louis - William and Kate name their baby
Description: Prince William and his wife Kate have named their newborn son Louis Arthur Charles, a nod to both his grandfather and heir to the throne and one of his most beloved mentors.

Headline: Home Secretary Rudd resists calls to quit, apologises for immigration policy error
Description: Britain's Home Secretary Amber Rudd resisted calls to quit on Friday, apologising for not being aware of the use of deportation targets in her department and vowing to implement fair and humane immigration policy.

Headline: UK police investigating possible terrorism motive in Birmingham car incident
Description: Police said they were investigating whether an incident outside a mosque in Birmingham on Friday in which two men in their 20s were hit by a car was terrorism-related.

Headline: British rail franchising model is 'broken' - parliamentary committee
Description: Britain's model of contracting companies to run rail services is broken and the government should review it before awarding any more franchises, a parliamentary committee said on Friday in findings rejected by the Department for Transport.

Headline: Prince William will be brother Harry's best man at wedding
Description: Prince Harry has asked his elder brother Prince William to be best man at his wedding to U.S. actress Meghan Markle next month, his office said.

Headline: Father of gravely ill child Alfie Evans seeks hospital truce
Description: The father of gravely ill Alfie Evans, the 23-month-old boy whose plight has drawn international attention, said on Thursday he wanted to build bridges with staff at the British hospital he has been battling in the courts over his son's treatment.

Headline: Trump to visit Britain, hold talks with May on July 13
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump will travel to Britain in July for a working visit with Prime Minister Theresa May, after months of back-and-forth over when the U.S. president would visit what traditionally has been the United States' closest ally.

Headline: Ireland says solid progress on post-Brexit border needed by June
Description: Britain and European Union negotiators must make further progress on the issue of the Irish border by June if talks are to move forward on a final withdrawal agreement, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Thursday.

Headline: Rudd refuses to quit over immigrants' treatment
Description: British interior minister Amber Rudd said she had no plans to resign after giving contradictory statements about meeting targets for deportations, deepening a scandal over Britain's treatment of Caribbean immigrants.

Headline: May feels more heat over EU's customs union
Description: British lawmakers stepped up pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May over her Brexit strategy on Thursday, criticising her refusal to pursue a customs union with the European Union.

Headline: Scottish Conservative leader Ruth Davidson expecting a baby
Description: Scottish Conservative leader Ruth Davidson, a rising star of the party, said on Thursday she was expecting her first child with her partner Jen Wilson later this year.

Headline: British lawmakers urge government to pursue customs union in symbolic vote
Description: British parliament approved a motion in favour of urging the government to pursue a customs union in Brexit negotiations on Thursday in a symbolic vote after most of the governing Conservative Party decided not to take part.

Headline: Britain will narrow its position to one customs option in Brexit talks
Description: Britain's government will narrow its position on a future customs arrangement with the European Union to one of the two options currently on the table in Brexit talks, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox - Commoners who have married into royal families
Description: In just over three weeks, U.S. actress Meghan Markle will join a select group of "commoners" to marry into a royal family when she weds Britain's Prince Harry at Windsor Castle.

Headline: Facing calls to resign, Rudd says committed to job
Description: British interior minister Amber Rudd said she was committed to her job after being asked whether she was considering resigning  over a scandal in which Caribbean immigrants living legally in Britain were being mistreated by her ministry.

Headline: May has full confidence in her minister over Windrush scandal - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has confidence in her interior minister Amber Rudd over the labelling of Caribbean immigrants who have lived legally in Britain for decades as illegal immigrants, May's spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Over 40 companies pledge to cut UK plastic pollution
Description: More than 40 companies, including Britain's biggest supermarkets, Coca Cola , Nestle  and Procter & Gamble , have bowed to growing pressure to tackle pollution by committing to cut plastic use over the next seven years.

Headline: Amber Rudd 'deeply regrets' failing to spot scale of Windrush migrant problem
Description: Interior minister Amber Rudd said on Wednesday she deeply regretted failing to realise there was a widespread problem that some Caribbean immigrants who have lived legally in Britain for decades were being labelled illegal immigrants.

Headline: Iran detains British-Iranian academic - New York-based rights group
Description: A British-Iranian academic was detained in Iran by the country's  Revolutionary Guards in mid-April, the New York-based Center for Human Rights in Iran (CHRI) reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Court rules gravely ill UK child cannot travel to Vatican hospital
Description: A British court rejected an appeal on Wednesday from parents of  a gravely ill 23-month-old boy to take their son to Italy for treatment, a case that has drawn international attention, including from Pope Francis.

Headline: May dealt new Brexit defeat in upper house of parliament
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May was dealt a new defeat by Britain's upper house of parliament on Wednesday over her Brexit plans, this time in a challenge to the government's push to adopt wide-ranging powers to amend laws.

Headline: UK parliament will back government on customs union - Brexit minister
Description: Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said on Wednesday he expects parliament to back the government's policy of leaving the customs union at a crunch vote which could come as early as next month.

Headline: High probability of a Brexit deal with EU, says Davis
Description: Brexit minister David Davis said on Wednesday he believed that there was a high probability that Britain would negotiate a deal to leave the European Union, dismissing fears that the country could crash out of the bloc.

Headline: Britain steps up battle against loan sharks
Description: Britain's government on Wednesday pledged fresh funds to crack down on illegal money lenders, who charge unfair high interest rates and often intimidate, threaten and trap vulnerable victims in a cycle of fear and violence.

Headline: British building material fire tests inadequate - insurance body
Description: British laboratory tests on the fire safety of building materials are inadequate, research for the insurance industry in the wake of the Grenfell Tower fire showed on Wednesday.

Headline: UK Jewish groups say disappointed by talks with Labour leader Corbyn on anti-Semitism
Description: Jewish community leaders in Britain said their talks on Tuesday with opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn on how to end anti-Semitism in his party had been a "disappointing missed opportunity".

Headline: It's a boy - "Very excited" Prince William takes Kate home after birth of prince
Description: Kate, wife of Prince William, smiled and waved as she left hospital on Monday after giving birth to a boy who is now fifth in line to the British throne.

Headline: Swipe right to remain? Brexit app leaves EU lawmakers wary
Description: British officials presented their plans to ensure 3 million European Union citizens can be granted rights to remain in Britain after Brexit, but their presentation in Brussels on Tuesday left EU lawmakers worried the system won't work.

Headline: All-male no more - London's Parliament Square gets first statue of a woman
Description: A statue of 19th century British feminist leader Millicent Fawcett was unveiled in London's Parliament Square on Tuesday, the first monument honouring a woman in a public space previously occupied by 11 statues of men.

Headline: All-male no more - London's Parliament Square gets first statue of a woman
Description: A statue of 19th century British feminist leader Millicent Fawcett was unveiled in London's Parliament Square on Tuesday, the first monument honouring a woman in a public space previously occupied by 11 statues of men.

Headline: Britain's Treasury 'fully supports' work on toughening up gambling rules
Description: Britain's finance ministry said on Tuesday it fully supported a government proposal to toughen up gambling rules, saying reports that it was worried about losing tax revenues were speculative.

Headline: Gospel choir to sing at wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle
Description: A Christian gospel choir and a teenage cellist will provide some of the music at the wedding of Britain's Prince Harry and his American fiancee Meghan Markle next month, Kensington Palace said on Tuesday.

Headline: Ethiopia says British museum must permanently return its artefacts
Description: Britain must permanently return all artefacts from Ethiopia held by the Victoria and Albert Museum and Addis Ababa will not accept them on loan, an Ethiopian government official said.

Headline: Factbox - A prince is born: Kate, wife of Prince William, gives birth to third child
Description: Kate, the wife of Britain's Prince William, gave birth to a boy at a hospital in London on Monday, the third child for the royal couple.

Headline: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle attend memorial service for murdered black teenager
Description: Britain's Prince Harry and his American fiancée Meghan Markle attended a memorial service on Monday to mark 25 years since the murder of black teenager Stephen Lawrence.

Headline: May suffers another defeat in upper house over EU rights
Description: Britain's upper house of parliament handed the government its  third defeat over Brexit in less than a week on Monday, voting down plans not to retain EU rights in national law before Britain leaves the bloc.

Headline: Smiling Prince William and Kate leave hospital with newborn son
Description: Britain's Prince William and his wife Kate left hospital with smiles on Monday carrying their newborn son, less than 7 hours after his birth.

Headline: Britain to set up compensation scheme for 'Windrush' migrants
Description: Britain will compensate some Caribbean immigrants who have lived legally in Britain for decades and have wrongly been labelled illegal immigrants because of trouble documenting their status, interior minister Amber Rudd said on Monday.

Headline: Kate, wife of Prince William, to leave hospital on Monday after giving birth to a boy
Description: Kate, wife of Britain's Prince William, will leave hospital on Monday evening after giving birth to a boy, Kensington Palace said.

Headline: After birth of son, Prince William waves to crowds
Description: Britain's Prince William left the hospital where his son was born on Monday, waving to crowds and telling reporters: "I'll be back in a minute."

Headline: May congratulates William and Kate on birth of baby boy
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday congratulated Prince William and his wife Kate on the birth of a boy.

Headline: Labour Party likely to seek broader BoE mandate if in power
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party would likely broaden the Bank of England's mandate to include factors such as employment but would not seek to remove the central bank's independence, Labour's finance policy chief John McDonnell said on Sunday.

Headline: Britain says web firms 'turning blind eye' to children, threatens regulation
Description: Britain's health minister Jeremy Hunt threatened to impose new regulations on social media firms unless they do more to protect young people using their services.

Headline: Queen Elizabeth celebrates 92 years with star-studded concert
Description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth attended a star-studded special concert on Saturday as the world's oldest and longest-reigning living monarch celebrated her 92nd birthday.

Headline: Head of Welsh government says he will stand down later this year
Description: The head of the devolved government in Wales, Carwyn Jones, said on Saturday he intends to stand down in the second half of this year, BBC news reported on Saturday.

Headline: May says will consider compensating affected Windrush migrants
Description: Britain will consider compensating members of the "Windrush generation" of post-War Caribbean immigrants who may have suffered after being wrongly labelled as illegal entrants, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday.

Headline: Britain confident in Brexit talks, sees no return to hard Irish border
Description: Britain expressed confidence on Friday that no hard border with Ireland would return following Brexit, but European Union negotiators have dismissed a proposal by Britain on how to ensure goods would flow freely after it quits the EU.

Headline: Leaders approve Prince Charles to succeed queen as Commonwealth head
Description: Prince Charles was approved as the successor to Queen Elizabeth as head of the Commonwealth at a meeting of the group's heads of government on Friday.

Headline: EU's Barnier says still some 25 percent of work to do on Brexit
Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday some 25 percent of work remained to be done on a pact covering UK withdrawal from the EU, including crucial issues such as management of the Ireland/Northern Ireland border.

Headline: EU's Barnier says still some 25 percent of work to do on Brexit
Description: The European Union's chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday some 25 percent of work remained to be done on a pact covering UK withdrawal from the EU, including crucial issues such as management of the Ireland/Northern Ireland border.

Headline: Queen to celebrate 92nd birthday at concert party
Description: Queen Elizabeth will attend a special concert on Saturday as the world's oldest and longest-reigning living monarch celebrates her 92nd birthday.

Headline: Britain confident of finding way to avoid hard border with EU member Ireland
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is confident Britain and the EU can find a solution to avoid any return to a hard border with Ireland after Brexit, her spokesman said on Friday, saying he did not recognise reports that the bloc had rejected her plans.

Headline: Scottish Power becomes third UK firm to raise energy prices
Description: Scottish Power will raise its standard variable domestic gas and electricity prices in Britain by an average of 5.5 percent from June 1, becoming the third firm to announce an increase this month.

Headline: Police start security operation a month ahead of UK royal wedding
Description: Police in Windsor, where Prince Harry marries American actress Meghan Markle next month, said on Thursday they had begun one of the biggest security operations in their history to ensure the event passes off safely.

Headline: Labour tries new pitch to financiers - higher taxes for some influence
Description: Britain's shadow chancellor John McDonnell offered London's mighty financial services industry a new pact on Thursday: higher taxes in return for a seat at the policymaking table if Labour wins the next election.

Headline: MPs to debate EU customs union membership
Description: The House of Commons will debate staying in a customs union with the European Union next week, stepping up pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May to change her Brexit blueprint.

Headline: In a variety of cases, Brexit starts to reach EU court
Description: The fallout from Brexit is starting to come before the European Union's top judges, in cases whose variety the head of the EU Court of Justice said defied the imagination.

Headline: UK pottery produces 'well suited' Harry and Meghan wedding mugs
Description: A British pottery is producing royal wedding mugs emblazoned with the description of Prince Harry and U.S. actress Meghan Markle as "game changers, free spirits, big hearts and well-suited".

Headline: Trouble in the family - UK's migrant embarrassment undermines Commonwealth reunion
Description: As it prepares to leave the European Union, Britain's attempts to revitalise links with former colonies at a lavish summit in London have been overshadowed by outrage over Prime Minister Theresa May's treatment of Commonwealth migrants.

Headline: Britain to ban sale of plastic straws in bid to fight waste
Description: Britain plans to ban the sale of plastic straws and other single use products and is pressing Commonwealth allies to also take action to tackle marine waste, the office of Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May said.

Headline: Queen backs her son Charles to take on Commonwealth role
Description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth said on Thursday she hoped her son and heir Prince Charles would take on leadership of the Commonwealth, answering some who argue the position should be rotated around member states.

Headline: May dealt embarrassing Brexit defeat in House of Lords
Description: The House of Lords inflicted an embarrassing defeat on Theresa May's government on Wednesday, challenging her refusal to remain in a customs union with the EU after Brexit.

Headline: Hunt faces investigation over luxury flats purchase
Description: Health Secretary, Jeremy Hunt, is facing an investigation by a parliamentary watchdog over his failure to declare a property investment deal.

Headline: May pays tribute to Queen's dedication to Commonwealth
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth for leading the Commonwealth with "service, dedication and constancy" as she thanks her for opening her homes to welcome leaders from across the world this week.

Headline: Russia's RT a victim of 'targeted scrutiny' by Britain - embassy
Description: "Targeted scrutiny" of broadcaster RT by Britain will affect press freedom and is a major cause for concern, Russia's embassy in London said on Wednesday after Britain's media regulator opened seven investigations into the Russian news channel.

Headline: Russia's RT faces seven investigations in Britain over broadcasts since Skripal case
Description: Britain's media regulator opened seven investigations into Russian news channel RT, saying it had found an increase in programmes which may have breached impartiality rules since a nerve agent attack on a former Russian spy last month.

Headline: Last of UK Queen Elizabeth's beloved corgi dogs has died - Daily Mail
Description: The last of Queen Elizabeth's corgi dogs, who appeared with the British monarch for a film segment during the 2012 London Olympic Games opening ceremony, has died at the age of 14, the Daily Mail newspaper reported.

Headline: May faces embarrassing Brexit defeat in upper house
Description: Britain's upper house of parliament is expected to inflict an embarrassing defeat on Theresa May's government on Wednesday, challenging her refusal to remain in a customs union with the European Union after Brexit.

Headline: PM May says 'Windrush generation' migrants are 'part of us'
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday the "Windrush generation", people from the Caribbean who came to Britain as children after World War Two, were British and her government would not tell them to leave the country.

Headline: PM May says 'Windrush generation' migrants are 'part of us'
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday the "Windrush generation", people from the Caribbean who came to Britain as children after World War Two, were British and her government would not tell them to leave the country.

Headline: EU citizens given strong guarantees post-Brexit - PM May's spokesman
Description: Britain has given "very strong" guarantees to EU citizens about their status after Brexit, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday, rejecting fears they would experience similar difficulties to the "Windrush generation".

Headline: Post-Brexit UK will be just as important to India, says Modi
Description: Britain will be just as important to India after it leaves the EU as it is now, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi told his British counterpart Theresa May on Wednesday, May's spokeswoman said.

Headline: May apologises to Caribbean countries for UK treatment of post-war migrants
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May apologised to 12 Caribbean nations on Tuesday for immigration officials' harsh treatment of people from those countries who migrated to Britain as children after World War Two.

Headline: Famed UK royal biographer says Diana would approve of Meghan
Description: Princess Diana would approve of her son Prince Harry's marriage to U.S. actress Meghan Markle, according to author Andrew Morton whose famous biography of the late royal caused uproar in Britain some 25 years ago.

Headline: May apologises to Caribbean countries over treatment of post-war migrants
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May apologised to representatives from 12 Caribbean countries on Tuesday over recent harsh treatment by immigration bureaucrats of people who arrived in Britain as children between the late 1940s and the early 1970s.

Headline: Johnson calls for credible Myanmar probe into reported atrocities
Description: Boris Johnson said on Tuesday that Myanmar needed to start showing it is serious about the safety of the Rohingya and start a meaningful probe into atrocities which the United Nations has likened to ethnic cleansing.

Headline: UK political pollsters told to upgrade methods to improve predictions
Description: Britain's political pollsters have been told by a parliamentary committee to upgrade their methods to avoid the high-profile failures of recent years.

Headline: Brexit backer Banks denies allegation he misused data in campaign
Description: A prominent campaigner to leave the European Union, Arron Banks,  denied allegations on Tuesday by a former employee of political consultancy Cambridge Analytica that he had misused personal data for political purposes.

Headline: Factbox - Britain's Brexit legislation: What is left to do ahead of EU exit?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's minority government needs to pass a raft of legislation to prepare for Britain's divorce from the European Union on March 29, 2019, but many key bills have become bogged down in parliamentary process.

Headline: Britain says regrets role in anti-gay laws among former colonies
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday she regretted Britain's role in anti-gay legislation across its former colonies, seeking to address criticism of the Commonwealth at its gathering in London.

Headline: LGBT campaigners hope British PM's apology over anti-gay laws will fuel change
Description: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - LGBT campaigners were hopeful on Tuesday that a call by British Prime Minister Theresa May for Commonwealth countries to reform  outdated anti-gay legislation would help to stop widespread persecution and discrimination.

Headline: UK says nerve agent used to poison ex-Russian spy was in liquid form
Description: The nerve agent used to poison former Russian spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter at his home in southern England last month was delivered in a liquid form, British officials said on Tuesday.

Headline: Suspicious substance at UK immigration minister's office not hazardous
Description: A suspicious substance found at the constituency office of British immigration minister Caroline Nokes in southern England is not hazardous, police said on Tuesday.

Headline: Suspended Cambridge Analytica CEO Nix cancels UK parliamentary appearance
Description: The suspended CEO of Cambridge Analytica, a political consultancy at the centre of a scandal over the use of Facebook data, has cancelled an appearance before British lawmakers, the chairman of a parliamentary committee said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain expresses regret to 12 Caribbean nations over 'Windrush' residents
Description: Britain has expressed regret to 12 Caribbean countries for any anxiety caused to the so-called "Windrush generation" caught up in a tightening of the British immigration system, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain to review its climate targets - government minister
Description: Britain will review its climate targets to see whether they need to be strengthened to fit with the aims of an international climate accord, Britain's energy minister said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK appeals to Supreme Court to stop Scottish, Welsh Brexit bills
Description: The British government appealed to the Supreme Court on Tuesday to rule on whether Brexit bills passed last month by the Scottish and Welsh parliaments were constitutionally sound, arguing that they would cause legal confusion.

Headline: May defends British strikes in Syria against parliament critics
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May, facing a rowdy session of parliament on Monday, defended her decision to join U.S.-led missile strikes against Syria without first seeking parliament's authorisation.

Headline: Prince Harry promises to listen as he starts new Commonwealth job
Description: Britain's Prince Harry has been appointed a Commonwealth youth ambassador, his highest-profile public role to date and a job that will see him working with his future wife encouraging young people to use the network of mostly former British colonies.

Headline: UK supports Prince Charles to succeed Queen Elizabeth as Commonwealth head
Description: Britain backs Queen Elizabeth's son and heir, Prince Charles, to succeed her as head of the Commonwealth network of 53 mostly former British colonies, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: May - Do not doubt our resolve to prevent normalisation of chemical weapons
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said Britain was determined to prevent the use of chemical weapons becoming normalised, responding to questions in parliament about her decision to authorise air strikes against Syria.

Headline: May - Syria strikes were in Britain's interest, not because Trump told us to
Description: Britain's decision to conduct air strikes against Syria was in the country's national interest, and not the result of pressure from U.S. President Donald Trump, Prime Minister Theresa May told parliament on Monday.

Headline: Britain apologises for 'appalling' treatment of 'Windrush generation' migrants
Description: Home Secretary Amber Rudd apologised on Monday to thousands of British residents who arrived from the Caribbean decades ago and are now being denied basic rights after being incorrectly identified as illegal immigrants.

Headline: Government apologises for treatment of 'Windrush generation' of migrants
Description: Britain's Home Secretary Amber Rudd on Monday apologised to thousands of British residents who arrived from the Caribbean decades ago and are now being denied basic rights after being incorrectly identified as illegal immigrants.

Headline: EU threatens new sanctions against Syria but not Russia
Description: European Union foreign ministers on Monday threatened new sanctions against Syria over its alleged chemical attacks, but held off from joining expected new punitive U.S. measures against Russia.

Headline: May wants to give parliament time to debate Syria strikes - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May wants to give parliament plenty of time on Monday to scrutinise her decision to join U.S. and French air strikes on Syria at the weekend, her spokesman said.

Headline: Chemical weapons inspectors not yet allowed access to Douma - UK delegation
Description: Inspectors have not yet been granted access to sites in Douma, Syria, the British delegation to the Organization for the Prohibition for Chemical weapons said on Monday, citing the agency's director general.

Headline: Germany continues to believe Syria must one day see regime change
Description: Germany continues to believe that the Syrian government of Bashar al-Assad must be replaced at the end of a peace process, but acknowledges the realities that make this impossible in the short term, the government spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: British envoy - OPCW must act to prevent 'further barbaric use of chemical weapons'
Description: The global chemical weapons organisation has recorded more than 390 alleged incidents of illicit use of poisonous munitions in Syria since 2014, the British envoy to the organisation said on Monday, calling for members to take collective action.

Headline: EU calls on Russia, Iran to prevent Syria from chemical weapons use
Description: The European Union on Monday said Russia and Iran should use their influence on the Syrian government to prevent it from further use of chemical weapons.

Headline: Assad cannot be part of Syria solution - German minister
Description: The Syrian crisis needs a negotiated solution involving all powers in the region, German foreign minister Heiko Maas said on Monday, adding he could not imagine anyone who had used chemical weapons against his own people to be part of that process.

Headline: Air strikes on Syria will not change course of war - Johnson
Description: The air strikes carried out by the United States, France and Britain on Syria will not change the course of the war, Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Monday, but they were a way of showing the world had had enough of chemical weapons.

Headline: UK to study options if Syria's Assad uses chemical weapons again - Boris Johnson
Description: Britain will study the "options" with its allies if President Bashar al-Assad again uses chemical weapons against his people in Syria, but as yet there is nothing planned, foreign minister Boris Johnson said on Sunday.

Headline: Legal basis for British strikes in Syria debatable - Jeremy Corbyn
Description: The leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, said on Sunday that the legal basis used to support British air strikes in Syria was debatable, adding that he would only support action backed by the United Nations Security Council.

Headline: Britain joins Syria strikes to deter chemical attacks
Description: Britain struck Syria with air-launched cruise missiles on Saturday in partnership with the United States and France to try to cripple its chemical weapons facilities and stop what Prime Minister Theresa May cast as a global slide towards their greater use.

Headline: Britain's eurosceptic UKIP names new party leader
Description: Britain's eurosceptic United Kingdom Independence Party (UKIP) named a new leader on Saturday as it seeks to draw a line under recent turmoil.

Headline: Russia's Lavrov says Skripals may have been poisoned by substance Russia never made
Description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Saturday the nerve agent used to poison former Russian spy Sergei Skripal in Britain could have been the BZ substance - which was never produced in the Soviet Union or Russia.

Headline: Corbyn says no legal basis for attack on Syria

Headline: Mary, Alice and Victoria are bookies' favourites for UK royal baby name
Description: Mary, Alice and Victoria are the favourites for the name of Britain's Prince William and wife Kate's next baby according to bookmaker William Hill , as the birth of Britain's fifth in line to the throne nears.

Headline: UK ministers back action to deter Syrian chemical weapon use

Headline: Corbyn wants parliament to be consulted over Syria

Description: (Removes incorrect ownership reference in paragraph 6, in this April 3rd story)

Headline: UK's post-Brexit immigration laws delayed, less urgent after transition deal - minister

Headline: Brexit and the City - the real estate agent's view

Headline: Corbyn under fire over Russia, anti-Semitism and Brexit
Description: British opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn's path to the prime minister's residence at 10 Downing Street is not proving as smooth as the veteran socialist had hoped.

Headline: Facebook data scandal widens as Canadian company accused of helping target U.S. voters
Description: A scandal engulfing Facebook  over the use of its data by political consultants widened on Tuesday when a whistleblower said Canadian company AggregateIQ had developed a programme to target Republican voters in the 2016 U.S. election.

Headline: Ireland says to expel Russian diplomat, Moscow's envoy blasts move
Description: Ireland will expel one Russian diplomat in response to a nerve agent attack in England that the British government has blamed on Russia, a move that Moscow's ambassador to Dublin said would not go unanswered.

Headline: Expulsion of Russian diplomats shows NATO relevance - Mattis
Description: U.S. Defense Secretary Jim Mattis said on Tuesday that NATO's expulsion of Russian diplomats showed the alliance was still relevant, adding that Moscow had the potential to be a partner with Europe but had chosen a different path.

Headline: Throwing Brexit to the wind - how the EU rallied around Britain over Russia
Description: Three days after European Union leaders left a summit in Brussels with a discreet yet vague agreement to expel Russian diplomats over a nerve agent attack on British soil, envoys met back to share details before an afternoon deadline.

Headline: May says she hopes Facebook boss understands data leak concerns
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she hoped Facebook  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg understood why people were concerned about alleged leaks of personal data, but it was up to him to decide whether to face a committee in Britain's parliament.

Headline: Britain reviewing visas issued to investors - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May, answering questions about Britain's response to Russia's suspected involvement in a poisoning in England, said her government was conducting a review of visas issued to wealthy foreign investors.

Headline: UK minister - We will implement the result of the EU referendum
Description: Britain will implement the result of the 2016 referendum on leaving the European Union, cabinet office minister Chloe Smith told parliament on Tuesday during a debate about allegations pro-Brexit campaigners broke electoral laws.

Headline: Whistleblower says Canadian company worked on software to find Republican voters
Description: A Cambridge Analytica whistleblower said on Tuesday that Canadian company AggregateIQ worked on software called Ripon which was used to identify Republican voters ahead of the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

Headline: UK minister - 'miserable little worm' Assange should turn himself in
Description: Julian Assange was called a "miserable little worm" on Tuesday by a British foreign affairs minister who said the WikiLeaks founder should leave the Ecuadorean embassy in London and give himself up to British justice.

Headline: Zuckerberg's snub of UK parliament 'astonishing' says MP
Description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's decision not to answer questions from British lawmakers about a scandal over the firm's data is "astonishing", the parliamentary committee chief who invited him to attend said on Tuesday.

Headline: May says more to be done against Russia over spy attack
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May told senior ministers on Tuesday there was still more to be done in Britain's long-term response to Russia after blaming Moscow for the use of a nerve agent against a former Russian spy in England.

Headline: Far-right referrals to UK's counter-terrorism scheme soar
Description: Referrals to the British government's counter-terrorism programme Prevent because of far-right concerns rose by more than a quarter last year, official figures showed on Tuesday.

Headline: Whistleblower questions Brexit result, says campaigners broke election law
Description: A whistleblower at the heart of a Facebook data scandal on Monday questioned the result of Britain's 2016 Brexit referendum as his lawyers presented evidence that they said showed the main campaign for leaving the EU had broken the law.

Headline: Doping - UK agency says no data lost in weekend cyber attack
Description: Cyber attackers targeted British sport's anti-doping agency over the weekend without gaining access to any data, it said in a statement on Monday.

Headline: British Jews protest against Corbyn over anti-Semitism
Description: British Jewish groups held a street protest outside parliament on Monday against opposition Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn, accusing him of failing to tackle anti-Semitism in party ranks because of a far-left world view hostile to Jews.

Headline: Labour leader Corbyn apologises for anti-Semitism in his party‍​
Description: The leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, apologised on Sunday for anti-Semitism within his party, as he faced the prospect of protests over a perceived failure to act on such incidents in the past.

Headline: Americans less likely to trust Facebook than rivals on personal data
Description: Opinion polls published on Sunday in the United States and Germany cast doubt over the level of trust people have in Facebook  over privacy, as the firm ran advertisements in British and U.S. newspapers apologising to users.

Headline: Parliament must have power to stop 'No Deal' Brexit - UK opposition
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party on Monday demanded that parliament have the final say on the government's Brexit deal, including an option to send ministers back to the negotiating table rather than leave without an exit agreement.

Headline: May - More than 130 people could have been exposed in Salisbury nerve attack
