Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday that more than 130 people could have been exposed to the military-grade nerve agent that poisoned Russian ex-spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter in the English city of Salisbury earlier this month.

Headline: Czech president asks spy service to see if Novichok was produced locally
Description: Czech President Milos Zeman has ordered the country's counter-intelligence service to see if the type of nerve agent used in an attack in Britain could have been made in the Czech Republic.

Headline: UK says world's patience is wearing thin with Russia's Putin after chemical attack
Description: British Defence Secretary Gavin Williamson said on Monday that the world was united behind Britain's stance over the poisoning of a former Russian spy and that patience was wearing thin with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Headline: Baltics poised to expel Russian envoys over British spy attack - diplomats
Description: European Union governments were set to make good on a threat to punish Russia for a nerve agent attack in Britain they blame on Moscow, with Baltic governments expected to expel Russian envoys on Monday, diplomats said.

Headline: Baltics poised to expel Russian envoys over British spy attack - diplomats
Description: European Union governments were set to make good on a threat to punish Russia for a nerve agent attack in Britain they blame on Moscow, with Baltic governments expected to expel Russian envoys on Monday, diplomats said.

Headline: Britain welcomes EU support over spy attack, up to states to decide action against Russia
Description: Britain welcomes the support shown at a summit last week by other EU countries over an attack on a former Russian spy, but it is up to them if they decide to take further action against Moscow, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: Parliament will have a meaningful vote on Brexit deal- PM's spokesman
Description: The British government has been clear that it will give parliament a meaningful vote on the final Brexit deal it negotiates with Brussels, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Egypt says it deported British journalist for working illegally
Description: Egypt said on Sunday it had deported a British journalist for the Times newspaper last month because she was working illegally.

Headline: UK opposition seeks binding promise on post-Brexit Northern Ireland border
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party demanded on Sunday that the government makes a legally binding promise to avoid a hard border in Northern Ireland once Britain leaves the European Union, saying ministers' pledges could not be trusted.

Headline: Former Brexit activist says UK's Leave campaign broke funding rules
Description: A former pro-Brexit activist has accused a group which campaigned to take Britain out of the European Union of breaking spending limits before the 2016 referendum, Britain's Channel 4 television reported, a charge denied by the campaign group.

Headline: UK investigators search London office of firm at centre of Facebook data storm
Description: Investigators from Britain's data watchdog searched the London offices of Cambridge Analytica, the data analytics firm at the centre of a storm over allegations it improperly harvested Facebook  data to target U.S. voters.

Headline: Labour sacks Northern Ireland policy chief over call for second EU referendum
Description: Britain's opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn sacked his shadow Northern Ireland minister on Friday after he called for a second referendum on Brexit, a move that exposes deep divisions in the party over how and whether to leave the European Union.

Headline: Factbox - Parlez-vous Brexit? A 'Brexicon' of the UK-EU break-up
Description: As Britain's Brexit negotiations with the European Union moved into a new phase on Friday, the process has generated a new language all of its own, some of it colourful, much of it mystifying to the uninitiated.

Headline: May welcomes Brexit transition, trade talks loom
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May welcomed the approval by European Union leaders on Friday of a transition period to help business adapt after Brexit, telling the bloc to ride the "new dynamic" in upcoming trade talks.

Headline: Who's your friend? Wistful EU embraces May before Brexit
Description: With Brexit a year away, European Union leaders made a point on Friday of embracing Theresa May, with some treating her troubles with Russia and the United States as an opportunity to show Britain who its friends are.

Headline: Porton Down denies it could have been source of nerve agent that poisoned ex-spy
Description: Britain's military research facility at Porton Down said it could not have been the source of the nerve agent that poisoned Russian ex-spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter in the city of Salisbury this month, the BBC reported on Friday.

Headline: Prince Harry and fiancee Meghan delight crowds in Belfast
Description: Britain's Prince Harry took his American fiancee Meghan Markle to Northern Ireland on Friday where they were met by screams of delight as the couple ended their tour of the United Kingdom's four nations.

Headline: Teenager who tried to bomb London train jailed for 34 years
Description: An Iraqi asylum-seeker was jailed for 34 years on Friday for trying to set off a homemade bomb on a rush-hour London commuter train in a botched attack that injured 30 people last year.

Headline: Arch-Brexiteer accepts PM May's transition deal for now, denies wanting her job
Description: A millionaire Brexiteer who cultivates the image of an English gentleman from another century, Jacob Rees-Mogg is one of the unlikely winners of the 2016 referendum and is the bookmakers' favourite to become next leader of the Conservative Party.

Headline: Police stand down London Westfield shopping mall alert
Description: Police briefly closed roads and underground railway exits as they investigated a suspicious vehicle near the Westfield shopping centre in west London on Friday.

Headline: Police stand down suspicious package alert near London's Gherkin building
Description: British police said a reported suspicious package in the City of London near London's "Gherkin" building on Friday was a harmless discarded electrical item and lifted cordons in the area.

Headline: May now faces biggest test - a Brexit trade deal to keep everyone happy
Description: For Theresa May, the hardest stage of Brexit talks may be just beginning.

Headline: Heathrow Airport expansion on track despite election delay - Grayling
Description: The expansion of Europe's biggest airport Heathrow is on track despite a delay in the consultation process due to last year's parliamentary election, Transport Secretary Chris Grayling said on Friday.

Headline: Britain, EU make significant progress in Brexit talks - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday Britain and the European Union had made significant progress in Brexit talks and that she was looking forward to talks on their future economic partnership.

Headline: Policeman in poisoned ex-spy incident discharged from hospital
Description: A British police officer, one of the first to respond to the poisoning of a former Russian double agent, was released from hospital on Thursday after more than two weeks of treatment, officials said.

Headline: Russian agent may have limited mental capacity after nerve attack
Description: A military-grade nerve toxin attack on former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter may have left them with compromised mental capacity and it is unclear whether they will recover, a British judge said on Thursday.

Headline: 'Sacre bleu!' New post-Brexit British passport to be made by Franco-Dutch firm
Description: The new blue British passports that Prime Minister Theresa May hailed as "an expression of our independence and sovereignty" after Brexit will be made by a Franco-Dutch firm, the boss of the British company which lost the contract said on Thursday.

Headline: Prince Harry and fiancee Meghan invite 600 guests to wedding
Description: Britain's Prince Harry and his American fiancee Meghan Markle have invited 600 guests to their wedding in May although who is on the list is not being revealed yet, his office said on Thursday.

Headline: May lays wreath to mark anniversary of parliament attack
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May laid a wreath on Thursday to remember the five victims of an attack exactly a year ago when a driver mowed down pedestrians on Westminster Bridge before killing an unarmed policeman outside parliament.

Headline: UK court allows OPCW to test blood samples from poisoned ex-Russian spy
Description: An English court has given permission for blood samples to be taken from poisoned ex-Russian spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter for testing by chemical weapons experts, a courts spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Second police officer in hospital after UK spy poisoning - Mail Online
Description: A second police officer is being treated in hospital for suspected poisoning after a chemical attack on a former Russian double agent but the symptoms are minor, the Mail Online reported on Thursday.

Headline: Secret buyers of luxury properties in Britain face jail in new crackdown
Description: Frontmen who help wealthy investors from Russia and other states use foreign shell companies to hide the ownership of luxury London properties face up to two years in jail and unlimited fines, Britain's government said on Thursday.

Headline: Hollywood actor Michael Sheen takes on Britain's high-cost lenders
Description: Hollywood actor Michael Sheen has launched a campaign aimed at tackling high-cost credit in Britain, as a report released on Wednesday surveyed for the first time the impact on people's health and mental wellbeing of such problem debts.

Headline: Devolved UK parliaments pass bills to keep current powers after Brexit
Description: Britain's devolved parliaments in Scotland and Wales on Wednesday approved bills that aim to keep their current powers unchanged after Brexit, a backstop in case a dispute with Prime Minister Theresa May's government drags on.

Headline: Sparks fly in Moscow as Russia, Britain trade accusations over spy poisoning
Description: Britain accused Moscow on Wednesday of running an assassination programme to eliminate its enemies, while Russia said Britain may itself have orchestrated the poisoning of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia in England.

Headline: Russia's foreign ministry says UK's Johnson poisoned with hatred
Description: Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman said on Wednesday British foreign minister Boris Johnson was poisoned by hatred for Russia and that his apparent comparison between Russia and Hitler's Germany was unacceptable.

Headline: Russia's foreign ministry says UK's Johnson poisoned with hatred
Description: Russia's foreign ministry spokeswoman said on Wednesday that British foreign minister Boris Johnson was poisoned with hatred and anger, and that she found it frightening he represents a nuclear power.

Headline: Chemical weapons inspectors on scene of UK nerve agent attack
Description: Inspectors from the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) have begun work at the scene of the nerve agent attack on former Russian agent Sergei Skripal in the English city of Salisbury, a Reuters photographer said.

Headline: Brexiteers dump fish in Thames to protest at EU deal
Description: Supporters of Britain's exit from the European Union dumped crates of haddock into the River Thames on Wednesday to protest against Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit transition deal which they say has betrayed the fishing industry.

Headline: Putin wants to cause trouble wherever he can, says Johnson
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin wants to cause trouble wherever he can so he can portray his country as strong again after the collapse of the Soviet Union, British foreign minister Boris Johnson said on Wednesday.

Headline: Salisbury attack probably linked to Russian election - Johnson
Description: The timing of an attack using military-grade nerve agent against a former Russian spy in England was probably connected to the weekend election won by President Vladimir Putin, British foreign minister Boris Johnson said on Wednesday.

Headline: Germany stands by Britain's side after nerve agent attack - Merkel
Description: Germany stands at Britain's side after a nerve agent attack in England that bares the hallmarks of Russian involvement, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Wednesday.

Headline: Russia foreign ministry - Britain may be behind attack on Skripal's daughter
Description: A Russian Foreign Ministry official said on Wednesday that Britain may be behind a chemical attack on Yulia Skripal, daughter of former Russian spy Sergei Skripal.

Headline: Court rules in favour of case on Britain's ability to reverse Brexit
Description: A legal attempt by anti-Brexit campaigners to establish that Britain could unilaterally reverse Brexit was given a boost on Tuesday by Scotland's top court, which said it wants to examine the case in greater depth.

Headline: Court rules in favour of case on Britain's ability to reverse Brexit
Description: A legal attempt by anti-Brexit campaigners to establish that Britain could unilaterally reverse Brexit was given a boost on Tuesday by Scotland's top court, which said it wants to examine the case in greater depth.

Headline: UK says RAF engineer dies in jet crash in Wales
Description: Britain's Ministry of Defence said an engineer from the Royal Air Force's Red Arrows Aerobatics Team died when a Hawk jet crashed at RAF Valley in Anglesey, north Wales, on Tuesday.

Headline: Expelled Russian diplomats leave Britain in nerve agent crisis
Description: Twenty three expelled Russian diplomats and their families left London for Moscow on Tuesday as Britain and Russia traded recriminations over a nerve agent attack in England that has plunged relations into their worst crisis since the Cold War.

Headline: Tests of substance in UK attack on ex-Russian spy to take three weeks - agency
Description: Experts with an international chemical weapons watchdog were sent to Britain following an attack on a former Russian spy in Salisbury, and the results of the analysis will take about three weeks, the agency's head said on Tuesday.

Headline: Scots take hard line on Brexit fishing rights
Description: Politicians on both sides of the divide in Scotland criticised a Brexit transition deal which failed to deliver full control over fishing rights, with Conservatives suggesting they could not support a final agreement unless it did so.

Headline: Britain and U.S. clash with Russia at U.N. arms control forum over nerve attack
Description: Britain accused Russia of spreading "half-truths and half-lies" in a U.N. debate on Tuesday over a nerve toxin attack on a Russian double agent, while Russian officials quoted British opposition politicians to raise doubts about the allegations.

Headline: UK wins Brexit transition deal in return for Irish vow
Description: Britain and the European Union agreed on Monday to a transition period to avoid a "cliff edge" Brexit next year -- though only after London accepted a potential solution for Northern Ireland's land border that may face stiff opposition at home.

Headline: Merkel pleased about Brexit transition deal but says many problems remain
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday she was pleased that the European Union and Britain had agreed on a Brexit transition deal but added that there were still many challenges to overcome in negotiating Britain's departure from the bloc.

Headline: EU's Barnier sees most difficult Brexit issues to come at the end of talks
Description: European Union Brexit negotiator, Michel Barnier said on Tuesday he expected the most difficult negotiations with London to come at the end of the process.

Headline: Britain withdraws offer to lead EU military force after Brexit
Description: Britain has withdrawn its offer to lead a European Union military force next year because of Brexit, the Ministry of Defence said on Tuesday.

Headline: Three buses leave Russian embassy in London as expelled diplomats head to Moscow
Description: Three buses with diplomatic number plates left the Russian embassy in London on Tuesday as 23 diplomats who were expelled by Prime Minister Theresa May over a military-grade nerve toxin attack headed back to Moscow.

Headline: UK business lobby says Brexit deal a victory for pragmatism
Description: The deal on Brexit transition gives British businesses 20 months of valuable time and marks the victory of pragmatism over politics, the head of British business lobby CBI said on Tuesday.

Headline: Irish Foreign Minister sees 'good progress' in Brexit transition agreement
Description: Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said an agreement between the European Union and Britain on Monday on a Brexit transition period represented "good progress" and made the British commitment to address Irish issues clearer.

Headline: Ireland says Brexit border deal 'legally firm'; DUP says not resolved
Description: The Irish government on Monday said an agreement that would leave Northern Ireland within the European Union's customs union after Britain leaves the EU was "legally firm," but Northern Ireland's largest party said the issue remained open for debate.

Headline: EU firms scale back presence in UK as Brexit nears - survey
Description: One in seven businesses from European Union countries with a presence in Britain have moved parts of their business out of the country because of concerns about disruption after Brexit, according to a survey published on Tuesday.

Headline: DUP not concerned by Brexit transition deal - source
Description: Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party is not concerned by the British government's commitment on Monday to a "backstop" solution to avoid a hard post-Brexit border as no final agreement has been made, a party source said.

Headline: Inspectors analyse toxin used on Russian spy, EU backs Britain
Description: Inspectors from the world's chemical weapons watchdog on Monday began examining the poison used to strike down a former Russian double agent in England, in an attack that London blames on Moscow.

Headline: Britain wins fresh EU, NATO support over nerve attack
Description: Britain's foreign minister won further support from the European Union and NATO on Monday over a nerve agent attack on a former Russian double agent as he denounced Moscow's denials of involvement as "increasingly absurd".

Headline: Russia says regrets EU comments on UK spy attack
Description: Russia's Foreign Ministry said on Monday it regretted comments made at a meeting of European Union foreign ministers on Monday about the poisoning of a former Russian double agent in Britain.

Headline: UK police say spy poisoning investigation likely to take months
Description: The investigation into a nerve agent attack on former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter is likely to take several months as it is one of the most complex undertaken by British counter terrorism officers, police said on Monday.

Headline: Sweden to summon Russian ambassador over nerve toxin claim
Description: The Swedish foreign ministry said it would summon Russia's ambassador on Tuesday over Moscow's claim that Sweden could be the source of a nerve toxin used in the Skripal attack in Britain.

Headline: Putin to France's Macron: Allegations Russia behind UK spy poisoning unproven
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday told Emmanuel Macron, his French counterpart, by phone that allegations Moscow was behind the poisoning of a former British spy and his daughter in Britain were unsubstantiated, the Kremlin said.

Headline: May says only conclusion is Russian state behind spy poisoning
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday Russia was to blame for the poisoning of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal, rejecting denials from Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Headline: Reaction to the Brexit transition deal between UK and EU
Description: The European Union and Britain agreed that their divorce treaty would include an emergency "backstop" to avoid a hard border in Ireland, the bloc's Brexit negotiator said on Monday, adding that meant London would now get a transition deal.

Headline: EU's Barnier says Britain secures post-Brexit transition
Description: The European Union and Britain agreed that their divorce treaty would include an emergency "backstop" to avoid a hard border in Ireland, the bloc's Brexit negotiator said on Monday, adding that meant London would now get a transition deal.

Headline: EU, UK agree should be 'backstop' on Ireland border - draft Brexit text
Description: The European Union and Britain have agreed that there must be a "backstop" solution to ensure that there is no hard border between Northern Ireland and Ireland, according to the draft text of a Brexit treaty published on Monday.

Headline: No sign of forced entry in suspected murder of Russian businessman - Police
Description: British police said on Monday there was no sign of forced entry to the house of a Russian businessman who they believe was murdered at his home in London last week.

Headline: Britain says $500 million from alleged fraud can be returned to Angola
Description: Britain's National Crime Agency (NCA) said on Monday $500 million  frozen in the UK as part of an ongoing investigation into a potential fraud against Angola's central bank can be returned to the southern African country.

Headline: Britain assured EU that Brexit deal will have Irish 'backstop' - lawmaker
Description: The European Union and Britain reached agreements on several fields the bloc has required to grant London a status-quo transition after Brexit, said Danuta Hubner, a bloc's lawmaker who deals with the matter.

Headline: Britain plans greater powers for pensions watchdog
Description: Britain's pensions regulator will be able to impose "punitive fines" on companies which put their pension schemes at risk, the government said on Monday in a document outlining proposals to strengthen powers to protect employees after retirement.

Headline: Britain plans greater powers for pensions watchdog
Description: Britain's pensions regulator will be able to impose "punitive fines" on companies which put their pension schemes at risk, the government said on Monday in a document outlining proposals to strengthen powers to protect employees after retirement.

Headline: EU, UK reach broad agreement on transition, Irish issues - diplomat
Description: EU and British negotiators have agreed draft Brexit treaty texts dealing with a transition period and other issues and have a broad agreement on Irish border arrangements although some details are outstanding, a senior EU diplomat said on Monday.

Headline: Amid Brexit deal talk, EU summons envoys, media
Description: EU Brexit negotiators summoned national envoys and journalists at short notice on Monday as speculation mounted among diplomats of an interim deal to grant Britain a transition -- though some urged caution.

Headline: Gambling shares rise after commission calls for 30 pounds limit on machines
Description: Share prices in British betting shops rose on Monday after the  Gambling Commission recommended setting the maximum stake for fixed odds betting terminals at 30 pounds, a higher cap than campaigners had sought.

Headline: UK aerospace industry could be priced out after Brexit - MPs
Description: Britain's aerospace industry would be badly damaged if the country leaves the European Union without a free trade deal and any divergence from EU rules would be "utterly self-defeating", a committee of lawmakers said.

Headline: Britain accuses Russia of secretly stockpiling deadly nerve agent used in attack
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Sunday that Russia has been stockpiling the deadly nerve agent used to poison a Russian former double agent in England and has been investigating how such weapons can be used in assassinations.

Headline: Russia expels 23 British diplomats as crisis over nerve toxin attack deepens
Description: Russia expelled 23 British diplomats on Saturday in a carefully calibrated retaliatory move against London, which has accused the Kremlin of orchestrating a nerve toxin attack on a former Russian double agent and his daughter in southern England.

Headline: NATO eyes changes at July summit after attack blamed on Russia - Welt am Sonntag
Description: NATO must improve its defensive capabilities and willingness to act in the wake of increasingly aggressive and unpredictable actions by Russia, the head of the transatlantic alliance said in a German newspaper interview published on Sunday.

Headline: Britain should consider longer EU exit process if needed - lawmakers
Description: Britain should consider a limited extension to its exit process from the European Union if needed to ensure details of its future relationship with the bloc are agreed, a committee of lawmakers said in a report.

Headline: Swedish foreign minister rejects 'unacceptable and unfounded' Russia toxin claim
Description: Swedish Foreign Minister Margot Wallstrom rejected Russian claims on Saturday that the country could be the source of a nerve toxin used against a former Russian double agent and his daughter in Britain, calling them "unacceptable and unfounded".

Headline: Czech foreign minister rejects Russia's nerve toxin origin claim
Description: Czech Foreign Minister Martin Stropnicky on Saturday denied Moscow's accusation that the nerve toxin used against a former Russian double agent and his daughter in southern England came from the Czech Republic.

Headline: Britain says its priority is looking after staff in Russia
Description: Britain said on Saturday its priority was looking after its staff in Russia, after Moscow expelled 23 British diplomats in a escalating crisis between the two countries over the poisoning of a double agent.

Headline: May says considering next steps after Russia expels British diplomats
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Saturday Britain would consider its next steps alongside its allies in the coming days after Russia had earlier said it would expel 23 British diplomats.

Headline: Russia summons British ambassador as it readies to expel diplomats
Description: Russia's foreign ministry summoned Britain's ambassador to the country, Laurie Bristow, for a meeting on Saturday, Russian news agencies reported, citing an unidentified ministry source.

Headline: British ambassador in Moscow arrives at Russian foreign ministry
Description: Britain's ambassador to Russia arrived at the foreign ministry in Moscow for a meeting on Saturday, a Reuters witness said.

Headline: UK treating death of Russian businessman Glushkov as murder - police
Description: British police said on Friday they had launched a murder investigation following the death this week of a Russian associate of late tycoon Boris Berezovsky.

Headline: Kremlin says no clear proof Russia behind Skripal attack - RIA
Description: There is no clear proof that Russia is linked to an attack involving a nerve agent against a former Russian double agent  in England, the Kremlin spokesman said on Friday, commenting on U.S. President Donald Trump's suggestion that there was.

Headline: Expelled Russian diplomats will leave Britain on March 20 - RIA
Description: The Russian diplomats expelled from Britain will leave London on March 20, RIA news agency cited the Russian Ambassador to Britain as saying.

Headline: Russia to expel UK diplomats as crisis over nerve toxin attack deepens
Description: Russia is set to expel British diplomats in retaliation for Prime Minister Theresa May's decision to kick out 23 Russians as relations with London crashed to a post-Cold War low over an attack involving a military-grade nerve agent on English soil.

Headline: Britain says likely that Russia's Putin made decision for nerve agent attack
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Friday that it was overwhelmingly likely that Russian President Vladimir Putin himself made the decision to use a military-grade nerve toxin to strike down a former Russian agent on English soil.

Headline: Russian ambassador gets note saying Skripals in critical condition - RIA
Description: Russia's ambassador to London said he had received a diplomatic note informing him that Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia are in a critical condition, but that Britain was "hiding" further details, RIA news agency reported on Friday.

Headline: Germany, France to discuss response to nerve agent attack in UK - Merkel
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Friday she would discuss with French President Emmanuel Macron an appropriate response to an attack using a military-grade nerve agent that Britain has blamed on Russia.

Headline: Britons face holiday red tape without Brexit deal - trade body CEO
Description: Britons going on holiday in the European Union next year will need to pay more for travel insurance and get documentation to take their cars to the continent without a strong Brexit transition deal, the head of Britain's insurance trade body said on Friday.

Headline: Russia says will investigate poisoning of Skripal's daughter
Description: Russia's Investigative Committee said on Friday it had opened a criminal investigation into the attempted murder of Yulia Skripal, daughter of former double agent Sergei Skripal, and what it said was the murder of another Russian in Britain.

Headline: Kremlin - Accusation of Putin role in poisoning is shocking: TASS
Description: The Kremlin said on Friday that British accusations that President Vladimir Putin was involved in a nerve agent attack in England were shocking and unforgivable, TASS news agency reported.

Headline: In poison attack, EU's first focus not to boycott Russian World Cup - Merkel
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said the immediate priority of European Union leaders discussing the nerve agent attack on a Russian ex-spy in Britain would not be to discuss a potential boycott of the soccer World Cup in Russia.

Headline: Ad executive admits sexist email 'misses the mark'
Description: An outgoing advertising executive ranked his female colleagues by attractiveness in an email sent to his entire office, in the latest episode of sexist behaviour to rock a British workplace.

Headline: Germany urges Russia to be transparent over nerve agent attack in Britain
Description: Germany believes there is "no plausible alternative" to Britain's view that the responsibility for the chemicals weapons attack on a former spy in England is to be found in Russia, a government spokesman said.

Headline: UK seeks independent verification of nerve agent used in attack on spy
Description: Britain has written to the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) to arrange external verification of a military-grade nerve toxin used to attack a Russian double agent, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Friday.

Headline: Russia could announce measures against Britain 'any minute' - Kremlin
Description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Friday that Russia could announce retaliatory measures against Britain in a diplomatic row over the poisoning of former double agent at "any minute".

Headline: Birmingham wants further details from Uber before licence decision
Description: Britain's second city Birmingham is seeking clarity from Uber  on its business model as it decides whether to renew the taxi app's licence after granting a temporary extension.

Headline: Labour leader warns of rushing into new Cold War without full evidence
Description: British Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn warned on Friday against rushing into a new Cold War with Russia before full evidence of Moscow's culpability in a military-grade nerve toxin attack on a former double agent is proven.

Headline: Russia's Lavrov says UK defence minister may lack education
Description: Russia's foreign minister Sergei Lavrov said on Friday that British defence minister Gavin Williamson, who earlier told Russia to "go away and shut up", may lack education.

Headline: May visits city where Russian double agent was poisoned
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May visited Salisbury on Thursday, the elegant cathedral city which became the unlikely backdrop to a chemical attack against a Russian former double agent this month.

Headline: Nerve agent planted in luggage of Russian agent's daughter - The Telegraph
Description: The military-grade nerve toxin that poisoned former Russian agent Sergei Skripal was planted in his daughter's suitcase before she left Moscow, The Telegraph newspaper reported, citing unidentified sources.

Headline: Russia: We'll exert maximum pressure on Britain over spy poisoning - Ifax
Description: Alexander Yakovenko, Russia's ambassador to Britain, said on Friday that Moscow would exert maximum pressure on London in a standoff over the poisoning of a former spy, the Interfax news agency cited him as saying.

Headline: Russia expects West to take new steps over spy poisoning - RIA
Description: Moscow expects Britain, the United States and their partners to soon take new steps against Russia related to the poisoning in Britain of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal, news agency RIA quoted a senior Russian diplomat as saying on Friday.

Headline: Russia's Lavrov says Moscow will expel British diplomats
Description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Friday Russia will expel British diplomats in response to London's decision to expel 23 staff at the Russian embassy in London.

Headline: West calls on Russia to explain nerve toxin attack on former double agent
Description: Britain, the United States, Germany and France jointly called on Russia on Thursday to explain a military-grade nerve toxin attack in England on a former Russian double agent, which they said threatened Western security.

Headline: UK city Birmingham wants further details from Uber before licence decision
Description: Britain's second city Birmingham is seeking clarity from Uber [UBER.UL] on its business model as it decides whether to renew the taxi app's licence after granting a temporary extension.

Headline: After nerve agent attack, NATO sees pattern of Russian interference
Description: NATO accused Russia on Thursday of trying to destabilise the West with new nuclear weapons, cyber attacks and covert action, including the poisoning of a Russian former double agent in Britain, that blurred the line between peace and war.

Headline: Britain tells NATO nerve agent attack 'concerns whole alliance'
Description: Britain's National Security Adviser Mark Sedwill told the Western NATO alliance on Thursday that the nerve agent attack on a Russian double agent was an issue for all 29 allies and blamed Moscow for the attempted murder.

Headline: Britain to let international body check its poison findings
Description: Britain is working on giving independent international experts the opportunity to check its conclusion that a critically ill Russian former spy was poisoned by a Russian-made nerve agent, its foreign minister said.

Headline: Novichokolate from Putin? Graffiti irony near Russian embassy tackles nerve attack
Description: Opponents of President Vladimir Putin used graffiti on Thursday to take an ironic swipe at Russia over the nerve toxin attack on a former double agent.

Headline: Macron to respond firmly after Russia attack - presidential source
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron will act with "firmness" following the "despicable" attack in Britain, a presidential source said.

Headline: Queen gives formal consent for grandson Harry to marry Meghan Markle
Description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth has formally given her permission for her "dearly beloved" grandson Prince Harry to marry his U.S. fiancee Meghan Markle.

Headline: May visits policeman in hospital after he was poisoned helping Russian spy - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May visited a policeman in hospital on Thursday after he was poisoned helping a Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, her spokesman said.

Headline: UK nuclear project needs better supply chain management - regulator
Description: A nuclear plant project in southwest England has made good progress in supply chain management but some improvements are needed before construction accelerates, an inspection has found.

Headline: Russia: We never had a programme to develop nerve gas named in UK spy case - Ifax
Description: Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said on Thursday that neither Russia nor the Soviet Union had run a programme to develop the 'Novichok' nerve gas which Britain says was used to poison a former double agent, the Interfax news agency reported.

Headline: 'Go away and shut up', British minister tells Russia
Description: Britain's defence secretary said on Thursday that Russia should shut up and go away as London and Moscow traded insults over the nerve agent attack on a former Russian double agent in the English city of Salisbury.

Headline: 'Go away and shut up', British minister tells Russia
Description: Britain's defence secretary said on Thursday that Russia should shut up and go away as London and Moscow traded insults over the nerve agent attack on a former Russian double agent in the English city of Salisbury.

Headline: After hesitancy, France backs Britain over Russian role in attack
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Thursday he shared Britain's assessment that Russia was behind a nerve agent attack on a former spy living in England and vowed to take measures in response in the coming days.

Headline: Latest suspicious package at parliament found to be harmless
Description: London police were called to investigate a suspicious package at the British parliament on Thursday but concluded it was not harmful, the latest in a string of such incidents which Prime Minister Theresa May has condemned as "abhorrent".

Headline: UK, U.S., France, Germany jointly condemn chemical attack on ex-spy
Description: The leaders of France, Germany, Britain and the United States issued a joint statement on Thursday condemning a chemical attack on a Russian former double agent in England and blaming Moscow for it.

Headline: Russia hopes ex-spy will recover, reveal truth about poison attack
Description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Thursday he hoped that former double agent Sergei Skripal recovers from a nerve agent attack in Britain so that he can shed light on what happened, Russian state news agency TASS reported.

Headline: UK to invest 48 million pounds in new chemical weapons defence centre
Description: Britain will invest 48 million pounds in a new chemical warfare defence centre at its Porton Down military research laboratory, Defence Secretary Gavin Williamson said on Thursday.

Headline: Macron says will announce response to spy poisoning in Britain in coming days
Description: President Emmanuel Macron said on Thursday he would decide in the coming days what measures France will take after agreeing with a British assessment that Russia was behind an attack on a former spy in England.

Headline: Britain needs tougher law to tackle 'air quality catastrophe' - lawmakers
Description: Britain should introduce new, more ambitious legislation to tackle poor air quality after failing to deal with the problem, lawmakers said on Thursday.

Headline: Russia says will first inform UK on retaliation, then wider public
Description: Russia will first tell Britain about any retaliatory measures against London in the spy case before revealing them to the wider public, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Thursday.

Headline: Russia to expel British diplomats soon, foreign minister says - RIA
Description: Russia will soon expel British diplomats in retaliation for Britain's decision to expel 23 Russian diplomats over the poisoning of a former spy in southern England, Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Thursday.

Headline: UK cut in Russia gas imports would be political gesture - Russian energy minister
Description: Any move by Britain to cut its gas imports from Russia would be "politically motivated", the Russian energy minister said on Thursday, amid a worsening rift between Moscow and London over the poisoning of a former Russian double agent in England.

Headline: Russia calls British PM's allegations over poisoning 'insane'
Description: A Russian foreign ministry spokeswoman on Thursday described  allegations by British Prime Minister Theresa May that Russia was to blame for the nerve agent poisoning of former spy Sergei Skripal as insane.

Headline: Moscow says still ready to work with London on spy poisoning
Description: Moscow is still ready to work with London to investigate a chemical weapons attack in Britain on a former Russian double agent, but Britain is refusing to cooperate, Russia's foreign ministry said on Thursday.

Headline: May and France's Macron to discuss spy poisoning on Thursday - Johnson
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will speak with French President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday after France said it was too early for Paris to decide whether action should be taken following a nerve agent attack on a Russian ex-spy in Britain.

Headline: Britain expels 23 Russian diplomats over nerve attack on ex-spy
Description: Britain is to kick out 23 Russian diplomats, the biggest such expulsion since the Cold War, over a chemical attack on a former Russian double agent in England that Prime Minister Theresa May blamed on Moscow, an assessment backed by the United States.

Headline: May expels 23 Russian spies, but unlikely to bother Putin
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's response to Russia after a nerve agent attack on British soil is unlikely to trouble Kremlin chief Vladimir Putin unduly, despite the expression of outrage that greeted it in Moscow.

Headline: Toys 'R' Us plans to close all U.S. stores; 33,000 jobs at risk - source
Description: Bankrupt Toys 'R' Us Inc is preparing to sell or close all 885 stores in its U.S. chain, risking up to 33,000 jobs, after failing to reach a deal to restructure billions of dollars in debt, a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headline: France says to coordinate response soon with Britain on spy poisoning
Description: France on Wednesday said it would be in touch with Britain in the coming hours to coordinate a response to a nerve agent attack on a Russian spy, which London has blamed on Russia, after an earlier muted reaction to Britain's allegations.

Headline: U.S. supports Britain's decision to expel Russian diplomats
Description: The United States shares Britain's assessment that Russia was responsible for a nerve agent attack in Britain against a former Russian double agent and supports Britain's decision to expel Russian diplomats, the White House said in a statement on Wednesday.

Headline: France to coordinate response to UK spy attack at the highest level
Description: France will coordinate with British authorities at the highest level its response to the nerve agent attack that London has blamed on Russia, Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK's devolved nations see potential deal over post-Brexit power-sharing
Description: Scotland and Wales are within reach of a deal with the central government over power-sharing, Scotland's Nicola Sturgeon said on Wednesday, easing the pressure on the British government as it negotiates its exit from the European Union.

Headline: UK response to Russia over spy poisoning not tough enough - Litvinenko widow
Description: Britain's response on Wednesday to the nerve agent attack on a Russian double agent in southern England does not go far enough and senior Kremlin figures should be targeted with sanctions, the widow of a Russian dissident murdered in London said.

Headline: Secret trial shows risks of nerve agent theft in post-Soviet chaos - experts
Description: The British government says Russia is to blame for poisoning former spy Sergei Skripal with a nerve agent, and most chemical weapons specialists agree.

Headline: Moscow received list of 23 Russian diplomats to be expelled from Britain - Foreign Ministry
Description: Moscow has received a list of 23 Russian diplomats to be expelled from Britain following Prime Minister Theresa May's statement responding to a nerve toxin attack on a Russian ex-spy in southern England, the Russian foreign ministry's spokeswoman said on state TV on Wednesday.

Headline: UK privacy watchdog ends WhatsApp probe after compliance pledge
Description: Britain's privacy watchdog said it had dropped an investigation into WhatsApp after the messaging service signed an undertaking not to share the personal data of users with its owner Facebook.

Headline: New German foreign minister - disappointed with Russia in ex-spy attack
Description: Germany's new Foreign Minister Heiko Maas called on Russia to cooperate in the investigation into a nerve agent attack on an ex-Russian spy in England for which British Prime Minister Theresa May blames Moscow.

Headline: Poland calls on Russia to answer questions in Skripal case
Description: Poland's Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki condemned on Wednesday an attempt to murder in Britain of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and demanded Russia, Poland's former master, to address the UK's questions regarding the case.

Headline: Russia says Britain chose confrontation over spy poisoning
Description: Russia's Foreign Ministry accused Britain on Wednesday of choosing confrontation over cooperation with Russia when handling the case of Sergei Skripal, a former Russian double agent poisoned in Britain.

Headline: UK media regulator, asked about Russia Today, says considering May's update
Description: Britain's media regulator said on Wednesday it was considering the information given by Prime Minister Theresa May on the poisoning of a Russian double agent when asked about the status of an investigation into Moscow's state-funded Russia Today.

Headline: Russian lawmaker promises tough reply from Moscow to May - RIA
Description: The speaker of the upper house of the Russian parliament, Valentina Matvienko, said on Wednesday that Moscow should react to Britain's actions in a fast, tough and reciprocal way, RIA news agency cited the lawmaker as saying.

Headline: Russian lawmaker promises tough reply from Moscow to May - RIA
Description: The speaker of the upper house of the Russian parliament, Valentina Matvienko, said on Wednesday that Moscow should react to Britain's actions in a fast, tough and reciprocal way, RIA news agency cited the lawmaker as saying.

Headline: Merkel says EU united on Russia, but must keep talking to Moscow
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said the European Union would present a common stance over a nerve agent attack on an ex-Russian spy in England for which British Prime Minister Theresa May holds Moscow responsible.

Headline: Russia's Lavrov never accepted invite, now withdrawn, to visit Britain - Foreign Ministry
Description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov had not accepted an invite to visit Britain, a ministry spokeswoman said on Wednesday, after British Prime Minister Theresa May that the invite was withdrawn.

Headline: UK seeking other gas suppliers as part of Russian sanctions, says May
Description: Britain is looking to find other countries to supply gas as part of steps being taken by London against Russia following the poisoning of a former double agent on British soil, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain has made clear the seriousness of spy poisoning to U.S. - May
Description: Britain has made the seriousness of the attempted murder of a former spy with nerve agent clear to U.S. officials, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday, and will work with whoever is in the administration to take a tough line on Russia.

Headline: Britain will stand up to any threats from Russia, says May
Description: Britain will stand up to any threats from Russia as relations deteriorate between the two countries, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday, after blaming Russia for the poisoning of a former Russian spy in southern England.

Headline: Britain ready to take other steps against Russian provocation - May's spokesman
Description: Britain has taken its first steps against Russia after a nerve agent attack on a former spy but Prime Minister Theresa May is ready to take other measures to respond to any more Russian provocation, her spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Status of Russia Today broadcaster in UK is up to the regulator - May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said the future in Britain of TV network Russia Today was not a matter for her but for the independent regulator Ofcom.

Headline: UK expulsion of envoys unacceptable and short-sighted -Russian embassy
Description: Britain's expulsion of 23 Russian diplomats following the poisoning of a former double agent is a hostile and unjustified action, Russia's embassy in London said on Wednesday.

Headline: May calls on allies to act on Russian chemical programme
Description: A nerve agent attack on a former Russian spy raises broader questions about Russia's illegal use of chemical weapons, and Britain's allies should respond appropriately, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: Russian MP says Russia could expel more than 23 British diplomats - RIA
Description: Russian lawmaker Vladimir Dzhabarov said on Wednesday he did not rule out that Moscow could expel more than 23 British diplomats from Russia, RIA news agency said.

Headline: Britain says actions of Putin 'tragic' after blaming Russia for spy attack
Description: Britain has no quarrel with the people of Russia but it is tragic that Russian President Vladimir Putin has chosen to act in such a way, British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday as she accused Moscow of being responsible for the poisoning of a former spy in England.

Headline: Britain expels 23 Russian diplomats over chemical attack on ex-spy
Description: Britain will expel 23 Russian diplomats in response to a nerve agent attack on a Russian former double agent in southern England, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday, adding it was the biggest single expulsion in over 30 years.

Headline: Russia says to respond to British expulsion of Russian diplomats
Description: Russia's Ambassador to Britain Alexander Yakovenko warned London on Wednesday of reciprocal measures if Britain expelled Russian diplomats, the RIA news agency said.

Headline: Facebook bans far-right group Britain First for inciting hatred
Description: Facebook  said on Wednesday it banned Britain First from its platform for breaking rules against inciting hatred, blacklisting a far-right group brought to global attention when U.S. President Donald Trump retweeted its anti-Islamic posts.

Headline: British ambassador discusses Skripal case at Russia's Foreign Ministry
Description: Britain's ambassador to Russia, Laurie Bristow, attended a meeting at Russia's Foreign Ministry on Wednesday where the poisoning in Britain of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal was discussed, the diplomat said.

Headline: U.N. Security Council to meet Wednesday on British nerve agent attack - diplomats
Description: The U.N. Security Council will meet on Wednesday afternoon to be briefed on the investigation into the nerve agent attack in Britain, United Nations diplomats and the British Foreign Office said.

Headline: Russia's Lavrov says no progress made in stand-off with Britain
Description: Moscow finds that no progress has been made towards resolving a standoff with London over the poisoning of Russian former double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter in Britain, Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain to expel significant number of Russian diplomats - Sky News
Description: Britain will expel a significant number of Russian diplomats as part of its response to the poisoning for a former double agent in southern England, Sky News reported on Wednesday, citing unidentified sources.

Headline: PM May to make statement to parliament on Salisbury incident
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will make a statement to parliament on Wednesday about the poisoning of a former Russian double agent, the opposition Labour Party said on Twitter.

Headline: PM May to make statement to parliament on Salisbury incident
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will make a statement to parliament on Wednesday about the poisoning of a former Russian double agent, the opposition Labour Party said on Twitter.

Headline: Britain accuses 'reckless' Russia at U.N. Human Rights Council
Description: Britain told the U.N. Human Rights Council on Wednesday that the use of a military grade nerve agent used in an attempt to kill a former Russian spy was a flagrant breach of international law and should serve as a warning to the international community.

Headline: Russian embassy seeking access to Skripal's daughter, Ifax cites source
Description: Russia's Interfax news agency cited a source as saying on Wednesday that the Russian embassy in Britain plans to ask for consular access to Yulia Skripal, who was poisoned together with her father, Russian former double agent Sergei Skripal.

Headline: Only Russia could be behind U.K. poison attack - toxin's co-developer
Description: A Russian chemist who helped develop the Soviet-era nerve agent used to poison a former Russian double agent in southern England said only the Russian government could have carried out the attack with such a deadly and advanced toxin.

Headline: After spy is poisoned, Britain mulls closing door to London for Russia's rich
Description: Britain's response to the poisoning of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal on its soil, using a nerve agent developed by the Soviet Union, could hit members of the Russian elite hard if it closes the door on their London lifestyles.

Headline: May wins backing of Trump, EU leaders in showdown with Russia
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and British Prime Minister Theresa May agreed on Tuesday that Russia must provide "unambiguous answers" after London gave Moscow until midnight to explain how a Soviet-era nerve weapon was used against a former Russian double agent.

Headline: Kremlin: Russia had no role in spy poisoning
Description: Moscow is in no way connected to the poisoning of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter in Britain, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Wednesday, adding that the accusations against Russia are groundless.

Headline: Russia says is not responding to British ultimatum on nerve attack
Description: Russia has not responded to Britain’s demand to explain by midnight how a Soviet-era nerve toxin was used to strike down a former Russian double agent, the Russian embassy in London said.

Headline: Irish PM calls for fresh Northern Ireland talks next month
Description: The British and Irish governments should redouble efforts next month to broker a deal that would restore a power-sharing government in Northern Ireland after a year of political stalemate, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Tuesday.

Headline: Russian associate of late tycoon Berezovsky found dead in Britain
Description: British counter-terrorism police were on Tuesday investigating the unexplained death of a Russian associate of late tycoon Boris Berezovsky but said the death was not thought to be linked to a nerve agent attack on a former Russian double agent.

Headline: Despite Brexit, Britain wins EU support on nerve agent attack
Description: Germany and France expressed solidarity with Britain on Tuesday after London accused Moscow of a nerve agent attack on British soil, but beyond strong vocal EU support, diplomats said there was little appetite for more economic sanctions on Russia.

Headline: Russia threatens to expel British media if UK bars Russia Today TV over spy poisoning crisis
Description: Russia threatened on Tuesday to expel all British media after Britain warned it could strip Russian broadcaster RT of its UK operating license if the government finds Moscow was behind a chemical attack on a Russian ex-double agent in England.

Headline: UK set for years of slow growth but Hammond vows to do better
Description: Britain's sluggish economy is heading for more weak growth over the next five years, according to official forecasts announced by finance minister Philip Hammond on Tuesday as the country heads for Brexit.

Headline: Germany's Merkel, UK's May agree to counter 'Russian aggression'
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel and British Prime Minister Theresa May agreed on Tuesday that allies should act together to counter "the pattern of aggressive Russian behaviour" after the poisoning of a former Russian double agent in England.

Headline: May says 'highly likely' Russia behind nerve attack on spy
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday it was "highly likely" that Moscow was responsible for the poisoning in England of Russian former double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter using a military-grade nerve agent.

Headline: Factbox - A few facts about the nerve agent Novichok
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday it was "highly likely" that Moscow was responsible for the poisoning in the English city of Salisbury of a Russian former double agent with Novichok, one of the deadliest chemical weapons ever developed.

Headline: Trump says U.S. with Britain 'all the way' over spy chemical attack
Description: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday the United States was with Britain "all the way" in a telephone call with Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: Trump agrees with May: Russia must provide answers on chemical attack - White House
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump agreed with British Prime Minister Theresa May that Russia must provide "unambiguous answers" about how a Russian-developed chemical agent came to be used against a Russian double agent in Britain, the White House said on Tuesday after the two leaders spoke.

Headline: France's Macron condemns nerve agent attack in Britain
Description: France's President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday condemned a nerve agent attack in Britain that poisoned two Russian nationals, including a former spy.

Headline: Britain to consider taxing digital giants' revenue
Description: Britain said it was considering taxing the revenues of internet companies like Facebook  and Google  until international tax rules are changed to cope with digital firms that can shift sales and profits between jurisdictions.

Headline: Britain to consider taxing digital giants' revenue
Description: Britain said it was considering taxing the revenues of internet companies like Facebook  and Google  until international tax rules are changed to cope with digital firms that can shift sales and profits between jurisdictions.

Headline: Russia will kick out UK media outlets if London shuts RT - RIA
Description: Russia will not allow any British media outlets to operate on its territory if Russian broadcaster RT loses its UK licence, a Russian foreign ministry spokeswoman said on Tuesday, amid a row over the poisoning of an ex-Russian double agent in England.

Headline: Russia warns Britain against cyber attack response to spy poisoning
Description: Russia's embassy in London said on Tuesday it was seriously concerned about reports that Britain could launch a cyber attack against Russia and urged the UK to carefully weigh the consequences of such action.

Headline: Explainer - The poisoning of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal
Description: Former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia remain critically ill in hospital after being poisoned with a nerve agent in the southern English city of Salisbury.

Headline: UK ambassador to Russia - UK expects Russian explanation on nerve agent used in Salisbury
Description: Britain's ambassador in Moscow, Laurie Bristow, said on Tuesday Britain expected an explanation from Russia on how a nerve agent used in an attack on a former double agent came to be in Britain.

Headline: U.S. Libor trader loses UK appeal over rigging conviction
Description: A former Barclays  trader lost an appeal against his conviction over Libor benchmark interest rate rigging at London's Court of Appeal on Tuesday.

Headline: Factbox - Main economic forecasts in UK budget
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond on Tuesday gave an update on Britain's finances and economic outlook.

Headline: Perpetrators of spy poisoning in UK must be held accountable - Germany
Description: The German government on Tuesday sharply condemned a nerve agent attack on a former spy that the British government has blamed on Russia, and said the perpetrators must be held accountable.

Headline: UK ambassador to Russia says May to decide on spy poisoning case on Weds - TASS
Description: Britain's ambassador in Moscow, Laurie Bristow, said Prime Minister Theresa May will announce on Wednesday who is responsible for poisoning a former double agent, Russian state news agency TASS reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain says investigation into spy poisoning going well, police to update soon
Description: The investigation into the poisoning of a former Russian spy in Britain is going well, Britain's Home Secretary Amber Rudd said on Tuesday, adding that the police would provide an update later in the day.

Headline: Britain to consider tax changes to reduce plastic use - Hammond
Description: The British government will consult on how the tax system can be used to change consumers' behaviour on plastic use, finance minister Philip Hammond said on Tuesday.

Headline: Trump says will talk to May about nerve agent attack
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he planned to talk to British Prime Minister Theresa May later on Tuesday about the nerve agent attack in Salisbury, England, that struck down a former Russian double agent who passed secrets to British intelligence.

Headline: EU says will support UK in Russian spy case if requested
Description: The European Union said on Tuesday that the attempted murder of a former Russian spy in Britain was "shocking" and that it was ready to support Britain if asked to do so.

Headline: Highlights - Chancellor Hammond delivers update on economy
Description: Philip Hammond, Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer, delivered a half-yearly update on the public finances and the economy.

Headline: Hammond trims deficit forecast for coming years
Description: Britain's government will borrow less by the early years of the next decade than previously forecast, finance minister Philip Hammond said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK nudges up 2018 growth forecast - Chancellor
Description: Britain has nudged up its official forecast for economic growth in 2018 while the outlook for subsequent years was unchanged or slightly worse, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Tuesday as he delivered an update on the economy.7

Headline: More work to be done on economy, Hammond tells cabinet
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond told top ministers on Tuesday there was still work to be done on the British economy and that he would continue to take a balanced approach to its management, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said.

Headline: British ambassador meeting Russian deputy foreign minister
Description: Britain's ambassador in Moscow, Laurie Bristow, met Deputy Foreign Minister Vladimir Titov at the Russian foreign ministry in Moscow, a spokesman for the embassy said on Tuesday.

Headline: Police assessing second suspicious package at parliament in two days
Description: Police were called to assess a suspicious package at parliament on Tuesday, the second such incident in as many days.

Headline: Suspicious items sent to parliament deemed non-hazardous
Description: Two suspicious packages sent to Britain's parliament have been found not to be hazardous after a police investigation, a spokesman for the parliament said on Tuesday.

Headline: France calls spy attack in Britain 'unacceptable', avoids reference to Russia
Description: France's foreign minister on Tuesday expressed his solidarity with Britain after a nerve agent attack on two Russian nationals, including a former spy, calling it "totally unacceptable."

Headline: Allegations of Russian involvement in 14 UK deaths to be investigated
Description: British Home Secretary Amber Rudd said police and the security services would investigate allegations of Russian state involvement in a number of deaths over recent years in Britain, a letter published on Tuesday showed.

Headline: Chemical weapons watchdog chief condemns Salisbury attack
Description: The head of the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons on Tuesday condemned the use of a chemical agent in the attack last week on a former Russian spy in Britain.

Headline: Russia's Lavrov says London refuses to provide access to Skripal case materials
Description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said on Tuesday the British government had refused to provide Moscow access to materials related to poison attack on Russian former double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter.

Headline: Johnson says Britain encouraged by 'friends' support over Russian spy poisoning - PA
Description: Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said Britain had been encouraged by the "willingness of friends" to show support and solidarity following the poisoning of a Russian double agent, Britain's Press Association reported on Tuesday.

Headline: German industry needs Brexit clarity next week - BDI
Description: German companies on Tuesday demanded that Britain agree by next week to an interim phase based on the status quo for its transition from the European Union and said that otherwise they would implement 'worst case' contingency plans.

Headline: Merkel ally eyes joint Western response against Russia in ex-spy case
Description: A conservative ally of German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday that if Russia fails to cooperate in the investigation into a nerve agent attack on a former Russian double agent in Britain, there should be a joint Western response.

Headline: U.S.'s Tillerson says Russia 'likely responsible' for ex-spy's poisoning
Description: The United States agrees with Britain's assessment that Russia was "likely responsible" for the poisoning in England of a Russian double agent and his daughter, U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson in a statement said on Monday.

Headline: Russia: British threats to boycott World Cup over spy attack hurt ties, sport - Ifax
Description: Russia's foreign ministry said on Monday British threats to boycott the 2018 soccer World Cup over the poisoning of a former Russian double agent in England would damage ties with Moscow and hurt world sport, Interfax news agency reported.

Headline: British authorities ban three foreign right-wing activists
Description: Britain has banned three foreign far-right activists from landing on its soil in the last three days, a British security official said.

Headline: Meghan Markle carries out first royal engagement with Queen
Description: Prince Harry's American fiancee Meghan Markle on Monday took part in her first official royal engagement with Britain's Queen Elizabeth since the couple announced they were getting married last year.

Headline: Russia calls British PM's spy attack allegations a 'circus' - agencies
Description: Russia said on Monday that British Prime Minister Theresa May's allegations Moscow was probably behind an attack on a former Russian spy in England were politically motivated and based on a provocation, Russian news agencies reported.

Headline: May says 'highly likely' Russia responsible for poisoning of ex-spy
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday it was "highly likely" that Moscow was responsible for the poisoning in England of a former Russian spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia.

Headline: Police say suspicious substance at parliament not hazardous
Description: A suspicious substance at the British parliament in Westminster was deemed non-hazardous, police said on Monday, in the latest of a string of packages to politicians and royals that have sparked security alerts.

Headline: 'No deal' Brexit could cost UK, EU companies 58 billion pounds - report
Description: Companies in Britain and the European Union face an extra 58 billion pounds in annual costs if there is a no-deal Brexit, with Britain's vast financial sector set to be the worst-hit industry, according to a report on Monday.

Headline: Two taken to hospital after suspect package at parliament
Description: Two people were taken to hospital as a precaution, as detectives investigated a suspect package at Britain's parliament, police said in a statement on Monday.

Headline: Britain still confident on winning transition deal at EU summit - spokesman
Description: Britain is still confident it can reach agreement with the European Union on a transition period after Brexit at an EU summit later this month, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Britain very close to Brexit transition deal with the EU -minister
Description: Britain is very close to agreeing the details of an implementation period with the European Union for its transition out of the bloc, junior Brexit minister Robin Walker said on Monday.

Headline: May to make 1630 GMT statement about nerve attack on Russian spy
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will make a statement in parliament at 1630 GMT on Monday about the nerve agent attack against a former Russian spy who passed secrets to British intelligence, Sky News said.

Headline: Kremlin says spy attack in Britain not a matter for Russian government
Description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Monday that the poisoning of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal in Britain was not a matter for the Russian government.

Headline: Kremlin says spy attack in Britain not a matter for Russian government
Description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Monday that the poisoning of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal in Britain was not a matter for the Russian government.

Headline: Britain will respond if it identifies who was behind spy attack - May's spokesman
Description: Britain will respond if it identifies who was responsible for an attack on a former Russian double agent in the English city of Salisbury, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: Russian state TV accuses Britain of poisoning spy in special operation
Description: Russian state TV has accused Britain of poisoning former double agent Sergei Skripal in southern England as part of a special operation designed to spoil Russia's hosting of the soccer World Cup this summer.

Headline: May expected to blame Russia for poisoning of spy - MP
Description: The chairman of the British parliament's foreign affairs committee said on Monday the nerve agent attack on a former Russian agent in southern England looked like state-sponsored attempted murder and he expected Moscow to be blamed.

Headline: UK police identify over 200 witnesses in nerve agent attack - minister
Description: British police have identified more than 200 witnesses and are looking at more than 240 pieces of evidence in their investigation into a nerve agent attack on a Russian ex-spy and his daughter, interior minister Amber Rudd said on Saturday.

Headline: Hundreds urged to wash clothes after UK nerve agent attack
Description: Hundreds of people who visited the Zizzi restaurant or the Mill pub in the English city of Salisbury were told on Sunday to wash their clothes after traces of nerve agent used to attack a former Russian spy last week were found at both sites.

Headline: Russian ex-spy, daughter still critical after nerve agent attack - UK minister
Description: Russian ex-spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia remain in hospital in a critical but stable condition after they were poisoned with a nerve agent, Home Secretary Amber Rudd said on Saturday.

Headline: BBC appeals to U.N. over 'collective punishment' of its journalists by Iran
Description: British broadcaster the BBC said on Monday it was appealing to the United Nations to protect its journalists in Iran after it said persecution and harassment by the Iranian authorities escalated in 2017.

Headline: Britain sends specialist troops to city where Russian double agent poisoned
Description: Britain deployed specialist troops on Friday to remove potentially contaminated objects from the English city where a Russian former double agent and his daughter were poisoned with a nerve agent.

Headline: Four arrested after balcony protest at Iranian embassy in London
Description: Four people were arrested after they climbed on to a first-floor balcony of the Iranian embassy in London on Friday and waved flags in an apparent protest against the government in Tehran.

Headline: Saudi Crown Prince signs off UK visit with push for fighter deal
Description: Britain and Saudi Arabia took a step closer to a multi-billion- pound arms deal on Friday, touching on the most inflammatory element of their relationship at the end of an official visit to London that has mixed warm diplomacy with angry street protests.

Headline: 'Terrible' to tell people to move city to find work - BoE chief economist
Description: British people should not be expected to move city to find work, and instead the government should find a way to revive depressed towns that have lost their original economic purpose, Bank of England chief economist Andy Haldane said on Friday.

Headline: Russia says London spreading propaganda over spy poisoning
Description: Britain's warnings of retaliation if it is proven Russia was behind the poisoning of a double agent are propaganda and not serious, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Friday.

Headline: British firms hope for halcyon days ahead of royal wedding
Description: After nearly 70 years of producing royal merchandise, British luxury gift manufacturer Halcyon Days is hoping the upcoming wedding of Prince Harry and his U.S. fiancee Meghan Markle will be a happy one for them as well as the bride and groom.

Headline: Britain will work with EU on exemptions to U.S. metals tariffs
Description: Britain will work with the European Union to consider the scope of any exemptions from impending U.S. tariffs on metals after President Donald Trump introduced levies on steel and aluminium imports, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Friday.

Headline: UK sends troops to city where Russian spy poisoned with nerve agent
Description: Britain is sending 100 military service personnel with expertise in dealing with chemicals to the city where a Russian double agent was poisoned with a nerve agent, police and the defence ministry said on Friday.

Headline: Russian double agent still in very serious condition after nerve agent attack
Description: Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia are still in a very serious condition in hospital after exposure to a nerve agent, British Home Secretary Amber Rudd said.

Headline: Britain will respond if Russia is proved to be behind nerve attack - May
Description: Britain will respond appropriately if evidence shows Moscow was behind a nerve agent attack on a former Russian spy and his daughter in England, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: Explainer - The poisoning of former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal
Description: A nerve agent was used to poison former Russian double agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia in the southern English city of Salisbury, Britain's top counter-terrorism officer said.

Headline: Meghan Markle baptised by archbishop ahead of wedding to Prince Harry - paper
Description: U.S. actress Meghan Markle has been baptised by the Archbishop of Canterbury, the spiritual head of the Church of England, ahead of her royal wedding in May to Britain's Prince Harry, the Daily Mail newspaper reported on Thursday.

Headline: Saudi Crown Prince commits to interfaith tolerance, says Anglican church
Description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman met the head of the Anglican church in London on Thursday and promised to promote interfaith dialogue as part of his domestic reforms, the British faith leader's office said.

Headline: Sinn Fein calls for British-Irish body to avoid direct rule of Northern Ireland
Description: Northern Ireland's largest Irish nationalist party, Sinn Fein, on Friday said a British-Irish body created under a 1998 peace deal should be convened urgently after London moved to impose a budget on the region because its parties have failed to form a government.

Headline: London moves to set Northern Ireland budget, step towards direct rule
Description: The British government on Thursday moved to impose a budget directly on Northern Ireland in the latest step towards re-imposing direct rule of the region, a move likely to upset Irish nationalists and that may spark a diplomatic row with Dublin.

Headline: Complex and dangerous, nerve agents are rarely used for assassinations
Description: Thousands of people have been fatally gassed with nerve agents on battlefields since World War Two, most recently in Iraq and Syria, but they are not a weapon of choice for urban assassinations.

Headline: Saudi crown prince met Hammond in London - government spokeswoman
Description: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman met British finance minister Philip Hammond at the Saudi embassy in London, a government spokeswoman said on Thursday, without giving further details of the discussions.

Headline: May defends Saudi ties as crown prince gets royal welcome in London
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May defended Britain's links to security ally Saudi Arabia on Wednesday as Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman met Queen Elizabeth for lunch on a high-profile visit that drew protests over Riyadh's human rights record.

Headline: UK, Saudi to strengthen U.N. inspection regime for Yemen -Johnson
Description: Britain and Saudi Arabia want to strengthen a United Nations inspection regime for ships headed to Yemen, the British foreign minister said after meeting his Saudi counterpart in London.

Headline: UK to build prison wing in Lagos to transfer Nigerian prisoners
Description: Britain will build a new wing at Kirikiri Prison in the Nigerian city of Lagos so that it can transfer Nigerian prisoners there, the government in London has announced.

Headline: Britain could use tracking devices on domestic abusers to protect survivors
Description: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - People who abuse partners or family members could be ordered to wear tracking devices and forced to attend addiction recovery programs as part of a proposed bill to better protect victims of domestic abuse, the British government said on Thursday.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP leader sees no return to devolution for months
