Description: EU summit chair Donald Tusk said on Friday that the bloc would start "exploratory contacts" with Britain on what London wants in a future trade relationship, as well as starting discussion on a post-Brexit transition.

Headline: May says wants best Brexit trade deal while regaining sovereignty
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday that Britain is working to secure the best trade deal with the European Union while regaining control over issues like immigration after the bloc agreed to move talks onto the next stage of negotiations.

Headline: EU gives formal green light to new Brexit phase
Description: European Union leaders gave their formal approval on Friday to the opening of a second phase of Brexit negotiations with Britain, focusing on a transition period and future trading relationship.

Headline: UK government has no plans to remove exit date in Brexit law to avoid rebellion
Description: Britain's government has no plans to withdraw its amendment to insert an exit date into Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit blueprint, a spokesman for the leader said on Friday, after losing a vote in parliament earlier this week.

Headline: UK PM May says Brexit accord is big step towards smooth EU exit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday Britain had taken an important step forward in delivering a smooth departure from the European Union after the bloc agreed to move talks onto the next stage of negotiations.

Headline: Scottish economic growth seen persistently below UK growth rate in coming years
Description: Scotland's economy will grow at a slower rate than that of the United Kingdom overall during the next five years, the Scottish Fiscal Commission forecast on Thursday.

Headline: Scotland breaks from rest of UK with tax hike for higher earners
Description: Scotland's government said on Thursday it will raise taxes on higher earners and increase public sector pay, using powers to levy higher income tax rates than the rest of Britain for the first time since it was given its own parliament 20 years ago.

Headline: After London setback, May wins Brexit cheer in Brussels
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May made clear her desire on Thursday to move Brexit talks forward to a discussion of a future trade relationship at a dinner with EU leaders who applauded her for progress made so far.

Headline: What a difference a year makes - EU warms to Britain's May
Description: A year ago, Prime Minister Theresa May was pictured standing alone at an EU summit, nervously playing with her sleeve as other leaders embraced and chatted around her - an image that summed up her isolation after Britain voted for Brexit.

Headline: What a difference a year makes - EU warms to Britain's May
Description: A year ago, Prime Minister Theresa May was pictured standing alone at an EU summit, nervously playing with her sleeve as other leaders embraced and chatted around her - an image that summed up her isolation after Britain voted for Brexit.

Headline: Britain First leader whom Trump re-tweeted arrested again in Belfast
Description: A leader of a British far-right group, whose anti-Islamic posts were retweeted by U.S. President Donald Trump causing outrage in  Britain, was arrested in Northern Ireland on Thursday minutes after being bailed over a separate incident.

Headline: Britain says best way forward on North Korea is to intensify economic pressure
Description: The best way forward on resolving the North Korean crisis is to intensify economic pressure on the secretive state, British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Thursday.

Headline: UK's May says on course to deliver Brexit despite parliament setback
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday she was on course to deliver Brexit and a new partnership with the European Union, shrugging off a parliamentary defeat that could weaken her hand as the decisive phase of talks begin.

Headline: Six months on, Grenfell fire survivors weep at London memorial
Description: Survivors of a blaze that killed 71 people six months ago in the Grenfell Tower social housing block in west London wept during a multi-faith memorial service at St Paul's Cathedral on Thursday attended by members of the royal family.

Headline: Parliament rebellion leaves UK with compressed Brexit timetable - May's spokesman
Description: Britain now faces a compressed timetable to pass all the laws it needs to get ready for Brexit, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday after lawmakers defeated the government on proposed changes to its EU withdrawal legislation.

Headline: Government avoids contempt of parliament charge over Brexit papers
Description: Ministers will not be held in contempt of parliament for their statements about the existence of studies on how Brexit will affect the economy, Britain's House of Commons speaker John Bercow said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit 'no deal' is massively less probable after EU agreement, Davis says
Description: Britain is less likely to leave the European Union without an agreed exit deal after last week's decision by the European Commission to recommend that talks move on to the next phase, Brexit minister David Davis said on Thursday.

Headline: UK RICS house price balance slips to lowest since March 2013
Description: British house prices were flat for the first time in more than four years during the past three months, a closely watched industry survey showed on Thursday, as falling prices in London and nearby areas dragged down the national average.

Headline: UK urgently needs Brexit transition deal, and more time after that, MPs say
Description: Britain urgently needs a "standstill" deal to keep its ties with the European Union unchanged in a post-Brexit transition period, and will probably need an adaptation phase after that for sectors such as financial services, a group of MPs said.

Headline: Heathrow launches environmental consultation on expansion
Description: Heathrow Airport announced a public consultation on the proposed development of a third runway at Europe's biggest airport, saying it aimed to mitigate the environmental impact of expansion.

Headline: May defeated in parliament over Brexit blueprint
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government was defeated on Wednesday, when MPs forced through changes to its Brexit blueprint that ministers said could endanger Britain's departure from the European Union.

Headline: Parliamentary defeat will not stop preparations for Brexit day - government
Description: The British government is disappointed by a vote in parliament to change Prime Minister Theresa May's Brexit blueprint, but it will not stop legal preparations for Britain to leave the European Union, a spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Exclusive - After Grenfell fire, same builders rehired to replace dangerous cladding, Reuters finds
Description: Some building companies that installed dangerous cladding on social housing blocks across Britain are now winning new contracts following the Grenfell Tower blaze to remove their original work and install panels that can pass safety tests, a Reuters review shows.

Headline: Prince Harry's fiancee Meghan Markle to spend Christmas with  royals
Description: Prince Harry's fiancee, American actress Meghan Markle, will join Queen Elizabeth and other senior Windsors for their family Christmas celebrations in what commentators said was a break with royal protocol.

Headline: SFO head sees cross-border cooperation surviving Brexit
Description: The outgoing head of Britain's Serious Fraud Office (SFO) said on Wednesday the agency had provided the government with Brexit impact assessments and was confident all parties recognised the importance of cross-border criminal justice cooperation.

Headline: Close ranks - EU braces for 'divisive' Brexit trade talks
Description: EU negotiators look forward to trade talks with Britain next year once a Brexit divorce deal is endorsed by national leaders on Friday -- but they also worry this might fray the united front states have shown so far in dealing with London.

Headline: Scottish Conservative leader Davidson hints at move to Westminster
Description: Scottish Conservative leader Ruth Davidson, tipped by some as a future British Prime Minister, hinted she might stand for a seat in the UK parliament at the next election, a first step towards taking a more prominent role in British politics.

Headline: U.S. prepares to open doors on billion-dollar London embassy
Description: The United States' diplomatic team in London, custodians of one of the most significant bilateral relationships of the last 100 years, will next month move into a new home: a billion-dollar, 12-storey glass cube overlooking the River Thames.

Headline: Britain urged to prosecute social media firms over online abuse
Description: Social media companies should face prosecution for failing to remove racist and extremist material from their websites, according to a report by an influential committee.

Headline: UK seeks new anti-fraud head after crime agencies overhaul
Description: The British government on Tuesday began a long-delayed hunt for a new head of the Serious Fraud Office (SFO) after announcing plans to create a new national economic crime centre with the power to instruct the anti-fraud agency to investigate cases.

Headline: EU readies 'David Davis-proof' Brexit summit
Description: The European Union plays down talk by Britain's Brexit minister that last week's interim accord is not binding and will launch new talks on Friday that are "David Davis-proof", a senior EU official said.

Headline: May nudges UK towards a friendly EU divorce
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's divorce deal with the European Union is the strongest signal since the shock 2016 Brexit referendum that the United Kingdom is heading towards an orderly departure that preserves very close trade ties.

Headline: Goldman Sachs to have Labour over for tea as City seeks warmer ties
Description: The British Labour Party's would-be finance minister, John McDonnell, has accepted an invitation for talks at the Wall Street bank Goldman Sachs as it seeks better relations with a political party whose leaders have pilloried bankers.

Headline: Factbox - What are the economic policies of Labour Party?
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party, led by socialist Jeremy Corbyn, is more popular than Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives according to some opinion polls, and says it is ready to run the country if May's minority government falls.

Headline: Brexit minister says agrees with EU negotiator Verhofstadt on last week's deal
Description: British Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday that he and the European Parliament's negotiator Guy Verohfstadt agreed about the importance of last week's deal between Britain and the EU to move divorce talks to the next phase.

Headline: May hails new optimism in Brexit talks after deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May hailed "a new sense of optimism" in Brexit talks, telling parliament on Monday an agreement to move negotiations on to future trade ties is progress and will reassure those concerned Britain may leave with no deal.

Headline: May's deputy to keep job after pornography claims, ITV says
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's senior minister will not have to resign over claims that police found pornography on a work computer and that he made an inappropriate sexual advance against a young woman, ITV political editor Robert Peston said on Monday.

Headline: Ryanair pilots in Dublin vote in favour of industrial action
Description: Pilots employed directly by Ryanair in Dublin, its second largest base, have voted overwhelmingly in favour of taking industrial action in a growing dispute over the airline's collective bargaining system, the IMPACT trade union said on Monday.

Headline: Uber's London licence appeal to be heard next year
Description: Uber will defend its right to operate in London in court next year after the app was deemed unfit to run a taxi service and stripped of its licence in its most important European market.

Headline: Man arrested trying to climb wall at Buckingham Palace
Description: British police on Monday said they had arrested a man who tried  to climb a wall at Queen Elizabeth's Buckingham Palace home in central London, but said that the incident was not terrorism-related.

Headline: Brexit divorce bill dependent on future partnership agreement, says PM May
Description: Britain's promise to pay a financial settlement worth around 35 to 39 billion pounds to the European Union is conditional upon agreeing a future partnership with the bloc, British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: UK government accepts MPs' demands for scrutiny of Brexit law changes
Description: The British government will grant lawmakers more oversight of the process of severing ties with the European Union, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: In Dordogne idyll, Brits unimpressed with Brexit talks
Description: Britain's prime minister may be hailing "a new sense of optimism" in Brexit talks. But David and Iona Stent, who sold their English home three years ago to start anew in the sun-kissed vineyards of France's Dordogne, are having none of it.

Headline: Labour could move Bank of England operations away from London
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party is considering moving parts of the Bank of England to Birmingham if it wins power at the next national election, saying the change is needed to reduce the economy's reliance on London's banking industry.

Headline: Britain steps up battle against money laundering
Description: Britain said on Monday it would create a new national economic crime centre to crack down harder on money laundering by drug dealers and people traffickers who are expected to net 90 billion pounds ($120.3 billion) this year.

Headline: May shook on gentlemen's agreement on Brexit deal, EU says
Description: An interim Brexit deal struck by Theresa May and the European Commission is not legally binding but the British prime minister has committed her government to honouring a gentlemen's agreement, an EU spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Britain committed to no hard Irish border, whatever outcome of Brexit talks - Davis
Description: Britain intends to prevent a hard border in Ireland after leaving the European Union whatever the outcome of talks with the bloc, UK's Brexit minister said on Monday, saying comments that this was not legally enforceable were taken out of context.

Headline: Labour Party looks to move some BoE functions away from London
Description: Britain's Labour Party is considering moving some of Bank of England's functions to Birmingham, from its current home in Threadneedle Street in the City of London, according to an interim report on the British financial system released on Sunday.

Headline: Johnson meets Iran president as he lobbies for jailed aid worker
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson held almost an hour of talks with Iranian President Hassan Rouhani on Sunday after flying to Tehran to seek the release of a jailed British-Iranian aid worker.

Headline: After Brexit, UK aims for trade deal with EU that tops Canada pact
Description: Britain is aiming to secure a comprehensive free trade deal with the European Union and wants it to be signed shortly after it leaves the bloc in 2019, Brexit minister David Davis said on Sunday.

Headline: Britain has ways to secure no hard border with Ireland post-Brexit, says minister
Description: Britain has two proposals on how to secure a frictionless border with EU member Ireland after Brexit, a new customs partnership or a "highly streamlined approach" to customs, Northern Ireland minister James Brokenshire said on Sunday.

Headline: Labour wants closest UK ties with EU's single market post-Brexit - Starmer
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party supports keeping the closest possible trading ties with the European Union after Brexit and will lobby Prime Minister Theresa May to stick to that, the party's Brexit policy chief Keir Starmer said on Sunday.

Headline: Boris Johnson to meet Iran's president on Sunday - UK Foreign Office
Description: Britain's foreign minister Boris Johnson is expected to meet Iranian President Hassan Rouhani on Sunday to discuss bilateral and regional issues, a UK Foreign Office official said on Saturday.

Headline: Britain, EU clinch Brexit 'breakthrough' with move to trade talks
Description: Britain and the European Union struck a divorce deal on Friday that paves the way for arduous talks on future trade ties, easing immediate pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May and boosting hopes of an orderly Brexit.

Headline: EU eyes quick Brexit transition deal, trade pact to take time
Description: Businesses fretting about Brexit should get reassurance early in the new year that little will change for a couple of years after Britain leaves the European Union in less then 16 months, EU officials said on Friday.

Headline: Britons can change terms of Brexit to diverge from EU - pro-Brexit minister Gove
Description: British voters will be able to change the terms of the country's relationship with the European Union after leaving the bloc if they don't like the final Brexit deal, senior cabinet minister and pro-Brexit Member of Parliament Michael Gove said on Saturday.

Headline: Factbox - What's in the Brexit divorce deal?
Description: The European Commission said on Friday that enough progress had been made in Brexit negotiations to allow a second phase of talks on future relations to begin.

Headline: UK opposition leader Corbyn wants close relationship with Europe
Description: Britain's opposition Labour party wants a close relationship with the rest of Europe after Brexit, Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn told an audience at the United Nations in Geneva on Friday.

Headline: Questions on free movement, red tape linger in Brexit citizens' deal
Description: Britain's agreement with the European Union over key Brexit terms still leaves major issues like freedom of movement undecided, some campaigners said on Friday.

Headline: Questions on free movement, red tape linger in Brexit citizens' deal
Description: Britain's agreement with the European Union over key Brexit terms still leaves major issues like freedom of movement undecided, some campaigners said on Friday.

Headline: Corbyn wants much more information on EU divorce deal
Description: Opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Friday that he wanted to see much more information about the Brexit divorce deal struck between Prime Minister Theresa May's government and the European Commission.

Headline: EU draft guidelines on Brexit transition and a future relationship with Britain
Description: The European Commission said on Friday that enough progress has been made in divorce talks with Britain for the EU to move on to discussing a transition period after Britain's exit from the bloc and elements of a future trade deal.

Headline: May's Brexit deal wins her some peace at home - at least for now
Description: Theresa May won a temporary reprieve from rival factions within her own party on Friday by striking a overnight agreement with the European Union that some business leaders hope will increase prospects of an orderly exit from the bloc.

Headline: Irish PM cautious over two-year Brexit transition period
Description: The Brexit transition period of around two years envisaged in EU draft guidelines on Friday is a "decent amount of time" but a longer period could be needed to ratify a future trade deal, Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said.

Headline: UK staying in single market not a solution to Irish border issue - EU's Barnier
Description: Britain remaining in the EU single market is not one of the possible solutions to the problem of avoiding a hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland, the EU's chief Brexit negotiator said on Friday.

Headline: Scotland's Sturgeon harks back to independence after Brexit deal
Description: Scotland's leader cautioned Britain on Friday that its willingness to avoid a hard border in Northern Ireland after Brexit meant the issue of frontiers could never be used again as an argument against Scottish independence.

Headline: Tusk says EU to start transition talks with Britain
Description: The chairman of European Union leaders, Donald Tusk, said the bloc is ready to start negotiating a transition period with Britain after it leaves the EU, and it wanted more clarity from London on how it sees their new relationship after leaving.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Farage says UK set for 'next stage of humiliation'
Description: Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage said Britain was now ready to "move on to the next stage of humiliation" after Prime Minister Theresa May agreed the terms of Britain's divorce from the European Union.

Headline: EU ready to start Brexit transition talks early in 2018
Description: The European Union should be ready to start negotiating details of a post-Brexit transition period with Britain early in the new year, a senior EU official said on Friday, but talks on future trade will take longer.

Headline: France says progress in Brexit talks shows common sense prevailing
Description: Common sense is prevailing in Brexit negotiations between Britain and the European Union, France's foreign minister said on Friday, as he welcomed signs that talks were moving into a new phase after an initial breakthrough.

Headline: Ireland hails 'bullet-proof' border deal, sees less damaging Brexit
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar hailed a "politically bullet proof" agreement on its border with Northern Ireland as a very significant day for the island and one that pushed all sides towards a less economically damaging Brexit by Britain.

Headline: Germany - A lot of Brexit work remains even if talks enter phase two
Description: Germany regards Friday's joint report on progress made in the negotiations on Britain's departure from the European Union as a step forward but believes much work remains even if the initial stage of Brexit talks is concluded, a spokesman said.

Headline: Hammond says Brexit deal is a boost to the economy
Description: The divorce deal agreed by London and Brussels on Friday is a boost to the British economy, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Friday, as he urged both sides to now move on to a trade deal that supports jobs and prosperity.

Headline: Johnson congratulates May on Brexit talks progress
Description: Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson, who spearheaded the campaign for Britain to leave the European Union, congratulated Prime Minister Theresa May on agreeing a divorce deal with the EU to move Brexit talks on to trade on Friday.

Headline: Britain won't pay EU more, or sooner, than if it were EU member - Barnier
Description: Britain will honour all its financial obligations to the European Union as part of its divorce bill, but the payments will not be required any earlier than if Britain had remained an EU member, the EU's chief negotiator Michel Barnier said.

Headline: EU negotiator says British withdrawal deal must be ready by October 2018
Description: Britain's withdrawal agreement from the European Union must be ready by October, the bloc's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday as London and the 27 remaining states sealed a deal to move their negotiations forward.

Headline: David Davis says today is a big step forward in delivering EU exit - Twitter
Description: Brexit minister David Davis said Britain had taken a big step forward in delivering the country's departure from the European Union on Friday, commenting on a deal with the EU Commission to move to the next stage of negotiation.

Headline: More work to do on Irish border before final Brexit deal agreed - DUP
Description: There is more work to do to establish how Irish border arrangements will look after Brexit, Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party said on Friday, after Britain and the European Union agreed the outline of a deal.

Headline: Border agreement puts floor under EU/UK trade talks - Irish foreign minister
Description: The Brexit agreement on the Irish border that assures Northern Ireland will remain aligned with the European Union's customs union and single market "puts a floor" under what is possible in negotiations on trade after Britain leaves the EU, Ireland's foreign minister said.

Headline: Britain, EU agree on divorce bill, Northern Ireland, citizens' rights - joint report
Description: Britain and the European Union have agreed on the three key divorce issues of a financial settlement, citizens' rights and how to avoid a hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland after Britain leaves the EU, a joint report said.

Headline: EU's Tusk to make statement at 0730 GMT after meeting Britain's May
Description: The chairman of European Union leaders Donald Tusk is scheduled to meet British Prime Minister Theresa May at around 0700 GMT on Friday in Brussels and will make a statement to media at 0730 GMT, his press office said.

Headline: Boris Johnson to visit Iran, lobby for jailed aid worker
Description: British foreign minister Boris Johnson will travel to Iran on Saturday to lobby counterpart Mohammad Javad Zarif for the release of jailed Iranian-British aid worker Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe.

Headline: May promises to uphold Northern Ireland peace process as Brexit impasse ends
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday she would continue to govern in the interests of all Northern Ireland and uphold the agreement that ended decades of sectarian violence in the province.

Headline: UK to remain in sync after Brexit with EU rules supporting Irish peace
Description: Britain will "maintain full alignment" after Brexit with the European Union's single market and customs union rules that support peace, cooperation and economy on the island of Ireland, an agreement between the bloc and London said on Friday.

Headline: EU's Juncker says Brexit talks to move to second phase
Description: European Union chief executive Jean-Claude Juncker said on Friday that Brexit talks would move on to the second phase to talk about trade after he judged that "sufficient progress" had been made on the divorce deal.

Headline: EU executive says 'sufficient progress' made in Brexit talks
Description: The European Commission on Friday said Britain and the bloc have made "sufficient progress" in divorce talks.

Headline: Aide to EU Commission head tweets picture of white smoke at Brexit meeting with May
Description: Martin Selmayr, a top aide to the head of the European Commission Jean-Claude Juncker, signalled on Friday there was an agreement on Britain's divorce terms with the EU by tweeting a picture of white smoke that is a symbol of the election of a new pope.

Headline: Fighting deportation from UK, convicted ex-trader Adoboli wins reprieve
Description: Kweku Adoboli, a former UBS trader jailed for Britain's biggest fraud over unauthorised trades that cost the Swiss bank $2.3 billion (£1.7 billion), averted the immediate threat of deportation at a court hearing in London on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit Irish border deal possible within hours
Description: The United Kingdom and Ireland could reach agreement in hours on how to run their post-Brexit Irish land border, paving the way for a deal that would remove the last obstacle to opening free-trade talks with the European Union.

Headline: Brexit Irish border deal possible within hours
Description: The United Kingdom and Ireland could reach agreement in hours on how to run their post-Brexit Irish land border, paving the way for a deal that would remove the last obstacle to opening free-trade talks with the European Union.

Headline: 'Slightly modified' Irish border text under consideration - governing party MEP
Description: Brexit negotiators in Brussels, Dublin and London are working on a new text on the post-Brexit Irish land border with Northern Ireland that might be modified somewhat from a version that was almost agreed earlier this week, a member of the European Parliament from Ireland's governing party said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain says Brexit talks ongoing after calls with Irish and EU's Juncker
Description: Britain said on Thursday that talks about moving the Brexit process forward were "ongoing" after Prime Minister Theresa May spoke to Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker.

Headline: Brexit deal on Irish border possible by Friday - EU Commission
Description: Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker may meet early on Friday to reach a deal on the Irish border after Brexit, a Commission spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: 'We won't hold back', minister-turned-editor Osborne warns May on Brexit
Description: "We won't hold back," former Chancellor and now newspaper editor George Osborne declared on Thursday in a warning to Prime Minister Theresa May that he will not relent in his criticism of her Brexit plans.

Headline: EU's Tusk to make Brexit statement early Friday
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk will make a statement on Brexit early on Friday, his office said on Thursday, prompting speculation on the fate of British Prime Minister Theresa May's plans for a deal with Brussels.

Headline: British Foreign Secretary Johnson to travel to Iran this weekend - Guardian newspaper
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson is expected to travel to Tehran this weekend in a bid to win the release of a jailed Iranian-British aid worker, the Guardian newspaper reported on Thursday.

Headline: Uber's licence suspended in British city of Sheffield
Description: Uber's licence to operate in the northern English city of Sheffield was suspended last Friday after it failed to respond to requests about the management of its taxi app, the local authority said.

Headline: Whole of the UK needs to take back control of borders and cash from EU, Johnson says
Description: The United Kingdom as a whole needs to take back control of its borders, laws and cash when it leaves the European Union, Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Thursday.

Headline: Talks over Brexit divorce bill make progress - EU's Oettinger
Description: The European Union's budget commissioner Guenther Oettinger said on Thursday that noticeable progress was being made on talks over the divorce bill that London will pay the EU as it leaves the bloc.

Headline: EU sets Sunday deadline for May to cut Brexit deal
Description: The European Commission effectively set a deadline of Sunday for British Prime Minister Theresa May to return to Brussels to deliver an offer on a Brexit divorce deal.

Headline: Getting closer, but more work to be done on Brexit deal - May's spokesman
Description: Britain is close to an agreement with the European Union to unlock Brexit talks but Prime Minister Theresa May knows there is more work to be done on a deal for the border with Ireland, her spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Support for Irish PM's party surges on back of Brexit row
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar's Fine Gael party surged into an 11-point lead in a poll on Thursday, gaining credit for the government's Brexit negotiating stance and indicating its recent near-collapse had not hurt his popularity.

Headline: UK electoral body says investigating Labour-backing campaign group Momentum
Description: Britain's Electoral Commission said on Thursday it was investigating campaign group Momentum - which backed the opposition Labour Party at a June election - over whether it breached campaign finance rules.

Headline: Exclusive - EU parliament details UK concessions on rights
Description: Britain will guarantee rights for as yet unborn children who join EU parents after Brexit and accept EU judges' rulings on such rights, according to a draft European Parliament resolution seen by Reuters on Thursday.

Headline: Britain will not sign up to a bad Brexit deal, transport minister says
Description: Britain will not sign up to a bad Brexit deal but its economy will succeed even if it does not get a deal, transport minister Chris Grayling said on Thursday.

Headline: No Brexit deal worst-case scenario for Britain - Lords committee
Description: Britain will fail to agree a free trade deal with the EU before it plans to leave the bloc in 2019 and should seek a transition period to avoid a worst-case scenario of crashing out without an agreement, lawmakers from parliament's upper house said.

Headline: Britain to propose new language on Irish border, Irish PM says
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told her Irish counterpart Leo Varadkar that she would propose suggestions to Brexit negotiators over the next 24 hours to try to break an impasse on the issue of the Irish border, Varadkar said on Wednesday.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP says border talks delay raises 'no deal' Brexit risk
Description: The Northern Ireland party propping up the government of British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday warned that a stand-off over the wording of an agreement on the future of Northern Ireland's border increased the likelihood of a "no deal" Brexit.

Headline: May, Ireland's Varadkar speak on phone - May's office
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May spoke to Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar on the telephone on Wednesday, her office said in a statement.

Headline: May, Ireland's Varadkar speak on phone - May's office
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May spoke to Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar on the telephone on Wednesday, her office said in a statement.

Headline: Ireland open to adding to border text but clock ticking
Description: Ireland is open to adding to a tentative Irish border agreement that collapsed on Monday but movement will be needed by the end of the week if Brexit talks are to move onto the next phase this year, the country's European Affairs Minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: Bespoke Irish border solutions might work if no Brexit deal - Hammond
Description: British chancellor of the exchequer Philip Hammond said specific cross-border agreements could work in Ireland and Northern Ireland if Britain and the European Union fail to agree on broader issues about their relationship as part of the Brexit negotiations.

Headline: Chiding May, opposition Labour presses case for a customs union
Description: Britain should leave open the option of being in a UK-wide customs union with the European Union after Brexit and aim to keep the benefits of the bloc's single market, the opposition Labour Party said on Wednesday.

Headline: Irish, British PMs to speak again on Brexit in coming days
Description: The Irish and British Prime Minister agreed to speak again over the coming days after Irish premier Leo Varadkar reiterated his firm position on the Irish border in a call with Theresa May on Wednesday, his spokesman said.

Headline: UK government still undecided on final Brexit aims - Hammond
Description: Britain's government has not yet decided what it wants from a final Brexit deal because it is still waiting to clear preliminary talks with Brussels, chancellor of the exchequer Philip Hammond said on Wednesday.

Headline: Irish finance minister says Brexit border text must be retained
Description: The text agreed on Monday between British and EU negotiators on the future of Northern Ireland's border must be retained, Ireland's finance minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: May will discuss Brexit vision with team before year-end - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will discuss the desired "end state" for Brexit with her top team of ministers before the end of the year, her spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: May's spokesman warns against 'speculating' that money involved in DUP Brexit row
Description: A spokesman for British Prime Minister Theresa May warned on Wednesday against the idea that discussions with Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party to resolving a Brexit row could involve the Northern Irish budget.

Headline: Leader of DUP says will not be rushed on Brexit border text
Description: The leader of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party Arlene Foster has said she would "not be rushed" on agreeing the text of a deal between Britain and the European Union on the future of the region's border, the Belfast Telegraph reported.

Headline: DUP declines to comment on whether Brexit border deal possible by end of week
Description: A spokesman for Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party on Wednesday declined to comment on whether agreement could be reached between Britain and the EU on the region's post-Brexit border by an end-of-week deadline.

Headline: May says details of UK internal market to be worked out in second stage of Brexit talks
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday the government would give more details about how to preserve and protect the United Kingdom's internal market in the second phase of Brexit talks.

Headline: May says good progress in Brexit talks, expects a deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she had made good progress in Brexit negotiations and that she expected to get a deal that was right for the whole of the United Kingdom.

Headline: DUP says leader speaks to PM May but no plans to fly to London
Description: The leader of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party Arlene Foster spoke to British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday but she has no plans to fly to London for talks, a party spokesman said.

Headline: UK spring fiscal statement to be announced on March 13 - Hammond
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond said he would deliver an update on his budget plans on March 13.

Headline: Leaving EU customs union might not have big impact - UK's Hammond
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond said leaving the European Union's customs union need not represent a big change to Britain's relationship with the bloc, if the country replicates most of the current arrangements.

Headline: Briton accused of terrorism offences posted picture of Prince George - court
Description: A British man posted a picture of Prince George, 4, and the address of his London school as part of a series of possible targets for Islamist militants, a court heard on Wednesday.

Headline: PM May working towards EU summit, progress made in talks - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is working towards unlocking Brexit talks at an EU summit later this month and, despite there being more work to be done, has made good progress, her spokesman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Man appears in court accused of trying to kill May
Description: A 20-year-old man appeared in court on Wednesday accused of plotting to kill British Prime Minister Theresa May by first detonating an explosive device to get into her Downing Street office.

Headline: London mayor calls for UK apology over colonial-era massacre in India
Description: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan called on the British government on Wednesday to make a formal apology for the 1919 Jallianwala Bagh massacre in which nearly 400 Sikhs were shot dead by British Indian army soldiers.

Headline: British PM May faces pressure to soften Brexit divorce after EU exit deal crumbles
Description: Hours after a Brexit deal collapsed, British Prime Minister Theresa May came under pressure on Tuesday from opposition parties and even some allies to soften the EU divorce by keeping Britain in the single market and customs union after Brexit.

Headline: Christine Keeler, woman at the centre of Britain's biggest sex scandal, dies
Description: Christine Keeler, the model and dancer whose liaisons with a British minister and a Soviet diplomat at the height of the Cold War shocked Britain and embroiled the government in a notorious political sex scandal, has died aged 75.

Headline: Man appears in court accused of plotting to kill British PM May
Description: A man appeared in a London court on Wednesday on suspicion of plotting to kill Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: May speaking to DUP leader Foster - Sun newspaper
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is speaking to Arlene Foster, leader of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party, by telephone, the political editor of the Sun newspaper said on Wednesday.

Headline: Ireland might consider adding to Brexit border text - Irish Times
Description: Ireland might consider adding elements to the text of an agreement on the post-Brexit future of Northern Ireland's border as long as they do not undermine those already contained in the deal, the Irish Times reported on Tuesday.

Headline: 'Deadline of deadlines' in Brexit divorce talks this week
Description: Theresa May must deliver her offer on a Brexit divorce package this week if she wants European Union leaders to grant Britain's request for talks on future free trade when they meet next week, EU diplomats and officials said on Tuesday.

Headline: Countdown to Brexit breakthrough?
Description: Here is a timeline of the coming few days that will determine whether Britain avoids further costly delays in giving business assurances of a smooth exit from the European Union and of free trade with its biggest market in the future:

Headline: Supporters of jailed British-Iranian aid worker sing carols at Downing Street
Description: Supporters of Iranian-British aid worker Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, who is jailed in Iran, sang "homecoming" carols outside Prime Minister Theresa May's Downing Street offices on Tuesday evening.

Headline: DUP leader says warned UK's May it could not support Irish border deal - RTE
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party propping up British Prime Minister Theresa May told her on Monday it could not support her minority government unless a Brexit deal on the Irish border was changed, Irish broadcaster RTE quoted her as saying on Tuesday.

Headline: DUP leader says just as firm as Irish government on Brexit - Sky News
Description: The leader of the Northern Irish party propping up Britain's minority government said on Tuesday her party was just as firm about its demands for a Brexit plan for Northern Ireland as Ireland's government.

Headline: Britain says 'conceivable' Manchester attack might have been stopped
Description: A suicide attack at a pop concert in Manchester that killed 22 people in May might have been prevented if the security services had responded differently to intelligence in the months before the attack, a government report has found.

Headline: Irish PM seeking border deal on principles agreed already
Description: Ireland wants to reach an agreement on the future of the Irish border after Brexit that is based on the principles struck in a tentative deal on Monday, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Tuesday.

Headline: DUP accuses Dublin of reckless behaviour over Brexit
Description: The deputy leader of the Northern Irish party locked in a dispute over the border with Ireland accused Dublin on Tuesday of acting in a "reckless and dangerous" way, saying it was putting at risk years of good Anglo-Irish relations over Brexit.

Headline: DUP says it told UK it could not accept Brexit deal text
Description: The Northern Irish party that props up Prime Minister Theresa May said it only got the text of the draft Brexit deal late on Monday morning and that the party told the British government that the terms were unacceptable.

Headline: May to reconvene Brexit talks with EU this week
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May told senior ministers on Tuesday that she expects to reconvene Brexit talks with the European union later this week.

Headline: Britain says regulatory alignment for Northern Ireland could apply to whole UK after Brexit
Description: Britain wants any regulatory alignment for Northern Ireland to apply to the whole of the United Kingdom after Brexit, chief British negotiator David Davis said on Tuesday.

Headline: DUP says will not accept divergence between Northern Ireland and rest of UK
Description: The Northern Irish party which props up Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday it would not accept any Brexit deal that saw Northern Ireland diverging either economically or politically from the United Kingdom.

Headline: Britain's security services thwart nine plots in past year
Description: Britain has thwarted nine plots in the last 12 months, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday, after senior ministers were briefed by the head of the MI5 security service Andrew Parker.

Headline: London security alert ends as package ruled non-suspicious
Description: London police said an item that had prompted a security alert in the financial district of the city on Tuesday morning was non-suspicious, after authorities had closed St Paul's underground station as a precaution.

Headline: EU ready to resume Brexit talks with UK as soon as London is ready
Description: The European Commission is ready to resume Brexit negotiations with Britain as soon as London signals it is ready, a spokesman said on Tuesday, a day after a tentative divorce agreement collapsed at the last minute.

Headline: After Brexit deal crumbles, May to speak to Northern Irish party
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May and other British officials will speak to Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) on Tuesday after a tentative deal on Brexit with the European Union over the border with Ireland was dashed at the last minute.

Headline: Britain's Hammond says 'very confident' of deal on Brexit talks
Description: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond said on Tuesday he was confident the EU and Britain could reach a Brexit deal in talks this week.

Headline: Scottish Conservatives leader calls for a Brexit deal on a UK-wide basis
Description: The leader of Britain's Scottish Conservatives has called for a UK-wide Brexit deal which respects the integrity of the United Kingdom as a constitutional structure, Ruth Davidson said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headline: Irish border row thwarts May bid to clinch Brexit trade deal
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May failed to clinch a deal on Monday to open talks on post-Brexit free trade with the European Union after a tentative deal with Dublin to keep EU rules in Northern Ireland angered her allies in Belfast.

Headline: Irish PM says won't change substance of border deal with UK
Description: Ireland's prime minister said he was disappointed that Britain and the EU had failed to close a deal on Northern Ireland's border on Monday, and warned he would not accept any change to the substance of the agreement.

Headline: Factbox - Countdown to Brexit breakthrough?
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May failed to secure a breakthrough in Brexit talks on Monday with European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker.

Headline: Scotland, Wales and London want special Brexit deal if Northern Ireland gets one
Description: Scotland, Wales and London should all benefit from any special deal given to Northern Ireland to smooth access to European Union markets after Brexit, the three regions' most senior politicians said on Monday.

Headline: India asks UK court to extradite tycoon on fraud charges
Description: India asked a London court on Monday to extradite tycoon Vijay Mallya to face fraud charges of palming off losses from his failing Kingfisher Airlines onto a state-owned bank.

Headline: Scotland's Sturgeon sees no reason not to get special Brexit deal like Northern Ireland
Description: An agreement to keep Northern Ireland in "regulatory alignment" with the Europen Union after Brexit could be replicated in other parts of the UK, Nicola Sturgeon, the head of Scotland's devolved pro-independence government, said on Monday.

Headline: EU's Juncker says Brexit no deal is not a failure
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is a tough counterpart in Brexit talks, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said, adding that the lack of an agreement on Monday "is not a failure".

Headline: Time for Brexit deal getting very tight, but still possible next week - Tusk
Description: Time to reach an agreement between the European Union and Britain on divorce terms is getting very short, but a deal that would unblock talks on a future trade agreement is still possible by next week, the chairman of EU leaders said.

Headline: British PM says still confident can reach Brexit deal with EU
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she was confident of getting an agreement with the European Union on moving to the second phase of Brexit talks, despite failing to achieve a breakthrough on Monday.

Headline: No Brexit agreement between EU and Britain after May-Juncker meeting
Description: There was no agreement between the European Union and Britain on Brexit after a meeting on Monday between Prime Minister Theresa May and European Commission head Jean-Claude Juncker, a source said.

Headline: Britain and EU fail to agree Brexit deal on Monday - BBC
Description: Britain and the European Union have failed to fully agree a deal on Brexit, the BBC Europe editor said on Monday.

Headline: Juncker, May to address media after Brexit talks at 1550 GMT
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker will make statements to the media at 4:50 p.m. (1550 GMT) on Monday after talks on Brexit, the Commission said.

Headline: Irish PM statement on Brexit talks delayed
Description: A statement by Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar on the progress of Brexit talks between Britain and the European Union has been delayed, a spokesman said.

Headline: London mayor says wants special Brexit deal if Northern Ireland gets one
Description: London should get a special Brexit deal allowing it to stay within the European Union's single market and customs union if Northern Ireland is allowed to, the city's mayor said on Monday.

Headline: Facebook opens new London hub, to create 800 UK jobs
Description: Facebook opened its new London office on Monday with the promise of a further 800 jobs in the capital next year, underlining its commitment to Britain once it leaves the European Union.

Headline: Brexit deal on Ireland will ensure no hard border - minister
Description: British and European Union negotiators are "very close to final agreement" on issues relating to Ireland that will ensure there will be no re-imposition of a hard border on the island, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit deal agreed on all Irish issues - Irish government sources
Description: British and European Union Brexit negotiators have reached agreement on a deal for all Irish issues, including the maintenance of regulatory alignment on the island to avoid a hard border, two Irish government sources told Reuters.

Headline: Draft Brexit border text commits to 'continued regulatory alignment' - RTE
Description: Britain and the European Union will commit to "continued regulatory alignment" between Ireland and Northern Ireland after Brexit, Irish national broadcaster RTE reported on Monday, citing a draft negotiating text.

Headline: Luxembourg PM Bettel says has had "rather positive" news on Brexit talks
Description: Talks on Brexit on Monday have brought positive news, Luxembourg's prime minister said ahead of British Prime Minister Theresa May's meetings with EU officials later in the day in Brussels.

Headline: Brexit talks making good progress, but more to be done - May's spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday that there was more still to be agreed upon between Britain and the European Union in Brexit negotiations, although good progress is being made.

Headline: Britain and EU agree to avoid hard border in Ireland - Daily Telegraph
Description: Britain and the European Union have agreed a deal that ensures there will be no hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland after Brexit, the chief political correspondent of the Daily Telegraph said on Twitter on Monday.

Headline: Irish government says significant progress on Brexit talks
Description: Ireland has made "significant progress" in talks with Britain on the future of the Northern Irish border, but the sides are "not there yet", a spokesman for Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Monday.

Headline: Irish foreign minister says Brexit border breakthrough possible on Monday
Description: No agreement has yet been reached between Britain and Ireland on the future of the Northern Irish border, but the breakthrough required to allow wider Brexit talks to proceed could come later on Monday, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said.

Headline: Irish minister sees progress on border issue but no agreement with UK yet
Description: Negotiations over future border arrangements between the United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland after Brexit have made progress but there is no agreement yet, Ireland's European Affairs Minister Helen McEntee said on Monday.

Headline: Half of Britons support a second vote on Brexit, poll finds
Description: Half of Britons support a second vote on whether to leave the European Union and a third said they would be worse off financially outside the world's largest trading bloc, according to a new opinion poll.

Headline: PM's social mobility board quits over failing the poor
Description: All four members of the British government's Social Mobility Commission have quit accusing Prime Minister Theresa May of being too fixated on Brexit to improve the prospects of those from poor backgrounds.

Headline: London's mayor takes control of former Olympic stadium
Description: The mayor of London is taking control of the former Olympic stadium used by Premier League side West Ham United after an independent review disclosed rising costs and mounting losses.

Headline: London's mayor takes control of former Olympic stadium
Description: The mayor of London is taking control of the former Olympic stadium used by Premier League side West Ham United after an independent review disclosed rising costs and mounting losses.

Headline: Prince Harry and fiancee Markle delight crowd on first official walkabout
Description: Britain's Prince Harry and his American fiancee Meghan Markle delighted cheering crowds who braved the cold on Friday to watch the couple on their first official engagement together.

Headline: Fearing for post-Brexit prosperity and peace, farmers demand invisible Irish border
Description: Northern Irish sheep farmers like John Sheridan collectively transport more than 1,000 lambs a day over the Irish border for slaughter and shipment to shoppers across the European Union. At the moment, the process is seamless.

Headline: UK MPs cast doubt on plan to avoid Ireland border after Brexit
Description: Britain's intention to avoid a hard border between Ireland and Northern Ireland after Brexit is inconsistent with its plan to withdraw from the European Union's single market and customs union, a committee of lawmakers said on Friday.

Headline: Ireland demands 'significantly more clarity' from UK over Brexit border
Description: Ireland needs Britain to provide "significantly more clarity" on its plans for the Irish border, Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Thursday, denting hopes that London was on the verge of a deal to move on to the second phase of Brexit talks.

Headline: No north-south Ireland border despite leaving customs union, British minister pledges
Description: There will never again be a border dividing Northern Ireland and the republic, a British minister said days before a summit at which the Irish border issue threatens to derail Britain's Brexit plans.

Headline: Ireland says it needs significantly more clarity from UK on Brexit border
Description: Ireland will need "significantly more clarity" from the British government on the future of the Northern Ireland border before it will allow Brexit talks to move onto the next phase, Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Thursday.

Headline: DUP says Brexit talks must not compromise integrity of UK market
Description: The head of the Northern Ireland party propping up British Prime Minister Theresa May's government on Thursday warned her against any concession in Brexit talks that would create trade barriers between the region and the rest of the United Kingdom.

Headline: May says Donald Trump was wrong to retweet far-right videos
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday that U.S. President Donald Trump was wrong to retweet a video from a far-right British group which she said was "hateful" and spreads division.

Headline: Record fall in net migration to UK in year after Brexit vote
Description: Net migration to Britain fell by the largest amount on record in the 12 months after the Brexit vote, with more than three-quarters of the drop due to more EU citizens leaving and fewer arriving, official data showed on Thursday.

Headline: May is focused on tackling extremism, spokesman says in response to Trump
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is fully focused on tackling extremism, her spokesman said on Thursday, responding to a tweet by U.S. President Donald Trump telling her to focus on "destructive Radical Islamic Terrorism".

Headline: Amber Rudd hopes condemnation of Trump tweet has impact
Description: British Home Secretary Amber Rudd said on Thursday she hoped Britain's condemnation of U.S. President Donald Trump for retweeting material from a British far-right group would have an impact.

Headline: Irish minister says worried by lack of UK solution on post-Brexit border
Description: An Irish government minister said on Thursday said he was concerned that the British government had yet to present detailed proposals on allowing frictionless movement of goods and people across the Northern Ireland border after Brexit.

Headline: UK consumer sentiment sinks to 16-month low, house prices weak
Description: British consumers, the main drivers of the economy, are their least confident since just after last year's Brexit vote, and business morale has also softened, surveys showed on Thursday, adding to signs of a further economic slowdown in 2018.

Headline: BoE's Carney sees changes to UK financial rules after Brexit
Description: Britain's regulators will tweak banking and insurance rules inherited from the European Union after Brexit to make them more tailored to the British market, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit supporters say PM May selling UK short over divorce bill
Description: Brexit supporters accused Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday of being far too weak with the European Union after reports that she is ready to pay what Brussels is demanding to settle the divorce bill to leave the bloc.

Headline: Wary EU still pressing Britain for full Brexit deal
Description: The EU has not yet reached a deal with Britain over the "Brexit bill", EU officials said on Tuesday, adding that some in Brussels were worried that progress on a cash settlement masked differences over other issues.

Headline: Former Channel 4 boss Terry Burns to chair UK media regulator
Description: Britain said on Wednesday it had chosen Terry Burns, a former finance ministry official and chairman of publicly owned broadcaster Channel 4, to chair media regulator Ofcom from Jan. 1.

Headline: UK picks central England location for new electric battery hub
Description: Britain has picked a site in central England to house a new automotive battery manufacturing development facility, in a move which ministers and companies hope will lead to large-scale local production.

Headline: New electric London taxi poised for second overseas market
Description: London's black-cab maker could strike a deal soon on the second overseas market for the new electric version of its famous taxi, the boss of the Chinese Geely-owned firm told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain close to deal on Brexit bill with EU - sources
Description: Britain has offered to pay much of what the European Union was demanding to settle a Brexit "divorce bill", bringing the two sides close to agreement on a key obstacle to opening talks on a future free trade pact, EU sources said on Tuesday.

Headline: Nothing agreed yet, says UK government responding to 'Brexit bill' reports
Description: The British government said on Wednesday that nothing had been finalised in talks with the European Union on leaving the bloc, declining to comment on media reports it had reached a deal on the size of its Brexit divorce bill.

Headline: British negotiators still working on Brexit deal - Treasury minister
Description: British negotiators are still working out a deal with the European Union, Treasury minister Liz Truss said on Wednesday, calling reports that the government has agreed a sum of money to pay the Brexit bill "media speculation".

Headline: Johnson hopeful of moving onto second phase of Brexit talks
Description: Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Wednesday he hopes Britain's offer to settle the Brexit divorce bill at next month's European Union summit will be sufficient so they can move on to discuss their future trading relationship.

Headline: Irish border should see no queues post-Brexit - British minister
Description: Britain wants to reach an agreement with the European Union that would secure a frictionless border between EU member Ireland and Northern Ireland to avoid any need for queues on either side, junior Brexit minister Robin Walker said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK says seeking to build on 'momentum' for Brexit talks breakthrough
Description: Britain is seeking to build on the "recent momentum" in the Brexit divorce talks with the European Union before a summit next month, a spokeswoman for Britain's Department for Exiting the European Union said on Tuesday.

Headline: UK bows to EU, will assume liabilities worth up to 100 billion euros, FT says
Description: The UK has agreed to fully honour its financial commitments to the European Union, assuming liabilities worth up to 100 billion euros ($118.44 billion), as part of its agreement with the European Union on the Brexit divorce bill, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Redacted Brexit reports spark new tug-of-war with UK parliament
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's attempts to keep her Brexit plans secret provoked a new row on Tuesday when lawmakers criticised her for failing to hand over complete studies on the economic impact of Britain leaving the European Union.

Headline: UK government official says 'does not recognise' reported Brexit bill settlement
Description: A British government official cast doubt on a newspaper report on Tuesday that Britain and the EU had reached a financial settlement of between 45 billion and 55 billion euros.

Headline: No more pain for UK banks in 2017 BoE tests, but Brexit risks ahead
Description: Britain's banks all avoided bills for more capital in annual stress tests for the first time since 2014, but the Bank of England warned of pain ahead if there is no Brexit deal and said the country's current account deficit posed a big risk.

Headline: BoE questions EU figures showing banks' pullback after Brexit vote
Description: The Bank of England has challenged figures from the European Union's banking watchdog that showed a big drop in EU banks' exposures to Britain since the Brexit vote.

Headline: From blind date to Botswana's stars, Prince Harry charts love for U.S. actress Meghan Markle
Description: Just four weeks after a blind date with U.S. actress Meghan Markle that left him "beautifully surprised", Britain's Prince Harry took his wife-to-be on a trip to Botswana to camp under the stars in his tent.

Headline: Prince Harry's engagement shows British monarchy has moved on from scandals of past
Description: King Edward VIII sacrificed his throne and Queen Elizabeth's sister Margaret gave up her one true love, but for Prince Harry marrying a divorcee is no longer a bar to being a royal or following his heart.

Headline: Reaction to Prince Harry's engagement to Meghan Markle
Description: Britain's Prince Harry is engaged to his U.S. actress girlfriend Meghan Markle with the marriage due to take place in the spring of 2018, his father Prince Charles announced in a statement on Monday.

Headline: 'Thrilled' Prince Harry announces he will wed U.S. actress Meghan Markle
Description: Britain's Prince Harry and U.S. actress Meghan Markle announced on Monday they were getting married next year, saying their relationship had blossomed "incredibly quickly" after meeting on a blind date.

Headline: Teenage IS supporter guilty of plotting attack on Bieber concert in UK
Description: A British teenager was found guilty on Monday of planning to drive a car into a crowd in the Welsh capital Cardiff, with a Justin Bieber concert and a shopping centre among the list of possible targets for his Islamic State-inspired attack.

Headline: Britain, Ireland at odds on border as Brexit deadline nears
Description: Ireland and Britain remained at odds on Monday on how to progress talks on the Irish border with a week to go before London could face failure in persuading European Union leaders to open trade talks at a December Brexit summit.

Headline: As Brexit looms, UK pitches new industry plan, wins support from Merck, Qiagen
Description: Britain pitched a new strategy for industry on Monday, pledging greater state intervention to tackle weak productivity and to help the world's sixth largest economy cope with the upheaval of leaving the European Union.

Headline: Prince Harry says thrilled at engagement to U.S. actress Markle
Description: Britain's Prince Harry, who announced earlier on Monday he was engaged to his American girlfriend Meghan Markle, said they were both thrilled as they posed for their first picture together after the announcement.

Headline: Britain committed to avoiding infrastructure at Irish border post-Brexit
Description: Britain is committed to avoiding any physical infrastructure at the border with EU member Ireland after Brexit, but a solution can only be found in the context of a future relationship, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

Headline: Irish PM 'doing everything he can' to avoid election-spokesman
Description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar "is doing everything he can" to avoid a snap general election, his spokesman said, but the crisis that has brought his minority government to the brink showed no obvious sign of resolution on Sunday.

Headline: Support for Irish PM's party falls as snap election nears
Description: Support for Ireland's governing Fine Gael party fell in a poll on Saturday as a political crisis that has left the country three days away from the calling of a snap election showed no sign of being resolved.

Headline: Northern Ireland's DUP says will not accept different rules to rest of UK
Description: The Northern Irish party propping up Britain's minority government will not support any Brexit deal that sees the province operate under different regulations to the rest of the United Kingdom, its leader said on Saturday.

Headline: Brexit talks progressing, but issues remain - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday that Brexit talks were making progress but that there were outstanding issues on the divorce settlement and the border with EU member Ireland.

Headline: Ten days to crack Brexit deal, EU tells May
Description: The European Union handed Prime Minister Theresa May a 10-day "absolute deadline" to improve her Brexit divorce offer or face failure in persuading EU leaders to open trade talks with Britain at a December summit.

Headline: Britain has 10-day 'absolute deadline' to deliver on key Brexit issues - Tusk
Description: Britain has only 10 days left to deliver on all three areas of its divorce terms with the European Union if London wants to start talks on a transition period after Brexit and a future relationship, the chairman of EU leaders Donald Tusk said.

Headline: May wants EU, UK to 'move together' to Brexit trade talks
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May repeated her wish on Friday to make a joint move with the European Union to open negotiations on a post-Brexit trade deal.

Headline: Bank of England's Tenreyro says markets have understood rate message - Bloomberg
Description: Financial markets have understood the Bank of England's message on future interest rate policy, although the Brexit process risks throwing things off course, new BoE policymaker Silvana Tenreyro said in an interview published on Friday.

Headline: EU's Juncker says December 4 meeting with May will show if Brexit progress made
Description: The president of the European Commission Jean-Claude Juncker said on Friday that a meeting with British Prime Minister Theresa May on December 4 will allow the EU to see whether sufficient progress was made on Brexit talks.

Headline: Factbox - What progress? EU's price for Brexit breakthrough
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will hold talks in Brussels on Friday as Britain and the EU try to orchestrate a deal on divorce terms in the next three weeks that can unlock negotiations on post-Brexit trade.

Headline: Waiting for May, Brussels eyes December Brexit deal
Description: When Theresa May visits Brussels on Friday, EU negotiators will be listening intently for signs the British prime minister is preparing to risk a domestic backlash and raise her offer to secure a Brexit deal in December.

Headline: Iran sets Dec. 10 court date for jailed Iranian-British aid worker
Description: Iran has told jailed Iranian-British aid worker Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe that she will appear in court next month accused of spreading propaganda, her husband, Richard, said on Thursday.

Headline: UK sees weak growth, more borrowing, but Hammond says will spend
Description: Brexit-bound Britain slashed its economic growth forecasts and ramped up its borrowing plans going into the 2020s, but Chancellor Philip Hammond announced a number of spending steps aimed at winning back voters.

Headline: Britain to hike levy on diesel cars
Description: Britain will increase the tax paid by those driving new diesel cars that do not meet the latest emissions standards from next year, in the latest blow to the hard-pressed sector.

Headline: Brexit withdrawal bill to be debated from Dec. 4
Description: Britain's parliament will debate the Brexit withdrawal bill on Dec. 4, and on a further four days in the month, the leader of the House of Commons said on Thursday.

Headline: City to May - Don't haggle over pennies in Brexit talks
Description: Britain must not get bogged down haggling over "pennies" in settling its Brexit divorce bill and focus instead on the "big pounds" that a trade deal with Europe would bring, the new Lord Mayor of London said.

Headline: Britain to introduce extra levy on empty properties
Description: British councils will be able to double an annual charge paid by homeowners who leave their properties empty, in a new levy which could hit foreign buyers, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain urged to map out post-Brexit future for lawyers
Description: Britain needs to set out plans to make sure its lawyers can keep working across Europe after Brexit, a lobby group said on Thursday.

Headline: UK debt agency sees little rise in yields despite rising issuance
Description: British government bond yields do not look poised for a big increase, despite the higher public borrowing entailed by finance minister Philip Hammond's budget statement earlier on Wednesday, the UK Debt Management Office said.

Headline: Airlines unimpressed with British air passenger duty tweaks
Description: Britain's aviation industry on Wednesday criticised changes to a tax on air passengers which will freeze the duty for a majority of customers, saying they did not go far enough to keep Britain competitive as Brexit approaches.

Headline: May tries to win over young voters by slashing property purchase tax
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May slashed property purchase taxes for first-time buyers in a bid to win over younger voters who have shunned the ruling Conservatives because they are unable to buy a home.

Headline: Britain will use Brexit money to prepare for all outcomes - ministry official
Description: Britain will use extra money set aside for Brexit on preparations for all possible outcomes from the talks to leave the European Union, an official at the finance ministry said on Wednesday.

Headline: Factbox - British budget's energy sector policies
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond on Wednesday published the country's annual budget. Below is an outline of the main policies impacting the energy sector:

Headline: UK to reduce planned rise in business rates - Hammond
Description: Britain will reduce the annual rise in business rates by bringing forward a planned change in the way the tax is calculated, chancellor Philip Hammond said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK watchdog says Hammond's budget is 'significant giveaway'
Description: Britain's official budget watchdog said chancellor Philip Hammond's spending plans for the next two years represent a "significant giveaway" and that debt will only be cut through share sales and statistical reclassification.

Headline: Highlights - Chancellor Hammond delivers budget
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond delivered his annual budget statement to parliament on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain's budget contains 25 billion pounds of new spending - spokeswoman
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond's budget contains 25 billion pounds of new spending, his spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headline: Instant View - UK Budget: Britain slashes growth forecasts, sees higher borrowing
Description: Britain has slashed its official forecasts for economic growth and expects to borrow sharply more going into the next decade, chancellor Philip Hammond said as he delivered a budget statement in parliament.

Headline: Britain commits 44 billion pounds to boost housebuilding
Description: Britain on Wednesday committed 44 billion pounds to provide funding, loans and guarantees over the next five years in a bid to deliver 300,000 net additional homes per year on average by the mid-2020s.

Headline: UK to seek to cut plastic waste through tax system, charges - Hammond
Description: The British government will look into ways to reduce plastic waste through the tax system and charges on single-use plastic items, chancellor Philip Hammond said on Wednesday during his budget speech to parliament.

Headline: UK to seek to cut plastic waste through tax system, charges - Hammond
Description: The British government will look into ways to reduce plastic waste through the tax system and charges on single-use plastic items, chancellor Philip Hammond said on Wednesday during his budget speech to parliament.

Headline: Hammond raises thresholds for income tax next year
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond on Wednesday committed to raise the threshold at which Britons start to pay tax on their income to 11,850 pounds next year, compared with 11,500 pounds currently.

Headline: UK cuts economic growth forecasts - Hammond
Description: Britain has cut its official forecasts for economic growth, chancellor Philip Hammond said on Wednesday as he delivered a budget statement in parliament.

Headline: UK sets aside extra 3 billion pounds for Brexit preparations - Hammond
Description: The British government is setting aside 3 billion pounds for Brexit preparations in addition to funds allocated previously, chancellor Philip Hammond said on Wednesday during his budget speech to parliament.

Headline: UK budget to set out vision for post-Brexit Britain, says PM's spokesman
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond told ministers that his budget, due to be announced later on Wednesday, will set out a vision for post-Brexit Britain, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May told reporters.

Headline: UK government failed to protect consumers over Hinkley nuclear deal – MPs
Description: Britain's government failed to protect energy consumers when agreeing a deal to build the Hinkley C nuclear power station and should reevaluate the case for investing in more atomic plants, a UK parliamentary committee said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK government averts Brexit rebellion, giving ground on EU rights plan
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government averted a rebellion in parliament on Tuesday over plans to ditch the European Union's Charter of Fundamental Rights, promising to review its approach and make changes if needed.

Headline: Britain to detail Brexit bill when EU agrees to move talks forward
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May will only detail how big a divorce settlement Britain is willing to pay the EU when the bloc gives a commitment to moving talks forward, according to a plan rubber-stamped by even her most pro-Brexit ministers.

Headline: Higher UK borrowing underscores budget headache for Hammond
Description: British government borrowing unexpectedly grew last month, underscoring chancellor Philip Hammond's challenge as he weighs calls for more spending in his budget on Wednesday against the prospect of weaker economic growth ahead.

Headline: UK Brexit minister says EU agreement likely, but UK ready for no deal
Description: Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday that reaching a deal with the European Union was the most likely outcome of talks, but added that the British government was prepared for no agreement with the bloc.

Headline: Britain will honour commitments made to EU - May's spokesman
Description: Britain will honour its commitments made while a member of the European Union, but specific figures on how much the country will pay for Brexit are subject to negotiations, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday.

Headline: Northern Ireland parties downbeat on talks as May calls for progress
Description: Northern Ireland's main political parties pointed on Tuesday to fresh obstacles to restoring a devolved power-sharing government in the British region after meeting Prime Minister Theresa May, who urged them to resume talks next week.

Headline: May says believes Northern Irish accord possible
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday she wanted to see more talks next week between Northern Ireland's main parties, adding she believed an agreement to restore the devolved power-sharing government in the province could be reached.

Headline: May meets senior ministers to discuss Brexit divorce bill offer
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May met with senior members of her ministerial team on Monday to discuss their response to European Union demands for more detail on how much Britain is willing to pay as part of its Brexit divorce package.

Headline: DUP says Northern Ireland will leave EU on same terms as rest of UK
Description: The head of the Democratic Unionist Party said on Monday Northern Ireland would leave the EU on the same terms as the rest of the United Kingdom, rebuffing a suggestion from the bloc that the region remain subject to some of its rules.

Headline: Queen and husband Philip celebrate 70 years of marriage, quietly
