Description: Queen Elizabeth and husband Prince Philip mark their platinum wedding anniversary with a small family get-together on Monday, a far cry from the pomp and celebration which greeted their marriage 70 years ago.

Headline: UK commits billions to 'industries of future' to ward off Brexit shocks
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday announced 4 billion pounds of spending on research and development and regional growth strategies, setting out plans to help the economy grow after Brexit.

Headline: Brexit campaign probed over possible breach of electoral finance rules
Description: Britain's Electoral Commission has opened an investigation to establish whether Vote Leave Limited, the organisation behind the official campaign to leave the European Union, breached campaign finance rules during the 2016 referendum campaign.

Headline: Hammond seeks answer to voter unrest in new housebuilding push
Description: British finance minister Philip Hammond, under pressure to help weakened Prime Minister Theresa May in this week's budget, promised to speed up house building and said he had some room to help voters despite his squeeze on public finances.

Headline: Britain to submit 'Brexit bill' proposal before December EU meeting
Description: Britain will submit proposals on how to settle its divorce bill with the European Union before an EU summit next month and is expected to negotiate hard, finance minister Philip Hammond said on Sunday.

Headline: Gerry Adams to step down in end of an era for Irish nationalism
Description: Sinn Fein's Gerry Adams, a pivotal figure in the political life of Ireland for almost 50 years, said on Saturday he will step down as party leader and complete a generational shift in the former political wing of the Irish Republican Army (IRA).

Headline: Hammond increasingly confident Britain will get Brexit deal
Description: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond said on Sunday he was becoming more convinced Britain would secure a Brexit deal with the European Union.

Headline: Official photo released to mark 70th wedding anniversary of Queen Elizabeth
Description: Buckingham Palace issued a new photographic portrait of Queen Elizabeth and her husband Prince Philip on Saturday to mark their upcoming 70th wedding anniversary.

Headline: Gerry Adams - Face of IRA who helped cement Northern Ireland peace
Description: As the public face of the Irish Republican Army during its bombing campaigns, then peacemaker and mainstream politician, Gerry Adams has been a defining figure of Northern Ireland's 50-year journey from sectarian torment to relative stability.

Headline: Two weeks to unlock Brexit, EU tells May
Description: "There is more work to be done" to unlock Brexit talks, British Prime Minister Theresa May was told on Friday, as the European Union repeated an early December deadline for her to move on the divorce bill and border with Ireland.

Headline: Brexit progress needed by early Dec. to unlock talks - EU's Tusk
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said he told British Prime Minister Theresa May that the European Union wants progress on Irish border and financial issues by early December to move Brexit talks forward.

Headline: UK govt to consider tax on throwaway plastic
Description: Britain's finance department said on Saturday it expected finance minister Philip Hammond's budget statement next week to include a consultation on taxing and charging environmentally damaging single-use plastics.

Headline: Scottish Labour elects Leonard leader as Corbyn puts stamp on party
Description: Scottish Labour elected Richard Leonard as its new leader on Saturday, cementing the control of Jeremy Corbyn over Britain's opposition Labour Party north of the English border and -  supporters hope - priming it to regain the political impetus.

Headline: Lords appoint first woman to historic 'Black Rod' role
Description: Britain's upper parliamentary chamber, the House of Lords, has appointed a woman to the role of "Black Rod" for the first time in the office's 650-year history.

Headline: More work to be done to unlock Brexit talks - May, EU's Tusk
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and European Council President Donald Tusk agreed on Friday there was more work to be done to advance Brexit talks and discussed ways to take further steps before December, a spokesman for May said.

Headline: More work to be done to unlock Brexit talks - May, EU's Tusk
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and European Council President Donald Tusk agreed on Friday there was more work to be done to advance Brexit talks and discussed ways to take further steps before December, a spokesman for May said.

Headline: Britain's government to push ahead with plan on specific Brexit date
Description: Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May will push ahead with plans to fix into law the time and date of the country's European Union exit for March 2019, her spokesman said on Friday, despite opposition from some members of her party.

Headline: Some EU countries want Brexit talks to move to trade - Davis
Description: Some European countries want the Brexit talks to move on to focus on trade and, although Germany and France are key to allowing that progress, it is a decision for the whole of the bloc, Britain's Brexit minister David Davis said on Friday.

Headline: Britain wants trade deal with EU 'much closer than Canada'- Davis
Description: Britain wants the freest possible trade in goods and services with the European Union in a Brexit deal that goes further than the bloc's trade agreement with Canada, Brexit Secretary David Davis said on Thursday.

Headline: Davis says no Brexit deal 'incredibly unlikely'
Description: It is "incredibly unlikely" that Britain will not be able to negotiate a deal with the European Union on its departure from the bloc, Brexit Secretary David Davis said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain denies £400 million debt to Iran linked to bid to free jailed aid worker
Description: Britain said on Thursday that moves towards paying half a billion dollars to Iran for a debt owed since the 1979 Islamic Revolution had nothing to do with a bid to secure the release of a jailed Iranian-British aid worker.

Headline: EU to press May at summit, UK dismisses Brexit offer talk
Description: European Union leaders will press Theresa May to meet their conditions soon for launching post-Brexit trade talks when she holds talks on the sidelines of a summit in Sweden on Friday, EU officials said.

Headline: Scotland may give Labour another chance at British power
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party is poised for a resurgence in Glasgow, raising its hopes that a recovery from a disastrous election performance in Scotland two years ago can help its socialist leader Jeremy Corbyn win power in London.

Headline: Britain preparing to transfer 400 million pounds to Iran - Telegraph newspaper
Description: Britain is preparing to transfer over 400 million pounds to Iran as it seeks the release of a jailed Iranian-British aid worker, The Telegraph newspaper reported, citing unidentified British sources.

Headline: Tehran says no link between Britain's debt to Iran and jailed dual national's case - TV
Description: Iran rejected as "wrong" some British media reports linking a 400 million pound debt Britain owed to Iran and the fate of a jailed Iranian-British aid worker, state TV reported on Thursday.

Headline: May's spokesman says report UK will raise Brexit bill offer is speculation
Description: A newspaper report that British Prime Minister Theresa May is preparing to offer up to 20 billion pounds more to the European Union as part of Brexit divorce bill is speculation, her spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Merkel's EU ally says more confident about resolving Brexit problems
Description: Manfred Weber, a leading lawmaker in the European Parliament, said on Wednesday he was more confident about Britain and the European Union ironing out difficulties in the Brexit talks.

Headline: May weathers new challenges on Brexit plan, more to come
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May withstood new attempts to force concessions on her blueprint for leaving the European Union on Wednesday, the second day of a parliamentary debate that is deepening divisions over Brexit.

Headline: Number of new homes in England nears pre-crisis high
Description: The number of new homes coming onto the market in England reached nearly 220,000 in 2016-17, just short of the pre-financial crisis peak, as the government faces pressure to solve a growing housing shortage.

Headline: Uber's London licence appeal could take years - Mayor Khan
Description: Uber's appeal process against a decision by London's transport regulator to strip the taxi app of its operating licence in the British capital could take years, the Mayor of London Sadiq Khan said on Thursday.

Headline: FCA targets pension scammers in Welsh steelworks
Description: Britain's markets watchdog is sending supervisors to Wales to make sure that 15 billion pounds in steelworker pensions does not become a "honey pot" for crooks.

Headline: Need for Brexit transition seen in UK and Europe - Carney
Description: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Thursday there was a broad understanding in Britain and in Europe of the importance of reaching a transition deal for Brexit and a good trade and investment deal after that.

Headline: Final death toll from London's Grenfell Tower fire is 71 - police
Description: The final death toll from the fire that destroyed the Grenfell Tower social housing block in London in June is 71, police said on Thursday after five months of painstaking search and recovery operations.

Headline: May preparing to raise Brexit divorce bill offer - Sun
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is preparing to offer up to 20 billion pounds more to the European Union as part of a Brexit divorce bill, the Sun newspaper reported on Thursday.

Headline: EU parliament's Brexit negotiator - 'Not so pessimistic' about reaching deal
Description: The European Union and Britain must quickly solve major issues in Brexit negotiations such as finances and citizens' rights but there is a good chance a deal can be reached, European Parliament negotiator Guy Verhofstadt was quoted as saying.

Headline: Johnson vows no stone unturned to free aid worker jailed in Iran
Description: Foreign minister Boris Johnson said Britain would appeal to Iran on humanitarian grounds to free a jailed aid worker but expressed reservations that granting her diplomatic protection would help secure her release, her husband said on Wednesday.

Headline: May sees off challenges to Brexit plan, so far
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's blueprint to leave the European Union emerged unscathed on Tuesday from a first day of debate in parliament on legislation to sever ties with the bloc.

Headline: UK has reservations about diplomatic protection for jailed aid worker in Iran, husband says
Description: Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson has reservations about granting diplomatic protection to an Iranian-British aid worker jailed in Iran, her husband said on Wednesday.

Headline: Going strong after 70 years - Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip celebrate platinum anniversary
Description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth will add another landmark to her record-breaking reign on Monday when she and Prince Philip celebrate their 70th wedding anniversary.

Headline: Scotland's Sturgeon demands changes in EU exit bill after meeting May
Description: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Tuesday the UK government had to make changes to its European Union withdrawal bill before her devolved government in Edinburgh would agree to back it, but said she was hopeful progress could be made.

Headline: Ireland says new thinking from UK needed for Brexit breakthrough
Description: New thinking is needed from the British government to secure agreement on the Irish border and allow Brexit talks to move onto the next phase as the current proposals are not credible, Ireland's Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Tuesday.

Headline: Scotland becomes minimum alcohol price trailblazer in bid to boost public health
Description: Scotland, globally known for its whisky production, is to become one of the first countries in the world to introduce minimum alcohol pricing in an attempt to tackle a worsening public health problem.

Headline: Russian Twitter accounts promoted Brexit ahead of EU referendum - Times newspaper
Description: Russian Twitter accounts posted almost 45,000 messages about Brexit in the 48 hours around last year's referendum in an attempt to sow discord during the vote on whether to leave the European Union, the Times newspaper reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Russia attacked energy, telecom and media in Britain - government official
Description: Russian cyber operatives have attacked Britain's media, telecommunications and energy sectors over the past year, according to prepared remarks by the head of the government's  main cyber defence agency.

Headline: Damages for Grenfell fire victims may total just $5 million - Reuters analysis
Description: (This Oct. 18 story corrects age in paragraph 19 to five, not six)

Headline: Damages for Grenfell fire victims may total just $5 million - Reuters analysis
Description: (This Oct. 18 story corrects age in paragraph 19 to five, not six)

Headline: Britain has not seen any evidence of successful meddling in elections
Description: Britain has not seen any evidence of successful direct interference in its electoral system, which is one of the most robust in the world, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday.

Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's blueprint for Britain's exit from the European Union faces a crucial test starting on Tuesday, when members of parliament try to win concessions from a weakened leader on the government's legislation to sever ties.

Headline: Factbox - Divided, rebellious parliament takes on May's Brexit plan
Description: British lawmakers will debate legislation underpinning the government's plan to leave the European Union this week, the latest stage in an arduous journey through parliament.

Headline: May pledges to protect Europe from Russian threats
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday the government would maintain its commitment to protecting Europe after Brexit as she accused Russia of military aggression and meddling in elections.

Headline: British government introduces budget for Northern Ireland

Headline: Johnson makes fuller apology for remarks on jailed aid worker in Iran
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson issued a second, fuller apology on Monday for remarks about an Iranian-British aid worker jailed in Iran that critics said might have prompted Iran to extend her prison sentence.

Headline: Minister Davis offers parliament new vote on any Brexit deal
Description: British Brexit minister David Davis said on Monday the government would allow parliament the opportunity to debate, scrutinise and vote on any final Brexit agreement, offering a concession to Conservative Party rebels.

Headline: EU signs defence pact in decades-long quest
Description: France and Germany edged towards achieving a 70-year-old ambition to integrate European defences on Monday, signing a pact with 21 other EU governments to fund, develop and deploy armed forces after Britain's decision to quit the bloc.

Description: Hundreds of people displaced by a fire that killed about 80 people in London in June are still living in hotels or friends' houses because of a failure by local authorities to rehouse them, the member of parliament representing the area said on Monday.

Headline: Britain considers diplomatic protection for jailed aid worker in Iran
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's government is considering granting diplomatic protection to a jailed aid worker in Iran as part of an effort to secure her release from a jail in the Islamic Republic.

Headline: Johnson apologises for distress caused by remarks on jailed aid worker in Iran
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson on Monday apologised for causing distress with remarks about a Iranian-British aid worker jailed in Iran.

Headline: CEOs urge May to speed up Brexit talks to avoid exodus
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May needs to speed up negotiations with the European Union, business leaders told her on Monday, amid concern Britain will crash out the world's biggest trading bloc without a deal.

Headline: Poems in Dottyville - How two traumatised soldiers changed notions of war
Description: An imposing 19th Century building with elegant manicured lawns and sweeping views of the Edinburgh skyline seems an unlikely place to have earned the nickname "Dottyville" from one of Britain's most revered poets.

Headline: Chronology - Europe's long road in search of a common defence
Description: France, Germany and 21 other EU governments signed a defence pact on Monday they hope marks a new era of greater European military integration after Britain's decision to quit the bloc.

Headline: May wants to agree outline Brexit transition in next few months
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May wants to agree the broad outline of a transition deal with the European Union for after Brexit in the next few months, her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Forty Conservative MPs ready to oust May - Sunday Times
Description: Forty members of parliament from Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party have agreed to sign a letter of no-confidence in her, the Sunday Times newspaper reported.

Headline: British ministers rally around Foreign Secretary Johnson over Iran
Description: British ministers rallied around Boris Johnson on Sunday, saying the foreign secretary was doing a "great job" and had no reason to resign over remarks that critics say may prompt Iran to extend the prison sentence of a jailed aid worker.

Headline: Johnson has 'constructive' call with husband of jailed aid worker - Sky
Description: British foreign minister Boris Johnson had a "constructive" conversation with the husband of Iranian-British aid worker Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe who is jailed in Iran, Sky News reported on Sunday.

Headline: Britain won't offer a new figure on Brexit bill to unlock talks - minister
Description: Britain will not offer a figure or a formula for how much it believes it owes the European Union, Brexit minister David Davis said on Sunday, after the EU demanded that London spell out its approach to the final bill to unblock talks.

Headline: Prince Charles leads Remembrance day ceremony for British war dead
Description: Prince Charles led the annual ceremony to honour Britain's war dead on Sunday, laying a wreath on behalf of 91-year-old Queen Elizabeth to mark Remembrance Sunday as she watched the service from a balcony.

Headline: Poems in Dottyville - How two traumatised soldiers changed notions of war
Description: An imposing 19th Century building with elegant manicured lawns and sweeping views of the Edinburgh skyline seems an unlikely place to have earned the nickname "Dottyville" from one of Britain's most revered poets.

Headline: Ireland will not threaten to veto Brexit talks 'at this stage', PM says
Description: Ireland will not threaten to use a veto on Brexit talks "at this stage" over the lack of progress on the Irish border as Dublin is in a very strong position with all EU member states behind it, Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said on Sunday.

Headline: EU agreed no sum needed to move talks forward - British Brexit minister
Description: The European Union agreed that Britain would not have to come up with a figure for a financial deal to leave the bloc before moving talks on to discuss a trade deal, Brexit minister David Davis said on Sunday.

Headline: London mayor calls on Foreign Secretary Johnson to resign
Description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan called on Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson on Sunday to resign after a series of gaffes which he said had offended Libyans, Americans, the Spanish and others.

Headline: Britain's Gove offers support to foreign secretary over Iran comments
Description: British environment minister Michael Gove defended his colleague Boris Johnson on Sunday, saying he was doing a "great job" as foreign minister and Iran should be "in the dock" over a jailed aid worker, not him.

Headline: London mayor supports compromise efforts between regulator and Uber
Description: London mayor Sadiq Khan said on Sunday he supported efforts by the city's transport regulator Transport for London to try to reach a compromise with Uber after the taxi app confirmed it would appeal in a running row over workers' rights.

Headline: EU wants Brexit money this month, Davis seeks 'political' fix
Description: The European Union told Britain on Friday to spell out what it will pay Brussels for when it leaves the bloc in 2019 or face more delay in talks on future trade ties that are vital for British business.

Headline: Uber loses UK appeal bid to overturn workers' rights decision
Description: Taxi app Uber [UBER.UL] lost a bid on Friday to overturn a decision by a tribunal which had said its drivers deserved workers' rights such as the minimum wage, in a blow to the company as it also battles to keep its licence in London.

Headline: Drawing flak, Scotland ex-first minister to host Russia Today chatshow
Description: Top Scottish nationalist Alex Salmond is under fire for agreeing to host a Russia Today talkshow, but the man who once sought to split Scotland from the United Kingdom rejects suggestions he is helping Moscow or perceived Kremlin mischief-making in Europe.

Headline: Brexit never? Britain can still change its mind, says Article 50 author
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May should stop misleading voters and admit that Brexit can be avoided if Britain decides unilaterally to scrap divorce talks, the man who drafted Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty said on Friday.

Headline: Nigerian police kill one, arrest two suspects in British kidnapping
Description: Police in Nigeria's southern Delta state said they killed one suspect and arrested two others accused of involvement in the kidnapping last month of four Britons.

Headline: May picks Brexiteer to replace scandal-hit aid minister
Description: Theresa May appointed a strong Brexit supporter as aid minister on Thursday following a resignation that left the British prime minister struggling to ward off open conflict in a cabinet divided over leaving the European Union.

Headline: Rudd urges social media companies to block militant content
Description: Britain's top internal security official is pressing social media companies to devise automatic systems to spot and block violent militant messaging before it is posted on their networks.

Headline: Britain agrees to set EU "Exit Day" in law
Description: Britain's government said on Thursday it would use legislation to fix the time and date of the country's European Union exit, addressing concerns of Brexiteers who fear slow negotiations and opposition to the divorce could cause delays.

Headline: Drug bingo - EU readies vote for London-based pharma agency
Description: Nineteen EU governments will slug it out in a series of secret ballots in 10 days' time for the right to host the European Medicines Agency (EMA) once it leaves London after Brexit, EU officials said on Thursday.

Headline: May to restate desire for Brexit transition deal to European business chiefs
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will restate her desire for a two-year Brexit implementation period when she meets European business organisations on Monday, her office said in a statement.

Headline: Penny Mordaunt appointed new UK aid minister - May's office
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's office confirmed that Penny Mordaunt has been appointed Britain's new minister for international development, replacing Priti Patel who resigned on Wednesday over undisclosed meetings with Israeli officials that breached protocol.

Headline: City of London asks regulators to help banks compete after Brexit
Description: Britain's regulators should put more emphasis on keeping banks globally competitive after Brexit, the City of London financial district's policy chief said on Thursday.

Headline: Thousands of children referred to UK's counter-terrorism scheme, figures show
Description: Thousands of children and teenagers, including large numbers of girls, were referred to Britain's often-criticised counter-terrorism programme Prevent, new official figures showed on Thursday.

Headline: Bankroller of Brexit denies claims he broke funding rules
Description: Multimillionaire Brexit donor Arron Banks wrote to Britain's Electoral Commission on Thursday to imply he was the subject of a politically motivated investigation amid speculation that Russia may have meddled in the 2016 referendum vote.

Headline: EU parliament's Brexit negotiator -  'major issues' unresolved on citizens rights
Description: "Major issues" must still be resolved on safeguarding citizens' rights after Brexit, the European Parliament's negotiator Guy Verhofstadt said on Wednesday, the eve of another round of divorce negotiations between London and Brussels.

Headline: In new test for PM May, aid minister resigns
Description: British aid minister Priti Patel was forced from office on Wednesday over undisclosed meetings with Israeli officials after Prime Minister Theresa May sought to reassert her diminished authority as she negotiates Brexit.

Headline: VW has still not fixed one in three dieselgate cars in Britain
Description: Volkswagen  has yet to fix around 390,000 of the 1.2 million cars affected by the diesel emissions scandal in Britain, over two years since the revelations first came to light, according to a parliamentary committee.

Headline: Smiling wax figure of Theresa May belies prime minister's torment
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May gained a wax doppelganger on Wednesday that projected an air of strength and permanence sorely lacking in her crisis-prone government.

Headline: British minister arrives for PM meeting over undisclosed meetings
Description: British aid minister Priti Patel arrived at the Downing Street residence of Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday, entering the building via a back door to answer questions over undisclosed meetings with Israeli officials.

Headline: Non-EU Norway appeals for smooth Brexit terms
Description: Non-EU Norway called on Brussels and London on Wednesday to ensure that Brexit does not disrupt its trade relations once Britain leaves the European Union.

Headline: Irish PM sees Brexit talks moving to next stage in December
Description: It is likely European Union leaders will allow Brexit talks to move onto trade relations in December, as long as Britain provides guarantees in writing on issues currently being debated, Ireland's prime minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: May decides on cabinet hiring and firing - Williamson
Description: Defence secretary Gavin Williamson said on Wednesday it was up to Prime Minister Theresa May to decide who serves in her top team, responding to a question about the political future of aid minister Priti Patel.

Headline: Patel heading back to London - BBC
Description: British aid minister Priti Patel is flying back to London after cancelling a planned trip to Africa, the BBC reported on Wednesday, after local media reported she was facing the sack for not fully disclosing meetings during a holiday to Israel.

Headline: Patel heading back to London - BBC
Description: British aid minister Priti Patel is flying back to London after cancelling a planned trip to Africa, the BBC reported on Wednesday, after local media reported she was facing the sack for not fully disclosing meetings during a holiday to Israel.

Headline: EU eyes tough Brexit transition terms
Description: EU diplomats will start sketching out a Brexit transition offer on Wednesday that would probably let Britain stay in the single market for about two years after it leaves the bloc in March 2019, EU officials said.

Headline: Boris Johnson 'could have been clearer' on jailed aid worker in Iran
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Tuesday that his remarks about a jailed aid worker in Iran could have been clearer, after opponents said his comments might provoke the Islamic Republic to hand the dual national a longer jail term.

Headline: Scottish parliament offices briefly evacuated in suspect white powder scare
Description: Offices at Scotland's devolved parliament in Edinburgh were briefly evacuated on Tuesday after suspicious packages containing white powder were found.

Headline: Oxford Islamic academic takes leave after rape allegations
Description: Britain's Oxford University said one of its professors, the prominent Swiss Muslim intellectual Tariq Ramadan, had taken a leave of absence after two women filed complaints against him in France alleging rape.

Headline: Former Welsh government minister, suspended in scandal probe, found dead
Description: Former Welsh government minister Carl Sargeant, who was suspended last week after allegations were made over his conduct with women, has been found dead, police said on Tuesday.

Headline: Scotland apologises to gay men for historical convictions
Description: Scotland's devolved government issued an apology on Tuesday to men convicted in the past for same-sex activity and passed a new law which will allow them to clear their names.

Headline: Voter confidence in UK handling of Brexit ebbs away - ORB poll
Description: A record majority of Britons disapprove of Prime Minister Theresa May's handling of Brexit talks and they are increasingly sceptical that leaving the EU will make the country better off, an opinion poll showed on Tuesday.

Headline: British foreign secretary to seek to meet jailed aid worker during trip to Iran
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said he will seek to meet jailed Iranian-British aid worker Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe during a planned trip to Iran in coming weeks.

Headline: Britain says minister's remarks offer no basis for action against jailed aid worker in Iran
Description: Comments by British foreign minister Boris Johnson about the case of Iranian-British aid worker Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe can form no "justifiable basis" for further action against her, a spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain says expects most EU citizens can stay after Brexit
Description: The British government said on Tuesday that most European Union citizens currently living in Britain will be allowed to remain in the country after Brexit in 2019.

Headline: Britain faces new legal challenge over air quality improvement plan
Description: New legal proceedings have been launched against the British government by environmental law firm ClientEarth over what it says is a failure to tackle air pollution, the firm said on Tuesday.

Headline: Police examine three envelopes at Scottish parliament, one thought to contain white powder - source
Description: Three similar envelopes, one believed to contain a suspicious white powder, were being investigated by police on Tuesday at the Scottish parliament, a source at the building said.

Headline: UK Brexit assessments will be released in next three weeks - minister
Description: The British government will release documents setting out its assessment of the impact that Brexit will have on the economy to a parliamentary committee in the next three weeks, junior Brexit minister Steve Baker said on Tuesday.

Headline: White powder sent to lawmaker caused Scottish parliament evacuation - source
Description: Scotland's parliament was evacuated on Tuesday after a package containing white powder was sent to a Conservative Party lawmaker, a source at the parliament said.

Headline: Britain says Iran's treatment of jailed aid worker is unacceptable
Description: Iran's continued detention of jailed Iranian-British aid worker Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe is unacceptable, British trade minister Liam Fox said on Tuesday, adding that she should be released as soon as possible.

Headline: The battle for minds - Britain expands project on mental health in terrorism
Description: A project looking at links between mental health and terrorism in three English cities has been expanded nationwide after it found a significant number of people referred to counter-radicalisation programmes suffer some form of mental illness.

Headline: Brexit with no deal risks chaos in drug supply, report warns
Description: Crashing out of the European Union without a deal would cause major problems for Britain's health service and risk "chaotic disruption" to medicine supplies, according to a report on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain introduces law seeking to help post-Brexit trade
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's government said it would submit legislation to parliament on Tuesday needed to let Britain pursue an independent trade policy once it leaves the European Union.

Headline: May, party leaders agree to tackle sexual harassment with new measures
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and other party leaders agreed on Monday to introduce new safeguards for those working in parliament to try to contain a growing sexual harassment scandal.

Headline: May, party leaders agree to tackle sexual harassment with new measures
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May and other party leaders agreed on Monday to introduce new safeguards for those working in parliament to try to contain a growing sexual harassment scandal.

Headline: Sinn Fein says proposed UK time limit on soldier prosecutions 'unacceptable'
Description: Sinn Fein on Monday dismissed as unacceptable a bill proposed by a British Conservative Party lawmaker to set a 10-year limit on prosecuting soldiers, saying it breached a 2014 deal intended to rescue the province's power-sharing arrangements.

Headline: British minister ignores opposition demands on Brexit impact studies
Description: Britain's government ignored opposition demands on Monday to share its economic assessment of Brexit this week, delaying the publication of reports Prime Minister Theresa May has said might hurt her negotiating stance.

Headline: UK says Briton kidnapped in Nigeria last month killed, three others released
Description: A Briton kidnapped in Nigeria last month has been killed with three others released after negotiations, Britain's Foreign Office said on Monday.

Headline: Britain's aid minister apologises over undisclosed Israel meetings
Description: Britain's international development minister Priti Patel apologised on Monday for failing to disclose meetings with senior Israeli officials during a private holiday.

Headline: UK car sales in October down for seventh consecutive month
Description: British new car sales in October fell by about 12 percent year on year, marking a seventh consecutive month of decline, preliminary data released by an industry body showed on Monday.

Headline: May says wants people to pay tax that is due
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday that she wants people to pay tax that is due, when asked about tax evasion after the recent publication of a global investigation into offshore tax trusts.

Headline: May's deputy denies report pornography was found on office computer
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's most senior minister has denied an allegation that police found pornography on one of his computers in the Houses of Parliament in 2008 as the British government struggles to contain a scandal about sexual harassment.

Headline: BBC name change stirs language row in Afghanistan
Description: The BBC is facing an angry reaction in Afghanistan after it changed the name of one of its local language Facebook pages to BBC Dari, the official name of the Afghan version of Persian or Farsi but one rejected by many local Persian speakers.

Headline: Britain's ruling Conservatives suspend lawmaker, refer his case to police
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party has suspended a lawmaker over what it said were serious allegations, a step that could undermine the authority of her minority government as Britain seeks to iron out a Brexit deal with the European Union.

Headline: MPs chide slow progress on diversity at top of Bank of England
Description: British lawmakers said on Friday they were disappointed by finance minister Philip Hammond's slow progress at encouraging greater diversity at the highest levels of the Bank of England.

Headline: Libya considering UK extradition request for Manchester bomber's brother
Description: Libyan authorities are processing a request from Britain to extradite the brother of the bomber who killed 22 people in Manchester in May, but no decision has been taken yet, a government spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Libyan force ready to cooperate on UK extradition request for bomber's brother - spokesman
Description: The Libyan force holding the brother of the brother of the bomber who killed 22 people in Manchester in May is ready to cooperate on a British extradition request if it is approved by the attorney general, a spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: After rate hike, May expects higher returns for savers - spokesman
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May expects to see higher returns for savers following the Bank of England's decision to raise interest rates, her spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: Libya reviewing extradition request for Manchester bomber's brother - spokesman
Description: Libya's internationally recognised government is "cooperating to process" an extradition request for the brother of the bomber who killed 22 people in Manchester in May, but no decision has been taken yet, a spokesman said on Thursday.

Headline: British parliament - respected institution or 'den of vice'?
Description: From William Pitt to Winston Churchill, Britain's finest prime ministers have risen to greatness in the Palace of Westminster, heightening its reputation as one of the world's most respected parliaments.

Headline: Fallon resigns in growing harassment scandal
Description: British defence minister Michael Fallon quit on Wednesday, the first resignation in a growing sexual harassment scandal that  prompted calls for a wholesale change in the "locker room" culture in parliament.

Headline: DUP calls for Northern Ireland direct rule in 'very near future'
Description: The head of the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) in the British parliament urged the British government on Thursday to institute direct rule of Northern Ireland "in the very near future", saying otherwise its economy would be left to drift.

Headline: May replaces defence minister in growing harassment scandal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May was forced to appoint a new defence minister on Thursday after her ally Michael Fallon quit in a sexual harassment scandal that has prompted calls for an end to the "locker room" culture in parliament.

Headline: London to set Northern Ireland budget as direct rule looms
Description: The British government is to impose a budget on Northern Ireland for the first time in a decade, a major step towards imposing direct rule after attempts to form a power-sharing government in Belfast collapsed.

Headline: London to set Northern Ireland budget as direct rule looms
Description: The British government is to impose a budget on Northern Ireland for the first time in a decade, a major step towards imposing direct rule after attempts to form a power-sharing government in Belfast collapsed.

Headline: DUP calls for Northern Ireland direct rule in 'very near future'
Description: The head of the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) in the British parliament urged the British government on Thursday to institute direct rule of Northern Ireland "in the very near future", saying that otherwise its economy would be left to drift.

Headline: Brighton renews Uber licence for six months as it monitors London dispute
Description: Brighton has renewed Uber's licence to operate in the southern English city for six months while the local authority follows the outcome of London's move to strip the taxi app of its licence.

Headline: UK parliament to consider Northern Ireland budget in mid-November
Description: The British government expects to bring a budget for Northern Ireland before parliament at Westminster in mid-November, after the region's largest parties failed to reach agreement on forming a government, the Northern Ireland minister said on Thursday.

Headline: May appoints Julian Smith as chief whip - statement
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May appointed member of parliament Julian Smith as her new Chief Whip on Thursday, promoting him to head the office which is responsible for making sure May's Conservatives vote in support of the government.

Headline: British government to release Brexit studies to MPs - Davis
Description: The British government will hold discussions with members of parliament about handing over dozens of documents assessing the impact on the economy of leaving the EU, Brexit minister David Davis said on Thursday.

Headline: Scottish MPs call for international recognition for Catalan independence
Description: Pro-independence Scottish members of parliament have presented a motion in their devolved parliament urging international recognition of Catalonia's unilateral declaration of independence from Spain, putting pressure on Scotland's leader to endorse the movement.

Headline: Hain calls for probe of UK bank's ties in South African money laundering case
Description: British lawmaker Peter Hain said on Wednesday he has asked finance minister Philip Hammond to refer an unidentified UK bank to regulators for an investigation into possible involvement in alleged money laundering involving South Africa's Gupta family.

Headline: UK seeks arrest of Manchester bomber's brother, asks Libya to extradite him
Description: British police said on Wednesday they had issued an arrest warrant for the brother of a suicide bomber who killed 22 people in an attack on a pop concert in Manchester in May and prosecutors had asked Libya to extradite him.

Headline: Parliament says government must publish secret Brexit impact studies
Description: British lawmakers ramped up pressure on the government to publish its assessment of the impact Brexit will have on the economy, passing a motion in parliament on Wednesday which could compel the government to release the papers.

Headline: Deliveroo riders to seek employment rights at UK tribunal
Description: Riders at food courier firm Deliveroo will begin the process of seeking employment rights such as the minimum wage at a tribunal on Thursday, in a further challenge to the flourishing "gig economy."

Headline: May says action will be taken on sexual abuse in parliament
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday action would be taken when there are allegations and evidence of sexual misconduct in parliament.

Headline: Labour activist says she was raped, advised not to report it
Description: An activist in Britain's opposition Labour Party has said she was raped at a party event when she was 19, and that a party official discouraged her from reporting the attack to avoid damaging her career.

Headline: U.S. urges dialogue on North Ireland power sharing - State Dept.
Description: The United States urged the parties involved in Northern Ireland to continue their dialogue to reach a power-sharing agreement on Wednesday after the British government moved to impose a budget on the region.

Headline: UK investigates Brexit campaign funding amid speculation of Russian meddling
Description: Britain's Electoral Commission is investigating whether a leading anti-EU campaigner breached referendum finance rules, after speculation mounted that Russia may have meddled in the Brexit vote.

Headline: Johnson says U.S. will drive hard bargain in post-Brexit trade talks
Description: Foreign minister Boris Johnson said on Wednesday Britain should expect the United States to drive a very hard bargain in talks to secure a post-Brexit trade deal.

Headline: Sinn Fein says Northern Ireland talks have failed
Description: Irish nationalist party Sinn Fein said on Wednesday that its talks with the pro-British Democratic Unionist Party aimed at re-establishing a power-sharing government in Northern Ireland had failed.

Headline: DUP blames Sinn Fein for Northern Ireland talks collapse
Description: A senior member of Northern Ireland's Democratic Unionist Party on Wednesday blamed rivals Sinn Fein for the collapse of talks on forming a power-sharing government and suggested the DUP would not compromise on the key issue of the Irish language.

Headline: May's deputy denies inappropriate sexual advance
Description: Damian Green, number two in the British government, has denied an allegation that he made an inappropriate sexual advance on a young woman as discussion about an unhealthy culture of abuse by powerful men in British politics continues to swirl.

Headline: May wants Northern Ireland's government restored
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday everyone wanted to see an agreement to restore Northern Ireland's devolved government after parties failed to reach agreement.

Headline: May wants Northern Ireland's government restored
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday everyone wanted to see an agreement to restore Northern Ireland's devolved government after parties failed to reach agreement.

Headline: Brexit bill could mean UK courts get drawn into policy - judge
Description: British judges could find themselves drawn into policy matters normally best left to parliament if a government bill on exiting the European Union is enacted as currently worded, a senior judge said on Wednesday.

Headline: Ireland says ongoing failure of Northern Ireland talks 'deeply concerning'
Description: The continuing failure of Irish nationalists and pro-British Unionists to form a government in Northern Ireland is "deeply concerning," Ireland's Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said after Britain moved to directly set a budget for the region.

Headline: Higher chance of no deal if EU exit talks do not move on quickly - minister
Description: The longer it takes for Britain and the European Union to start negotiations on their future relationship after Brexit, the higher the chance of a no deal scenario, trade minister Liam Fox said on Wednesday.

Headline: Fox says hopes to confirm EU trade deals with countries before Brexit
Description: British trade minister Liam Fox said on Wednesday he hoped to be able to agree similar trading arrangements with those countries which already have free trade deals with the European Union by the time Britain leaves the bloc.

Headline: Suggestions Britain must be punished over Brexit are regrettable - minister
Description: Language suggesting that Britain should be punished for leaving the European Union is "regrettable", as are any suggestions from London that officials do not want to negotiate a Brexit deal, trade minister Liam Fox said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain accelerates Brexit plans, divorce talks also to speed up
Description: Britain is accelerating preparations for "all eventualities" when it leaves the European Union, but both sides are hopeful an agreement on stepping up talks to unravel more than 40 years of partnership will be sealed soon.

Headline: Bayer, Novartis clash with UK doctors over use of cheap eye drug
Description: Bayer  is weighing legal action and Novartis  has expressed concern at plans by doctors in the north of England to defy official guidance by using a cancer medicine as a cheap eye drug.

Headline: Northern Ireland power-sharing talks to extend into Wednesday
Description: Northern Ireland's main political parties are to continue talks aimed at restoring the British region's devolved government on Wednesday, a British government official said, in an apparent extension of a deadline for a deal.

Headline: Brexit minister says 'basic' EU deal likely even if trade talks fail
Description: Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday he believed Britain would agree some kind of basic deal with the European Union, even in the "very improbable" eventuality that they fail to agree a trade deal.

Headline: Bank of England sees up to 75,000 finance job losses after Brexit - BBC
Description: The Bank of England expects Britain to lose up to 75,000 financial services jobs in the years after its departure from the European Union in 2019, the BBC reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain weighs big cut in top stake on gambling machines
Description: The maximum stake on gambling machines in British betting shops could be sharply cut in response to concerns that the terminals -- a key source of revenue for bookmakers -- fuel addiction.

Headline: British government extends Northern Ireland talks deadline
Description: The British government on Monday extended by 24 hours a deadline for Northern Ireland's political parties to re-establish a devolved regional executive and avoid London setting the region's annual budget for the first time in a decade.

Headline: British government extends northern Ireland talks deadline
Description: The British government on Monday extended by 24 hours a deadline for Northern Ireland's main political parties to reach agreement on re-establishing a devolved regional executive and avoid London setting the region's annual budget directly.

Headline: Britain moves to tackle abuse in a bastion of tradition - parliament
Description: There will be zero tolerance of sexual harassment in Britain's parliament, the government said on Monday, toughening rules after allegations of abuse at the 800-year-old institution fuelled demands for reform.

Headline: Northern Ireland talks break up without deal
Description: Northern Ireland's political parties ended talks on Monday with no sign of a deal to restore devolved government, raising the prospect of London imposing a budget on the British province for the first time in a decade.

Headline: 'Significant gaps' in talks on Northern Ireland power-sharing - May's spokesman
Description: Talks on restoring a power-sharing government in Northern Ireland are making progress but there are "significant gaps"  between the province's two main political parties, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: Minister to be investigated over sexual harassment allegation
Description: (Note readers might find some language offensive in paragraph 2)

Headline: Parliament Speaker - there must be zero tolerance of sexual harassment
Description: The Speaker of Britain's parliament said on Monday there must be zero tolerance of sexual harassment or bullying among members of parliament, their staff and anyone else within the parliamentary estate after media reports about alleged misconduct.

Headline: May 'deeply concerned' over reports of sexual harassment in parliament
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is deeply concerned by media reports about the alleged misconduct of staff in parliament and believes any unwanted sexual behaviour is "completely unacceptable", her spokesman said on Monday.

Headline: May appoints new Brexit representative in upper house
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May appointed on Friday a former member of the European Parliament to represent her government on Brexit in parliament's upper chamber following the resignation of the incumbent on medical grounds.

Headline: Britain sets Monday as latest deadline for Northern Ireland political talks
Description: Britain will have to bring in legislation to set a budget for Northern Ireland if the province's political parties cannot reach an agreement to restore their power-sharing government by Monday, a British government spokesman said.

Headline: Man appears in court over alleged plot to murder UK MP
Description: A man accused of being a member of a banned far-right British group appeared in court on Friday, accused of plotting to murder a politician with a machete and making threats to kill a female police officer.

Headline: May concerned by reports of sexual harassment in parliament - spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is concerned by a newspaper report describing a culture of sexual harassment among members of parliament and their staff working in parliament, her spokeswoman said on Friday.

Headline: UK gender pay gap drops to record low in 2017 - ONS
Description: The difference between hourly pay rates for men and women in Britain's workforce fell to its lowest since records began 20 years ago, the country's statistics agency said on Thursday.

Headline: Average UK motor insurance prices hit highest since 2012 - ABI
Description: The average price of motor insurance in Britain jumped 10 percent in the third quarter of the year, taking premiums to their highest level since 2012, the Association of British Insurers (ABI) said.

Headline: Scotland's Sturgeon seeks assurance on Brexit transition
Description: Scotland's first minister Nicola Sturgeon has sought confirmation from Prime Minister Theresa May that Britain is urgently seeking a transition agreement with the European Union before the end of the year.

Headline: Ireland says Brexit talks can't move on without clarity over border
Description: Britain's talks on exiting the European Union cannot progress, as London wishes, to trade relations until it give more clarity on what will happen at its border with Ireland, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Friday.

Headline: Brexit talks cannot move to phase two without border clarity, Ireland says
Description: Britain's talks on exiting the European Union cannot progress, as London wishes, to cover trade relations until it gives more clarity on what will happen at the border with Ireland, Irish Foreign Minister Simon Coveney said on Friday.

Headline: UK sets date for parliamentary showdown on crucial Brexit laws
Description: The British government said on Thursday its key piece of Brexit legislation would be debated in parliament on Nov. 14 and 15, the next stage in what is expected to be a tortuous lawmaking process that will test Prime Minister Theresa May's authority.

Headline: UK Labour Party women urged to speak out about sexual harassment
Description: A group of women members of Britain's opposition Labour Party have set up a website calling on fellow members who have experienced sexual harassment within party ranks to tell their stories anonymously to try and improve Labour's culture.

Headline: Too early to say if new legislation needed for Brexit transition deal - PM May's spokeswoman
Description: Britain is not yet able to say if new legislation will be needed to implement a Brexit transition deal, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokeswoman said on Thursday, hours after a junior Brexit minister said the position was that it would be necessary.

Headline: London lawyers join banks in weighing up post-Brexit move to Dublin
Description: Brexit has prompted some London law firms to follow banks in examining a move to Ireland, the country's chief promoter told Reuters, posing a threat to one of London's biggest money spinners.

Headline: Johnson says Poles' post-Brexit rights protected 'whatever happens'
Description: Foreign minister Boris Johnson said Poles in Britain "will be protected, whatever happens" after Brexit, in comments publicised on Thursday that appeared to go further than Prime Minister Theresa May on guaranteeing the rights of EU citizens.

Headline: UK parliament expected to vote on Brexit deal by late 2018 or early 2019 - Davis
Description: Britain's parliament will vote on whether to accept the government's deal on exiting the European Union by December 2018 or January 2019 if negotiations with Brussels progress as anticipated, Brexit minister David Davis said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit transition deal will require new UK legislation - minister
Description: The British government is planning to pass a separate piece of legislation through parliament to approve the terms of the transitional period it wants to smooth its exit from the European Union, a junior Brexit minister said on Thursday.

Headline: Failure to pass Brexit bill would create legal holes - minister
Description: Failure to pass the government's flagship piece of Brexit legislation through parliament will result in holes in the statute book and increased uncertainty, two junior British ministers said on Thursday.

Headline: Mediator picked to resolve Royal Mail pensions row with union
Description: Royal Mail  and the Communications Workers Union have appointed Lynette Harris of Britain's Central Arbitration Committee to mediate in a row over plans to replace the company's defined benefit pension scheme.

Headline: UK worker earnings fall in real terms in year to April 2017 - ONS
Description: British workers' earnings fell in inflation-adjusted terms for the first time in three years during the 12 months to April 2017, according to a major annual survey of households published on Thursday.

Headline: UK car output falls again in September
Description: British car production fell 4.1 percent in September from the same month a year earlier, a fifth decline in six months that adds to signs of faltering consumer and business confidence.

Headline: London's Canary Wharf Docklands Light Railway station reopens after fire alert
Description: London's Canary Wharf Docklands Light Railway Station was reopened on Thursday after a temporary closure due to a fire alert, Transport for London (TfL) said on Twitter.

Headline: Amid Brexit timetable confusion, UK aims for transition outline by early 2018
Description: Britain wants an outline agreement with the European Union by the end of March 2018 on the transitional arrangements that will apply temporarily after it leaves the bloc, Brexit minister David Davis said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK economy gains pace, puts BoE rate hike firmly on track
Description: Britain's sluggish economy perked up slightly during the past three months, an unexpected boost that clears the way for the Bank of England to raise interest rates next week for the first time in a decade.

Headline: UK expecting Brexit deal in time for MPs to vote - PM May's spokeswoman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May expects a Brexit deal to be agreed in enough time for members of parliament to vote on it before March 2019, her spokeswoman said, addressing earlier contradictory remarks from her Brexit minister.

Headline: UK ministry says parliament will vote on any deal before Brexit
Description: Britain's Brexit ministry said on Wednesday parliament will vote on the final deal with the European Union before the country has left the bloc, clarifying an earlier statement by its minister that politicians may be denied a vote until after it has left.

Headline: Cost of energy in Britain is too high, independent review finds
Description: The cost of energy in Britain is too high and is higher than necessary to meet the country's climate change targets, an independent review has found.

Headline: MP regrets 'academic enquiry' into how UK universities teach Brexit - minister
Description: A member of parliament who sparked censorship fears when he asked universities for details of how they teach Brexit was misinterpreted and regrets the request, Britain's minister for universities Jo Johnson said on Wednesday.

Headline: May confident parliament will have vote on final Brexit deal
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday she expects parliament will have a vote on the final Brexit deal before the country has formally left the bloc.

Headline: UK economic growth 'solid' in third-quarter, says Hammond
Description: Britain enjoyed solid economic growth during the three months to September and has continued its pattern since last year's Brexit vote of outperforming economists' expectations, Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Wednesday.

Headline: UK parliament vote on Brexit deal may come after Britain leaves - minister
Description: Britain's parliament may not vote on the final terms of the country's withdrawal agreement with the European Union until after the country has formally left the bloc in March 2019, Brexit minister David Davis said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain aiming for outline Brexit transition deal by first quarter 2018 - Davis
Description: Britain wants an outline agreement with the European Union on the transitional arrangements that will apply after it leaves the bloc by the first quarter of 2018, Brexit minister David Davis said on Wednesday.

Headline: Disorderly Brexit risk rises but BoE to raise rates anyway - Reuters poll
Description: The likelihood of a disorderly Brexit has crept higher but that won't deter the Bank of England from raising rates next week for the first time in a decade, even though many economists believe that would be a mistake, a Reuters poll showed on Tuesday.

Headline: Hammond eyes 'measured' approach to November budget
Description: Britain will continue with a "measured and balanced" approach to reducing public borrowing in next month's budget, chancellor Philip Hammond said on Tuesday, seeking to contain any expectations of big surprises.

Headline: Executives spooked as hopes for early Brexit transition deal fade
Description: Executives at some of Britain's largest companies have reacted with alarm to Prime Minister Theresa May's statement that the details of any transitional arrangements with the European Union may not be known until a broader trade deal has been agreed.

Headline: Weedkiller ban would disrupt UK trains and raise ticket prices - study
Description: British travellers could face higher train fares and disruption to services if controversial weedkiller glyphosate is banned, a study said on Tuesday, in a move that could cost the rail industry millions of pounds each year.

Headline: UK economy approaching full capacity, says Hammond
Description: Britain's economy is approaching full capacity, chancellor Philip Hammond said on Tuesday ahead of his Nov. 22 budget announcement when asked about using public money to finance homebuilding.

Headline: UK sees swift deal on Brexit transition outline, still at odds with EU on trade
Description: Britain believes it can quickly agree a framework for a transitional agreement on exiting the European Union, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday, even as other stark differences over the Brexit timeline persisted.

Headline: EU's Tusk says 'good deal' or 'no deal' on Brexit up to London
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Tuesday that it was up to Britain to determine if there was to be a good deal or no deal in Brexit talks.

Headline: No 'bespoke' Brexit, transition means 'status quo' - Barnier
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said Britain must accept the full economic and legal status quo in a transition period after it leaves the EU and should expect no tailor-made terms on trade in its future relationship.

Headline: UK universities fear censorship after MP asks how they teach Brexit
Description: British universities rounded on an MP on Tuesday for asking them how they teach Brexit to students, a move many academics felt might be a prelude to censorship.

Headline: UK Supreme Court hears attempt to change Northern Ireland abortion law
Description: An attempt to change the law in Northern Ireland to allow abortions in cases of rape, incest or serious malformation of the foetus started in the UK Supreme Court on Tuesday with harrowing accounts of women's experiences.

Headline: Up to UK to find concrete proposals over Brexit/Irish border issues - Macron
Description: Britain must find concrete proposals to tackle issues concerning the border between the United Kingdom and Ireland in the wake of Brexit, said French President Emmanuel Macron during a news conference with Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar.

Headline: German bank regulator urges EU to be ready for Brexit cliff edge
Description: European Union regulators need temporary fixes in place to prevent market distortions in case banks based in Britain face a Brexit without a deal, Germany's financial watchdog said.

Headline: UK certain Iran nuclear deal to be preserved, U.S. says remains committed
Description: There is absolutely no doubt that a deal between Western powers and Iran to curb its nuclear programme will survive despite the U.S. decision not to recertify the deal, Britain's foreign minister Boris Johnson said on Monday.

Headline: Transition to be agreed with Brexit trade deal - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May signalled on Monday that any Brexit transition deal would be put together as part of a wider trade agreement - potentially stripping companies of the time they need to prepare to leave the European Union.

Headline: London introduces vehicle pollution levy in new blow to diesel
Description: London brought in a new levy on the oldest and most polluting cars entering the city centre from Monday, almost doubling how much motorists have to pay in the latest blow to diesel.

Headline: EU calls report on May-Juncker talks a smear
Description: The European Commission said a newspaper report that Jean-Claude Juncker had disparaged Theresa May's "despondent" demeanour after a dinner last week was a deliberate smear intended to disrupt Brexit negotiations.

Headline: After question on foreign meddling in Brexit, UK says democracy secure
Description: Britain's democracy is one of the most secure in the world and will remain so, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday in response to a question about a suggestion that there may have been foreign interference in the Brexit vote.

Headline: May says she is 'ambitious and positive' about Brexit talks
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she was "ambitious and positive" about the country's future and its negotiations to leave the European Union, describing the talks as being conducted in a "constructive spirit".

Headline: UK parliament to vote on Brexit deal before European parliament - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she expected a vote in parliament on the final Brexit deal to take place before the European parliament gets to vote on the agreement.

Headline: UK parliament to vote on Brexit deal before European parliament - May
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday she expected a vote in parliament on the final Brexit deal to take place before the European parliament gets to vote on the agreement.

Headline: May's meeting with EU officials 'constructive and friendly' - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's meeting with European Union officials last week was "constructive and friendly", her spokesman said on Monday when asked about an unflattering  newspaper account of the meeting in a German newspaper.

Headline: Now talk nice - EU script to help May settle Brexit bill
Description: Diplomatic theatrics at last week's Brussels summit revealed how European Union leaders will coax British Prime Minister Theresa May over the next two months into parting with tens of billions of euros in return for a post-Brexit trade deal.

Headline: 'Despondent' May losing sleep on in-fighting, said Juncker - FAZ
Description: Theresa May looked "despondent", with deep rings under her eyes, EU chief executive Jean-Claude Juncker told aides after dining with the British prime minister last week, a German newspaper said on Sunday.

Headline: UK's divorce bill figure will come in final Brexit deal - Liam Fox
Description: Britain can only come up with a figure for a financial settlement with the European Union when Brexit has been agreed, trade minister Liam Fox said on Sunday, warning leaders not to believe London is bluffing over a no deal.

Headline: Briton jailed for touching man at Dubai bar - newspapers
Description: A Briton accused of touching another man at a bar in the United Arab Emirates was sentenced to three months in jail by a Dubai court on Sunday, local newspapers reported.

Headline: PM May readying concessions on welfare reform - Sunday Telegraph
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is on the verge of making concessions around a key welfare reform that has angered opposition parties as well as members of her own Conservatives, the Sunday Telegraph reported.

Headline: EU's Tusk notes Brexit progress, hopes for trade talks by December
Description: EU Chairman Donald Tusk said on Friday there had been progress in Brexit negotiations and he hoped that by December it would be sufficient to start talks with London on their relationship after Britain leaves.

Headline: Merkel says Britain must move on Brexit bill to break deadlock
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Friday that the European Union could only agree to enter the next phase of Brexit negotiations in December if Britain provided specific assurances about its readiness to settle financial obligations to the bloc.

Headline: May wins Brexit reprieve, faces tough weeks ahead
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May won a modest reprieve in stalled Brexit talks on Friday, with European Union leaders signalling their readiness to move the negotiations forward in the coming months.

Headline: Airbus CSeries deal could boost Belfast jobs - Greg Clark
Description: A deal giving Airbus SE  a controlling stake in Bombardier Inc's   CSeries jets should lead to extra work for the Canadian planemaker's factory in Northern Ireland, UK Business Secretary Greg Clark said on Friday after meeting with executives from both companies.

Headline: May says will 'honour commitments' to EU
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Friday she had told fellow EU leaders that Britain would honour its commitments to the Union on Brexit and that other countries would not lose out in the current budget plan.

Headline: EU's Tusk says 27 leaders open internal work on Brexit phase two
Description: European Council President Donald Tusk said on Friday that 27 EU leaders meeting in Brussels had agreed to give the green light to internal preparations for the second phase of Brexit talks with London.

Headline: Highlights - Comments of EU leaders at summit in Brussels on Friday
Description: European Union leaders meet on Friday in Brussels to their response to British Prime Minister Theresa May's appeal to break the deadlock in Brexit negotiations.

Headline: Britain's new concessions are not enough, EU leaders tell May
Description: European Union leaders welcomed a proposal by British Prime Minister Theresa May aimed at unblocking Brexit talks, but said concessions to ease the fears of EU citizens living in Britain were not enough.

Headline: Merkel has no doubts UK, EU will achieve good Brexit result
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Thursday she had no doubts that the European Union and Britain could achieve a good result on Brexit after Prime Minister Theresa May appealed to leaders to move the talks forward.

Headline: Britain seeks new ways to detect explosives in airports
Description: Britain launched a fund on Friday to support new technology to screen hand-luggage in airports in a bid to detect concealed explosives without passengers having to remove electrical items from their bags.

Headline: London will remain leading financial centre - May's spokesman
Description: London will remain the world's leading financial centre, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday when asked about comments by Goldman Sachs  chief executive Lloyd Blankfein.

Headline: Britain will legislate Northern Irish budget unless power-sharing deal reached - minister
Description: A written agreement to restore power-sharing in Northern Ireland must be forthcoming by Oct. 30 or else Britain's parliament will have to legislate a budget for the province, the minister for the region said on Thursday.

Headline: Corbyn says Brexit must not be used to turn UK into a tax haven
Description: Jeremy Corbyn, leader of the British opposition Labour Party, said on Thursday he would fight any attempt by Prime Minister Theresa May's government to use Britain's exit from the European Union as a way to turn the country into a tax haven.

Headline: Britain must be clearer on Brexit divorce bill - Dutch PM
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May should clear up what financial commitments Britain is willing to honour as part of its divorce agreement with the European Union, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said on Thursday.

Headline: May calls for Brexit talks progress at EU summit
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said she would tell fellow European Union leaders on Thursday of "ambitious plans" for progress in Brexit negotiations in the coming weeks.

Headline: France's Macron says EU all united on Brexit talks
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Thursday that the European Union's 27 remaining nations were all united in their stance on Brexit behind the bloc's negotiator Michel Barnier in talks on Britain's withdrawal.

Headline: UK Brexit bill not scheduled for debate in parliament next week
Description: Britain's parliament will not discuss the key European Union withdrawal bill next week, the leader of the lower House of Commons, Andrea Leadsom, said on Thursday, amid concerns the government is struggling to manage divisions over its contents.

Headline: May to meet Bill Clinton to discuss Northern Ireland crisis
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will meet former U.S. President Bill Clinton on Thursday morning to discuss the political crisis in Northern Ireland, May's spokesman said.

Headline: MPs vent anger at May's fragile government over welfare reform
Description: Lawmakers from Britain's ruling Conservative Party vented their anger on Wednesday against Prime Minister Theresa May's pursuit of welfare reforms, reinforcing doubts about her authority over a party divided by Brexit.

Headline: May to pitch on Brexit at EU summit dinner
Description: Theresa May will make a pitch to fellow EU leaders in Brussels on Thursday as she tries to break a deadlock in Brexit talks that has left Britain's future trading position up in the air.

Headline: EU parliament chief snipes at UK over Brexit
Description: The head of the European Parliament derided British plans to leave the EU on Wednesday, saying they had not thought it through and faced problems for their trade, including vital food imports.

Headline: EU's Tusk expects no breakthrough on Brexit at summit
Description: The chairman of European Union leaders Donald Tusk said on Wednesday he did not expect any breakthrough in talks on the terms of Britain's exit from the EU at a summit on Thursday.

Headline: Germany upbeat on Brexit negotiations, official says
Description: Germany believes a lot has already been achieved in Brexit negotiations and Berlin is upbeat about the prospects of making further progress in the talks, a German government official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Germany upbeat on Brexit negotiations, official says
Description: Germany believes a lot has already been achieved in Brexit negotiations and Berlin is upbeat about the prospects of making further progress in the talks, a German government official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Northern Ireland political talks stall as time runs out
Description: The chances of Northern Ireland's political parties restoring a power-sharing agreement are "not positive" and Britain will have to impose a budget early next month if talks cannot be salvaged, the minister for the region said on Wednesday.

Headline: May might leave next stage of Brexit bill until next month
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has not yet set a date for the next stage in the passage of legislation to sever ties with the European Union, her spokesman said on Wednesday after the BBC reported it would not be until November, later than many had expected.

Headline: May not yet set date to move forward with Brexit bill
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May has yet to set a date to move forward with legislation to sever ties with the European Union, her spokesman said on Wednesday, after reports that the government was delaying its passage through parliament.

Headline: May says preparing for all Brexit scenarios
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday Britain was working to win the best possible deal for when it leaves the European Union but that government had to plan for every eventuality, including exiting without a deal.

Headline: Britain says chances of resolving Northern Ireland impasse 'not positive'
Description: The chances of Northern Ireland's political parties restoring a power-sharing agreement in Northern Ireland are "not positive" and talks in the last few days have stalled, Britain's minister for the region said on Wednesday.

Headline: Jailed British-Iranian charity worker received letter from ex-PM Cameron - prosecutor
Description: A British-Iranian charity worker serving a jail sentence in Tehran received a letter from ex-prime minister David Cameron that showed she had ties to the British government, a prosecutor said on Tuesday, according to Mizan, the news site of the Iranian judiciary.

Headline: EU rebuffs May, demands more concessions on Brexit
Description: The European Union told Britain on Tuesday it must make more concessions in talks over its departure from the bloc, offering little hope of a breakthrough for Prime Minister Theresa May at a summit later this week.

Headline: British spy chief says Islamist militants can execute deadly attack plans in just days
Description: Britain faces the most acute threat ever from Islamist militants seeking to inflict mass attacks, often with spontaneous plots that take just days to bring to execution, the head of the MI5 domestic intelligence agency said on Tuesday.

Headline: Highlights - Bank of England rate setters speak in parliament
Description: Members of the Bank of England interest rate setting committee were speaking in parliament on Tuesday. They also supplied statements to the Treasury Committee. Below are some of their comments:

Headline: EU business leaders urge Britain to hasten pace in Brexit talks
Description: European employers group BusinessEurope urged the British government on Tuesday to speed up negotiations with the European Union over withdrawal from the bloc, saying businesses urgently needed certainty.

Headline: Brexit divisions resurface as minister says no deal is 'unthinkable'
Description: British interior minister Amber Rudd said on Tuesday it was "unthinkable" that Britain and the European Union would fail to get a Brexit deal, distancing herself from other ministers who say London should be ready to walk away without an agreement.

Headline: 'It takes two to accelerate' - EU's Barnier on Brexit
Description: EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said he told British Prime Minister Theresa May over dinner that he was ready to speed up the pace of negotiations but that Britain still must do more to meet EU demands.

Headline: UK says needs 1,200 officials to register EU nationals after Brexit
