Headline: Old loyalties fray in Welsh ex-steel town divided by Brexit
Description: Loyalties of the past are eroding in the Welsh town of Merthyr Tydfil, a stronghold of the Labour Party since its birth more than a century ago and a former powerhouse of now departed heavy industries.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage says has no links to Russia - Daily Mail
Description: Britain's Nigel Farage, a leading Brexit campaigner, denied he had any links to Russia following a media report that he is a "person of interest" in the U.S. investigation into possible links between Russia and Donald Trump's presidential campaign.

Headline: May's Conservatives dwarf rivals in election campaign donations
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives received 3.8 million pounds in large donations in the third week of campaigning ahead of a June 8 election, more than ten times their main rivals, data published on Thursday showed.

Headline: From no-hoper to crowd-puller, British Labour leader Corbyn gains ground
Description: For a radical socialist written off by many as a no-hoper leading Britain's Labour Party to its worst ever election defeat on June 8, Jeremy Corbyn is pulling in big crowds.

Headline: What is the YouGov model which estimates May could lose majority?
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May could lose control of parliament in Britain's June 8 election, according to a projection by polling company YouGov, raising the prospect of political deadlock just as formal Brexit talks begin.

Headline: May's lead narrows to 3 percent points in latest YouGov poll - the Times
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party has a 3 percentage point lead over the opposition Labour Party ahead of Britain's June 8 election, the latest YouGov poll for the Times showed on Wednesday.

Headline: Corbyn to join TV debate as gap with Conservatives narrows
Description: The leader of Britain's main opposition Labour Party, Jeremy Corbyn, will take part in a live televised debate on Wednesday, hoping to capitalise on his party's momentum as it narrows the gap with the ruling Conservatives ahead of a June 8 election.

Headline: Conservatives lead Labour by six points ahead of June election - the Sun
Description: Ahead of Britain's June 8 election, Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party has a 6 percentage point lead over opposition Labour Party, a SurveyMonkey poll for the Sun showed on Wednesday.

Headline: YouGov model shows Conservatives 3 points ahead of Labour
Description: YouGov's election model, which pointed to British Prime Minister Theresa May losing her majority, was based on a voting intention of 41 percent for the Conservatives and 38 percent for Labour, a difference of 3 points, the pollster said.

Headline: Conservatives extend lead to 10 points over Labour - Kantar poll
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's lead over the opposition Labour Party has increased to 10 percentage points, an opinion poll showed on Wednesday, contrasting with others which have shown the gap closing markedly over the past week.

Headline: Farage 'person of interest' in Trump-Russia investigation - Guardian
Description: Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage is a "person of interest" in the U.S. investigation into possible collusion between Russia and Donald Trump's presidential campaign, the Guardian reported on Thursday citing unidentified sources.

Headline: UK's Economist calls May 'insular' as backs opposition Lib Dems
Description: The Economist has dropped its support for Theresa May's Conservative Party, saying the British prime minister had been "found out" for being illiberal, indecisive and insular during the short election campaign.

Headline: May looks 9 seats short of parliament majority - YouGov
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May looks nine seats short of winning a majority at next week's parliamentary election, a model from polling company YouGov estimated on Thursday, a smaller shortfall than the 16 seat gap shown a day earlier.

Headline: May's lead over Labour nearly halves to 8 points - Panelbase poll
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's lead over the opposition Labour party has almost halved to eight points in the space of a week, an opinion poll from Panelbase showed on Thursday.

Headline: Britain urges United States to take climate change seriously
Description: Britain wants the United States to take a leading role on addressing climate change, Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Thursday but he would not be drawn on what his response would be if President Donald Trump pulls out of the Paris accord.

Headline: Conservatives lead Labour by six points ahead of June election - the Sun
Description: Ahead of Britain's June 8 election, Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party has a 6 percentage point lead over opposition Labour Party, a SurveyMonkey poll for the Sun showed on Wednesday.

Description: YouGov's election model, which pointed to British Prime Minister Theresa May losing her majority, was based on a voting intention of 41 percent for the Conservatives and 38 percent for Labour, a difference of 3 points, the pollster said.

Headline: Conservatives extend lead to 10 points over Labour - Kantar poll
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's lead over the opposition Labour Party has increased to 10 percentage points, an opinion poll showed on Wednesday, contrasting with others which have shown the gap closing markedly over the past week.

Headline: May dodges question on whether she will resign if she loses seats in election
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May dodged a reporter's question on Wednesday about whether she would resign if she lost seats in a June 8 election.

Headline: Ex-Oasis singer Liam Gallagher honours bomb victims at emotional Manchester gig
Description: Former Oasis frontman Liam Gallagher paid homage to the victims of a suicide bombing in his home town, telling the crowd "Manchester I love you" on a stage lit up by 22 candles, British media reported.

Headline: Conservatives' lead over Labour seen narrowing - Panelbase
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's lead increased to 15 percentage points in a poll conducted over a week ago and published on Wednesday, but is likely to narrow in an upcoming poll, market research company Panelbase said on Wednesday.

Headline: YouGov sets out methodology for British election model
Description: British pollster YouGov on Wednesday set out the methodology behind its model which produced a shock projection that Prime Minister Theresa May would lose control of parliament in the  June 8 election.

Headline: From landslide to upset defeat - scenarios for May's election
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's narrowing lead in opinion polls ahead of the June 8 election has weakened sterling and raised questions over whether she will win the landslide predicted just a month ago.

Headline: MI5 to review its handling of intelligence on Manchester bomber
Description: Britain's MI5 has begun an internal review of how it handled intelligence on Manchester suicide bomber Salman Abedi, who was known to the authorities but not under active investigation, a source told Reuters on Monday.

Headline: Corbyn says he would ensure Brexit deal
Description: The leader of Britain's main opposition Labour Party said he would ensure there was Brexit deal with the European Union were he to win power, in contrast to Prime Minister Theresa May who has said she would be prepared to walk from a bad deal.

Headline: UK's 'Big Brother' anti-terror strategy is flawed, U.N. expert says
Description: Britain is undergoing a subtle but alarming shift towards criminalising peaceful protest and free expression, said a U.N. report on Monday that likened it to a "Big Brother" state of surveillance and suspicion.

Headline: Police seek information about Manchester attacker's suitcase
Description: British police released a picture of Manchester bomber Salman Abedi on Monday that showed him wheeling a blue suitcase on the day of the suicide attack last week, asking the public to come forward with information as their investigation continues.

Headline: May says no delaying June 19 start to Brexit talks
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said there would be no way to delay a June 19 start to Brexit negotiations as she urged voters to give her a strong mandate in a national election due next week.

Headline: MI5 starts review on handling of intelligence on Manchester bomber - source
Description: Britain's MI5 Security Service has started an internal review on whether there are lessons to be learned from its handling of intelligence on Salman Abedi before he killed 22 people by blowing himself up at a concert in Manchester.

Headline: Police arrest 16th person in connection with Manchester attack
Description: British police said on Monday they had arrested a 16th person in connection with the Manchester suicide bombing last week.

Headline: Britain says some of Manchester bomber's network potentially still at large
Description: Members of Manchester suicide bomber Salman Abedi's network are still potentially at large, British interior minister Amber Rudd said on Sunday, after the terrorism threat level was lowered because of significant progress in the investigation.

Headline: UK police arrest 15th person in connection with Manchester attack
Description: British police arrested a 19-year-old man on Sunday, the 15th person to be taken into custody in connection with the Manchester suicide bombing that killed 22 people.

Headline: If SNP wins election in Scotland, May will have to grant independence vote - Sturgeon
Description: If the Scottish National Party wins the most seats in Scotland at a June 8 election, Prime Minister Theresa May's refusal to agree to a second independence referendum will be unsustainable, Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Sunday.

Headline: May's lead narrows after Manchester attack placing landslide win in doubt
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's lead over the opposition Labour Party has narrowed sharply, according to opinion polls published since the Manchester attack, suggesting she might not win the landslide predicted just a month ago.

Headline: Police arrest 14th person in connection with Manchester attack
Description: British police said on Sunday they had arrested a 14th person in connection with the Manchester suicide bombing, and were searching a property in the south of the city.

Headline: UK says making progress with tech companies on getting encrypted militant messages
Description: Britain is making good progress with technology companies on getting access to the encrypted messages of militant suspects, interior minister Amber Rudd said on Sunday.

Headline: UK looking to increase pressure on internet firms over extremist material - minister
Description: Britain is looking at range of options to put pressure on internet companies to do more to take down extremist material, Security Minister Ben Wallace said on Sunday.

Headline: Defence minister denies report of divisions in May's team
Description: British Defence Secretary Michael Fallon on Sunday denied media reports of divisions in Prime Minister Theresa May's team ahead of a June 8 election.

Headline: May's lead narrows after Manchester attack placing landslide win in doubt
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's lead over the opposition Labour Party has narrowed sharply, according to five opinion polls published since the Manchester attack, suggesting she might not win the landslide predicted just a month ago.

Headline: May is retreating from globalisation, Osborne says
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May is offering voters a retreat from globalisation in one of the most significant developments in recent British political history, former Chancellor George Osborne said on Saturday.

Headline: UK lowers attack threat level as police close in on bomber's network
Description: British intelligence experts no longer believe another attack is imminent after police made significant progress in their investigation into a suicide bomb attack on a pop concert in Manchester, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Saturday.

Headline: May's lead narrows to seven percent points - YouGov poll
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's lead has narrowed to 7 percentage points from nine a week ago, according to a YouGov poll published by the Sunday Times ahead of the June 8 election.

Headline: May's lead halves to six percent points - ORB poll
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's lead over the opposition Labour Party has narrowed to 6 percentage points from 12 points a week ago, according to an ORB poll published on Saturday.

Headline: May's lead narrows to 10 percent points - Opinium poll
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party's lead over the opposition Labour Party has narrowed to 10 percentage points, according to an Opinium poll for the Observer newspaper on Saturday.

Headline: Obama offers condolences to Manchester victims in Prince Harry meeting
Description: Former U.S. president Barack Obama offered his condolences to the victims of the Manchester suicide bombing on Saturday when he met Britain's Prince Harry.

Headline: Two British jets dispatched after Russian incursion
Description: Two British fighter jets were dispatched from a Royal Air Force base in Scotland on Saturday after an incursion by Russian jets, Britain's Ministry of Defence (MoD) said.

Headline: Britain cuts terrorism threat level after significant police activity
Description: Britain lowered its security threat level to "severe" on Saturday following significant activity by police investigating the suicide bomb attack in Manchester, Prime Minister Theresa May said.

Headline: Police say they've arrested some key players behind Manchester bombing
Description: British police have arrested a "large part of the network" behind this week's Manchester suicide bombing but more arrests are likely, the country's top counter-terrorism officer said on Friday.

Headline: Rudd says threat remains critical as police hunt Manchester attacker's network
Description: Britain's threat level will remain at its highest level while police hunt down the suspected network of a suicide bomber who killed 22 people at a concert in Manchester, interior minister Amber Rudd said on Friday.

Headline: Police make 11th arrest over Manchester bomb attack
Description: British police on Friday arrested a man in connection with this week's suicide attack on a concert in Manchester, taking the total number of arrests since the bombing to 11.

Headline: U.S. takes 'full responsibility' for Manchester intelligence leaks -  Tillerson
Description: The United States government takes full responsibility for leaks of the British police investigation into Monday's deadly bomb attack in Manchester which killed 22 people, U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson said on Friday.

Headline: UK police say 'large part of network' behind Manchester attack arrested - Sky News
Description: Britain's top counter-terrorism officer Mark Rowley said on Friday that a "large part of the network" behind the Manchester suicide bomber had been arrested but more arrests were likely,  Sky News reported.

Description: The leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party said on Friday Britain's foreign policy and intervention in wars abroad had fuelled the threat of terrorism at homes as a political truce after the Manchester suicide attack came to an end.

Headline: May sticks to EU demands in talks with France's Macron
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May stuck to her demands for talks on leaving the European Union on Friday, telling French President Emmanuel Macron she wanted to discuss future arrangements with the bloc at the same time as setting the departure terms.

Headline: Police arrest another man after Manchester attack
Description: British police arrested a man on Friday in the of suburb of Moss Side, the tenth person to be taken into custody in connection with Monday night's Manchester attack.

Headline: May's lead falls to new low of 5 points ahead of June 8 election, YouGov poll
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's lead in the polls has fallen to 5 percentage points, a new low less than two weeks ahead of a June 8 election, but her personal rating recovered slightly in the days since the Manchester suicide bombing.

Headline: UK parties not giving full picture on likely tax rises - IFS
Description: Britain's two main political parties are not giving the public the full picture about how much taxes will need to rise in order to support public services after next month's election, a leading think tank said on Friday.

Headline: UK consumers downbeat on finances as inflation bites
Description: The rise in inflation in Britain after the Brexit vote has made households the most downbeat about their finances in more than two years, and the giant services sector is also feeling the impact, surveys showed on Friday.

Headline: UK security minister says no specific threat to public this weekend
Description: British emergency services are prepared for possible attacks on public events over an upcoming holiday weekend but have no information on specific threats after Monday's bomb attack in Manchester which killed 22, a government minister said.

Headline: After UK attack, voter confronts Rudd over police cuts
Description: A British voter has angrily confronted interior minister Amber Rudd over police cuts, prompting her to deny that a suicide bomb attack in Manchester which killed 22 at a music concert was linked to falling police numbers.

Headline: Manchester leaks will not damage U.S.-U.K. intelligence relations - U.S. officials
Description: U.S. intelligence officials said on Thursday they do not expect British Prime Minister Theresa May's concerns about U.S. officials' leaks on the Manchester suicide bombing to affect the closest intelligence partnership in the world.

Headline: UKIP chides May over Manchester attack as election campaign resumes
Description: Britain's UK Independence Party (UKIP) criticised Prime Minister Theresa May's record on security after a bombing in Manchester as it announced its policy pledges on Thursday, restarting an election campaign which was suspended following the suicide attack.

Headline: London police charge men over alleged terrorism plot in Britain
Description: London police said they had charged three men on Thursday with offences over an alleged British-linked terrorism plot.

Headline: Profiles of victims of Manchester Arena bomb
Description: The following are short profiles of those identified by family or friends as being among the 22 people killed in a suicide bombing at a Manchester concert by U.S. singer Ariana Grande.

Headline: EU offers post-Brexit rights to Britons in Europe - document
Description: The European Union will offer to protect the welfare and residence rights of Britons living on the continent after Brexit when it opens talks with London next month, according to a document seen by Reuters on Thursday.

Headline: Trump condemns leaks after UK police stop sharing attack information
Description: President Donald Trump said on Thursday that "deeply troubling" leaks to U.S. media about the Manchester suicide bombing would be investigated, after irate British police stopped sharing information with U.S. agencies.

Headline: Conservatives hold eight point lead in election poll taken before attack
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party held an eight percentage point lead over the opposition Labour Party in a Kantar poll taken before a suicide bombing in Manchester which killed 22 people.

Headline: Police close off London's Westminster Bridge over unattended vehicle
Description: British police sealed off Westminster Bridge in central London next to parliament on Thursday following reports of an unattended vehicle.

Headline: Is UK sick man of Europe? Not yet, even as economy slows sharply
Description: Britain's economy slowed more sharply than first thought in early 2017 as consumers felt the hit from the rise in inflation that followed the Brexit vote and exporters struggled to benefit from the weak pound.

Headline: May raised intelligence concerns with Trump after leaks row - UK source
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May raised concerns with U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday over leaks to U.S. media about the Manchester suicide bombing, a British government source said.

Headline: Bomb disposal team helping with search of property in south Manchester - police
Description: British police said on Thursday that a bomb disposal unit was helping with the search of a property in Withington, south Manchester, in connection with a suicide bombing earlier in the week which killed 22 people.

Headline: U.S. Secretary of State Tillerson to visit Britain on Friday - UK
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson will make his first official visit to Britain on Friday in an expression of solidarity following a suicide bombing in Manchester earlier this week, the British government said.

Headline: Turkey says no record of Manchester bomber travelling to Syria
Description: The suicide bomber who killed 22 people in Manchester passed through Istanbul on his way to Europe but there were no records of him entering Syria during his travels, two Turkish security officials said on Thursday.

Headline: Queen visits Manchester bombing casualties
Description: Queen Elizabeth met some of the young victims of the Manchester bombing in hospital on Thursday as well as doctors, nurses and members of the emergency services who responded to the attack that killed 22 and injured more than 100.

Headline: Manchester bomber's father says he did not expect attack
Description: The father of the bomber who killed 22 concert-goers in an attack in Manchester told Reuters in the Libyan capital on Wednesday that he had last spoken to his son some five days ago, by phone, and "everything was normal."

Headline: Trump says intelligence leaks 'deeply troubling'
Description: U.S. President Trump vowed on Thursday to bring anyone caught leaking U.S. intelligence to justice after British police stopped sharing information about the Manchester suicide bombing with the United States.

Headline: 'Don't look back in anger', sing crowds at Manchester victims' tribute
Description: Manchester crowds broke into an emotional chorus of "Don't Look Back in Anger" on Thursday after a minute of silent tribute to the victims of the Manchester Arena bombing.

Headline: May says intelligence sharing partnership with U.S. based on trust
Description: The United States is Britain's deepest defence and security partner and the intelligence sharing relationship between the two countries is based on trust, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday.

Headline: Leaks of Manchester bomb probe 'reprehensible,' will stop - U.S. envoy
Description: The most senior U.S. diplomat in Britain condemned media leaks of an investigation into a suicide bomb which killed 22 people in Manchester, saying the U.S. government would take action to identify those responsible.

Headline: UK security services have thwarted five plots since March Westminster attack - source
Description: British security services have thwarted 18 militant plots in the UK since 2013, including five following an attack in central London in March, a source with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Headline: UK interior minister 'confident' Manchester attack leaks will end - BBC reporter
Description: British interior minister Amber Rudd is "confident" that leaks to the U.S. media about the investigation into a suicide bombing in Manchester which killed 22 people will end, a BBC reporter said on Thursday.

Headline: British police say suspicious package in Manchester deemed safe, cordon removed
Description: A reported suspicious package in Manchester which British army bomb disposal experts investigated has been deemed safe, police said Thursday, adding that a cordon had been removed.

Headline: Manchester attack arrests 'significant,' important items found - police
Description: British police have made significant arrests and have uncovered important items as they investigate a suicide bomb attack which killed 22 at a music concert in Manchester, the head of the city's police said.

Headline: May's Conservatives attract most donations in second week of election campaign
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's ruling Conservatives received 1.6 million pounds in donations in the second week of  campaigning ahead of a June 8 election, far more than their rivals, the Electoral Commission, a watchdog, said on Thursday.

Headline: May says terror threat level will remain at critical
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday the terror threat level will remain at critical, following a suicide bombing at a concert hall in Manchester on Monday.

Headline: May says to tell Trump shared intelligence must remain secure - PA
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Thursday she would "make clear" to U.S. President Donald Trump that intelligence shared between the two countries must remain secure, the Press Association reported.

Headline: Manchester bomb forces sports, music venues into urgent reviews of security
Description: The Manchester bombing is forcing entertainment venues and security forces worldwide to look urgently for better ways to protect the public - and raising questions about who should pay the fast-rising costs.

Headline: Father of Manchester bomber arrested in Libyan capital Tripoli - spokesman, witness
Description: The father of the attacker who killed 22 people in a suicide bombing in Manchester has been arrested in the Libyan capital Tripoli, according to a counter-terrorism force spokesman and a witness.

Headline: UK police arrest fifth person in connection with Manchester attack
Description: A fifth person has been arrested in connection with a suicide bombing in the northern English city of Manchester which killed 22 people, police said on Wednesday.

Headline: British election campaigning to resume after Manchester bombing
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives and the main opposition Labour Party will resume national campaigning for next month's election on Friday following a suicide bombing that killed 22 people in Manchester.

Headline: May's party expected to resume national election campaign on Friday - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is expected to resume her election campaign on Friday, a party spokesman said, after campaigning was suspended due to a suicide bomb attack which killed 22 people on Monday.

Headline: Manchester police beefed up after attack but envy Fortress London
Description: Hours after the Manchester suicide bombing, British Prime Minister Theresa May stood on the steps of her official Downing Street residence and promised to give police the resources they needed to investigate the attack.

Headline: Muslim man, Jewish woman pray together at tribute to Manchester attack victims
Description: A Muslim man comforted an elderly Jewish women and the pair prayed together at a floral tribute in the centre of Manchester in a symbol of the city's unity following a suicide bomb attack which killed at least 22 people.

Headline: May receives further condolence calls from foreign leaders after attack
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May received condolence calls from several foreign leaders on Wednesday, following an attack on a concert hall in the northern English city of Manchester which killed 22 people, her spokesman said.

Headline: British police say investigating 'a network' in Manchester attack probe
Description: British police are investigating a network in their probe into the Manchester suicide bombing that killed 22 people on Monday, the head of Greater Manchester Police said.

Headline: BBC radio station back on air after brief evacuation
Description: A BBC radio station located just outside Manchester city centre briefly stopped live broadcasting on Wednesday after it was evacuated for what turned out to be a fire alarm.

Headline: Police find more explosives in searches following Manchester bombing - Independent
Description: Police and security services have found more explosives which could have been used in follow-up attacks to Monday's bombing which killed 22 in Manchester, the Independent reported citing security sources.

Headline: Father of Manchester bomber says he didn't expect attack
Description: The father of the bomber who killed 22 concert-goers in an attack in Manchester told Reuters in the Libyan capital on Wednesday that he had last spoken to his son some five days ago, by phone, and "everything was normal".

Headline: Manchester bomber seen buying rucksack in city on Friday - Sky
Description: Manchester bomber Salman Abedi was photographed by security cameras in the city's Arndale shopping centre on Friday evening, carrying a rucksack that appeared to be recently purchased, Sky News reported.

Headline: Police chiefs says U.S. leaks on Manchester bombing damage trust
Description: British police chiefs responded to leaks of information relating to Monday's suicide bombing in Manchester that appeared in U.S. media by warning that breaches of trust between international partners undermined their investigation.

Headline: May to cut short G7 programme after Manchester attack
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May plans to cut short her visit to the G7 meeting in Sicily after the terror threat level was raised in Britain to critical following a suicide bombing in Manchester, a senior government official said.

Headline: Police make sixth arrest after Manchester bomb attack
Description: British police arrested a sixth person, a woman, in connection with Monday's suicide bombing in Manchester, following searches in the north of the city.

Headline: Police hunt possible bomb-maker, accomplices after Manchester bombing -  sources
Description: British police hunted on Wednesday for potential accomplices who may have helped Salman Abedi build the bomb that killed 22 people in a crowded concert hall in Manchester and who could be ready to kill again.

Headline: Manchester bomb forces sports, music venues into urgent reviews of security
Description: The Manchester bombing is forcing entertainment venues and security forces worldwide to look urgently for better ways to protect the public - and raising questions about who should pay the fast-rising costs.

Description: The father of the attacker who killed 22 people in a suicide bombing in Manchester has been arrested in the Libyan capital Tripoli, according to a counter-terrorism force spokesman and a witness.

Description: A fifth person has been arrested in connection with a suicide bombing in the northern English city of Manchester which killed 22 people, police said on Wednesday.

Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives and the main opposition Labour Party will resume national campaigning for next month's election on Friday following a suicide bombing that killed 22 people in Manchester.

Headline: May's party expected to resume national election campaign on Friday - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is expected to resume her election campaign on Friday, a party spokesman said, after campaigning was suspended due to a suicide bomb attack which killed 22 people on Monday.

Headline: Manchester police beefed up after attack but envy Fortress London
Description: Hours after the Manchester suicide bombing, British Prime Minister Theresa May stood on the steps of her official Downing Street residence and promised to give police the resources they needed to investigate the attack.

Description: A Muslim man comforted an elderly Jewish women and the pair prayed together at a floral tribute in the centre of Manchester in a symbol of the city's unity following a suicide bomb attack which killed at least 22 people.

Headline: May receives further condolence calls from foreign leaders after attack
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May received condolence calls from several foreign leaders on Wednesday, following an attack on a concert hall in the northern English city of Manchester which killed 22 people, her spokesman said.

Description: British police are investigating a network in their probe into the Manchester suicide bombing that killed 22 people on Monday, the head of Greater Manchester Police said.

Headline: BBC radio station back on air after brief evacuation
Description: A BBC radio station located just outside Manchester city centre briefly stopped live broadcasting on Wednesday after it was evacuated for what turned out to be a fire alarm.

Headline: British police say military to guard key London sites
Description: British police said they had increased the number of officers on the streets in London and would deploy the military to guard key sites including Buckingham Palace and Downing Street following the suicide bombing in Manchester that killed 22 people.

Headline: 'Irritating' - UK scolds U.S. officials who leaked name of Manchester attacker
Description: Britain expressed irritation on Wednesday at leaks in the United States of details about a suicide bomber who killed 22 people at a packed pop concert, saying disclosures of that kind could hinder such investigations.

Headline: UK Independence Party to resume election campaign on Thursday
Description: Britain's UK Independence Party (UKIP) said on Wednesday it would re-start its election campaign with the launch of its policy pledges on Thursday, three days after a suicide bomber killed 22 people at a concert venue in Manchester.

Headline: France's Macron seeks extended emergency powers after Manchester attack
Description: The French parliament will be asked to extend by several months emergency powers introduced in 2015 to counter the threat of terrorist attacks, President Emmanuel Macron said on Wednesday after talks with security chiefs.

Headline: Parliament closes to visits after Manchester attack
Description: Britain's parliament said on Wednesday it would close to the public with immediate effect due to an increased security threat after Monday's suicide bomb attack in Manchester.

Headline: Three men arrested in Manchester bomb investigation, UK police say
Description: Three men have been arrested in Manchester on Wednesday in an investigation into the suicide bomb attack which killed 22 people at a music concert in the northern English city on Monday night, police in the city said.

Headline: France extends emergency powers after Manchester attack
Description: Emergency powers introduced in 2015 to counter the threat of terrorist attacks will be extended until Nov. 1, President Emmanuel Macron said after a security meeting on Wednesday.

Headline: Twenty in critical condition after Monday's Manchester bombing
Description: Around 20 people remain in a critical condition after Monday's suicide bombing at a British pop concert, with those wounded battling "highly traumatic injuries" such as damage to major organs and limbs, a health official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Polish couple died in Manchester attack - foreign minister
Description: A Polish couple died in the suicide attack in the English city of Manchester, Poland's Foreign Minister Witold Waszczykowski said on Wednesday.

Headline: May says to deploy armed forces after attack as threat level raised
Description: Soldiers will be deployed to key sites in Britain to boost security as the country raised its terror threat to the highest level of "critical" following a suicide attack in Manchester that killed 22 people, including children.

Headline: Ariana Grande returns to U.S. following Manchester bombing
Description: Ariana Grande returned to the United States on Tuesday, one day after a suicide bomber killed 22 people at the singer's concert in Manchester, England, as questions lingered over whether she would continue her European tour.

Headline: Factbox - What is known about suspected Manchester attacker Abedi
Description: The suspected suicide bomber who killed 22 people at a concert in Manchester, northern England, on Monday has been identified as 22-year-old Salman Abedi, British police said.

Headline: UK to deploy troops after attack, risk now 'critical' - May
Description: Britain's armed forces will be deployed to boost security, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Tuesday, as the country raised its terror threat to the highest level of "critical" after a suicide attack in Manchester that killed 22 people, including children.

Headline: 'No defeat, no pity' - Manchester unites against bomber
Description: Thousands of Manchester residents gathered in the centre of the northern English city on Tuesday in a show of defiance against a suspected suicide bomber who killed 22 people, including children, in an attack at a crowded concert hall.

Headline: British police name Manchester attacker as Salman Abedi
Description: A man who killed 22 people in a suicide bomb attack on a crowded concert hall in the northern English city of Manchester was named by British police on Tuesday as 22-year-old Salman Abedi.

Headline: France steps up security at public venues, plans new counter-terrorism body
Description: France ordered heightened security at sports and cultural events on Tuesday and President Emmanuel Macron said he would set up a new counter-terrorism coordinating body after a suicide bomber killed 22 people at a British concert hall.

Headline: May speaks to foreign leaders after Manchester attack - spokesman
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May spoke to several foreign leaders after a suicide bomber killed at least 22 people in an attack on a pop concert in the northern English city of Manchester, her spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: 'Please retweet' - Parents go online to find their children after UK attack
Description: Desperate parents and friends posted heart-wrenching messages and pictures on social media in the search for their loved ones on Tuesday after a suicide bomber killed 22 people and injured dozens at a British concert by U.S. singer Ariana Grande.

Headline: U.S. hasn't verified Islamic State link to Manchester attack - Coats
Description: The United States has not confirmed an Islamic State link to a suicide bombing that killed at least 22 people at a concert hall in the British city of Manchester, despite the militant group's claim of responsibility, the top U.S. intelligence official said on Tuesday.

Headline: Manchester suicide attack lays bare limits of security measures
Description: Countries across the world will tighten security ahead of major cultural and sports events after a suicide bombing in Britain that killed at least 22 people, but experts say reinforced measures will do little to prevent determined individuals.

Headline: Islamic State claims responsibility for Manchester arena attack
Description: Islamic State claimed responsibility for Monday's deadly attack at the Manchester Arena and said it was carried out with an explosive device planted at the concert, according to a statement the group posted on Telegram.

Headline: Trump and May agree Manchester attack was 'wanton and depraved'
Description: United States President Donald Trump told British Prime Minister Theresa May that Americans stood with the United Kingdom after a suicide bomber killed 22 people at a concert in the northern English town of Manchester.

Headline: Trump denounces Manchester attack by 'evil losers'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump extended his condolences on Tuesday to the victims of the Manchester suicide bombing that killed 22 people and said those behind the attack were "evil losers".

Headline: Police say controlled explosion was precautionary
Description: British police said a controlled explosion carried out near a concert venue in Manchester on Tuesday was done as a precaution, and that the destroyed item turned out to be abandoned clothing, rather than something suspicious.

Headline: Suicide bomber suspected in Manchester blast - two U.S. officials
Description: Initial signs point to a suicide bomber as the cause of a blast at a music venue in Manchester, England, that killed 19 people and injured 50, two U.S. officials who spoke on condition of anonymity said on Monday.

Headline: Bomb disposal team at scene of Manchester incident - Sky News
Description: A British bomb disposal team is investigating a reported explosion at a major concert venue that has caused a number of deaths in the northern English city of Manchester, broadcaster Sky News reported on Monday.

Headline: May's election lead falls to 14 points as Labour draws support - ICM
Description: Britain's Labour Party has cut the lead of Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives to 14 points from 20 points a week ago, according to an ICM poll which showed Labour regaining ground in some of its most closely contested voting districts.

Headline: May says has support for long-held immigration target - BBC
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May denied on Monday that her top ministers did not support a target to bring down immigration to the tens of thousands, rejecting reports of a split in her cabinet over one of the issues that drove Britain's Brexit vote.

Headline: Britain won't accept EU's 'obsession' with ECJ in Brexit talks - minister
Description: Britain will not accept the "one-sided" powers of the European Court of Justice as part of a deal to leave the European Union, Brexit minister David Davis said on Monday, criticising what he called an "ideological obsession" with the court in Brussels.

Headline: May says to cap amount elderly have to pay for social care
Description: Britain will cap the amount elderly people have to pay for social care, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday after a backlash against her election proposal to make more people contribute to the costs.

Headline: May to change social care pledge, George Osborne says
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's ruling Conservative Party will change its policy pledge on transferring the cost of caring for elderly people, former finance minister George Osborne said on Monday.

Headline: Conservatives' lead halved ahead of election - Survation poll
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives' lead over the opposition Labour Party halved to 9 percent in a Survation telephone poll published on Monday, adding to signs that the election race is tightening ahead of the June 8 vote.

Headline: Poll lead falls, but May to stick with elderly-care cuts
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative Party said on Sunday it would not ditch proposals to reduce support for elderly voters, as opinion polls showing their lead ahead of the June 8 national election falling.

Headline: Britain's EU 'no deal' threat is genuine, says Brexit minister Davis
Description: Britain is prepared to walk away from divorce talks with the European Union without a deal, Brexit minister David Davis said on Sunday, but stressed that he thought an agreement was the most likely outcome.

Headline: Polls show UK's Conservatives losing ground as policies set out
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's lead in the opinion polls has narrowed after her Conservatives and the Labour opposition published their policy plans this week, with one survey showing the gap between the two parties halving to nine points.

Headline: Survation poll finds Conservatives' lead narrows after policy launch
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives have narrowed their lead over the opposition Labour party ahead of a June 8 election after both parties presented their programmes for government, a Survation poll for the Mail on Sunday showed.

Headline: May's Conservatives lead Labour by 13 points - Opinium poll
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservative party has seen its lead narrow slightly ahead of a June 8 national election but it remains well ahead of its opposition, an Opinium poll showed on Saturday.

Headline: May's Conservatives on 46 percent, Labour on 34 percent ahead of election - Orb poll
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives have retained their lead over the opposition Labour Party ahead of the June 8 election, but with Labour gaining ground, an Orb poll published by the Telegraph showed on Saturday.

Description: Swedish prosecutors dropped an investigation of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange on Friday over a rape allegation, but British police said he would still be arrested if he left the Ecuadorean embassy in London where he has been holed up for five years.

Headline: Assange says ready to talk to UK and US after Sweden case dropped
Description: Wikileaks' Julian Assange said on Friday he was prepared to talk to Britain and the United States after Sweden dropped a probe into an allegation of rape against him, but he defended his right to remain in Ecuador's embassy in London.

Description: The leader of Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives in Scotland on Friday made a plea to supporters of Britain's opposition Labour Party to lend her their vote at next month's election to halt the march of the Scottish nationalists.

Description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange said on Friday he would not forgive or forget those behind a long-running Swedish rape investigation that he said had prevented him seeing his children while they grew up.

Description: Britain's ruling Conservatives are expected to outspend the opposition Labour Party on campaigning for next month's election, with many of their traditional business backers opting to stick with them despite concerns over Brexit.

Description: Britain's ruling Conservatives are expected to outspend the opposition Labour Party on campaigning for next month's election, with many of their traditional business backers opting to stick with them despite concerns over Brexit.

Headline: Assange lawyer claims 'total victory' after prosecutor drops investigation
Description: Swedish prosecutors' decision to drop an investigation into an allegation of rape against Julian Assange on Friday is a "total victory", his lawyer, Per Samuelson, said.

Headline: Timeline - Swedish prosecutors drop Assange rape probe
Description: Swedish prosecutors have dropped an investigation of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange over a rape allegation, but British police said he would still be arrested if he left the Ecuadorean embassy in London where he has been holed up.

Headline: Merkel says Britain to be treated fairly, but will pay Brexit price
Description: Britain would be treated fairly by the European Union after it quit the bloc, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Friday, but Brexit would nonetheless have its price.

Headline: UK police say WikiLeaks' Assange will be arrested if he leaves Ecuador's embassy
Description: British police said WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange would still be arrested if he leaves the Ecuadorean embassy in London after Swedish prosecutors said on Friday they would drop a preliminary investigation into an allegation of rape against him.

Headline: Factbox - UK investors and shareholders welcome May's corporate governance pledges
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May vowed to make it harder for foreign companies to take over British firms and threatened to clamp down on soaring executive pay as she set out her plans for Britain if her Conservative Party wins a parliamentary election on June 8.

Headline: May maps out bigger role for state in corporate Britain
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May promised to clamp down on executive pay, give workers a say on strategy and make it harder for foreign firms to take over British ones, as she set out pre-election plans to give the state more influence over corporate Britain.

Headline: May's pitch to voters: market intervention and stiffer rules for business
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May rejected "untrammelled free markets" and promised to rein in corporate excesses in pre-election pledges on Thursday designed to woo not only her core supporters but also those of her left-wing rivals.

Headline: Citigroup says May to win majority of 104-190 in June 8 election
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May is likely to win a majority of 104-190 seats in the June 8 election, Citigroup said in a research note published on Friday.

Headline: May surprises with change of policy on care for the elderly
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May unveiled a surprise new policy on Thursday that aims to transfer a greater share of the cost of caring for elderly people from taxpayers to those recipients who can afford to pay for their own care.

Headline: There is no 'Mayism', May says
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she stood within the mainstream of British Conservative party thought on Thursday, rejecting the suggestion that she had a distinctive personal approach or wanted to be compared with Margaret Thatcher.

Headline: May pledges to build more social housing
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May pledged to provide funding to local councils in Britain to build more homes, in a move which could significantly boost the amount of government-backed social housing for the first time in decades.

Headline: Factbox - What are May's plans for corporate reform and Brexit?
Description: Setting out her pitch to voters ahead of the June 8 election, British Prime Minister said on Thursday she will press on with her approach to Brexit, cut immigration and introduce corporate reform.

Headline: Conservatives pledge to abolish independent SFO
Description: Britain's ruling Conservative Party on Thursday pledged to scrap the Serious Fraud Office (SFO) and roll it into a broader crime-fighting body if it wins the June 8 national election, in a move roundly criticised by lawyers and anti-corruption groups.

Headline: Irish PM to step down, succession contest begins
Description: Irish Prime Minister Enda Kenny resigned as leader of his Fine Gael party on Wednesday, kicking off a succession contest between two younger ministers who colleagues hope will boost the party ahead of an election due late next year.

Headline: Norwegian-British man freed from Congo jail - PM
Description: A Norwegian man jailed for life in Democratic Republic of Congo for murder and espionage has been freed and returned to Norway, the Scandinavian country's prime minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain to investigate use of personal data in political campaigns
Description: Britain said it was investigating how politicians and campaigners use data to target voters with online advertising to make sure they comply with electoral laws and do not abuse people's privacy.

Headline: After Trump disclosures, May says will continue to share intel with U.S.
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday the government has confidence in its relationship with the United States, and will continue to share intelligence with Britain's most important defence and security ally.

Headline: UK police arrest four men on suspicion of terrorism offence
Description: British police said they had arrested four men on Wednesday on suspicion of preparing terrorism acts in the United Kingdom.

Headline: Lloyds new era begins as government sells off final shares
Description: Britain has sold its last remaining stake in Lloyds Banking Group, making the lender the first to re-emerge from British state ownership in a symbolic step for the country's recovering banking sector.

Headline: Factbox - Impact on banks from Britain's vote to leave the EU
Description: Global banks have warned they could move thousands of jobs out of Britain to prepare for the expected disruption caused by the country's exit from the European Union, endangering London's status as a major financial centre.

Headline: Labour's main union backer can't see party winning election - report
Description: The leader of Britain's biggest workers' union has said he couldn't see the opposition Labour Party winning a June 8 parliamentary election, a remarkable statement from one of Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn's most powerful supporters.

Headline: Conservatives to unveil policy pledges on Thursday
Description: The Conservatives will present their policy pledges to voters on Thursday ahead of a June 8 parliamentary election, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: May endorses Hammond after reports of rift
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May endorsed Chancellor Philip Hammond on Wednesday after media reports of a deepening rift between their two teams ahead of a June 8 election.

Headline: London office space rising despite Brexit uncertainty - Deloitte survey
Description: The amount of empty office space in London has jumped over the past 15 months and is likely to rise again despite potential for a post-Brexit business exodus that could drive down rental values, a survey showed on Wednesday.

Headline: 'Destroy Labour', Conservatives given election orders
Description: No talk of opinion polls and definitely no boasting - Britain's governing Conservative Party is under strict orders before a June election which it hopes will "destroy" the opposition.

Headline: Man arrested over 1984 murder outside Libyan embassy in London is released
Description: A man arrested in 2015 in connection with the 1984 murder of a British policewoman outside the Libyan embassy in London has been released without charge because crucial evidence was not available for national security reasons, police said on Tuesday.

Headline: Labour launches 'radical, responsible' election manifesto
Description: Promising renationalisation of some services, measures to curb corporate excess and end healthcare cuts, Britain's Labour Party made its case on Tuesday for voters to back its move to the left and throw out the Conservatives at next month's election.

Headline: Factbox - Key election manifesto pledges from Labour Party
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party launched its manifesto on Tuesday for a June 8 election, promising to renationalise mail, rail and water services, increase tax on the highest earners and clamp down on corporate excess.

Headline: Inflation tightens screw on UK consumers as election nears
Description: British inflation hit its highest level since September 2013 last month, extending its sharp rise since the vote to leave the European Union and tightening the squeeze on living costs as a national election approaches.

Headline: Conservatives on 47 percent, stretch lead on rivals - Kantar poll
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May's Conservatives have extended their lead over the opposition Labour Party ahead of the June 8 national election as support for smaller parties wanes, a poll by Kantar Public showed on Tuesday.

Headline: Labour party says would break up Royal Bank of Scotland
Description: The Labour Party would launch a consultation to break up state-owned Royal Bank of Scotland  into smaller local banks, the party said on Tuesday at the launch of its election manifesto.

Headline: UK National Grid pauses on Moorside nuclear project power line
Description: National Grid has put on hold development consent for a proposed power line connecting Britain's transmission network to the Moorside nuclear project in northwest England, in another blow to the project.

Headline: 'Fat cats keep the money', angry voter yells at May
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May was confronted while out campaigning on Monday ahead of next month's election by an angry voter who scolded the British leader over cuts to disability benefits.

Headline: After Trump disclosures, May says will continue to share intel with U.S.
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday the government has confidence in its relationship with the United States, and will continue to share intelligence with Britain's most important defence and security ally.

Headline: UK police arrest four men on suspicion of terrorism offence
Description: British police said they had arrested four men on Wednesday on suspicion of preparing terrorism acts in the United Kingdom.

Headline: Lloyds new era begins as government sells off final shares
Description: Britain has sold its last remaining stake in Lloyds Banking Group, making the lender the first to re-emerge from British state ownership in a symbolic step for the country's recovering banking sector.

Headline: Factbox - Impact on banks from Britain's vote to leave the EU
Description: Global banks have warned they could move thousands of jobs out of Britain to prepare for the expected disruption caused by the country's exit from the European Union, endangering London's status as a major financial centre.

Headline: Labour's main union backer can't see party winning election - report
Description: The leader of Britain's biggest workers' union has said he couldn't see the opposition Labour Party winning a June 8 parliamentary election, a remarkable statement from one of Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn's most powerful supporters.

Headline: Conservatives to unveil policy pledges on Thursday
Description: The Conservatives will present their policy pledges to voters on Thursday ahead of a June 8 parliamentary election, Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: May endorses Hammond after reports of rift
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May endorsed Chancellor Philip Hammond on Wednesday after media reports of a deepening rift between their two teams ahead of a June 8 election.

Headline: London office space rising despite Brexit uncertainty - Deloitte survey
Description: The amount of empty office space in London has jumped over the past 15 months and is likely to rise again despite potential for a post-Brexit business exodus that could drive down rental values, a survey showed on Wednesday.

Description: No talk of opinion polls and definitely no boasting - Britain's governing Conservative Party is under strict orders before a June election which it hopes will "destroy" the opposition.

Description: A man arrested in 2015 in connection with the 1984 murder of a British policewoman outside the Libyan embassy in London has been released without charge because crucial evidence was not available for national security reasons, police said on Tuesday.
