Description: Britain hopes to hold positive talks with the European Union over its divorce from the bloc but needs time to prepare, new Prime Minister Theresa May told EU Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker on Thursday, her spokeswoman said.

Headline: Obama calls new British PM May - White House
Description: President Barack Obama telephoned new British Prime Minister Theresa May on Thursday and looks forward to working with her on shared goals through the end of his term, the White House said.

Headline: Johnson says Britain can have greater Europe role post-Brexit
Description: British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson said on Thursday that Britain could play an even greater role in Europe despite voting to leave the European Union, a view he said was shared by the United States.

Headline: David Gauke appointed to number 2 job at the Treasury
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May has appointed David Gauke as the chief secretary to the treasury, the second in command at the finance ministry, her office said on Thursday.

Headline: New chancellor pledges to restore confidence after Brexit vote
Description: Britain's new chancellor of exchequer, Philip Hammond, said on Thursday he would do whatever is necessary to restore confidence in the economy after the Brexit vote, suggesting a less aggressive approach to bringing down the budget deficit.

Headline: U.S. Treasury Secretary Lew calls for flexibility in Brexit talks
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Jack Lew urged European Union and British officials to be pragmatic and flexible in talks on Britain's departure from the EU, and said he would meet new chancellor Philip Hammond later on Thursday.

Headline: PM May hands environment ministry to beaten leadership rival Leadsom
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May appointed Brexit campaigner Andrea Leadsom, who this week dropped out as her rival in the Conservative leadership contest, as environment secretary in her new cabinet on Thursday.

Headline: Greg Clark appointed minister for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy
Description: Greg Clark has been appointed head of a newly formed British ministry for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy, Prime Minister Theresa May's office said on Thursday.

Headline: James Brokenshire appointed Northern Ireland Secretary - PM's office
Description: James Brokenshire has been appointed Northern Ireland Secretary by Prime Minister Theresa May, her office said on Thursday.

Headline: Javid removed as business secretary by new PM May
Description: Conservative lawmaker Sajid Javid was removed from his position as business secretary by new Prime Minister Theresa May on Thursday, taking up a less prominent role leading the department responsible for local government.

Headline: Chris Grayling appointed British transport minister
Description: Brexit-supporting Conservative lawmaker Chris Grayling has been appointed Transport Secretary by new British Prime Minister Theresa May, her office said in a statement on Thursday.

Headline: Kerry congratulates Boris Johnson, urges 'sensible' Brexit approach
Description: U.S Secretary of State John Kerry on Thursday congratulated Boris Johnson on his appointment as Britain's new foreign secretary and urged a sensible approach to Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Steinmeier urges Britain to make formal Brexit request soon
Description: The appointment of Boris Johnson as British foreign secretary is a clear signal that Britain wants to leave the European Union and London should make the formal request soon, German Foreign Minister Frank-Walter Steinmeier was quoted as saying.

Headline: Former leadership candidate Crabb resigns from government - Sky News
Description: Britain's work and pensions minister Stephen Crabb, an unsuccessful candidate in the contest to replace Prime Minister David Cameron, has resigned from government, Sky News reported on Thursday.

Headline: Northern Ireland Secretary Villiers resigns from government
Description: Northern Ireland Secretary Theresa Villiers said on Thursday she had resigned from the government after declining a new post offered to her by Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: Frontrunner to lead UKIP vows to push new PM May to fulfil Brexit vote
Description: The favourite to take over as leader of the anti-EU UK Independence Party said on Thursday he would seek to hold new Prime Minister Theresa May's feet to the fire to ensure she sticks to her promise of removing Britain from the bloc.

Headline: PM May appoints new justice and education ministers
Description: British Prime Minster Theresa May appointed the government's new justice and education ministers on Thursday, as she continued assembling the senior team that will help her guide the country out of the European Union.

Headline: Chancellor Hammond says no need for emergency budget
Description: Britain's new Chancellor, Philip Hammond, said the country did not need an emergency budget and he would instead monitor the economic situation over the summer before setting out spending targets as normal in the autumn.

Headline: 'Reasonable' that Britain wants financial services access to EU - Schaeuble
Description: Chancellor Philip Hammond's remarks that British financial services should retain access to the European Union's single market are "reasonable," German Finance Minister Wolfgang Schaeuble said on Thursday.

Headline: Hammond - Mark Carney doing excellent job at Bank of England
Description: Britain's new Chancellor Philip Hammond said Mark Carney was doing an excellent job at the Bank of England and that he would work with him to forge a plan for Britain's economy after the Brexit vote.

Headline: Johnson a liar with his back against the wall, French counterpart says
Description: In Boris Johnson, Britain has appointed a liar with his back against the wall as its new foreign secretary at a time when somebody reliable is needed in the role, his French counterpart Jean-Marc Ayrault said on Thursday.

Headline: UK-Turkey ties stronger than Boris Johnson's quips - Turkish official
Description: Turkey will draw a line under disparaging comments by Britain's new foreign secretary Boris Johnson about President Tayyip Erdogan and his nation, a senior official said on Thursday, but warned relations would be damaged if he repeated such insults.

Headline: Pro-Brexit Gove sacked from the British government - Sky News
Description: Prominent pro-Brexit campaigner Michael Gove has been sacked from his cabinet post of justice secretary by Britain's new Prime Minister Theresa May, Sky News reported on Thursday citing sources.

Headline: UK must consider pace of deficit reduction - chancellor Hammond
Description: New British chancellor Philip Hammond said he would consider how quickly the country should bring down its budget deficit, suggesting he would take a less aggressive approach to that of his predecessor in the job George Osborne.

Headline: UK has not decided when to trigger Article 50 - Hammond
Description: Britain has yet to decide when to trigger Article 50 to begin the formal process of leaving the European Union, newly appointed Chancellor Philip Hammond said on Thursday.

Headline: Labour leadership contender says Britain should vote again on Brexit
Description: Britain should vote again on whether to remain in the European Union once a Brexit deal is agreed, Owen Smith, one of three candidates vying to lead Britain's opposition Labour Party, the Guardian newspaper reported on Thursday.

Headline: Merkel invites PM May for talks in Berlin, declines to comment on Johnson
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Thursday she had invited Britain's new prime minister Theresa May for talks in Berlin and that she was looking forward to working with her.

Headline: New PM May gives Johnson big job, says needs time before Brexit talks
Description: Theresa May became Britain's prime minister on Wednesday with the task of leading it out of the European Union, and quickly named leading 'Brexit' supporters including former London mayor Boris Johnson to key positions in her new government.

Headline: 'Charming Bastard' David Davis to lead Brexit talks
Description: David Davis, a staunchly Eurosceptic lawmaker who says the risk of losing a key export partner will force EU leaders such as Angela Merkel to agree to a free trade deal, was appointed as the man to lead Britain out of the bloc on Wednesday.

Headline: Hammond faces daunting task in charge of UK's Brexit-hit economy
Description: Philip Hammond took over as Britain's new finance minister on Wednesday, putting him in charge of the world's fifth-largest economy as it risks sliding into recession after voters decided to leave the European Union last month.

Headline: May tells Merkel and Hollande she needs time before Brexit talks
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May said she had told German Chancellor Angela Merkel and French President Francois Hollande on Wednesday that her government would need time before beginning talks on Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Known for jokes and insults, Boris Johnson takes helm of British diplomacy
Description: Boris Johnson, Britain's most colourful politician with a long record of gaffes and scandals, was appointed as foreign secretary on Wednesday in a surprise move by new Prime Minister Theresa May that could shake up world diplomacy.

Headline: Factbox - New British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson's forthright comments
Description: Boris Johnson, the popular and flamboyant ex-mayor of London, was on Wednesday appointed Foreign Secretary by new British Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: France's Hollande urges Britain's May to begin Brexit talks quickly
Description: French President Francois Hollande urged new British Prime Minister Theresa May to begin talks to pull her country out of the European Union quickly, his office said after a phone call between the two leaders on Wednesday.

Headline: Factbox - New British cabinet appointments
Description: New Prime Minister Theresa May, who took office on Wednesday with a mandate to take Britain out of the European Union, has announced the senior members of her cabinet.

Headline: David Davis - Who is Britain's Mr Brexit?
Description: David Davis, a strong supporter of Brexit, was appointed the minister responsible for leading Britain's negotiations to leave the European Union by Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: Amber Rudd appointed new interior minister
Description: Amber Rudd, a former British energy minister, was appointed as interior minister on Wednesday, a role which will make her a key player in the country's approach to immigration under new Prime Minister Theresa May.

Headline: Pro-Brexit campaigner Fox named as British trade minister
Description: Prime Minister Theresa May appointed Liam Fox, a pro-Brexit campaigner, as the minister for international trade on Wednesday, her office said.

Headline: After winning power, Theresa May faces Brexit divorce battle
Description: Having fought her way to the top of British politics, new Prime Minister Theresa May will face an even tougher battle in power: plotting a divorce from the European Union that she once opposed but now says must not be halted.

Headline: EU looks to May to help fix hole in calendar
Description: Brexit has torn a hole in the European Union's political calendar for next year and Brussels hopes new British Prime Minister Theresa May can help fix it in the coming days.

Headline: Fallon stays as defence minister in new PM May's cabinet
Description: British defence minister Michael Fallon will retain his post in Prime Minister Theresa May's new cabinet, her office said on Wednesday.

Headline: U.S. says it is looking forward to working with new British foreign minister
Description: The U.S. State Department looks forward to working with Boris Johnson, appointed on Wednesday as British foreign secretary, a U.S. State Department spokesman said.

Headline: EU's parting shot - 'Good riddance, Cameron'
Description: Europe won't miss David Cameron, a senior EU lawmaker in Brussels said on Wednesday as the prime minister who led Britain to the exit left office and handed on the job of completing its withdrawal from the European Union.

Headline: George Osborne resigns from UK government - Downing Street
Description: George Osborne has resigned as British finance minister and has left the government, the office of new Prime Minister Theresa May said on Wednesday.

Headline: White House congratulates May, confident on her Brexit handling
Description: The White House on Wednesday congratulated incoming British Prime Minister Theresa May and said it was confident in her ability to steer Britain through negotiations on leaving the European Union.

Headline: EU lawmakers to be 'tough but fair' in banking trade talks with Britain
Description: European Union lawmakers said they would be "tough but fair" in negotiating trading terms for financial services with Britain after its decision to leave the bloc.

Headline: Trade, not trouble, is the big Brexit fear for Irish border towns
Description: Along the narrow country roads that weave across the border between Northern Ireland and the Irish Republic, locals fear Brexit may curb trade and gut farm funding but few see a return to the dark days of military checkpoints.

Headline: For Cameron, a gamble too far
Description: Until last month, the advice David Cameron chose to give fellow British parliamentarians on his last day as prime minister on Wednesday might have seemed apt.

Headline: Drawing laughter and a few tears, Cameron the entertainer takes his final bow as PM
Description: David Cameron's last appearance in parliament as British Prime Minister ended in a standing ovation after a bravura 36-minute performance that taunted his rivals, reflected on his legacy and confessed his love for the office cat.

Headline: Sturgeon presses May to explore options for Scotland to remain in EU
Description: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Wednesday she wanted incoming British Prime Minister Theresa May to enable the Scottish government to explore options for Scotland to remain in the European Union as part of the overall Brexit process.

Headline: Demob-happy Cameron taunts Labour leader with 'Monty Python' jibe
Description: A demob-happy David Cameron used his last appearance in parliament as Prime Minister to taunt embattled Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn, likening him to the hapless Black Knight comedy figure in "Monty Python and the Holy Grail" who was unable to see when he was beaten.

Headline: Brexit could provide boost for Britain's shale gas
Description: Britain's shale gas industry could get a helping hand from a falling pound and a supportive new prime minister just as it is gearing up for its first production this year, after facing economic and political challenges that slowed its start.

Headline: PM Cameron says working to ensure EU citizens can stay in Britain
Description: The government is working hard to make sure European Union citizens can stay in Britain following its vote to leave the bloc but it will depend on reciprocal rights for Britons in Europe, outgoing Prime Minister David Cameron said on Wednesday.

Headline: Outgoing PM Cameron urges successor May to stay close to EU
Description: Outgoing Prime Minister David Cameron urged his successor Theresa May to position Britain as close to the European Union as possible, in his final weekly question session in parliament.

Headline: Efforts to overturn Brexit will go nowhere, says senior Tory lawmaker
Description: Parliamentary attempts to revoke the Brexit vote in favour of leaving the EU have no chance of succeeding and would run into a solid Conservative Party opposition, the chair of Britain's foreign affairs committee said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain set to welcome female PM but sexism still 'corrodes' politics, activists say
Description: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Britain may be about to welcome its second woman prime minister but female politicians are still far from achieving equality with online abuse, objectification and misogyny plaguing British politics, a leading women's rights group said.

Headline: Labour MP Owen Smith says to run for party leadership
Description: A second British Labour opposition MP entered the contest to topple leader Jeremy Corbyn on Wednesday, boosting the veteran left-winger's chances of being re-elected by splitting the support of those who oppose him.

Headline: Factbox - Theresa May's plans for a Brexit ministry and who might lead it
Description: Theresa May, who will take over as Britain's prime minister on Wednesday, has said she plans to set up a new government department to lead the process of withdrawing the country from the European Union.

Headline: German leaders demand Brexit clarity from May
Description: German leaders stepped up the pressure on Britain's incoming prime minister Theresa May on Tuesday by demanding she swiftly spell out when she will launch divorce proceedings with the European Union.

Headline: Theresa May joins small but growing band of women world leaders
Description: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Theresa May is set to become Britain's second female prime minister on Wednesday when she takes over from David Cameron as head of the ruling Conservative party, joining a small but growing band of female world leaders.

Headline: Labour rules Corbyn has right to stand again for leadership
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party ruled on Tuesday that its leader Jeremy Corbyn had the automatic right to stand in a new leadership contest, setting the stage for a struggle between the veteran socialist's supporters in the country and party lawmakers who want to oust him.

Headline: Labour says Corbyn has automatic right to defend leadership
Description: British opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn's name should automatically be on the ballot paper in the Labour Party's leadership contest, the party's national executive committee (NEC) ruled on Tuesday.

Headline: Europe in their hands - May and Merkel draw battle lines for Brexit clash
Description: Both are pastors' daughters who excelled as academics before rising to the top of their conservative parties. Now Theresa May and Angela Merkel, equally firm but pragmatic, will go head to head to determine Britain's future relationship with Europe.

Headline: British parliament to debate petition calling for second EU referendum
Description: Britain's parliament is to debate a petition signed by more than 4 million members of the public calling for a second referendum on European Union membership, but will not take a decision on whether to re-run last month's vote.

Headline: After Brexit vote, Scotland's Sturgeon takes control
Description: The Friday morning after Britain voted to leave the European Union, leaders in London had little to say.

Headline: Labour leader Corbyn calls for calm after challenger's office vandalised
Description: The leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party Jeremy Corbyn called on Tuesday for calm among the party's supporters after the office of a lawmaker challenging his leadership was vandalised, adding that he had also received death threats this week.

Headline: Minister says Gibraltar to be fully involved in Brexit negotiations
Description: Gibraltar will be fully involved in the negotiations to decide the terms of Britain's exit from the European Union, government minister David Lidington told parliament on Tuesday.

Headline: Eagle challenges Corbyn for leadership of Labour Party
Description: Labour MP Angela Eagle launched her bid to take over the leadership of the party on Monday, saying current leader Jeremy Corbyn was not up to the task of defeating the ruling Conservatives.

Headline: Obama confident U.S.-UK 'special relationship' to continue under May
Description: President Barack Obama is confident that the "special relationship" between the United States and Britain will continue after Theresa May becomes British prime minister, the White House said on Monday.

Headline: May must protect London's financial centre - MP
Description: Britain's next Prime Minister Theresa May must find ways to protect London's financial sector as the country negotiates its exit from the European Union, senior lawmaker Stephen Hammond said on Monday.

Headline: May wins battle to be PM but faces tussle over Brexit
Description: Theresa May has won the battle to be Britain's prime minister but will face a much tougher struggle once in power -- overseeing her country's divorce from the European Union.

Headline: Cameron says UK must stay close to the EU after Brexit
Description: Prime Minister David Cameron said it was in Britain's fundamental interest to remain very close to the European Union when it renegotiates a new relationship with the bloc it voted to leave in a referendum last month.

Headline: UK consults on insurance, driving rules for autonomous cars
Description: Britain launched a consultation on Monday on changes to insurance rules and motoring regulations as it pursues its plans to allow driverless cars to take to the streets by 2020.

Headline: May says to negotiate a successful Brexit as PM
Description: Next prime minister, Theresa May, called on Monday for the country to unite under her leadership, promising to make a success of negotiating the country's divorce from the European Union.

Headline: Brexit vote was not binding so parliament must decide, lawyers tell PM
Description: Lawmakers in parliament should decide whether Britain leaves the European Union because the Brexit vote was not binding, more than 1,000 prominent British lawyers said in a letter to Prime Minister David Cameron.

Headline: May poised to become Britain's next prime minister
Description: Home Secretary Theresa May was on course to become the country's next prime minister after her only rival for the leadership of the ruling Conservative Party, Andrea Leadsom, said on Monday she was pulling out of the race.

Headline: Cameron hums merry tune after announcing PM handover moves
Description: British Prime Minister David Cameron appeared in high spirits when he appeared briefly outside his Downing Street office on Monday to outline this week's timetable for his resignation.

Headline: May confirmed as leadership winner, Britain's new PM - committee
Description: Britain's Theresa May has been confirmed as the winner of the ruling Conservatives' leadership contest and will be installed as prime minister shortly, the chairman of a party committee running the contest said on Monday.

Headline: Cameron says will step down as prime minister on Wednesday
Description: David Cameron said he would resign as prime minister on Wednesday, paving the way for home secretary Theresa May to take over the job the same day.

Headline: Osborne welcomes prospect of May becoming prime minister
Description: Chancellor of Exchequer George Osborne said it was good news that home secretary Theresa May was now the sole candidate to become the country's next prime minister after her remaining rival Andrea Leadsom dropped out of the race on Monday.

Headline: Britain's next PM May stakes claim to centre ground
Description: Britain's next prime minister, Theresa May, pledged on Monday to put government at the service of "ordinary working people", laying claim to the centre ground in an effort to heal rifts exposed by a referendum vote to leave the European Union.

Headline: 'I know I'm not showy': Theresa May in her own words
Description: Theresa May is set to become Britain's next prime minister, lauded by her supporters as a safe pair of hands who can steer the country out of the European Union.

Headline: Latest developments in aftermath of Brexit vote
Description: Britain's June 23 referendum decision to leave the European Union has had far-reaching consequences for the world's economy, businesses, investors and politics. Following are the main developments:

Headline: Labour Party says leadership contest triggered
Description: Opposition Labour Party said on Monday a leadership contest had been officially triggered following the receipt of sufficient nominations for a rival candidate to left-wing leader Jeremy Corbyn.

Headline: May to make statement after Leadsom pulls out
Description: Theresa May, who will become Britain's next prime minister after her only rival in the Conservative Party leadership contest pulled out, will make a statement later on Monday, one of her key backers said.

Headline: May to be confirmed as UK Conservative leader, and next PM
Description: Theresa May is the only remaining candidate to be the new leader of Britain's ruling Conservative Party and a formal process will now take place to confirm her in the role, the chairman of a party committee running the leadership contest said on Monday.

Headline: May pledges to put 'working people' first if elected PM
Description: Home Secretary Theresa May pledged on Monday to put government at the service of "ordinary working people" to forge an economy that helps everyone if elected Britain's next prime minister next month.

Headline: May says to narrow pay gap if appointed PM
Description: Home Secretary Theresa May pledged on Monday to pursue measures to narrow the pay gap between bosses and workers if elected Britain's prime minister next month, promising a fairer society where the economy works for all.

Headline: PM candidate Leadsom apologises to rival over motherhood row
Description: Andrea Leadsom, the junior minister seeking to become Britain's next prime minister, apologised to her childless rival over remarks which suggested she had a greater stake in the country's future because she was a mother.

Headline: Osborne to urge U.S. investors to stick with Britain outside EU
Description: British finance minister George Osborne will meet some of Wall Street's biggest investors in New York on Monday to urge them to stick with Britain despite last month's vote to leave the European Union, his office said.

Headline: Corbyn says expects to be on ballot as Labour heads for bitter leadership contest
Description: Britain's opposition Labour Party is set for a bitter battle over its future after leader Jeremy Corbyn said he expected to be on the ballot automatically for a leadership contest and would fight any attempt to prevent him entering the race.

Headline: Sterling's fall could batter UK's fish & chips
Description: Prices of salmon and squid have soared as disease and weather hurt global supplies, and British fish sellers say the Brexit-related drop in its currency may be the next scourge.

Headline: Labour MP Eagle says challenging for leadership to unite party
Description: British opposition Labour lawmaker Angela Eagle said on Sunday she wanted to lead the party into the next national election and was challenging leader Jeremy Corbyn for his job to try to unite the party.

Headline: Would-be British PM sparks row with remarks on rival's childlessness
Description: Andrea Leadsom, one of two candidates vying to become the next British prime minister, has caused an uproar by suggesting that being a mother means she has a greater stake in the country's future than her childless rival Theresa May.

Headline: Brexit anxiety eats into NATO summit
Description: Officially the talk at this week's NATO summit in Warsaw was all about deterring a resurgent Russia, supporting Ukraine and Afghanistan, and protecting Baltic NATO members. But in the corridors, there was only one dominant anxiety - Brexit.

Headline: Obama says Brexit talks must not harm 'wobbly' world economy
Description: U.S. President Barack Obama said on Saturday he expected Britain to go through with leaving the European Union after last month's referendum and was concerned to limit the damage to the British, European and global economies from the move.

Headline: Obama tells France, Germany, Italy, Britain to safeguard EU after Brexit vote
Description: U.S. President Barack Obama told the leaders of Germany, Italy, France and Britain they should "preserve the stability and well-being of the European project" after Britons voted to leave the European Union, a White House official said.

Headline: Britain sets nuclear vote as NATO underlines need for deterrent
Description: Britain's outgoing prime minister David Cameron set a July 18 vote for parliament to decide on renewing Britain's nuclear deterrent, in a surprise move seemingly timed to underscore London's commitment to European security at a NATO summit.

Headline: Opposition Labour MP Eagle bids to unseat leader Corbyn
Description: Angela Eagle, a senior lawmaker from Britain's main opposition Labour Party, said on Saturday she would launch a bid to replace embattled socialist veteran Jeremy Corbyn as party leader.

Headline: British government rejects petition calling for second EU referendum
Description: The British government has rejected an online petition signed by 4.1 million people calling for a new referendum on whether to leave the European Union.

Headline: Factbox - From finance to fox hunting, Leadsom in her own words
Description: Andrea Leadsom was largely unknown to most British voters before the Brexit referendum but her upbeat argument that Britain could flourish outside the European Union resonated with voters, helping to steer the Leave campaign to a surprise victory.

Headline: Pro-Conservative Telegraph newspaper backs May for PM
Description: The Daily Telegraph, a British newspaper seen as influential among Conservative supporters, endorsed interior minister Theresa May on Saturday to be the country's next prime minister.

Headline: May and Leadsom vow to make EU immigration harder after Brexit
Description: Both candidates seeking to become Britain's next prime minister vowed in interviews published on Friday to impose tougher rules on EU citizens newly arriving in Britain, as they face a ballot of party members to choose David Cameron's successor.

Headline: PM candidate Leadsom says post-Brexit right to stay will depend on work permits
Description: EU citizens coming to Britain once the country has left the European Union will need to obtain work permits if they wish to stay, Andrea Leadsom, one of two candidates vying to replace David Cameron as prime minister, said.

Headline: May and Leadsom in all-women race to be new PM
Description: Home Secretary Theresa May and eurosceptic rival Andrea Leadsom emerged on Thursday as the two candidates who will battle to become Britain's next prime minister and lead the country out of the European Union.

Headline: New 'pop-up' paper launches for Britons hankering after the EU
Description: A new "pop-up" newspaper aimed at the 48 percent of Britons who voted unsuccessfully to stay in the European Union hit the news stands on Friday aiming to cater for what it called their sense of dismay and anger.

Headline: Brexit batters UK consumer confidence, retailers worry over sterling
Description: British consumer confidence suffered one of its biggest drops in 21 years and the country's largest department store expressed concern over the pound's fall, in the strongest evidence to date of the challenges Britain's economy faces after the Brexit vote.

Headline: Cameron nominates diplomat to fill seat on EU executive
Description: Britain has nominated its ambassador to France, Julian King, to fill its vacant seat on the European Commission, replacing Jonathan Hill who resigned after Britons voted to leave the European Union.

Headline: Analysis - Flightpath to Brexit: charting through the fog
Description: Britain's ruling Conservative party has determined that either Theresa May or Andrea Leadsom will succeed David Cameron as prime minister on September. 9 and so negotiate British withdrawal from the European Union.

Headline: UK renews pre-Brexit financial aid pledge for Tata Steel
Description: The British government's offer of financial aid to Tata Steel UK and to potential buyers of its assets here is still on the table, business minister Anna Soubry said on Wednesday, despite Britain's shock vote last month to leave the European Union.

Headline: 'Please stop saying I was lying,' says Blair after Iraq war inquiry
Description: Tony Blair, the former prime minister who led Britain into war in Iraq in 2003, launched a defence of his legacy following the publication of a highly critical report into the war with a simple message: "Please stop saying I was lying."

Headline: Iraqi who hammered Saddam's statue says Blair should be put on trial
Description: The Iraqi man who was filmed attacking Saddam Hussein's statue with a sledgehammer when U.S. troops stormed into Baghdad in 2003 said Iraq was in a better shape under his rule and George W. Bush and Tony Blair should be put on trial "for ruining" it.

Headline: Iraq planning failure not repeated in Afghanistan - PM Cameron
Description: Prime Minister David Cameron said on Wednesday that Britain's military involvement in Afghanistan had not repeated the planning failures of the 2003 Iraq invasion.

Headline: Londoners fear 'Pay to Stay' law will price poor tenants out of the capital
Description: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - From the moment Jan Sweeney first got the keys to her council flat in west London 35 years ago, she hoped she had found a sanctuary from the economic unrest gripping the city.

Headline: Criticised for sloppy Iraq reporting, U.K. spy agencies pursue reform
Description: Britain's foreign spy agency concluded within months of the invasion of Iraq that two key intelligence reports it had received about Iraqi weapons of mass destruction were fabricated, a British inquiry disclosed on Wednesday.

Headline: Farewell 'pantomime villain': Farage will miss EU boos
Description: Nigel Farage, the outgoing leader of the UK Independence Party, said on Wednesday he would miss being the "pantomime villain" of the European Parliament after Brexit, but would stay on for now to see that Britain got a good trade deal.

Headline: Former British PM Blair says could not delay Iraq invasion
Description: Britain's former prime minister Tony Blair said on Wednesday he could not delay the invasion of Iraq in 2003, responding to a critical report on the war which found that taking military action was not the last resort that had been presented to parliament and the public.

Headline: Blair had qualms on Iraq war, but promised Bush support 'whatever'
Description: British Prime Minister Tony Blair wrote to U.S. President George W. Bush eight months before the 2003 Iraq war that he would support him "whatever", even as he outlined numerous reservations about a possible military operation.

Headline: Blair defends Iraq decisions while expressing regret
Description: Britain's former prime minister Tony Blair said on Wednesday he felt sorrow and regret over the Iraq war but defended his decision to join the U.S.-led invasion of Iraq in 2003.

Headline: UK Conservatives to chose either May or Leadsom to succeed PM Cameron - committee
Description: British lawmakers Theresa May and Andrea Leadsom will go through to a vote of Conservative Party members to decide who succeeds Prime Minister David Cameron, the party said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain pays respects on 7/7 bombings anniversary
Description: Britain marked the anniversary on Thursday of the devastating Islamist suicide bombings on London's transport network on July 7, 2005, often called the 7/7 attacks.

Headline: Police investigating suspect package at British parliament
Description: A suspect package triggered a security alert at the British parliament on Thursday but there were no reports of illness or injury, police said.

Headline: PM candidate Leadsom - priority is tariff-free trade with EU
Description: Andrea Leadsom, one of three candidates vying to be Britain's next prime minister, said her top priority would be to guarantee tariff-free trade with the European Union after Britons voted to quit the bloc.

Headline: PM candidate Leadsom defends record of her career
Description: Andrea Leadsom, one of three candidates vying to become the next British prime minister, said she had given a full account of her past jobs on Thursday as some of her career credentials were called into doubt.

Headline: Britain needs to boost trade negotiating resources, says Hammond
Description: Britain will need to boost its trade negotiating resources following its decision to leave the European Union but it is unrealistic to believe the government will have a huge budget to do so, Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond said on Thursday.

Headline: Britain's deep relationship with U.S. to continue after Brexit - Hammond
Description: Britain's deep relationship with the United States will continue despite its vote to leave the European Union, British Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond said on Thursday.

Headline: Hammond hopes EU stays tough on Russia despite Brexit
Description: Britain's foreign minister Philip Hammond said on Thursday he fears that the European Union might soften its stance on Russian sanctions following a British exit from the bloc, and said he hoped that the EU would maintain a tough approach.

Headline: Hammond says Article 50 a decision for government, not parliament
Description: British Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond said it was up to government, not parliament, to trigger the formal Article 50 process for leaving the EU, and that the will of the British public is clear after voting to leave the bloc.

Headline: PM candidate Leadsom - priority is tariff-free trade with EU
Description: Andrea Leadsom, one of three candidates vying to be Britain's next prime minister, said her top priority would be to guarantee tariff-free trade with the European Union after Britons voted to quit the bloc.

Headline: PM candidate Crabb withdraws from race, endorses May
Description: Conservative MP Stephen Crabb pulled out of the race to be the next prime minister on Tuesday and endorsed front-runner Theresa May as the list of candidates was reduced to three.

Headline: Labour party reinstates Shah suspended for Israel comment
Description: An MP suspended by the Labour party over online posts about Israel has been reinstated, a local party spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: May leads first round of voting to succeed PM Cameron - committee
Description: British lawmaker Theresa May won the first round of voting to decide a successor to Prime Minister David Cameron, the Conservative Party said on Tuesday, as former defence minister Liam Fox was eliminated from the contest.

Headline: PM candidate May is 'bloody difficult', senior MP says
Description: Theresa May, the frontrunner to replace British Prime Minister David Cameron, is "bloody difficult" without much experience in foreign affairs, a senior Conservative lawmaker was caught on camera saying on Tuesday.

Headline: Rivals eye Britain's EU passport to riches
Description: A French president taking an interest in the arcane world of financial plumbing is a sure sign of how Britain's neighbours plan to exploit its vote to leave the European Union.

Headline: PM candidate May says EU exit deal must preserve London's financial sector
Description: Britain must seek to preserve London's financial industry and its competitive advantages in negotiations on leaving the European Union, Theresa May, a leading candidate to replace Prime minister David Cameron, said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain could import as much as 93 percent of its gas by 2040 – National Grid
Description: Britain could be forced to rely on other countries for 93 percent of its gas supplies by 2040 if there is weak economic growth and not enough money made available to support domestic gas production, National Grid said on Tuesday.

Headline: Ex-London Mayor Johnson backs Leadsom to be next British prime minister
Description: Former London Mayor and leading Brexit campaigner Boris Johnson on Monday gave his backing to junior minister Andrea Leadsom to be the next leader of the Conservative Party and British prime minister.

Headline: Candidate for PM Leadsom says Brexit talks should be short
Description: Talks over Britain's departure from the EU should be as short as possible to avoid prolonged uncertainty, prime ministerial candidate Andrea Leadsom said on Monday as she launched her leadership bid.

Headline: Analysis - EU authority fraying in reaction to Brexit vote
Description: The European Union's authority is fraying as governments and politicians in many members challenge EU policies and take aim at "Brussels bureaucracy" in the aftermath of Britain's vote to leave the 28-nation bloc.

Headline: Criticised for sloppy Iraq reporting, U.K. spy agencies pursue reform
Description: Britain's foreign spy agency concluded within months of the invasion of Iraq that two key intelligence reports it had received about Iraqi weapons of mass destruction were fabricated, a British inquiry disclosed on Wednesday.

Headline: Farewell 'pantomime villain': Farage will miss EU boos
Description: Nigel Farage, the outgoing leader of the UK Independence Party, said on Wednesday he would miss being the "pantomime villain" of the European Parliament after Brexit, but would stay on for now to see that Britain got a good trade deal.

Headline: Former British PM Blair says could not delay Iraq invasion
Description: Britain's former prime minister Tony Blair said on Wednesday he could not delay the invasion of Iraq in 2003, responding to a critical report on the war which found that taking military action was not the last resort that had been presented to parliament and the public.

Headline: Blair had qualms on Iraq war, but promised Bush support 'whatever'
Description: British Prime Minister Tony Blair wrote to U.S. President George W. Bush eight months before the 2003 Iraq war that he would support him "whatever", even as he outlined numerous reservations about a possible military operation.

Headline: Blair defends Iraq decisions while expressing regret
Description: Britain's former prime minister Tony Blair said on Wednesday he felt sorrow and regret over the Iraq war but defended his decision to join the U.S.-led invasion of Iraq in 2003.

Headline: Britain needs more independent ties with U.S. after Iraq - Corbyn
Description: Britain needs a more open and independent relationship with the United States to avoid a repeat of the 2003 invasion of Iraq which was an "act of military aggression", opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn said on Wednesday.

Headline: PM Cameron says partnership with U.S. vital for national security
Description: Britain's relationship with the United States is vital for national security, Prime Minister David Cameron said on Wednesday, after the publication of a critical report into the events leading up to the U.S.-led invasion of Iraq.

Headline: Cameron says MPs must take share of blame over Iraq
Description: Lawmakers who voted to support Britain's joining the 2003 invasion of Iraq need to take their share of responsibility for the mistakes that were made, Prime Minister David Cameron said on Wednesday.

Headline: PM Cameron says important to learn Iraq lessons
Description: Prime Minister David Cameron said the government needed to learn the lessons from what went wrong in the build-up to Britain's joining the invasion of Iraq, in his initial response to a long awaited inquiry on the war.

Headline: Blair says will take full responsibility for Iraq war failings
Description: Former British Prime Minister Tony Blair said he would take full responsibility for the failings made in the build up to the invasion of Iraq when he responds to a long-awaited inquiry later on Wednesday.

Headline: Legal case for Britain's 2003 Iraq invasion 'far from satisfactory'- inquiry
Description: Britain's decision to go to war with Iraq in 2003 had a "far from satisfactory" legal basis and ex-Prime Minister Tony Blair's case for military action was over-hyped, a long-awaited inquiry into the conflict concluded on Wednesday.

Headline: UK business minister calls for corporate, personal tax cuts - FT
Description: Britain's business minister Sajid Javid said the government should cut corporate and personal taxes to soften the blow from an expected slowdown after Britain's vote to leave the European Union.

Headline: May leads three-horse PM race as Brexit hits pound and property
Description: Home Secretary Theresa May opened up a strong lead on Tuesday in what is now a three-horse race to become Britain's next prime minister, but the first stage of voting was overshadowed by post-Brexit carnage for property investors and the pound.

Headline: Prime minister can launch EU exit procedure without parliament - Letwin
Description: Lawyers have advised the British government that the prime minister does not need parliamentary approval to trigger the procedure to leave the European Union, government minister Oliver Letwin said on Tuesday.

Headline: London's financial district urges fast action on EU trade terms
Description: Britain should move quickly to keep investment flowing and preserve the City of London's dominance in financial services after last month's vote to leave the European Union, the head of London's financial district said on Wednesday.

Headline: PM candidate Crabb withdraws from race, endorses May
Description: Conservative MP Stephen Crabb pulled out of the race to be the next prime minister on Tuesday and endorsed front-runner Theresa May as the list of candidates was reduced to three.

Headline: Labour party reinstates Shah suspended for Israel comment
Description: An MP suspended by the Labour party over online posts about Israel has been reinstated, a local party spokesman said on Tuesday.

Headline: May leads first round of voting to succeed PM Cameron - committee
Description: British lawmaker Theresa May won the first round of voting to decide a successor to Prime Minister David Cameron, the Conservative Party said on Tuesday, as former defence minister Liam Fox was eliminated from the contest.

Headline: PM candidate May is 'bloody difficult', senior MP says
Description: Theresa May, the frontrunner to replace British Prime Minister David Cameron, is "bloody difficult" without much experience in foreign affairs, a senior Conservative lawmaker was caught on camera saying on Tuesday.

Headline: Rivals eye Britain's EU passport to riches
Description: A French president taking an interest in the arcane world of financial plumbing is a sure sign of how Britain's neighbours plan to exploit its vote to leave the European Union.

Headline: PM candidate May says EU exit deal must preserve London's financial sector
Description: Britain must seek to preserve London's financial industry and its competitive advantages in negotiations on leaving the European Union, Theresa May, a leading candidate to replace Prime minister David Cameron, said on Tuesday.

Headline: Britain could import as much as 93 percent of its gas by 2040 – National Grid
Description: Britain could be forced to rely on other countries for 93 percent of its gas supplies by 2040 if there is weak economic growth and not enough money made available to support domestic gas production, National Grid said on Tuesday.

Headline: Ex-London Mayor Johnson backs Leadsom to be next British prime minister
Description: Former London Mayor and leading Brexit campaigner Boris Johnson on Monday gave his backing to junior minister Andrea Leadsom to be the next leader of the Conservative Party and British prime minister.

Headline: Candidate for PM Leadsom says Brexit talks should be short
Description: Talks over Britain's departure from the EU should be as short as possible to avoid prolonged uncertainty, prime ministerial candidate Andrea Leadsom said on Monday as she launched her leadership bid.

Headline: Analysis - EU authority fraying in reaction to Brexit vote
Description: The European Union's authority is fraying as governments and politicians in many members challenge EU policies and take aim at "Brussels bureaucracy" in the aftermath of Britain's vote to leave the 28-nation bloc.

Headline: Exit stage right - UKIP leader Farage announces surprise departure
Description: The leader of the insurgent right-wing UK Independence Party said on Monday he was stepping down after realising his ambition to win a vote for Britain to leave the EU, the latest twist in a dramatic reshaping of the nation's politics.

Headline: EU leaders tell Balkan states accession talks to go on despite Brexit
Description: European Union leaders on Monday sought to reassure Balkan nations that talks on their becoming members of the bloc would continue despite Britain's vote to leave the union.

Headline: Candidate for British PM May wants quick vote on Trident
Description: Britain must prioritise replacing its Trident nuclear deterrent in the wake of the referendum to leave the European Union with a parliamentary vote this month, interior minister Theresa May will say on Tuesday, The Daily Telegraph reported.

Headline: Queen, in Scotland after Brexit vote, says staying calm can be hard
Description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth told Scottish lawmakers on Saturday that staying calm in a fast-changing world can be difficult.

Headline: Labour MP says ready for leadership challenge; Corbyn clings on
Description: Britain's opposition leader Jeremy Corbyn will face a leadership contest unless he considers his position, Labour Party lawmaker Angela Eagle said on Monday, saying she has the necessary support to trigger a challenge and is ready to do so.

Headline: Britain's Serious Fraud Office on a high after Libor rollercoaster
Description: When David Green was appointed head of Britain's Serious Fraud Office (SFO) in 2012 he predicted he would be judged by how he fared prosecuting allegations of global interest rate rigging, a symbol of banker greed during the financial crisis.

Headline: UK plans lower corporation tax to cushion hit from Brexit
Description: Britain has announced plans to cut corporation tax to less than 15 percent in an attempt to cushion the shock of the country's decision to leave the European Union, raising the prospect of competitive tax cuts across the bloc.

Headline: Chancellor Osborne says meeting major banks on Tuesday for post-Brexit talks
Description: British Chancellor George Osborne will meet heads of major banks on Tuesday to discuss how the country should respond to the decision to leave the European Union.

Headline: PM candidate Crabb says would approve new Heathrow runway if elected
Description: Stephen Crabb, one of the candidates to replace British prime minister David Cameron, said on Monday he would approve a new runway at Heathrow Airport immediately if he is elected.

Headline: In or Out? Brexit limbo gives EU headache
Description: The European Union says it will not be "paralysed" after Britons voted to leave, but Brussels policymakers say uncertainty over Britain's future is already complicating the lawmaking process for the rest of the EU.

Headline: Future of EU nationals in Britain is for Brexit talks - PM spokeswoman
Description: The future status of European Union nationals living in Britain will have to be worked out as part of Brexit negotiations and will be for the next prime minister to decide, Prime Minister David Cameron's spokeswoman said on Monday.

Headline: No guarantees for EU citizens in UK without reciprocal deal - immigration minister
Description: Britain should not guarantee the right of European Union nationals to remain in the country once it has left the bloc unless it receives reciprocal assurances from other EU states, the immigration minister said on Monday.

Headline: Law firm Mishcon de Reya tangles Brexit in legal challenge over divorce trigger
Description: London law firm Mishcon de Reya said it had started legal action to demand the British government win legislative approval from Parliament before triggering a formal divorce from the European Union.

Headline: Factbox - How does the Conservative Party elect a leader, and who is running?
Description: Britain's governing Conservative Party has begun the process of electing a new leader and presumptive prime minister, after David Cameron said he would resign following the country's vote on June 23 to leave the European Union.

Headline: PM candidate Fox says no place for free movement in trade deal
Description: British prime ministerial candidate Liam Fox said the principle of free movement of people should not be on the table in negotiations about a trade deal with the European Union following the country's referendum vote to leave the bloc.

Headline: France's Macron - Corporate tax should not be first priority for UK
Description: France's Economy Minister Emmanuel Macron said on Monday that taking action on corporate tax should not be the priority for the British government as it comes to terms with a referendum vote to leave the European Union.

Headline: PM candidate Leadsom says she believes tariff-free trade with EU possible
Description: Europe will choose to give Britain tariff-free trade during negotiations to leave the EU, British prime ministerial candidate Andrea Leadsom said on Monday, though she added that freedom of movement with the bloc will end.

Headline: For next PM to trigger Brexit but parliament will have a role - Cameron's spokeswoman
Description: The next British prime minister will have to decide when to officially trigger the process of leaving the European Union but parliament will have a role to play, Prime Minister David Cameron's spokeswoman said on Monday.

Headline: Brexit vote shakes up London property market
Description: The aftershocks of Britain's decision to leave the European Union have hit the property sector over the past week, with a foreign bank freezing loans for buyers and some investors pulling out of commercial deals.

Headline: Top Scottish Conservative says London should not block second independence vote
Description: A second referendum on Scottish independence from the United Kingdom should not be blocked by Britain's next prime minister, the leader of the Scottish Conservatives has said, in a boost to nationalists who wish to protect Scotland's status in the EU.

Headline: Ex-London mayor Johnson says UK government needs to spell out Brexit benefits
Description: Ex-London mayor Boris Johnson, who shocked Britain last week when he decided not to stand to replace outgoing Prime Minister David Cameron, criticised the government on Monday for not having a positive plan to make a British exit from the EU work.

Headline: Foreign Secretary Hammond backs May to be prime minister
Description: Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond backed Theresa May to be the next prime minister on Monday, saying the interior minister had the pragmatism to get the best divorce deal for Britain from the European Union.

Headline: PM contender Leadsom says UK could leave EU next year
Description: British leadership contender Andrea Leadsom said the UK could pull out of the European Union as early as next year following last week's referendum vote to leave the bloc.

Headline: German politicians call for improvements to EU after Brexit vote
Description: Senior German politicians called for improvements to the European Union's processes to speed up decision making and boost its appeal among citizens, just a week after Britons stunned the world with a vote to leave the bloc.

Headline: Top candidates to lead Britain differ on Brexit urgency
Description: Two leading contenders to be the next British prime minister disagreed publicly on Sunday on how quickly negotiations should be triggered to plan a departure from the European Union.

Headline: Candidate May - Britain needs clear negotiating stance before article 50
Description: Home Secretary Theresa May, the front-runner in the contest to be Britain's next prime minister, said on Sunday the UK had to be clear about its negotiating stance on a post-Brexit deal with the European Union before triggering article 50.

Headline: Credit Suisse CEO blames Brexit on low UK education spending
Description: Britain is paying the price for a high level of inequality and a chronic lack of investment in education which have prompted a disillusioned population to vote to leave the European Union, Credit Suisse Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam said on Sunday.

Headline: Leadsom, candidate to lead Britain, would be quick to trigger article 50
Description: Andrea Leadsom, one of five candidates to succeed David Cameron as British prime minister, said on Sunday she would be quick to start the process of negotiating the terms of Britain's exit from the European Union.

Headline: Brexit vote makes united Ireland suddenly thinkable
Description: Protestant unionists are queuing for Irish passports in Belfast and once quiet Catholic nationalists are openly campaigning for a united Ireland, signs of deep shifts in the United Kingdom's most troubled province since Britain voted to leave the EU.

Headline: Post-Brexit, Britain may need 'Hotel California' model
Description: After the self-inflicted wound of voting to quit the European Union, Britain's best option to limit the mutual economic and political damage could be called the "Hotel California" model.

Headline: 'Reverse Greenland', anyone? Scots eye post-Brexit EU options
Description: Could Scots get their wish to remain, effectively, in the European Union even while maintaining their union with England once the United Kingdom as whole leaves the EU?

Headline: UK to face inflation, recession risks due to Brexit - ECB's Villeroy
Description: Britain will face two key challenges, inflation and recession, after Britons voted to leave the European Union, or Brexit, European Central Bank Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau said on Sunday.

Headline: Thousands march through London to protest against Brexit vote
Description: Thousands of demonstrators marched through central London on Saturday in a raucous and colourful protest against last week's referendum vote to leave the European Union.

Headline: MP Leadsom emerges as top pro-Brexit candidate for PM
Description: British lawmaker Andrea Leadsom emerged on Saturday as the top pro-Brexit candidate to succeed Prime Minister David Cameron, earning the support of a former Conservative Party leader and several members of parliament.

Headline: Gove denies treachery as he pitches to be next prime minister
Description: Justice Secretary Michael Gove pitched on Friday to be the prime minister to take Britain out of the EU, a day after he destroyed the chances of another frontrunner in what some colleagues called an act of treachery.

Headline: Euro zone will not add new members in next three years - Dombrovskis
Description: The European Commission does not expect any new countries to join the euro zone for at least the next three years, one of the vice presidents of the EU executive said on Thursday.

Headline: Putin - let's see how British democracy works after Brexit
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday the market turbulence caused by Britain's vote to leave the European Union  will subside in the medium term but it remains to be seen if Britain will uphold its democratic principles.

Headline: Ex-London mayor Johnson abruptly quits race to be prime minister
Description: Former London mayor Boris Johnson abruptly pulled out of the race to become Britain's next prime minister on Thursday, in a shock move that upturned a political order shaken by last week's vote to leave the European Union.

Headline: Briton charged with murder in Kenya granted bail
Description: A Kenyan court granted bail on Thursday to a British business executive charged with the murder of a Kenyan woman, his lawyer said.

Headline: Theresa May, favourite to be next PM, vows to honour Brexit vote
Description: British interior minister Theresa May, the bookmakers' favourite to replace David Cameron as prime minister, said on Thursday there was no going back on Britain leaving the EU but that divorce talks would not start until the end of the year.

Headline: Britain targets 57 percent emissions cut by 2032
Description: Britain will aim to reduce emissions blamed for climate change by 57 percent by 2032, the government said on Thursday.

Headline: Germany's Kohl tells EU - don't pressure UK after Brexit vote
Description: Former German chancellor Helmut Kohl, the architect of German reunification and a leading driver of European integration, said the EU must allow Britain time to sort itself out after its referendum vote to leave the bloc.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Andrea Leadsom to stand to be UK Conservative Party leader
Description: British lawmaker Andrea Leadsom, a prominent campaigner for Britain to leave the European Union, said on Thursday she would be standing as a candidate to replace Prime Minister David Cameron as Conservative leader.

Headline: Farage says can envisage Britain contribution to EU budget post-Brexit - Le Figaro
Description: Britain can make compromises to secure continued access to the EU's single market, including possibly a contribution to the bloc's budget, but compromises on immigration are out of the question, Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage told Le Figaro.

Headline: UK parties head for leadership battles amid Brexit fallout
Description: The Labour Party headed for a leadership battle, mirroring a fight for control of the ruling Conservative Party, after the decision by voters to leave the European Union last week led to upheaval in Westminster.

Headline: EU tells UK single market access requires full free movement
Description: European Union leaders met for the first time without Britain on Wednesday less than a week after it voted to leave, delivering a tough message that London can access the bloc's lucrative single market only if it agrees to allow free movement for EU workers.

Headline: Sturgeon's plea to stay in Europe rebuffed in Brussels
Description: Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon got a "sympathetic" hearing in Brussels on Wednesday as she pleaded her case for Scots to stay in the EU, showing how Britain's vote to leave the bloc could splinter the United Kingdom.

Headline: British decision to leave EU should be respected, Germany's Steinmeier says
Description: Britain's decision to leave the European Union was regrettable but should be respected, and the EU needed a common position over future relations with London, German Foreign Minister Frank-Walter Steinmeier said on Wednesday.

Headline: Brexit campaigner Grayling says not in EU interest to give UK a bad deal
Description: Britain will clinch a deal to allow it wide access to European Union markets after Brexit because Germany and France do not want to impose limits that could hurt their biggest industries, leading Brexit campaigner Chris Grayling told Reuters.

Headline: 'For heaven's sake man, go!' Cameron tells Labour leader Corbyn
Description: Prime Minister David Cameron, who promised to resign after Britain voted to leave the European Union, had some advice for his opposite number in the Labour Party on Wednesday: "For heaven's sake man, go!"

Headline: Conservative MP Liam Fox to announce leadership bid on Thursday
Description: Former Defence Secretary Liam Fox will formally announce his bid to succeed Conservative Prime Minister David Cameron on Thursday, he told radio station LBC on Wednesday.

Headline: PM candidate Crabb says immigration is red line in Brexit talks
Description: Britain must secure control over immigration in divorce negotiations with the European Union, Stephen Crabb, the first candidate to put himself forward to succeed David Cameron as prime minister, said on Wednesday.

Headline: Opposition leader Corbyn unwilling to discuss resignation, says deputy leader
Description: Britain's deeply divided opposition Labour Party seems to be heading for a contested leadership election with its leader Jeremy Corbyn refusing to resign, the party's deputy leader Tom Watson said on Wednesday.

Headline: 'Praised to grave,' loser Cameron slides out of Brussels
Description: It had been billed as David Cameron's most awkward summit, a time when he would be forced to rake over the mistakes which led to Britain voting to leave the European Union.

Headline: Hollande says no sense in scrapping France-Britain border policy
Description: President Francois Hollande said on Wednesday that a border agreement between France and Britain would not be affected by last week's Brexit vote because the so-called Le Touquet accord was a bilateral agreement

Headline: Britain delays airport decision due to post-Brexit fallout
Description: Britain will not decide where to build a new runway at a London airport until at least October due to the political turmoil following Britons' vote to leave the European Union, Transport Minister Patrick McLoughlin said on Thursday.

Headline: Brexit spells end to EU leadership in climate diplomacy
Description: Britain's exit dashes the European Union's leadership ambitions on efforts to slow climate change, leaving the bloc on the sidelines while others endorse the global pact it championed to curb greenhouse gas emissions.

Headline: No Brexit regrets for voters yearning for a better Britain
Description: Denise Draper was one of the 17 million people who last week voted in favour of Britain leaving the European Union. She has no regrets.

Headline: Next PM has to be on Brexit side - Conservative leader candidate Leadsom
Description: Brexit campaigner Andrea Leadsom, who is standing as a candidate to replace David Cameron as prime minister, said Britain's next leader had to be someone who wanted the country to leave the European Union.

Headline: Germany's Gabriel says British EU exit must be swift
Description: German Vice-Chancellor Sigmar Gabriel said on Thursday Britain's departure from the European Union should be swift.

Headline: Euro zone will not add new members in next three years - Dombrovskis
Description: The European Commission does not expect any new countries to join the euro zone for at least the next three years, one of the vice presidents of the EU executive said on Thursday.

Headline: Putin - let's see how British democracy works after Brexit
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday the market turbulence caused by Britain's vote to leave the European Union  will subside in the medium term but it remains to be seen if Britain will uphold its democratic principles.

Headline: Ex-London mayor Johnson abruptly quits race to be prime minister
Description: Former London mayor Boris Johnson abruptly pulled out of the race to become Britain's next prime minister on Thursday, in a shock move that upturned a political order shaken by last week's vote to leave the European Union.

Headline: Briton charged with murder in Kenya granted bail
Description: A Kenyan court granted bail on Thursday to a British business executive charged with the murder of a Kenyan woman, his lawyer said.

Headline: Theresa May, favourite to be next PM, vows to honour Brexit vote
Description: British interior minister Theresa May, the bookmakers' favourite to replace David Cameron as prime minister, said on Thursday there was no going back on Britain leaving the EU but that divorce talks would not start until the end of the year.

Headline: Cameron - Brexit talks can begin before Article 50 triggered
Description: British Prime Minister David Cameron said his successor could begin negotiations with the European Union about the country's exit from the bloc before the formal 'Article 50' legal process is triggered, despite comments from the EU to the contrary.

Headline: Cameron says keeping UK together of paramount importance
Description: Keeping the United Kingdom together is of paramount importance, British Prime Minster David Cameron said on Wednesday, responding to concerns that its constituent nations could seek independence after Britons voted to leave the European Union.

Headline: ACEA sees no short-term hit to UK car sales from Brexit
Description: Car sales in Europe's second-largest market, Britain, will not be affected in the short term by a British vote to leave the European Union, the secretary general of the European Automobile Manufacturers' Association ACEA said on Wednesday.

Headline: Britain's Hinkley nuclear project not affected by Brexit - minister
Description: A project to build two new nuclear reactors at EDF Energy's  Hinkley Point site in Britain will not be influenced by the outcome of the country's vote last week to leave the European Union, energy minister Andrea Leadsom told lawmakers on Wednesday.

Headline: UK government says committed to fighting climate change despite Brexit
Description: Britain's government remains committed to fighting climate change despite last week's vote to leave the European Union, the country's energy and climate minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: Conservative candidate Crabb plays down chances of new UK national election
Description: Conservative Party leadership candidate Stephen Crabb on Wednesday played down the chances calling a snap national election if he succeeds Prime Minister David Cameron.

Headline: Conservative leadership candidate Crabb says 'No' to second EU referendum
Description: British pensions minister Stephen Crabb launched his bid to succeed outgoing Prime Minister David Cameron on Wednesday, saying there could be no rowing back on last week's vote to leave the European Union and pledging to control immigration.

Headline: U.N. rights boss calls on Britain to prevent xenophobic abuse after Brexit vote
Description: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights urged Britain on Tuesday to prevent further incidents of xenophobic abuse in the wake of the vote to leave the European Union, and to prosecute perpetrators.

Headline: UK government says committed to fighting climate change despite Brexit
Description: Britain's government remains committed to fighting climate change despite last week's vote to leave the European Union, the country's energy and climate minister said on Wednesday.

Headline: Scotland determined to stay in EU, Sturgeon says in Brussels
Description: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said on Wednesday on a short-notice visit to Brussels that Scotland was intent on remaining in the European Union, despite last week's British vote to quit the bloc.

Headline: Labour leader Corbyn loses no-confidence vote as Brexit crisis deepens
Description: Britain's Brexit political crisis deepened on Tuesday when MPs in the Labour Party passed a motion of no confidence in its leader Jeremy Corbyn by an overwhelming margin, but Corbyn said he would not resign.

Headline: EU leaders tell Britain to exit swiftly, markets steadier
Description: European leaders told Britain on Tuesday to act quickly to resolve the political and economic confusion unleashed by its vote to leave the European Union last week, after the IMF said the uncertainty could put pressure on global economic growth.

Headline: Merkel sees no chance of British U-turn on Brexit
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Tuesday she saw no chance that Britain might go back on its decision to leave the European Union.

Headline: Expressing regret, Cameron says Britain will not turn back on EU
Description: Expressing regret and sadness over Britain's decision to leave the European Union, Prime Minister David Cameron said on Tuesday the country would not turn its back on Europe and would instead build the strongest ties it could.

Headline: At last EU summit, Cameron voices regret for Brexit
Description: Outgoing Prime Minister David Cameron told European Union leaders on Tuesday that Britain's future relations with the bloc it voted last week to leave could hinge on the EU's willingness to rethink free movement of workers.

Headline: U.S. mixes signals on possible separate EU, UK trade talks
Description: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry held out the possibility on Tuesday of negotiating separate trade deals with Britain and the European Union at the same time, but a spokesman later said he did not mean to suggest such a plan.

Headline: Sturgeon to meet EU leaders in drive to keep Scotland in bloc
Description: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said she will meet European Parliament leaders in Brussels on Wednesday to seek a way for Scotland to remain in the European Union.

Headline: No months to meditate over British EU withdrawal - EU's Juncker
Description: Britain's withdrawal from the European Union has to be notified as soon as possible after a referendum voted in favour of Britain leaving the bloc last week, EU Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said after a meeting of EU leaders.

Headline: Free movement key to future UK access to EU market - France's Hollande
Description: French President Francois Hollande warned that Britain would lose access to the EU's single market, and the City of London would no longer be able to act as a clearing house in euros, if the UK stopped free movement of workers from Europe.

Headline: No EU access for Britain without paying bill - Belgium
Description: Britain's new leaders should not expect to have access to the European Union's single market while leaving the bloc and the duties of membership, Belgian Prime Minister Charles Michel said on Tuesday.
